review: This game is tormenting to play I stopped playing this game due to raging at the toxic kill on sight community. It is so painfully frustrating to spend hours of your time gathering recources build a small base then a advanced group or individual will come along kill you and continously kill and raid you untill you leave whilst taking everything you have so you have to start again. And that repeats over and over again its a continuous tormenting cycle of getting bullied. Its a breeding ground for bullies and psyhcopaths if we evolved with the mentatlity of the comminity in this game the world would be controlled by Negans (Walking Dead).(And for those people who say the game is survival of the fittest shooting unarmed naked people is cowardice and disturbing)Its not worth playing so I stopped. Im happy I got it for pennies on humble bundle.It got massive potential but until the devs work out a fairer system and make it satisfying to play then I wont be touching it.

review: Spend 3 hours trying to build your way up to a bow and arrow. Run into person with an RPG that wants your arrows I guess. Respawn. Spend 1 hour gathering enough stone to build a stone hatchet. Game lags and when the game becomes responsive again you are dead. Respawn. Play game for 5 hours and begin trying to create your first gun game crashes. Restore the game and it returns you to where you left off with all of your items restored to you... Only they made your body lootable this whole time. So you lose everything you spent time into getting because the game crashed and they kept you an active player.This "Early Access" release is now 3 years old. Wait for them to actually release something that is playable. As you can see from my time played it does have some potential. The potential is currently far from realized.
title: Rust

review: Do you like farming/Grinding for supplies and then having a base actually pay off?Then this game is for you The constant pit in your stomach after you've just raided someone! Or when you get ambushed in the mountains and you manage to fight your attackers off it's the greatest feeling! But then the unthinkable happens You log off for the night only to get home from school or work the next day and find your base ransacked and your sleeper killed it adds an entire new concept to video games and the survival genre!Now would I recommend this game? YES!! Very much so The community on some servers are great! Say you just bought the game and just logged on for the very first time and you need some directions or some info if you just type in the chat what you need 9/10 times someone will help you build a base gather resources Or just give you a tour of the best farming places!Rate 8.5/10 Would be 10/10 but the hackers in this game are crazy Being a former hacker myself I know just how easy it is to download some hacks and start silent killing people from hundreds of metres away..

review: Product received for free. I received Rust as a Gift from a friend and so far this is what I have to say It has been a Very Good Experience overall I have to admit I was very demotivated a bout the Early Access Tag (because I've bought a few Early Access games) but I ended up loving it instead.PROS Very engaging when you are in a server with enough people it keeps up the tension of surviving other players.Survival elements are there but they are not annoying I think they are balanced enough so that you have to keep them on check but it's not something that you have to grind about (talking about basic needs thirst hunger warmth) specially the warmth/cold system allows you to build or plan around it.Simple and Efficient crafting system it's complex enough so that it doesn't feel dumb but is not annoyingly overcumbered with a lot of different elements and tricks to get early and medium tier items.Very Nice enviroments the procedural maps are filled with vegetation and it gives a good feeling to run around in a forest (for ex) and it creates very good opportunities to hide ambush and move during combatCONSIt's still a bit buggy (although not that much as you could expect from an Early Access title)the AI of the wildlife is very very simple and they sometimes spawn inside your basethe "biggest" CON (Not So CON) is that you cannot play this game alone or at least is VERY difficult because the community around it is quite toxic to say the least. but that's also what makes the game exiting in a big way.Besides I think is unfair to jugde a game for the quality of it's users.100% recommended I keep looking forward for more updates

This game tops any other zombie survival series like DayZ Infestation Survivor Stories and 7 Days to Die. I am really looking forward to where rust is going the game has great potential. For an Alpha it already has such a solid feel to it. Get some of your mates hop into a server and spend many hours with them gathering pvping raiding crafting and building. This game is endlessly fun.

review: It all began when I woke up on a beach. I feel lost and confused. I seem to have forgotten absolutely everything I've known even how my head is shaved... I look around and see nothing but trees some boulders and in the distance I see a couple of rusting abandoned shacks that lay on top of a hillside that I can assume were made by other lost people like me. I wonder around for a little and see a sturdy rock and I examine it it seems good enough to be tool. A weapon. A friend. As I pick up this rock I feel the urge pick up. The urge to survive. To see what lies out in this mystery of an island...Later in the day I have utilized this rock by hitting a tree as well as some other rocks and collected valuable resources. My crafty mind begins creating things that eventually become real in my hands like a wooden spear with a sharp stone tip a stone hatchet and a handy torch. I wonder the island more climbing passed what I like to believe were homes across a hill like many of the other hills and I gaze downwards at the beatif ... I'm not alone. Somebody else is running towards the houses near from where I came from. They hold a rock as well. My first instinct is to hide and watch. But as they approach I feel that they are hostile... I run.After traveling farther from where I encountered that person with a panic filled mind I hear a very loud rumbling sound far in the sky. I look up and expect to see something come from behind the hill at any time now. What is it? A plane?! Where did this come from in this desserted island? It is flying very close to me. I wave I jump I scream I yell for help! I don't know who they are but I feel a bit of civilized comfort. I feel a good feeling one that says "I'm not alone. We're not alone..." But wait it keeps flying it doesn't see me swinging my torch in the air. After it passes I see a large object drop from it. What could it be? Who are these people? After adventuring to where what seems to be a cargo has landed in an open field with nobody else around I make my way towards it and begin looking for what could be inside. Suddenly I hear footsteps running on the other side an animal perhaps? Or a threat.. Two others from both sides armed with spears see each other through me. I back away just as they do. One says "shoo" and the other says "lol." Are they speaking my language? Or are they from a different origin I wonder... Soon after the one that said shoo immediately charges me with their spear and cuts my arm. About after terrifying minutes of circling one another and hopelessely flailing our spears I manage to kill both of them. I loot what I can and head out in a hurry before it gets dark.Later in the night I hide between some average sized boulders and try to clear my mind from the fear growing inside me. I somehow manage my way to craft two large furnaces and begin smelting some metal ore I have gathered from the enemies I killed. I experiment and craft gunpowder from other resources and make bullets. I make tools like a pickaxe. Simple easy things that everyone like me can make naturally. I even manage to craft a homemade pistol. Suddenly I see a bright torch ignite from around the corner and I bolt up with my spear in my hands. It is someone that has nothing. Nothing but a rock. We look at each other as I lower down my spear. It now comes to me he has no clothes to stay warm in through the night. He is naked. I look down and see that I too am naked. Everyone is naked. And bald. I ask if they would like to stay with me for the night. To work as a team of course. This could be the person I first saw near the shore. After some agreement and an awkward moment being my first friendly encounterment they take watch with their torch as I craft us supplies and weapons to hold us off. I show off my homemade firearm and ask if they would like one too. He says he has some metal of his own to place inside the burning furnace so I let him. After he turns around I notice a figure sneaking up behind him in the dark. What seems to be yet another naked man holding a rock. Does he possibly want to join our team and bec nope he kills my friend and I miss 10 shots and he kills me too and steals everything while chanting inaudible things. As we lie there bleeding we stare into each others eyes... Death is close... he says "uh wut happened?" and with my last breath I say "we died. it was nice knowing you naked friend" ... He responds soon afterwards with "well I'm getting off." We close our eyes and rest in peace. lIk if u cried everytim. r7 8/8 m8.

review: *Before you read any further keep in mind that I've had almost 100 hours on the game when I made this post. Aka I'm not someone who played for a couple hours then ragequit.* This game has potential but there is little reason to buy or play it in its current state. Hackers are everywhere and hacking the game is EXTREMELY easy. Most hacks just involve editing or moving very easy to find game files. 99% of the people who play this have a killstreak mentality. Meaning all they care about is nonstop killing and nothing else. So no matter what you will die very often until you finally find a very isolated place to make a base. Also it doesn't matter what you have on you people will kill you anyways. I tried running around with absolutely nothing as an experiment and I was killed at least 12 times in a half an hour. People were killing me just to kill me. This game is made to be WAY more than a Call of Duty clone but its turning into one. Since most of the players just have one goal "KILL ALL PLAYERS". Admin abuse is all over the place. You will see many many many admins who give themselves items spawn themselves airdrops nonstop run around in godmode and kill everyone blowing up bases with unlimited c4 supplies kicking/banning anyone who complains about their abuse etc. I would highly recommend that people wait quite some time to buy this game. It is no where near complete enough to be worth money. Keep in mind this is an alpha. However if you're wanting to buy it for entertainment and a stable gaming experience just wait.

review: You spawn in naked carrying a stone and a torch personally I had been assigned the balled white woman as my character (which cannot be changed). You gather materials upgrade your gear and start building a base (or just steal one from some poor idiot) all while running and hiding from other players that have progressed further than you (believe me your rock is no match for an AK).Either playing with friends trying to establish them in game (which can be a deceitful experience) or playing solo (not advisable) you spend countless hours building raiding fleeing exploring hiding and crying and then it all starts over as you have your base taken away from you by a superior clan of 14 people that fire rockets and C4 until your castle is nothing but rubble. One thing I can guaranty you no other game will give you the same amount of adrenaline no other game can make you this angry/sad or exited.10/10 amazing social experiment.

review: I love this game. It is a great game. The visuals are great it has great sound clips. The building is fun hunting for survival items is great chasing after drop planes is a great way to view the map. Just all around solid!Some of you might be asking "But Southern Bella if you like the game so much why are you giving it a negative review?" The answer to that is simple my friends.The community. Now don't get me wrong. There are some great players I've met. But the number of great players who will help out and form alliances or who just follow simple rules are few compared to the number of people who get on just for the joy of utterly destroying everything on one server then hopping on the next server and repeating.I don't get a lot of time to play games and my playtime is limited to Friday nights and Saturdays and sometimes that is even iffy. So when I spend all of a Friday night building up my house and supplies only to log in the next day to find all my stuff and things ruined by some a hole mere minutes after I log off. It's annoying. Especially when I know the progress I make on Saturdays will be ruined by the time I get on the next Friday. It is not fun for me. I would love for there to be a single player option right from the menu instead of me having to work the LAN files to create my own private server...or having to rent one.

review: Rust a reaction of iron and oxygen in the presence of water or air moisture which is appropriate since it's what people will kill you for. In Rust you have very little options in life. You can't decide your character it's based off a random character generator that is automatically locked with your Steam profile which has lead my to become a wanna be Samuel L. Jackson. Not that I take issue with that seeing as he's still in better shape than I am.As a long time owner of Rust I have experienced the old version of the game just long enough to be called an OG and have seen the new changes that we now have and earned the privilige of me being a settler. And settle I did! Over and over again. I came across a someone who shot me with his entire armory. After pacifying the gentleman and explaining that I'm just passing by I realize how in danger I am. It's pitch black outdoors wolves howling in the night and worst of all bears. The incarnation of Death itself. Capable of passing rocks and walls like me in Fallout with cheats on. Which lead me straight back to that gentleman as I serenaded him with a guitar I found off another dead body who died by natural causes...I think. After I went into his home I actualy became good friends with him. And through living in the house I made more friends. But ah it's online! There's no such thing as peace and prosperity online! I learned the hard way that not everybody oops most people are not interested in talk only having waving people stand at gun's distance as they give you a 30 presents from their loving gift launchers. Of coarse death is to be expected but playing on all servers make me realize people are either you have a gun or you don't and if you have a gun you're free to act like Saddam Hussein to his Iranian neighbors. It might be just because I'm upset because I got lit the up twenty times over. But I feel that even on a brand new map where all are equal one somehow finds a machine gun and begins his reign as dictator.But this review can't be all anger coming off from idiots that don't affect gameplay. Firstly there's the basic survival menu. You have your life bar your food bar and your water bar. If any depletem you die or begin to die. However I found a way to stave off death with the use of cloth and furiously wrapping it around my arms. This way I managed to become immortal to the needs of my body. To the elements however I am VERY mortal. After learning how to play I came to the eventual conclusion that once you have a decent gun you don't need anything else. Self sufficient farm? Fah! Houses? Fah! Having a sniper rifle (affectionately called "bolties" by the players) mean that nothing is beyond your reach and you can kill your way to a better quality of life. Swords are useless and armor becomes useless once you get better bullets. But once the player discovers the ing tower of Sauron they would need to find "friends" who you can barely stand to tear this thing to bits and pieces and destroy someone's hopes and dreams of living peacefully.Overall the game was fun. Yes it was fun. Games like these rely on social interaction and without a couple negatives here and there I don't imagine I would ever have played this for more than 20 minutes.

review: It's in alpha state since Dec 2013 and I don't think they are planning to stabilize the game soon all your stuff will vanish whenever there s an update also it can disappear if it falls and passes through a rock this is the most glitched game I ve played animals can run through walls (I think they fixed it) and some other annoying glitches like installing an object that clips a little outside of your house to get used by whoever is outside. Game style disappoints me doesn t matter what you do you can t hide or make an impenetrable fortress sooner or later it will disappear by a clan of demolishers or by an update which means wipe therefore everything is gone almost in all the official servers is like this. I love constructions but here you are forced to make it freaky and crappy focused only to trap riders if you wanted to make a cool looking castle or a cozy hut forget it it will be an enjoyable target to be burned. I bought this only to play with friends but it really gets on my nerves it has some realistic aspects and some ridiculous aspects you can t build anywhere you want you are forced to build wherever someone sees your building even inside caves hey new neighbor here! so construction system is an illusion it will be gone next day. I recommend this game for players that will play in GROUPS power in numbers and then dedicate yourself to make explosives or collect junk it gets grindy so in conclusion the whole game is reduced to collect fast before you are destroyed so you can destroy others. In my case I enjoyed going man hunting but the main features for me are awful in my opinion if this game could allow forever lasting buildings I would be motivated to become a squirrel that collects and collects but it could be gone at any update. Everything else regardless of buildings is just another FPS with a huge map where you can loot whoever you killed or get killed and loose everything. I almost forgot! I know is a rated M game but the community is very very toxic lame insults racism and degenerated messages is what you will read/hear most times almost everyone hates everybody without provocation. review: So I've had this game Since about a week after it's release and played it on multiple accounts racking up 1000's of hours and I reckon it's high time I posted my indepth review so here goes Legacy Rust was a huge part of this games charm the combat system and overall feel of the game and although it's a distant memory way it will always hold a special place in the hearts of the veterans of Rust.Now for the curren't build you spawn naked alone on the beach confused and here your adventure begins it is what you make of it and nobody but you decides what you will do as you walk towards the mainland unless of course a hungry bear decides that you are going to be his next meal if you can't run fast enough.Rust is a unique game like no other there are many many other sandbox games each with their own unique charm that you can almost guarentee that Rust has had some kind of influence on clones and copies aside it really is a special game no wipe is the same one wipe you might build a huge base with all the loot in the world and be the kingpin of the server other wipes you might find yourself harveseting the dead and cooking it over your campfire to stay alive Rust's replay value is huge which is why I come back week after week.Pros Great with friends or solo (although solo can be more challenging) Very adaptable mechanics you can learn quite quickley but there are still little things that improve your gameplay Reasonably balanced PvP all things considered Base building and making land yours is incredibly fun Multiple ways of raiding other peoples hard earned loot at all ends of the resource scale Extremely unique player interactions (Some trash talk but mostly just funny remarks) Procedural map generation so no two wipes are the same PvE events like the airdrops and Helicopter battles Weekly updates from a VERY active and engaging developer who really use the early access title as it was intendedAll things considered Rust has a lot of positive attributes about it that make it a fun and interesting game to play many of which contribute to why people keep coming back week after week and enjoying the game.Cons Quite lengthy loading times on lower end machines Animal pathing is a bit wonky (This is being adressed in a coming update) Lack of Rad animals and other micro level PvE events (Rad animals being a great feature of Rust Legacy) Zerg clans can be a bit frustrating if you are a solo or small group (although this is not a reason to detract points from the game) Lower end systems may suffer lag spikes due to the large maps and player built structures New players might feel a bit overwhelmed as the game has no real tutorialAll games have their negitives and drawbacks and Rust isn't perfect by any stretch of the term but Rust really does justice to the term early access in my opinion if there is a game in EA that you could get behind Rust is that game weekly updates and very supportive and active developers alongside a fun and banterous community really make this game fun to be a part of sure there are times I get frustrated and lose all my hard grafted gear and base but you can guarentee I'll be back on the beach bloodthirsty for revenge come the next wipe.I couldn't reccomend a game more than Rust to sink hours days weeks years into and for 15 it's a steal Grab your rock and torch and let's start our journey.
title: Rust

review: Early access done okay fun with minor issues. Rust is in an early access state and has been for a few years now. Typically this would be a sign of the developers abandoning the game and running with their money. However rust is updated weekly and the developers are very communicative. They at least seem to be trying to get the game up and running. The optimization in this game is mediocre. It's not at all perfect in heavily populated areas you can expect dips in performance. The game itself is fun enough to warrant buying. In my opinion it could use an overhaul to all their current player vs. environment mechanics. I think this because it is fairly non existent at the moment and the largest threat is other players.

review: I understand that this game is trying to appeal as a hardcore surival game but it's just too much for people just getting onto a server for the first time. Maybe people have more of a chance once a server is wiped for a fresh start but if you miss that chance well fat chance getting anywhere unless you're friends with the people dominating the server. The last time I played this game was almost two years ago. Then it was at least manageable to find a simple resource such as stone. Today I spent around 30 minutes finding stone and once I did I simply received a good head shot from with someone with an AK and all the time spent simlpy looking for stone went for nothing. Stone. 30 minutes just for stone. Shouldn't be this difficult finding stone since there are stone like objects EVERYWHERE but they cannot be mined.Does this game still have wildlife? The whole time I played this session I didn't see any wildlife. I kept from starving by eating random scarce mushrooms and a single piece of corn that I came across. Lastly the game doesn't seem very optimized. Lots of frame stuttering going on with the "Beautiful" graphic option after travelling a short distance. The game does have good looking graphics however.Sad to feel that this game may be heading in a wrong direction.EDIT Just tried again to give it another go. Went onto another server with a lower population. Was having a decent time this session. Managed to get a small base with four walls and a furnace. Things seemed to be looking up. Then sure enough two players that were "controlling the area" decided to just blow up my roof and kill me with explosives and an AK. I had a spear and a bow. Don't play this game if you are going to play solo. You will simply have no chance.

review: Pros This game is indeed fun. It's great when it's working. If you can set up a base with trustworthy friends it's great fun.Cons This game crashes consistently. In the rust world this is terrible because your player is open for looting while the game is crashed. Playing for a mere 2 hours the game crashed 5 times. That's about one crash every half hour. So every half hour you have a potential to lose your items without being able to defend yourself. The roughness of the game. Rust is meant to be rough but the community is just terrible. If you can find a good server there are a few good people but it doesn't account for the sheer number that will just shoot you on sight. This would almost be acceptable but when mixed with the constant crashing of rust it's not acceptable. Early access BS. Seems to be another game hiding behind "early access" so they don't have to squash bugs. I would wait until this game is fully released (if ever) to play. If only they got rid of the bugs it would be a very enjoyable experience. Not beforehand however.

review: Well well well. So you want to play rust the video game. Good choice this game is balls to the wall rad. Never before have I played a survival game that crafted its core mechanics so well. The base building is smooth and fun to do. You can build houses in this game that you could never afford in life. The system allows you to use nothing but your inguenity to create a defensable s*** shack.The weapons and combat system is cool and feels satisfying. While guns are hard to use they have that heft to them that real guns and your fat b***h just have.The farming system is well tuned and balanced. The rock gods bless the nakeds with plentiful crafting supplies. No need to craft a bow using your right arm the hair on your back and your smallish d**k when times get tough. Just grab a cup of coffee put on some tunes and sprint out of your house and literally rip a tree stump out of the ground.Slavering at the bit at my accurate description of this game I see. Well hold on there you tremendous cancerous a** hole. This game is only fun for people who have over 500 hours of in game time. There are two people in this game naked noobs grabbing thier ankles and a group of armored gang bangers. Its actually impossible to make a base all by yourself on a populated server. As soon as you got some farm and start making a base people come and stop you. I don't advise trying to make friends. The majority of the people who play rust are the same people who tell little kids that santa isn't real and then later in the day pleasure themselves to the image of the childs crying face. In all my time playing rust I have made two bases and both were with a friend. One lasted 2 days before I was betrayed and lost the house the other lasted 8 hours before someone blew thier way in and stole my collection of fashionable beanies and boonie hats. Also its really f***in hard to get the reciepes to build anything less s***ty than litteraly just a repurposed piece of bark.Yes this game is fun but it is impossible to play unless you have two traits about your being. One you are more patient than a f***ing rock. And two you have managed to keep your cheese and onions stench repressed long enough to befriend a couple other cheeto encrusted pain loving sociopaths who will play with you. If you buy this game you will get to see the darkest side of humanity and over time lose yours. If you don't I don't know you can go back to playing minecraft you f***in pansy motherf***er.

review: Rust. Don't trust anyone. That's one of the most common sayings. I'm not going to say Rust was the first of the survival genre. There are many of them now DayZ Ark Hurtworld just to name a few. The genre is quickly becoming saturated. But unlike others Rust still holds strong by far my favorite. With the development team able to release updates with experimental features and quickly refining them sets Rust apart from others. Though Rust isn't perfect. The first two hours are grinding. The blueprint system favors groups. But what's most important is that the development team has already out lined goals to change the systems. Which once again sets Rust apart. The ability to rework basic systems hear feedback from community and update at a realistic speed. Not like you see from other games which update over a lengthy time and make the game feel stale. Plus on top of that after the first couple hours the game is fun and extremely additive. At $20 Rust is a steal.
title: Rust

review: Edited 11 4 16They removed the hated XP system and replaced it with a new crafting system that makes the game much more of a sandbox. I still miss some of the social aspects of the old Rust but the update yesterday was pretty brilliant. It is worth checking out.Just make sure you Youtube some strategy guides if you try playing it.Edited 8 10 16They used to have a system for advancement with an element of randomness where crafting abilities were gained randomly by exploring and could be traded or sold between players. They removed it in favor of an experience point system.There is little motivation to explore the rad towns or deal with other players. Materials gathered for research needed to be protected in the old system but under the new system there is no such value placed on random drops. That means there isn't much of value in your base to protect.That means I don't feel like building one. Now you farm so you are permitted to craft and you craft so you can raid people that did the same thing.I'm sure the game will improve in the future. Right now I'm not about it.______________________________For my review I'm going to tell a new player how to play solo.Step 1 Collect a small amount of stone and wood make arrows.Step 2 Collect Hemp and Wood make a bow.Step 3 Make more arrows. Congrats you are now able to defend your loot. Do this before making tools.Step 4 Make a hatchet and a pick.Step 5 Kill animals to get fat and use it with your hemp to make fuel. Get stone and wood. Make a furnace.Step 6 Hide the furnace behind a cliff and only run during the day. Hide a sleeping bag in a bush nearby.Step 7 Burn metal ore in the furnace while you are chopping wood. Get 2 3k wood and spend 1k on a toolbox. Let the furnace make 250 metal frags.Step 8 Get stone by hitting nodes. Step 9 Make a tiny stone base one level high no more than 2x2 but maybe smaller. Put the toolbox inside and wall it off with stone. Use the metal frags to make another door.Step 10 Be careful leaving so no one runs inside your house. Do not open the door to your house again until you can make another furnace inside and have enough metal ore and wood to make a second door for the house before you leave again. You must have two doors back to back like an airlock a furnace and a walled off tool box to block building authority a storeage box and a sleeping bag inside this tiny tiny building. Use this building to store materials to make a larger base.For bonus points build your base as far from other bases as possible while still building near a road or power lines. Do not put your base down unless you SEE hemp growing. Do not put your base down unless you see multiple nodes.More bonus points for finding a small stone base with a tool box you can access and a prebuilt furnace. Putting doors on a raided and empty base is easier than building one. Even more bonus points for using someone else's furnace to make a door before you kill animals.Warnings do not rely on wood walls wood floors or wood ceilings. They will be destroyed. Stone walls only. Wood doors only if you can put a metal door inside the wooden door while someone is destroying it. It can by time but you have to put a metal door deeper in the base.Master level build extra bases and fill them with doors and random loot boxes each with stone wood hammers and building plans. If you log on and see you got raided move inner doors out and patch the walls make one supply run and get back on top in an hour.I love this activity. Best video activity n/a.

review: This is one of those games that you just can't stop playing when you start. You'll suffer the first hours days and weeks your base will get raided over and over till you get strong enough then you will realize you just spent half of your life on RUST.Now let's get to the point.The good +Base building makes you get creative.+There's a ton of stuff you can craft.+Official and Comunity Server mods.+Huge community+Nakeds on the beach for you to kill and feel powerfull after you got raided.+The optimization is getting better with every update.+You can find monthly or weekly wipe servers.The bad Playing alone will make you quit as soon as you start so if you don't have any friends..just don't. There's always a hacker that will cheat the anticheat system. There's a lot of glitches and bugs.(i know i know.. it's EA game but hey i gotta say it).Bonus *Play with your friend it doesn't matter if you get raided often i assure you you are going to have a great time trying to move forward and you'll always learn something new about the game.My advice if you like crafting building hunting killing starting over seeking vengance exploring or even farming and surviving this is your type of game. If you like fast paced shooters..son..you're looking at the wrong game.

review: I am about to hit 1 000 hours in this game and I can confidently say this is the most replayable video game that I have ever played. Every week the developers Facepunch add in new mechanics guns skins graphics etc. This is what seperates it from the crowd. Rust is at its best when played with friends but it is not neccessary. The game can be incredibly frustrating but that is what makes it so rewarding. Nothing is handed to you. It requires work to succeed. Reward in Rust is easier to achieve when playing in a group or with friends so I reccomend finding some buddies and hopping on a server of your choice to get the best experience. At only $20 Rust is undeniably the best "bang for your buck" game you can buy on Steam due to weekly free updates. I cannot reccomend this game more.Pros Rewarding Weekly Updates Unique Cheap IntenseCons Difficult Learning Curve Community (The Rust community is generally very toxic and rude. I reccomend turning chat off)

review: This game is a cool concept not entirely original but still a cool concept that had the basis for being a fun and enjoyable game. But alas that is not what this game is. I've tried I really did. I tried to get past the hurdle of dealing with other players who have played the game for a long time before I even started. But it's just toxic. You can spend hours hitting trees with a rock build a small little house trying to level up so that you can protect yourself and then lose it all when someone runs 20 feet from you and shoots you then they destroy your house and everything you've accumulated.This will happen again and again and again until you are sick of wasting your life playing a game with people who have nothing better to do than to kill you because they can. It's not like you have anything worth anything to them. 1000 wood some food and no clothes doesn't matter. You'll respawn and run for about 5 minutes till you find a wooded area again and start hitting a tree with a rock and boom some guy runs up and kills you for the 30th time.The playerbase just spam memes and phallic shapes on signs anyway if that's any signal to the maturity of the people who play it.Find a better use of your time.
title: Rust

review: If you're trying to decide whether your money is better spent here or DayZ BUY THIS GAME IT'S MORE COMPLETE.Here are some reasons why Now this game has ALREADY given me hundreds of hours of awsomeness despite it being in alpha.Let me give you a comparison I have 285 hours on Rust and 9 on DayZ at the time of this review.This is NOT because DayZ is a bad game. But it's simply because what Garry Newman (Creator of Rust &amp Garry's mod) has brought to the table has all of its elements complete. What I mean by this Is all of the mechanics are working currently. There's no gamebreaking bugs. No character's disappearing no zombies running through walls/gates/doors like in DayZ standalone. Also In my opinion Rust has a lot more promise than DayZ. Garry has said he is not trying to make Rust "like every other zombie game" So he's going to be replacing the zombies soon with something hopefully more interesting. Also you can build your own bases in Rust! A fort if you will to fend off any invaders that try and ransack it. In this game you will also never find yourself running around for 4 hours only to find nothing. Instead you can craft all your tools/guns. You can start on a new server run into a radtown and if you get lucky there could be a gun in the very first crate you search. Or go hit a couple rocks with your rock then some trees build a furnace and slam yourself together a Revolver!Another cool thing about the crafting is the ability to research objects you can't craft. So say you just killed somone for their full set of Kevlar armor (The best defensive equipment in the game) But you want to learn how to research it so that you can craft it yourself. To do this you will need to kill zombies in Radtowns to find Research Kits. You can use these on an object and it will teach you how to craft it. Taking away from the need to kill zombies for the Kevlar armor blueprints. (Rarer spawn than kits) Because often times then not it will be easier to ambush someone in kevlar than harvest it yourself.I'm gonna keep this review short all in all Rust is an amazing game so far with incredible things to be added soon (Cars Helicopters Different armors/Building materials.)I would definitely recommend it over DayZ if you're trying to make up your mind.

review: Will likely go down in history as one of the best survival games ever made. It's a brutal experience and survival on a high population server is extremely competitive purchase with this reality in mind. I decided to write this review to mention a few things that you don't see from the screenshots. You don't see how intricate and clever the base building techniques are and how bank heist esque and surgical a base raiding experience can be. You can pinpoint weaknesses in other peoples designs and outsmart them on an engineering level. You also don't see how much potential there is to simply outsmart well equipped enemies and straight up dunk on them. For me it's what I dreamed of as a boy running around outside buildings forts and fighting bad guys with your buddies to back you up.

review: At time of writing Rust is still heavily in alpha stage with various problems plauging the gameplay and servers. That aside if you are lucky enough to find a server that suits your interest with people that have common goals then you are certainly in for a treat.I was fortunate enough to come across a PvE based server with a great community. The game and the server community instantly pulled me straight into an addiction. I clocked 81 hours in the space of a few weeks and I'd find myself scratching the bugs under my skin if I wasn't logged on.The concept of the game is entirely survival survive against the cold hunger thirst weather animals and most importantly other players. Admitedly I'm not a huge fan of the whole "people can kill you when you're logged out" part losing all of your hard work while offline and unable to defend yourself but that brings another element into the game strategy.So far it sounds like I'm reading straight off the brochure but you'll understand when you play it.My ratings below Audio 7/10 Ambient sounds are lame and the sounds the animals make suck. On the other hand the distant gun shots during the dead of night have a tendency to run a chill down your spine.Visual 6/10 Not exactly pleasing to the eye but as I mentioned earlier the game is still HEAVILY alpha and I'd expect that to change. That aside the textures are pretty cool but having crappy mountains and glitchy rocks puts a damper on that.Gameplay and content 8/10 There are enough varied items in the game to catch your attention for several hours and more to be expected in the full version release. On that same token if you were to play by yourself in the game you'd be very bored. If you were to play on a server with griefers than you'd be frustrated. If you find yourself a decent server with people who either allow you to get on your own two feet or help you out or play with friends then the game is out of this world.Replayability 8/10 I did put a lot of time into the game more than I should have. And to be brutally honest the time I spent in game was due to the server I was playing on as opposed to the game itself. The game did allow for this server to exist however but it was more of a social aspect than playing the game.All in all I would definately recommend this game to anyone. I would probably suggest to hold off until full version release or at least beta due to the problems you experience at this stagee but playing alpha I don't know what else you'd expect.This game has great potential and I am excited to see where it's headed. The only real problem I have is that it runs very poorly on lower spec machines there needs to be more options to allow users to turn it down a notch removing the grass doesn't always work!

The development of your character and your chances of survivng heavily depend on resource gathering and obtaining blueprints to allow for more advanced items to be constructed. review: 25% Constructing Bases40% Gathering Resources20% Looting Towns10% talking other players5% Enslaving nakeds to work for me in return for their freedom.Rust such a beautiful game the AI might be a bit dodgy but apart from that you can enjoy yourself just by walking through the forests and admiring the landscape for what it is bringing a friend or two along for a hunt for some meat to cook for later until you hear a gunshot from behind and see the bullet take out one of your friends you turn and look in panic you see two men wearing full kevlar armor you and your friend look at eachother and run the opposite direction from the two men gun shots zipping past you and your accomplice you start to lose them you've lost them. There is no way to "win" in rust the only thing you can win is a bottle of self accomplishment that feeling when you craft that sweet oh so sweet kevlar armor when you finally finish building that impenetrable fortress when you finally kill a fresh spawn.Yes I and many others have experience spawning into the server for the first time as a naked with nothing more than a torch and a rock you smash at some trees and smash some rock enough to make yourself a nice stone hatchet your mid craft and you see a group of bandits coming your way you can't run (Since crafting slows you down) you turn around and bang before you can even say "I'm friendly" you are dead.Enough of my t ranting about Kevlars killing nakeds let's talk about Legacy and how it's not ever going to be updated again.A few months ago Garry decided to release the experimental version (Fully revamped) of Rust to the public it's now the default version of rust although you can easily switch between the two Garry said that they will not be supporting Legacy anymore and they will be focused on providing Experimental with updates.Let me tell that doing this killed Rust Experimental feels like I'm playing some rust rip off made by an autistic 12 year old Darkrp admin the coloring and new graphics look like I will admit the UI Looks great but I'm not a fan of experimental.Legacy had so much potential it could go places Garry could create a whole new genre of gaming with this but he didn't for sakes Garry we believed in you.

review: Rust in my humble opinion is the best fps survival game out there! It has come a long way since its early beginnings and has been transformed into a beautiful experience. The switch from legacy Rust was absolutely the right decision and as the hacks and exploits have been fixed or removed more weapons and crafting added and the experience point experiment coming full circle the game is quickly nearing completion. There are still a few things that I hear people whine about 1. The community is a bunch of KOS freaks. A. You play serious PVP and that's what it's all about also everyone goes through the same thing. B. How about play some PVE first? C. There are also plenty of no KOS servers so try a bit harder and go find one... D. I have made many friends on RUST from all over the country (and the Great White North too)2. The changes that have been made ruined the game A. Game play has dramatically improved. B. Explioits and hacks are being cleaned up so the cheating bags have to play by the rules. C. The component system is more realistic than any other "crafting" system out there. (using a pipe some gears and a gun receiver is still a bit far fetched but better than crafting magic!!!) D. Radiation is plausible in post apocalyptic scenarios and although a drag it does add to the gameplay. (Plus if you don't like it there are plenty of non radioactive servers. E. The overall look / feel / sound has been polished by developers that clearly understand this game genre.This is one of those games that has tons of replay abilty for years to come. I trust the developers and applaud them for what they have created and excited to see where it goes from here!
title: Rust

review: Seem slike ll these other idiots only care about the player base. And complain about how it's so bad. I have countless friends from Rust and they are all nice people. This game is a survival game down to the core. Just because someone kills you and takes your stuff dosent make them an . This game is survival of the fittest anything goes even if its a scumbag move. You need to realize people will be nice to you if you are to them. Some people never change and will keep shooting and those people become your enemies. Another problem are Zerg's. These really suck to go up against but if you watch Kcmo or other youtube channels they destroy Zergs on many attempts. Everything else about this game is amazing. The graphics the new system component system finally got it right and the game is in a great place. Next they just have to fix the animals and from what ive heard it could be somewhat soon. When buying this game you need to think about the type of player you are. Do you like to watch Tyler1? Do you play CSGO? If you are an alpha male you will enjoy this game. This isn't a single player survival game it's on a whole other level of dificulty.

review: Definitely do not reccomend this game if you're usually a solo player. Atleast in the official servers. Pros Beautiful graphicsAwesome teamwork systemDevelopers listen to the fansGame gives you a really euphoric feel if you can actually get anywhereCons (Note some of these are just personal and changes may be made in the game that fixes these problems)Can be seriously frustrating and give you headaches if you get mad easily like I doReally experience being a solo player unless you play in one of the modded servers that makes you gather resources fasterRaiders/raids Raiders and being raided can be VERY frustrating you just built yourself a nice little hut to set yourself down in and you might be back from a resource gathering trip where you've gotten just enough resources to get that weapon or tool you're after. "What's that?" you say you look outside and see 5 people with full metal gear and AK74U's outside of your base screaming "Ooga booga! Ooga booga! give us yo !" and get blown up with C4 and rocket launchers immediately this is also why I reccomend modded servers for solo players because you've just played for about 7 hours straight and lost all your progress in a matter of 5 minutes. It's serious t but it's what makes the game fun (for them I guess) I've never personally raided but I've heard that it makes your toes stand up when raiding someones base always having the thrill of taking everything they own to progress yourself and your teammates (unless you're solo raiding of course). You always have that fear of dying but if you complete a raid it's most of the time worth it. The XP system (problem that will be fixed soon hopefully) I'm going to expand on the XP system that was introduced in Rust. You see some time ago Rust had a blueprint system where you would find blueprints of whatever you were trying to craft or you could take a whack at it yourself with research papers and such. I'm not too experienced in it myself because I just got a computer that could play Rust some months ago but from the fanbase this seems to be the most accepted system. People wanted the XP system at first but immediately after it was released it received constant backlash. Players hated it. I've had a experience with it and a lot of other people have as well. Please FacePunch remove the XP system.

review: Alpha ReviewI have to say that I'm just Barely recommending this game because it is a fairly new and great genre Straight up survival. I also recognize that this is the alpha and there are some things that are going to need improving. 1. Decay This just doesn't make sense. Building decays after a certain amount of time? Ok that makes sense but I mean building last for a long time even mud huts will stand for a long time. So 6 months or 180 game days for wood at least I mean wooden houses last for years in the real world. 12 hours...So say goodbye to your stuff all of it all the time.2. Goals There doesn't seem to be a reason to play 'except' survival at this point. Even if you got a sweet place with every schematic and you went around killing to your hearts content. There is no reason to keep going in the game once you've reached a certain point. Maybe instead of a goal they allowed the ability to create objects within the game or create more depth like diplomacy and trade. Clan operations and such. 3. Enemies Needs work no reason to get into this more. (Ex. Zombie has ten foot reach...)4. Exploration Needs more building the landscape doesn't feel like it has a story it's like gaming purgatory right nowThat all being said I'm probably going to play for a bit now it's just frustrating to see all of my hard work raided every dayNOT RECOMMENDED until certain things are fixed such as shooting through walls...

review: So I'm going to be uninstalling this game right now but I'm going to give it a positive review but I'm going to point out at bad things in this game particulary in this review.I spent 20 euros on this game and enjoyed (more or less) 150 hours into it I found that completely worth it. However this game besides being amazing idea and mostly good implementation has few major issues so here is the list 1. And most important this is Survival game that is close to impossible to play solo and in every turn groups will have advantages. I didn't expect co op/group survival when I bought it so it's more or less my mistake.2. Dev team is active but they are doing monthly updates consisting of updating animals and stuff while servers die in 2 days. They are focusing on wrong things.3. This game is for years in Early Access and it's probably never to going to get out with this pace.4. Balance of weapons is catastrophical. 5. Server and game performance is bad optimization is complete 6. It has long learning process and by the time you set up a bit first 5 things from this review will kill your will to play.Now good things If you have friends that you want to suffer with this might be game for you.It's worth of try idea is great game is solid 6 in current form could be solid 10 with a bit more work a bigger Dev team that takes it seriously.

review: I realize 70 hours(at the time of writing this) isnt a lot of gameplay but heres my take on this game. At first I had seen some people play the game and I thought "huh that looks kinda neat but not worth $20". Then a few weeks go buy and Ive found myself watching obscene amounts of videos on youtube on Rust. A friend mentioned that theres a site online where I could get a copy for &lt $15 and so I thought screw it lets just buy the damn game already. I will tell you right now if you are interested in survival games and you have not yet pulled the trigger on Rust just do it. Yes the community is pretty toxic depending on the server you're on and yes you will spawn and almost instantly get rekt by fully geared people despite having literally nothing but a rock and torch but I promise you once you find a server to call your home you will love this game. The 70+ hours ive spent thus far took place over about 3 weeks. I just cant stop playing this game. Obviously as a game thats still in alpha you will run into problems but as long as you know that going in you will be happy you spent the money on this. As far as the lifespan of this game is concerned they are still constantly pushing updates to the game and making it better. Theres relatively clear communication from the devs as to whats changing and theres a very consistent schedule for the updates

review: For an early access survival game that drops you into the game as a fully naked (censoring available) man geared with a rock and a torch it's pretty epic.The hunger/thirst starts out low and some take that into too much consideration when they start out but the main concern is making sure you don't get killed by someone else.The objective is to "survive" and the gameplay as a noob is exactly that on the Official servers. Those who have been gathering the Blueprints for better gear don't mind the monthly wipes of items and bases but those who are just joining in? Well it's a "dog eat dog world" out here in Rust.If Official is too tough the awesome selection of Community Servers is always available. These modded servers can be interesting though. Some wipe items and bases at random... some every 2 weeks! Currently the one I'm on wipes even the Blueprints (that can take a long time to obtain) every 4 weeks(monthly) to keep it interesting and noob friendly.Biggest Con I find right now is that an attacking animal (wolf/bear) can hit you and deal damage while at a considerable distance.Biggest Pro I find right now is the epic replayability.10 for 10 will play again.

review: Rust is an early access multiplayer survival game that I had my doubts about. But if you play with a friend it is a lot of fun but can be frustrating at times.In Rust your only aim is to survive. This can be easy or it can be difficult depending on the type of people you find in each server. The community itself isn't THAT bad. I have seen worse but I have also seen better. The game is very addicting once you get the hang of it and start raiding other player's bases. The game encourages you to make friends with other people but to also kill other people who threaten or try to raid you. The voice chat works well for only people within a certain range can hear you. The game does have it's downsides however for it is pretty laggy and pretty glitchy. Hopefully in the future that will be fixed.Overall this is a great game and I have a lot of fun playing it with my friends. Well really this game is only fun if you play with friends so yeah. I do recommend it but the characters are nude but that can be turned off in the settings if you wish.

review: Rust is an amazing real time open world survival pvp game that is constantly changing and improving. The devs are dedicated and the game receives updates frequently. The devs aren t for better or worse afraid of changing fundamental aspects of the game to achieve the rust they want it to be. Rust isn t a game you jump into a few times a week and play for an hour or two if you want to experience (vanilla) rust it requires a lot of grinding and dedication to get started but it can still be very fun. Rust is best played in groups of 2 8 people where you can watch out for each other get a base down faster and get resources quicker. I personally don t enjoy rust solo because the game punishes solos in many ways. If you have a weekend to play with a few buddies rust is an excellent game that plays very differently than other games (bare a few games in the same genre).

review: A lot of reviewers are saying the community is While this is in some case true I have seen many servers where people are generally nice and don't try to shoot you in the face as soon as they see you (most of the time). I have just started playing this game because of the sale and I am having a blast. Survival at its best!Quick tips for any new people. Don't go in expecting to play one long continuous game. Chances are that you will have to start over. Often. Whenever you log off for a few days even a few hours you can't expect your camp to still be intact with all your things. If it is good for you! And if not well you just gotta try to get even further than last time! Each game session is different you encounter a variety of people and places some friendly some not. If multiplayer is not your thing you can set up your own server (there are plenty guides for that pretty easy to do takes 15 minutes) and you will be able to play by yourself. But I find that the thrill of losing everything in one single moment of inattention one single mistake is part of the game and makes it much more entertaining. You cannot let your guard down always be attentive to your surroundings and if you see someone coming for you just RUN!! Survived many encounters just like that. Oh and watch out for the dogs. These things are more lethal than a player with an AK 47. Don't go near those things! And don't get me started on the bears...

review: When my friends tried to convince me to get this game I was skeptical at first because I didn't want to play "another broken early access survival multi player game". When I finally decided to buy it I was blown away by how beautiful it looked and how little bugs there was. Do not let the "early access" intimidate you this game is polished enough to be released a long time ago. The developers are also releasing patches with new content and fixes several times a month. The only minor thing that needs a little bit of work is the wildlife AI which the devs are very aware of.And even paying full price for this game is a no brainer. I would pay 3x full price and still be incredibly satisfied. In short an absolutely incredible experience well worth your money and time.

review: I had high hopes for this game because I enjoy other similarly themed games and I got this for an awesome price. It started sort of well The game looks good has different play options like battle royale or just the regular server. I was exploring poking around learning to craft and harvest. Then I got killed by another much higher level player. Meh it happens not everyone is a nice guy right? I respawn. I start again. Crafting items gathering dying. Oh wait! Dead again?? By now they'd realised I was spawning on the simulator and were killing me before I could even stop being naked. Any 'noob' who asked for help in chat was hunted down and killed for the sake of it. Switched to a different simulator and more of the same. After what was almost two hours of dying roughly every 9 minutes or so while idiots on voice chat called me ' ' or ' ' I realised that while this game holds high potential for being fun that unless you already know a large group of high level players you're screwed. Even if all your friends all join at once if you are a bunch of 'noobs' then you are screwed. If you buy anything on a simulator they will raid loot and destroy it and you are screwed. Toxic immature community that is best avoided even at the great price I bought this for. Shame really.

review: Rust is the closest thing to real life that you'd get if you dropped a bunch of guys off on an deserted island. Your personality goes a long way... if you run into someone who's cool and helps you out it feels good... if you run into someone who KOS then it infuriates you especially if they had nothing to gain... then you'll find people who betray you after being by your side for a good while. Starting off naked you earn everything you use... down to medical supplies food clothing and weapons. So when you earn these weapons you appreciate them and you tread lightly.. which is another pro about this game you'll likely if ever experience anyone running and gunning. There is too much to lose. The greatest satisfaction is building your house and living in it getting supplies running into weirdos and some cool people. Rust is the most authentic social experience you'll get in a game. Within a week of playing it the graphics drastically improved. Some reviews people had issue with the graphics the graphics look fantastic and some models and animations are still in development. I once met a group of 5 guys and we had a campfire and cooked food and held it down at night as people passed through camp. I felt like I was actually camping... cool experience. Hackers suck. When you launch the game you get a huge warning of hacking and if caught you'll be kicked off the servers forever. Yet the game is littered with hackers and they aren't shy about admitting it. Some can walk through walls jump high speed run and auto aim kill from 100 miles away. Keep telling yourself it's an Alpha and pray it gets better. I must say I've been playing games since the Atari 2600 and even in Alpha I'd say that Rust is my most favorite game I've played.

review: rustbrown coating that appears on metal when it gets weta reddish or yellowish brown flaking coating of iron oxide that is formed on iron or steel by oxidation especially in the presence of moisture.Rust is an iron oxide usually red oxide formed by the redox reaction of iron and oxygen in the presence of water or air moisture. Several forms of rust are distinguishable both visually and by spectroscopy and form under different circumstances. Rust consists of hydrated iron(III) oxides Fe2O3 nH2O and iron(III) oxide hydroxide (FeO(OH) Fe(OH)3). Given sufficient time oxygen and water any iron mass will eventually convert entirely to rust and disintegrate. Surface rust is flaky and friable and it provides no protection to the underlying iron unlike the formation of patina on copper surfaces. Rusting is the common term for corrosion of iron and its alloys such as steel. Many other metals undergo equivalent corrosion but the resulting oxides are not commonly called rust.

review: Warning! I just recently hit 100 hrs on this game and feel i should warn other players since Facepunch fails to do so. My irl Buddy and i were figureing the ins and outs of the game when we met another player in game who seemed to know his stuff. We decided to join him and his group and run around while he taught us some tactics. After 3 days of some serious grinding we recived a hacker buddy ban!?!?!? We are no longer aloud to play in the server b/c it turn out the guys we met were cheaters and not as good as we thought. So if you just play with people you really know and dont make friends in this game you should be fine. But if your like majority of people in the gaming community and want to make a clan and join up with people to have more power be very careful. I am extremley dissatisfied with the way facepunch has handeled this they refused to refund my money or unban me from the server or even consider it. They basically said we dont tolerate cheaters or anyone associated with them. Even though i met these "cheaters" in their server. Overall the game has a long way to go and considering it was only 20 dollars i would give it a 2 outta 5.

Finally this guy gets the balls to open his door only to take a arrow shaft right to the forehead where he then dies and falls to the canyon floor below lol. review: Nothing beats hiding in your Hut with three of your friends gathered around a fire pit at night time just hoping the chicken cooks fast enough before you starve to death.But wait! Whats that noise! *Footsteps in grass outside*Uknown says "Come out or We'll hack your door down and rip out your eyes!"Personally this game adds a thrill factor &amp pure adrenaline to a Survival Open World Multiplayer.Nothing can compare to chasing someone down with your rock naked as they run in fear sometimes screaming in the microphone while they are trying to escape. Just so you can plunder the spoils they have gathered while adventuring.Thus concluding Rust has made me enjoy Survival Open World gaming like no other has.It may have it's frustrating moments but once you pick yourself back up again and get back out in the wild there's nothing that can top the pure enjoyment. Kelles10/10

review: Having played the game for over 300 hours I figured it was about time to give this game an honest review.The Official Description "The only aim in Rust is to survive. To do this you will need to overcome struggles such as hunger thirst and cold. Build a fire. Build a shelter. Kill animals for meat. Protect yourself from other players and kill them for meat. Create alliances with other players and form a town. Whatever it takes to survive."Rust is at its core a magnificent social experiment in which the most ruthless and cunning survive. It is not a game for those easily upset and it is certainly not a game to be played alone.In my experience I've lived and died fought and fled built and destroyed and led rebellions and been deposed. Rust is one of the the most frustrating terrifying and satisfying games there is. Even though I definitely recommend Rust it is the level of satisfaction you'll earn playing this game is inarguably dependent upon what kind of player (and really what kind of person) you are.I'm not the kind of person that should play Rust I play as a lone wolf I get killed often because I don't kill everyone on sight and I try and fly under the radar by providing the more well off players with information and occasionally helping with tasks they might need. In the end I end up getting caught in the inevitable crossfire that occurs when two large groups collide.One aspect of Rust that is highly intriguing is that a person can utilize deception to their advantage. You can mislead people in such a way that they might think you are their friend allowing you to get close to them and assassinate them. You could confuse people as to your location. You can use it to avoid as much trouble as you can. And of course with deception you can just troll people.The game plays well and interesting things can happen when people come together. It all conglomerates into one big post apocalyptic island drama.Overall Rust is a great game but it's not for everyone. And remember (T)Rust no one...
title: Rust

review: After having 450+ hours in rust I can say that the game is most definitely worth the purchase. Rust has alot of action building and crafting to do. The PvP battles are fun engaging and rewarding. If you like ruining peoples day then rust is definitely the game for you!If you like giving kids abuse then rust is definitely the game for you!Pros Killing people is fun.Raiding peoples bases is fun. Still in alpha so more content is being added regulary. Game is well balanced.Well optimized. Cons Can get repetetive at times but if you don't mind that you will enjoy rust. Can be very time consuming. Because it is an online sandbox PvP world you need quite a bit of time for rust. Because your character and base stay in the game whilst your offline people can raid your base while you are AFK or offline at work. I found myself to love it whilst I was unemployed but now I'm back in full time work I don't really have as much time for rust. If you got 10 hours to kill a day on a game then rust is for you D!

review: "They looked at each other baffled in love and hate." Chapter 3 From Lord of the FliesI thought this game was going to be amazing... If you want to feel like you are in the novel "Lord of the Flies" then this is the game for you. Boys running around with their little Piggy trying to kill you. "Which is better to have rules and agree or to hunt and kill?" PiggyThere is no reasoning with the players. They lie to get close and kill you. As you respawn they kill you. They walk the beaches with their guns to shoot you down... naked with you only holding a rock and torch. This game is toxic literally filled with psychos. I can't even imagine female characters being put into this landscape (you start off as a naked man). Lots of racisim too. I don't know if this game can ever be fixed. The community is just awful. "Kill the pig! Cut his throat! Kill the pig! Bash him in!" The boysThere are still somes bugs in the game. The animals randomly disappear and the rain blinks in and out.EDIT The problem with this game is the onboarding. Most people will kill a naked on site. So if you are new... you'll propably die senselessly a couple of times. You also need a mic so you can chat ingame. Communication will get you far some times. Solo sucks find friends earn trust and trade mats/ bp with others. After hours of play I finally made a nice little base. Since I created my base I can now focus of other aspects of the game. The sever we are on currently wipes every week... which is good and bad. Now my home will be gone and I must start anew but players start off on just about the same footing. Still a grind though. Watch some youtube videos learn your map and find the Rust wiki. Another thing that I liked about the game are their ingame skins you can buy in the steam market place. It's a building game sandbox mmo tower denfense rpg fps and Second Life... depending on how you want to play it. steammocking steamsalty 10/10 would spawn again

review: Rust is a completely open world survival game the only goal is to survive. With the game's current mechanics the way of doing that is simply killing animals building shelter from raw materials and banding with other players or hiding from them.Rust at the moment is in it's early stages of Alpha something you don't really see from commercialised games Facepunch have been very open with their plans for the game and as a result is has attracted a lot of fans and general survivalist players.It has several unique features that released survival games don't have which gives this alpha a cutting edge on other titles such as "Infestation". Players can communicate over VOIP and the structure crafting system allows you to build almost anything you want with anything you can it follows a very logical process of creating items. The world is open not greatly designed but it is an alpha at the end of the day. It has no map and it is very difficult to gather bearings without using large landmarks or creating them yourself.Like all games Rust has it's problems but for me none of those have been core issues. My issues with the game are ones that plan on being removed or changed in later versions for example The zombies are too fast Weapons are too easy to craft There is a lack of non firearm weaponsI've played this game with friends it runs like a charm. There were a few issues connecting to servers both official and community but overall the game ran well was quick to install and there is a very little lack of optimisation. Where there is a lack of optimisation there is a list of console commands provided by facepunch to remove those graphical issues to improve performance.Overall Rust has to be one of my favourite 2013 games the community is fun to be around the developers are so open to critisim and are easy to contact and they're open to suggestions.
title: Rust

review: The first rule of Rust Never trust strangers!The second rule Make Metal doors!Imagine Minecraft and DayZ mixed together? While still in Alpha Rust brings a lot to the table (nothing new though). Weapons range from a simple bow to a powerful M4. What I most enjoy about Rust is that almost every item is craftable. This means that even if you lose your items to a bear or bandit then you can easily regain your losses. There is no single player in this game so if you plan on playing alone then you should probably stay away. You will not survive long if you're not with a group of trustworthy friends. There are hundreds of servers (although not all are full) to choose from so there will never be a problem with queues. I recommend playing on a low population server before diving into a high pop server since the map can get crowded with 100+ people. Unfortunately there are hackers present but I haven't run across many in my time. Always remember the first two rules of Rust!If you want to join my personal server then press F1 and type "net.connect 23.239.109.130 28165"It's a 50 slot PVP server but there are active Admins to monitor cheating/bad manners.

review: This has to be one of the best Early Accsess games currently available. Updates every week active community here and on reddit.With that said this is a game about building and surviving both against nature and other players. You collect resources by chopping down trees chipping away at stones and so on. You build your house search for blueprints around the large map in hopes of learning new exciting and powerfull things to build.How the game is played is very different depending on if you play on a server with a lot of players on it or not. If there is then it s about building a strong house fast become strong and raiding other players houses. But if there is not then it s more of a calm "building your house in a forest" kind of experience.I highly recommend it if you re looking for a surviving game with elements of building in it. Very fun game!

review: Product received for free. My friend bought this game in a 4 pack and was nice enough to give me a copy. So I loaded this baby up to see what all the fuss was about. I came to on a debris strewn coastline with not a damn thing on and anatomically correct lady bits (but I'm a guy???). I proceeded to explore my surroundings and found a wonderful pumpkin patch. I was pretty excited because who wouldn't be? I picked a few pumpkins and then noticed up stream there was a rickety old cabin type building. My curiosity got the best of me. I started making my way there when I heard a sound. In a fury I turned myself around rock at the ready. There standing before me was a man. But this was no ordinary man. It was the devil himself. Decked out in terrifying clothes no doubt made from the marijowannas. Atop his shoulders sat a carved out pumpkin. My heart sank. I knew it was the end for me. As he shot me in the face with his fully automatic crossbow I removed myself from my desk chair. Curled up into a ball. And began crying. My attacker must have heard this for all I heard after were the sounds of his terribly laughter. It will haunt me for the rest of my life.
title: Rust

review: One of my favorite games.
title: Rust

review: I have to work for a living I have places to be gotta attend stuff.Every time I start this game I have to build everything up from scratch. I can't really see why I keep doing that. It's the same thing over and over again. Chop some wood farm cloth mine some stone and metal get a furnace cookin'. The fun lies in the element of surprise random encounters with other people unlikely friendships (I've made some) fair PVP battles (especially the bow is great) conversations in the chatbox getting lucky with airdrops finding good stuff. Every time I start playing this the basics are the same and repetitive. But the randomness the surprises reactions of other people that's what makes this game. Negative aspects are huge fully geared clans who will destroy everyhting you once loved in a heartbeat. But that's also a matter of picking the right server. If you've much time on your hands you could eventually be the king of the server. I will never be the king I'm always the hunter in the forest keeping an eye out for trouble around the corner. I really do love this game.
title: Rust

review: This game IS fun don't get me wrong... I did have 72 hours like a week ago now i have about 140... I play this game because i think the pvp is good the community is funny and the game overall is fun yes... I will do pros and cons so lets get at it...Pros Alot of nice playersGood gameplayIt's repetetive but that feel when you get c4 and actually earn of it when you raid someone... &lt 3And probably one of the best survivals atmLoot system base building PVP PVE is so good i cant even explain it..Cons I remember i played this about 2 months ago and i got 60+ fps at 1080pNow i get 30 fps all low at 1080p so i dont play 1080p anymore...There's a quite bit of crashesNot alot of bugs but they're thereRust should do it so that you can turn off grass again as that literally boosts fps on some rigs with like 20 30 or just make it so that it doesn't ruin your preformance...Overall the cons are mostly preformance wise but gameplay wise the game is good...If you have an old rig then the fps is not that good but yeah.If you have a good rig then buy this if you like survival games that are intense...I give it a solid 8/10 when i get my new rig i will boost it to a 9/10 because of the crashes probably but yeah BUY IT

review: Basically if you die you lose pretty much everything. You can store a strongbox in a hut but they're destructable too and good luck appearing anywhere near them when you die unless you also have sleeping bags......which require animal skins...which require weapons to kill animals...which require staying alive for long enough to build tools collect resources build a hut a strongbox weapons kill 3 6 animals and fashion a sleeping bag before dying.GLWT.Took me a day to make a pair of pants and they were stolen within five minutes.Took me a week to build a hut and someone bashed the door in 30 seconds later killed me and looted my strongbox.Took me a month to build a stone hut with a wooden hut some distance away for backup and two sleeping bags.When I logged in the next day my wooden hut was gone and someone had beaten their way in and changed the locks on my stone hut.Who could have done such a thing? Someone with the kind of high level weapons you will never ever get in a world as hostile as rust.Back to the very beginning of the game by which I mean I went back to the point before it had been installed on my computer and I've never looked back since.It was definitely an interesting experience but I didn't learn much that I liked about myself or other people.
title: Rust
