The building is phenomenal the map looks amazing there's endless amounts of things you can do from raiding to just trolling people . The main problem I see people have with this game is they say it's too toxic . What online pvp game isn't toxic . The only difference in rust is you're going to get taken advantage of as lose everything unlike other games where you can just carry on . It's very very hard at first there's so much to learn although it is a lot easier for noobs now no backwards walls harder to raid . Face punch is by far my favorite developers not only for the amazing game but also because they are working so hard to make it better every single week right on time with an update . I can't wait till Thursday to see what's new . If you aren't a and love survival games I suggest you buy this and become a pvp raiding clan killing legend .. review: ALPHA ReviewIt's hard to fully judge a game that's this early in development and this being the first ever game ive actually played that was in its Alpha stage i dont have other games to compare it to. I in general dont like to play games that arent fully finished but since my friend gifted this to me i decided to give it a shot. and almst 60 hours later in the timespan of 3 or so days i am completely hooked. Survival type of games are games im not too familar with with the exception of something like Amnesia but thats a completely different kind of survival. I hopped into a new server on Rust with only a rock a torch and 2 bandaids. Now i have all kinds of guns heaps of food and a pretty decent sized base that me and some other friends i met through the game now live in. The community is pretty friendly from what ive seen so far sure there's those particular people who go around killing people for no good reason but since its PvP you cant blame them. Either way i believe this has the chance of becoming a fantastic game and something i can see putting hundreds maybe even thousands of hours into. Even in its alpha stage i do believe the game warrants its $20 price tag and if youre a fan of these type of games youre missing you if you dont get this.

review: *After many updates and a small GPU investment i can now safely say that this is again a good game it is fun to play and there is alwayes someone to fight. If you think the games to slow go on a 10x server that to fast try a 3x. What ever you chose im sure youl find a way to have fun.Play time 700h+ (I had a diffrent account that i gave to my brother)Ok this game was amazing i repeat was amazing. I could run it on my potato at around 30 40fps. There were aton of grate plugins for servers the map was of fair size and loot could be found. If you liked the game loot how it was there where servers for that. If you wanted a more fast paced kind of game where you could jump in and get loot like that there where servers for that too. However there were a ton of bugs the bugs couldnt be fixed on the current engine so the develpers started the game again exept they took everything that made the old game good took a on it. Giveing us a map that was way to big loot that was no wear to be found and frame rates that unless you were running on a 700+ rig look like a playing with a flip book for a moniter. However this was ok because they gave you the choice to play the old rust on launch if you so wanted to but now they have scraped it completly turning the game that i once couldnt wait to get home and play in to a game i consider a waist of 15

review: I bought Rust on January 23 2016 and I have now racked up 1000 hours. I think it is about time that I write a review on this game since I have dedicated so much of my time towards playing. Rust is a game that I am willing to play I enjoy the grind as of the most recent update (blueprints V2) I think the game has improved a lot as before this update there were people roaming with AK s on the first day. I believe that rust is heading in the right direction as they release an update weekly and I am always keen to see what new feature they have released. All in all rust is a great game and I would recommend it to any one as it is unique and always being updated.10/10

review: Its money worth and I didn't regret it so far.Positive Aspects Easy to learn simple game nothing too complicated in there Almost weekly updates Nice atmosphere High potential (Game's actual content is by 5 10%) Countless servers with different rules / plugins / community very "free" Gameplay very fun in interaction with other people Negative Aspects Still has some bugs (as game is in alpha) Decay on buildings can be molesting (specially on wooden ones) List of Community Servers can be confusing (too many incl. many empty ones) Can become boring quite fast if played soloThe game itself is supposed to be a survival game. Unfortunately this seems limited atm to "survive" against other players as once you have your basic stuff the environment isn't any danger anymore. At this point one must not forget that RUST still is under development and in early alpha so we still may expect alot more of content than it is by now.You better have a rather high frustration limit as this game might force you to start over again and again (and again ...) after being killed and raided. One should see this as a challenge or try one of the PVE Servers (there are also economy servers and such).So yes the game is actually pretty good specially for its alpha state and there's still much to expect from it in the future.And btw after me having the game my husband and my brother have bought it aswell after seeing me playing so I guess it can't be that bad )

review: Where to start with this game.Skip to the end for summary.SYNOPSISYou wake up in a post apocalyptic world you have no idea where you are or who you are but your first thoughts go to survival with rock and torch in hand you start hacking away at a tree in hopes to create a shelter in so that you can survive just a little longer then BAM a bullet goes through your brain from the AK 47 of some guy dressed in road signs the last thing you hear are his taunts "Noob Git Gid" as your eyes close all you see are his balls slapping your face.You wake up in a post apocalyptic world you have no idea where you are or who you are when a very strong feeling of deja vu hits you with rock and torch in hand you set out to survive... Wait is that a naked guy with a pumpkin on his head?GRAPHICSDoes are sum nice tiddies fanservice aside the graphics in this game are really THICC... I mean nice. Jokes aside this game is not the prettiest nor is it the ugliest the style really does bring that post apoclyptic all around me is death hopeless feeling while still remaing rather nice to look at.GAMEPLAYThe gameplay feels kinda of clunky and THICC. The animations aren't the the greatest and kinda put me off but all other aspects of the gameplay are enjoyable. It is also not ver intuitive but it does bring that feeling of "I don't know" that you would have in a apocalypse so it kinda makes sense that you must fend for yourself. Finally getting a base set up and getting tons of resources only to have them stolen away you then rinse and repeat until you get strong enough to do the same to all the other people on the server.And yes that is the best feeling in the world stealing all the other people's phat lewt.WARNING THIS GAME IS GRINDY AND YOU NEED TO BE COMMITED TO IT.STORY AND LOREYou wake up in a post apocalyptic world you have no idea where you are or who you are but where the hell is that music coming from... you climb up a hill and find a guy singing dubstep. A spear goes through your neck.MULTIPLAYERThis game is all about that multiplayer. Sure you can go onto a server with no people and play by yourself but thats WEAK. The whole point of this game is to screw other people over while not being screwed over yourself this game is amazing multplayer if you have friends to play with otherwise you can just slave for a zerg clan or try to fend for yourself though that's almost never going to work it is still fun. It is extremely fun just to be toxic this game doesn't ban toxic people but instead encourages it. You could meet a nice guy so you follow him back home then he stabs you with a bone knife and takes your stuff. The community is straight up toxic but it doesn't even matter if anything that toxicity is what makes Rust Rust.CUSTOMIZATIONHey I don't remeber selecting to be a white chick oh wait you I can't chose? So this is my life now.Besides the non existent character creation you still get to have skins in this game and the cool thing about the skins is they are almost all created by the community Thank you community for this Turkey Rock we are about to recieve... To the head probably. MISC You need a mid to high range PC No tutorial though this does make the game more immersive Used to have zombies now has bears. THOSE F*CKING BEARS. Yo dawg we heard you like spawning so we put a base outside of your base so we can snipe you on your way out. More stranger things happen than Stranger Things. I spawned in the snowy part of the map and now i'm dead. EXTRA THICC Tanks and Pumpkins and Caveman Guns oh my!MY PERSONAL ENJOYMENTThis game is like an abusive uncle to me. Its cruel to me for my own good you soon toughen up to all the taunting that goes down and you soon start to enjoy it. The story is non existent but who cares? TIDDIES!This game is one of the best if you enjoy trolling around with friends or on the other side of the spectrum a survival nut who has his own underground bunker and ready to survive the apocalypse all super cereal like.I give this game 9 turkey rocks out of 10.

review: Ok there are a lot of reviews out there. Some say it's good others say it isn't worth the time or effort (at least the experimental version anyway). What do I say about the experimental version of Rust? I think it has potential. Yes I have had problems getting stuff to be placed I've had server crashes every 5 minutes but why do I continue to play? It is a question that I answer with it has the potential to be GREAT. Long have I searched for a pure survival game that isn't Minecraft (if you would consider that a "survival game"). I wanted to be dropped into the world with nothing but the clothes on my back and my brain to survive. Then I found Rust where you don't even get the luxury of clothes on your back. I began foraging supplies then was attacked by a bear and died. I respawned on another side of the world where I again gathered resources only to find out I don't know how to open my inventory! Crap! This game is REALLY hardcore! It doesn't even give you a tutorial! After pushing a bunch of random buttons (primarily the "I" button) I discovered through forums that the inventory button is... CRAP! A wolf found me AFK and now I'm dead. I then respawned in the MIDDLE OF A DEN OF BEARS! I knew I had to either sneak or fight my way out! So I decided to go balls to the wall with my rock and began bashing a bear's skull in. I killed the bear only to die from severe bleading.These were the things that I wanted from a survival game and I got it in the Experimental Rust. Yeah we all know that Legacy is soo much better but hey give the developers a chance. We are playing as they are developing.Personally this game will stay in my steam library for a LONG LONG time! It's fun interactive hardcore creative buggy at times depending on what system you're running on but an overall awesome game.Unless the developers decide to give this game a story line. Then I'm out.

review: I would like to note I am aware I have barely played this game. Let me explain why. There is no singleplayer and the multiplayer is terrible. If they could add a singleplayer the game would almost top most survival games. However you are forced to play with other players. Of which I should note. Are extremely hostile naked and will smack you with a rock y. I spawn after a lengthy load. As I spawn asleep I struggle to wake the up. After waking up and getting to land after sleeping in water I notice a naked man hitting a rock onto the top of a small shack. I watch him for a small amount of time before the roof breaks and he falls in. I try to go inside to see if he is okay. He chases me with a rock for three hundred years. As I travel or should I say flee. I pass many terribly built structures and finally pass a group of three naked women I stop to admire and than I got smacked by a rock. Bleeding badly. I fled into a river to find a new naked man spying on the naked women looking around for the evil naked man chasing me and not seeing him I spy with him. I get off because that would only be playable on singleplayerLord Lich Rate 3/5 Unless there would be a singleplayer 5/5

review: I got this game barely 3 days ago and as of this review I have 20 hours of gameplay. Yes it is addicting. First Day Spawn on beach Ask various question in relation to getting help in chat Someone decides to find me and take me to their base He runs over 30minutes to find me Some other guy ran past me while I was looking at a bridge in the distance and said "You gotta pay a toll to cross that bridge" Awaits scared for my life in a bush for the guy helping me Another newcomer finds him before he finds me We spot each other so I come out and chat with him and the other newcomer Us 3 run back to his base I spot a guy sleeping Helping guy bashes his head in takes his stuff and I freak out Back to running and I see tons of beautiful landscapes Find the base and he gives me some tools a weapon and clothes to hide my thumb sized Comes night time the other newcomer logged off and an airdrop is on the way Helping guy goes to get it and actually gets it Runs back I hear gunshots My heart starts racing He tells me to help him I don't know what to do He spawns behind me Guarantees me the shooter can't get up to our base due to the radius building privileges.Hears knocking on the door Freaks out at helper guy for false hope He doesn't understand either Helper guy tells me to stay quiet and not move or turn lights on Hears knocking on the other door Sweating like a woman in labor Helper guy says we have to do this Hands him my stubby shotgun He runs outside and dies in a gun battle again Content with the kills and loot the bad guy leaves End of Day 1 10/10 completely amazing game except for my very small

review: If there ever was a metaphor for crack addiction this game personifies it best. Also I'm sure they modeled this game off of Somalia.Firstly if you spawn into a server already well on it's way you will HATE this game. You WILL BE TROLLED over and over and over and OVER (get the point) again. People in this game will make you hate humanity until you realize that this game was designed as an outlet for all those children bullied throughout their pathetic lives. And by children I mean 5 year olds who just heard the F word for the first time and won't stop repeating it until their voices go horse. Once you get passed that and find someone who will let you live long enough to put some pants on you will begin to see the charm of this game.At first you will say "I will rise above the trolls and griefers I will not be a dirty turd and p0wn n00bs (over and over and over again). I have standards higher than this I am a member of the HUMAN RACE after all!". However this WILL change this game WILL change you! Eventually when you get an ax you will begin to grind said ax on anything and anyone within swinging distance. The ax will lead to bows/arrows and then to guns grenades rockets land mines ect. Oh this will not suffice however soon YOU WILL BECOME THE TROLL. Your favorite food will be the tears of your enemies and the screams coming from the piles of nakeds just outside your door will be the only music you can sleep to at night. Yes you are now the monster you feared you'd become. At least you can paint peacful paintings on your wooden sign outside your home hiding the shame and disgusts learking inside.This game is addicting I now find myself tea bagging random strangers in real life. Thanks Rust!10 out of 10P.S You know who you are who trolled me (over and over and over again) I will find you and I will kill you!

review: For a game that is currently at its Alpha Stage I find it sensational (9/10).Initially I found it quite difficult to get started with but after approximately 100 hours of game play I felt I had a genuine grasp of the game. The real hook for me was the 'time investment' factor into to tasks and how ruthless/fragile the game can be. A perfect example was when I first started I spent a solid 2.5 hours gathering timber and stone to prep a base / I then spent 30 minutes crafting boxes / shelves and upgrading my base to stone until I realised I required a Furnace to generate Metal Fragments to create a Sheetmetal Door + Code Lock. Hence I had to venture out and hunt local animals to acquire the animal fat (for low grade fuel) to produce the furnace and after about 45 minutes of hunting I had attained enough cloth and animal fat for 3 furnaces (of course now I am far more efficient). On my venture back I was attacked from an absolute savage camping in a bush with a pipe shotgun and then polished off with an arrow to the spine only moments from my front door. To my grief the key to my wooden door was taken by the savage he then accessed my front door killed me as I awoke from my sleeping bag then hacked at my sleeping bag before I respawned and cleared my building rights.I swelled with Rage but then moments laughed it off "reminding me that it s just a game."My cheeky brain then took over from the disgust of what just happened and realised thatthe 2.5hours of gathering + 30minutes of setting up + 45minutes hunting and then being assassinated took up 3hrs &amp 45 minutes of my time just like that.. Giving that filthy wanka 3.75hrs of my hard earned effort... i.e. 3.75hours "time investment" for me became +3.75 for the savage stranger in literally 2 minutes. **I then punched my dog my wall and my family portrait in fury**This forced me to ironically 'adapt' 'evolve' my early game play style to a. Box out my tool box so no others can access it even when my base is breached (unless extreme measures are used)b. Create an airlock to my base (second layer of passage for those who don't know the expression)c. Bury a small stash in a secret location before doing my errands so that if I am killed before returning there is no risk of my base being breached (this of course a temporary measure until I acquire my code lock and metal door)d. Do not annotate on my map the exact location of my base so that I am not tracedetc etc etc.Long story short this is the best survival game I ve played It truly is cruel and rewarding and can be addictive so don't get too involved.I do recommend this game for 16years + as it requires a higher degree of logic and "mental prowess" to be successful as a solo player.For those who are wondering l too have become a filthy wanka .

review: As a player who has owned the game since "Legacy" I can honestly say I am pleased with how the game has progressed. I have about 250 hours logged on the game that I have owned for nearly the entire life of the game. I have played on and off since it came out and currently I feel like the game is a much improved version of when in first came out. I read the road map and I like the idea of the XP and level system/skill system. I think it would be interesting if you would grant certain skills or XP for those players with a lot of play time or have owned the game for a long time like myself. A little perk for those who have been here since the start through good times and bad times )As for my opinion of the game I originally purchased it with 3 other friends not a month or so after the release. When the game got too intensive for my one friends Mac and the game began to take shape of what it is today we drifted away disappointed of what it was becoming. Fast forward a year from then and whole lot of progress from the developers team and we get to where we are now back to a game that is fun to play and in my opinion well worth my original $20.

review: the game is realy horrid when geting started because everyone in the game is just either a squeeker who follows you or a bandit (95% of the time its a bandit) and you just constantly die straight after you get a glimmer of hope that you may just soon get established on the server. so you have your little shack with the wooden door and you have your fire going to cook the chicken you collected from pigs and you have a bed down as a spawn poing and your little wooden crate to store your loot and mabie even a bow as a defence. But suddenly you hear footsteps outside on your roof and circling around your base. ITS BANDITS! your not sure what to do sit and wait or do you be a man nut up and go outside to defend your small semi established kingdom you call home? ofcourse you just be a about it and stay in the base because who are you kidding you have a pair of pants on and a rock to defend your sorry the bandits start hiting the door with their hatchet and you tell them to leave you they say no. you offer them everything you have for exchange for your pathetic life. they decline and simpily disreguard your cries for salvation. the break the door down they kill your helpless strugling half naked vessel you call a body and take what little gear you own and break your bed. you respawn where are you? you dont know but what you do know is that you have to start again but this time you will get bigger and better until one day you have established yourself succesfuly and you make yourself the king of the server the richest raider that ever lived the most dangerous bandit to come across. all until one day you get raided your base has all its doors replaced and you have to start from the begining.

review: Ultimate Survivalgame! Playing from the early start when Rust (Legacy) was just started on steam.I loved the way it develops i run multiple servers for Rust Legacy and Rust Experimental and i will keep doing this until the client reaches RC state ( or maybe longer?) .The game is still in Alpha stage and gives the player so much fun being a survivalist in the early state after a apocalypse.From running with a rock to hunt down animals gather resources to build your home or tools that makes you gather easier so you can build more and more ( think of Tools/Guns/Ammo/Buildingparts/Usable items).Till hunting down other players to raid their bases and take all their stuff so you can move up the chain of eaten or be eaten only the strongest will survive! I love the way it develops cause of the numberous Bugs that come with it! If you are a " i want to play the perfect game NOW" you must thing it over before buying it!If you are a player that likes to see a game grow every week ( weekly updates) with the possibility to "forced" start all over again ( cause of massive updates that totally screws up everything(NOT always!) then you are at the right spot buy it &amp you'll like it!!!I really recommend this game!

review: The game is simple and easy to play yet harsh with the various radiation zones that litter the landscape. New players will often get lost fairly easily in game but with the help of the 'road' and hopefully friendly players new players will be able to get up and have fun. That being said most servers are PVP and players are rather more bandit then friendly they often shoot first and loot second for new players a PVE server to better understand the game is far better. Sometimes when your not careful the game becomes a harsh and unforgiving environment and the struggle to survive becomes more apparent which personally is a great reminder that Rust is survival game at its coreOverall with the harshness but also rewarding experience players will love the detail and at times complexity of RustWould recommend 10/10

review: Holy crap. Rust is the kind of game that you don't really get the chance to experience fully unless you play it a lot. The sheer amount of stuff you can do is staggering. Want to get a few friends and farm for endgame gear? I've done it and it was a blast. Want to hop around on servers messing arond? That too. Everything that can be done in this game can be done in its own way that's so much fun. It's easily some of the best fun I have ever had playing a game and I don't think that most of the stuff that happens in Rust can happen anywhere else.10/10.

review: in the video "your first" day of rust" they should have had (get killed and all your stuff taken and start again) but to be real i have had this for a long time good and bad hours back in the old legacy days of rust... it has definently improved alot and i cant wait to see what else they do.pros beautiful looking game good combat crafting systems and a good game that u can either casual play or go full balls deep in gamecons community community and the glitches that happen every once in awhile and maybe a few more but there isnt to much to complain about... when legacy first died off rust just sat there slowly dieing.. then all of a sudden they started almost from scratch on a new version of rust and ever since then u can go look at devblogs and they update it a good amount and its always fun to play as a game in a whole i would rate this 8.5/10 it isnt the perfect game at this moment yet.....but i hope that it will be on top of the survival genre soon.... and if you read other review yes u will possibly lose everything to some bandits.... but if u care that much about it either never go offline or never play survial games cause that IS a part of it is that risk

review: This game is not for the feint hearted. It is going to kick your and beat you down. It is full of people who want nothing more than to blow into your house murder you and take everything you worked so hard for. The community is nothing short of sperglords and trolls. And that is why I love it. People whine and cry about roof campers and naked hunters and KOS. But this is a game of resource wars it should be expected. But this game is built in such a way that a naked with a few spears can take down a full kitted guy with a well placed headshot. Got a huge clan on the server? Place cabnets around their base and raid their external cabnets. Make them frustrated. Make them squirm.Those who are skilled and smart will thrive in this game if you have the determination. But this game is not for everyone. Be it the game itself or the community this is not a place for your feelings. So take your fifi's and put them away for a few hours.

review: So pushing 800 hours I can give you a solid review. Playing this game solo is hard. You will get rolled over and over again by 3 5 man roaming squads. BUT playing solo is more satisfying as well... I mean EVERYTHING you have you earned yourself. Makes pvp more thrilling. I would recomend roleplaying ( talking to random people using the in game mic ) and getting cool with people in the game to start off. Like I said before playing the game solo is fun yet hard but I feel playing this game with a friend or 2 makes it just TOO fun. building up a big base together defending that base when a zerg clan tries to shoot 20+ rockets at your base as you kill people and repair up and keep them at bay go to sleep KNOWING you killed all those baddies but wake up in the morning to see they just came back 3 hrs later when you were sleeping and took everything!Hahah no lie this game is fun. Mastering the Recoil has never been more fun. If you love Risk vs Reward play with a VERY competative pvp scene then this is the game for you. KILL ON SIGHT. NO ONE IS FRIENDLY. TRUST NO ONE. Those are the 3 laws of the land on Rust. ENJOY!

review: Ok so Rust.Rust is a very time consuming game. You start off with a rock and a torch and basically need to gather resources and set up a home and satisfy your hunger/thirst. This game is basically Minecraft and DayZ thrown into a mix up but with better gameplay than both. This game is very frustrating as you will come across teams of players that get quite large in Rust I have made 50 friends in 192 hours. Pros Crafting Crafting does take time and requires a fair amount of time to get resources but is one of the better aspects of this game.PvP PvP in Rust is great it is very annoying but is great fun. It takes time to actually get good at Rust PvP and the excuse "I am really good at CSGO" does not apply with this FPS game.Hunting In the early stages of this game hunting was quite easy and simple as even if you spooked the animal it would only run 10m or so away but in the newer updates it has picked up quite a lot more animals have been added and when you shoot/wound an animal you either hope you kill it there and then or you try and follow it as it runs away and bleeds out however if you do not follow the animal there is a good chance your going to lose it seeing as they actually run away now.Community The Rust community is mixed it has it's good and bad. I am fortunate enough to have met around 50 good players in Rust that I now call mates. People have a way of trading gear not shooting on site and healing random players when killing them by mistake. Food So the food aspect of this game is fairly basic you eat and your food bar fills. However the greatest part of Rust is when you kill your first horse boar or even deer and realise. You just harvested Wolf meat. It is always fun too kill a horse and cook up some Wolf meat from it.Cons Cheating Rust Legacy is now basically dead and the few that remain are mostly hackers as the amount of free cheats for Rust Legacy that COMPLETELY up gameplay for others is incredible. Valve no longer protects Legacy as they once did which grants 80% of the Rust community too cheat and avoid a VAC ban. However it is very easy too catch these cheaters I reccomend not wasting your time on Legacy. There is obviously cheats for Experimental for those who are willing too pay for hacks such as HelioS or Iniuria but even then admins are very good.Abuse Of course every game that requires anybody to start a server and become admin has admin abuse Rust is not as bad as some games such as Minecraft or plain old Counter Strike but it is still there in my time on Rust I have seen admins spawn in 250 airdrops at once crash servers ban players without testing harrass and abuse players and kill in God mode. Unfortunately there is nothing anybody can do about this but it is there on the odd server.Rust overall is a game that will keep you on the edge and have you tense in frustration. The sound is great and it is always fun too go down too the beach and get chased away by 7 people screaming "Allah Akbar" into their mics. In Rust you have the ability to build hunt engage in PvP gather take players hostage trade raid make mates or just simply play forever alone and make yourself a hill top mansion.I really reccomend Rust despite the negative reviews from players who may be experiencing FPS lag problems with cheaters not a proper understanding of the game or even just not their type of game. If you enjoy games like H1Z1 DayZ or The Forest I believe you will enjoy Rust. It has come a long way since it's original release date and I still believe has a lot of potential. I reccomend you have a decently good PC as Rust does require a fairly good processor and video card too run it smoothly keeping that in mind I ran Rust fairly smooth on around 19 FPS using a HP Laptop with AMD A4 6210 APU with AMD Radeon R3 Graphics 1.80GHzInstalled Memory (RAM) 8.00GB (6.94 Usable)System Type 64 Bit Operating System x64 Bases ProcessorI hope this review helps you decide whether or not you wish too buy Rust and have fun.

review: This review was a joke review I'll try to do my best to make it an actual review.First off Rust is a survival game you have to invest time into my review will be broken into 3 sections Survival Crafting/Building and the PvP.Survival The survival aspect of Rust is what makes it challenging the Hunger and Thirst can get you when you least expect it to.The godly animals that can warp from the ground to a rock they are standing next to are hard to hunt but yield good rewards.Each tool you use in order to gather resources is different PickAxes are used to break down Nodes you find around Rock clusters to gain Stone Metal Sulfur and High Quality metal ores.Hatchets are used to gather Wood.The best way to gather leather and animal fat in this game is with bone knives.If you use a wrong tool(for example hatchet on a node) your aim will shift up by a considerable amount.Crafting/Building The Crafting and Building part of this game is what requires you to invest time into the game.Crafting takes time unlike other games and the materials required for certain weapons and armour are hard to find.The buildings you make are always vulnerable They can either be taken down with C4 or Rockets.There are a variety of building parts to choose from that may or may not make your building more resistant to explosives or gunfire.The best part about building in Rust is the Stability system.Stability ranges from 0% to 100% 100% being the most stable.PvP The PvP aspect of this game makes it all the more thrilling.There are a variety of weapons to choose from from Clubs made from broken Femurs to modern day Light Machine Guns.I won't go into depth with all of these weapons.You know how Counter Strike has Recoil patterns? Rust has them too but the Horizontal recoil(The one that goes left and right) is completely RnG. There is a bit of luck to controlling yourRecoil in this game.The hunting bow is probably the hardest ranged weapon to master in this game it shoots slow moving projectiles but is highly rewarding when you hear that headshot hitsound. Best of all it is a default weapon you don't need to learn it to craft it.The Crossbow is a non default weapon which means you have to find it from blueprint pages or barrels scattered accross roads and monuments. It is way better than the hunting bow since it fires the arrows faster and has more base damage.Over all this game gets a 7/10 for me there are some optimization issues but anyone with a computer made within 5 years can run this game at atleast 30 fps.

review: Rust is truly a standout top notch survival game. The gameplay coupled with the freedom to play however you wish lends itself to highly emergent and immersive gameplay scenarios. Thi is the best survival game hands down but this just isn't for survival game enthusiasts. This game belongs in EVERY FPS fan's library. It's easily worth the modest price of entry. The replay value is limitless. I've gotten my money's worth 100 times over.On top of everything Facepunch Studios has displayed incredible gumption in the face of critique after they scrapped Legacy Rust but what emerged (Rust in it's current form made from the ground up!) is absolutely amazing. They have shown an awe inspiring level of attentiveness to the community. Their work ethic with respect to constand updates and bug fixes and their dedication to making this game truly great is exceptional. Development has been 100% transparent throughout the duration of development leaving its users secure in the game's future. In kind it has improved markedly every step of the way. Facepunch is THE company that every other company should model their Early Access titles after. If you don't own Rust you should. Start with a couple of friends and dive in head first. You won't regret it.

review: This game gets a good review BUT BE WARNED! I do not recommend the vanilla version of the game! You will spend a whole 24 hours in real life just to get set up for example if you go raiding the total time required to craft a single c4 from scratch is almost 27 minutes ALSO! you will need a whole c4 more just to break a stone wall.. which most people have and more walls behind that! and on top of that you will need raiding essentials like guns clothes armor ammo which would take AGES! Unless you like extreme survival frustration risk and time consumption i recommend modded servers. Don't be discouraged when i say moded. It involves no work other than joining the server. The gather rates are higher and you instant craft this means in some 8 times gather servers you could be up and raiding in a half hour! Compared to the hours you will spend working and dying in vanilla. This is all considering you have blueprints. Now what are blueprints? A blueprint is simply learning how to craft something all advanced things require these such as C4 rockets guns base defences etc blueprints can drop or you may get fragments which help in the research of Blue prints.. Upon this whole mess moded servers drop more blueprints and fragments while vanilla has it pretty difficult. Now i do recommend this game in moded version. Its very fun and addicting. I would recommend it giving vanilla 4/10 and moded 9/10 )

review: Buy this game immediately So I've been playing Rust for a while and I definitely say that no matter what this game in Alpha is better than most fully complete survival games on the market. It makes other games in the survival genre boring and lackluster by comparison. Rust is a beautiful game with incredible graphics even on the lowest setting. It has a lush and vibrant landscape with majestic mountains and an even lovlier sunrise and sunset. Rust is the kind of game I can't get mad at no matter how many times I've been raided or killed. Rust could easily ascend to be the next Game of the Decade upon release (or at any point thereafter). My friends and I are always ready to sit down and enjoy some delicious Pig Chicken and be ready for our next great adventure in the untamed wilderness that is Rust.10/10

review: Rust away Previously in Rust I was playing the game with zombies instead of the bloody (or red) animals. I have also logged on after the update that replaced the zombies and I have to say I'm a little torn yet I understand why they want to do the natural survivalist game seeing as every game seems to be a zombie game now a days (not a complaint). This will be mostly the general game play setting and feel of Rust. So as a brand new naked guy that is spawned in the middle of nowhere yea that's right butt naked born from mother earth herself as if a miracle had just bloomed a huge horned flower that blossomed into you. You start by running and harvesting materials from animals trees and rocks if your smart. If your not smart you'll run until you find someone that is going to kill you or you'll run far away from a bunch of hostile animals but let's pretend your smart. So as you gather materials you will probably start wondering "what am I doing with my life"... in the game I mean. Well you can open your inventory up and as far as now you look center top of the screen and you will notice a tab named "crafting". Curious? Click it. You'll find a list on the right side of your screen pops up. This is a full list of things you can create once you click an item it will drop a material and quality list below that. Now that I've tricked you Ill make you aware that out in the open world those red animals I mentioned occasionally drop "loot bags" that may contain things like "blueprints" which if used with an item that is not in your crafting list will create a spot for that item as well as include materials and quantity. Also in towns or civilian buildings you will find chests that can contain the same things. Typically better loot as well as a higher quantity. Once you've gotten further down the line in the game you'll have a house and some things inside that house. Maybe you'll also have chosen to wear some clothes. Whatever it is you'll find that the game kind of ends once you have found and learned to craft all items in the sense that there isn't really any story to the game yet. Who said you need a story to play a game though? Altogether this game has a very exciting and expandable foundation for what could be one of the best survivalist crafting games of it's gen!

review: There are two ways to play Rust (in its current state). Spoiler alert both of them suck.Currently the game can be broken down into several phases. In the first phase you wake up naked in a field with nothing but a rock a torch and some bandages and must learn how to survive in a harsh world full of things that will make quick work of you if you give them the chance. Luckily you've apparently received survival traing from Bear Grylls himself and after a couple days of hunting gathering and drinking your own you'll find yourself fully clothed sufficiently housed and probably armed. Now begins the fun part!In this next phase you run around aimlessly gathering materials and killing zombies raiding abandoned towns for loot and hoping every time that you'll get something extraordinary. Mostly you won't but the variety between smacking rocks with a pickaxe and becoming an expert zombie hunter is enough to keep you doing it until you find something great. That special something is of course your first real gun. And what can you do with that gun? Of course you can kill more zombies and continue on your present course or if you're so inclined you COULD be a total .As I mentioned before there are two ways to play this game. What I've described above is for the most part the friendly way to play. Being that this is an online only game you will undoubtedly run into other players and you will be given the choice of how to deal with them. The friendly option is to help them if they need it or leave them alone if they don't. But there's a small problem with that being friendly is how you lose the game.I'm reminded of a team building exercise designed to be employed in offices and other workplaces in which the group of interest is divided into two teams unable to communicate with each other and a game is played in turns. Each turn of the game each team must make a choice Red or Blue. If both teams choose Red both teams will receive points. If both teams choose Blue both teams will lose points. However if one team chooses Red and the other Blue then the one that chose Red will lose double points and the one that chose Blue will gain double points. Obviously the best option for the whole is both teams always choose Red and everybody wins. But the best option for one team is to always choose Blue counting on the other team to choose Red and completely them over. (If you look into this experiment you'll find that almost without fail teams choose Blue repeatedly and both teams lose.)In the end Rust is just a very complex version of this game. The Red way to play the game is to gather resources build a fortress to secure your valuables and be nice and helpful to everybody who comes your way. This is beneficial to everyone and nobody suffers. Except you of course when you are surrounded by people playing the Blue way which is to let all the Red players grind away at resource gathering and break into their houses / kill them to steal their things. Obviously this is the easiest way to gain access to rare things but you do sacrifice some of the experience of the game if you choose to play this way. Also you're a person.Understandably this is a part of the game. This is not something that was overlooked. It was definitely intentional that this trust problem exist in the game as a part of the experience. Much like the real world the fastest way to the top is by stepping on other people but unlike the real world there are zero consequences to your negative actions other than possibly getting bored with the game faster than you otherwise would. Further it is frighteningly easy to play this way. Structures are not easily built for defense and any things that provide deterrent to other players can usually be bypassed with minimal effort. And even so regardless of what you do you will almost certainly lose everything you have to someone else. The only sustainable defense against other players is to never be around them and in a game with no Single Player mode that won't last very long.I get it. It's not a complete game. Although I find myself wondering if it's not a complete game then why the hell did I pay $20 for it? Because I'm an idiot of course. "Early Access" is a sugary way of saying "Public Alpha " which is a short way of saying "I know this is utter but please pay for it now instead of when it's worth any amount of money promise you'll enjoy seeing us change everything you came to love about it. Management"Conclusion Don't bother with this game until it's much more fleshed out. Hopefully the developers will address the social issues of the game that make it so unrewarding to play but I'm not holding my breath.

review: Rust is a fickle game where you will have your ups and downs. its all a matter of many key factors are you playin by yourself? or with friends? are you on a server where the denizens are friendly or are the the kind of people who will kill on sight. (KOS for those who are new to the survival genre.) usually your life when you start outs a 50 50 chance but as you catch on and you get with a good group of friends everything comes kinda naturally. Its an incredible game for an alpha and its one you can put a lotta time into. Youll have some good times some bad times some horrid times where you feel like rage quitting and others where you feel on top of it all. I am eager to see where facepunch studios decides to take this game ) sure its not the prettiest game but this games got whatta lot of modern and pretty looking games nowadays have challenge and charm. All in all its a fun and addicting game that i can see myself putting many more hours into and i cant wait to see what the future holds for rust. ) (P.S. it isnt a rust review without mentioning the naked men and rocks) D

review: If you're looking for an open survival game thats rough around the edges but all in all completely and utterly satisfying Rust is for you. After 60 hours of play I havent seen a single hacker but the more populated servers can certainly hold a few. Met a number of cool people and starting an entire neighbourhood can be delightfully entertaining while you build from the ground up and fend off would be raiders. There is a solid learning curve but once you get the hang of it it is a blast. Just make sure that when somone tells you that "Alt+f4 gives you infinite resources" you don't take their advice. The playerbase can be exceptional or frustrating. Find a server that works for you.Oh and deer drop chicken meat. 10/10

You can't do a server alone or for just you and your friends. And you cannot play offline. My experiences in this game have been horrible. I haven't been able to accomplish a single thing because all the other players keep deciding that they need to kill me for no reason. I understand it's part of the game. But at the sametime I feel there should be an offline type feature to prevent you from losing all your hard work and to avoid the people who only aim to kill you and beat you down. So... All in all I love this game but do NOT recommend it to people who do not have any patience to deal with a**hole players. But... if you enjoy the aspect behind the game and can handle dealing with said a**hole players you should buy it and support this company. They made a great product.

review: Rust is a survival game in which you must gather resources and craft items in order to survive. But sadly there is an element of human interaction which can be both friendly or hostile. You will soon find that everyone is HOSTILE. I do not know why but other players rarely if ever show reciprocity. It is quite demeaning to spend 2 hours building a base and crafting for it to just get destroyed by rage kids with rocket launchers. This game has a nice concept despite its good intentions other players are a large error factor which ruins a good game. I am displeased at best by this game it runs terribly on a GTX980 with a lot of frame dips. After doing some research I found that it is poorly optimised for most newer systems. So if you have a 980 970 780 770 you will not be able to run this game as smoothly as you should. I am very disappointed by this game it is a good game but the players are the most unlikeable holes you will ever encounter. Most players kill other players just because they are unable to defend themselves. I can only imagine those trigger happy players and anti social sociopath with little empathy and respect for others work and effort. I do not blame the developer for the players but I blame him (the developer) for the poor optimization. To summarise This game runs poorly on $1895 PC's The players are malevolent vindictive bullies with no respect for others Its overpriced and over rated. It makes my blood boil with rage. DO NOT BUY UNLESS YOU WISH TO GET ANNOYED BY ARROGANT SOCIO PATHS. Update The performance issues have been resolved but the comunty is still ed!Update Game has improved alot I will be making a new review soon.
title: Rust

review: The team stretches itself way too thin. We had promises of cars electricity PVE bosses NPC's ... Instead we keep getting new guns and gunplay reworks. They want AAA quality game without AAA budget and team sizes. For the same reason optimization is horrible everytime they optimize anything a new update destroys it. The game's performance keeps going down and down. Everytime I loot someone every time I open inventory everytime I fire everytime I do anything... Game freezes for a couple of seconds which makes it impossible to fight. No it's not my pc I could run it at 60FPS when It entered Experimental. I can't get it to go over 30 now. It's marketed as a Sandbox game but everything revolves arround PVP. Forget all the new things that were promised here's changes to gunplay. If you don't want to get wiped out as solo or a small group by a large clan you have to play it as much as a part time job. Now for the PVP. It used to be that hard hitting full auto guns (ak and m249) were hard to controll at full auto. So pretty much usless to full auto unless really close. You had to tap fire. But now even with the AK it's better to just spray and pray. And the person with better luck with the RNG wins. Which I welcome since no with my terrible FPS I can actually stand a chance. Doesn't matter if i can't see what I'm doing while my game is frozen I just hold LMB and hope for the best. Which is what my mates who can actually run the game do as well. The devs stopped making a game they wanted but focus on listening to the vocal majority. Thing is vocal majority is the group of people who have something they don't like about the game. The people who like it don't have much to say. "hackers are only on official servers" No they just got better at toggling on others. Haven't seen one since 2016 tho. And the main reason I hate this game the grind. Or better yet how much time you have to sink into it. It's no longet a weekend fun like it used to be in Legacy the game now requires you to literally ignore all other games drop countless hours into it and still can't even deliver fun. Everything's a chance get offline? Might get raided. Go gather for hours? Might get sniped. The same thing that added to the PvP also makes the game unwieldy exhausting and utterly tiring to play. It's basically grind with some highlights few and far between.

review: Possibly the best game I'll ever play. I'll list the pros and cons after I write an over all summary. MAKE SURE YOU READ CON #2Summary Amazing shooter/survival game some un realistic elements which take you out of the zone and some uber realistic elements which are so real they're a bit disturbing (such as puking/bone breaking noises). Definitely not a completed game but they've made this clear to us repeatedly. Considering this is still in Alpha definitely a 10/10. Incredibly early stage game and they would have to do something really wrong and stupid to screw up this package of awesomeness they've created. 10/10Pros 1 Actively updated2 Plenty of different types of servers some with modifications some with low populations some with high3 Never run out of things to do4 Extremely realistic except for buggy stuff which isn't intended (it's in alpha can't blame em)5 Guns sound insanely realistic not like the movie gunfire or reload sounds but the guns here have that realistic sound which people who have never handled a gun would think sounds like a "light plastic gun". Only in movies do guns sound like roaring machines that are %100 solid.6 The vomiting sounds and the sounds you make when you break a bone appear to be so realistic it makes me a little sick and puts me on the edge of my seat. I haven't really heard many bones break in my life but this is what I can imagine it sounding like if the break was severe.... And boy does it sound nasty.Cons 1 On most servers with a population of over 15 players on at a time the majority of the players are incredibly hostile and will kill you on sight. 2 Because of reason 1 the game turns in to more of a first person shooter rather than a survival game once you move on from the early stages which can be considered a pro if that's what you're in to. Only listing it as a con here because the trailers/screenshots don't hint to this at all when in fact this is the reality. This is %80 a first person shooter game once you build your base etc (whch can take a very long time depending on how sneaky you are since you have to be very sneaky around other people to avoid being shot in the face).3 Incredibly buggy and not many items considering the possibilities. This is only because of Alpha though.4 Water seems to be non existant I've never seen it and even if it existed it doesn't have any uses such as to quench thirst. Again I'm assuming this is because of Alpha5 Animal sounds are incredibly un realistic and for some reason they can't jump... And since when can a human sprint for 20 minutes out running a wolf?

review: I have over 180 hours played of this game. That was before the feburary 6th update to which ruined the game. The game was fun and had a lot of appeal as a zombie survival game. The game was advertised as a zombie survival game and they removed them. This was all done under the guise of their "early access game" statements. They state "this is in very early development" "things will change" or "Some things work some things don't we haven't totally decided where the game is headed". The problem with this is that zombies did work. The only problem they posed was that they conficted with the lead developer's vision of the game (Garry from Garry's mod). This is where things really rub me the wrong way. The game is first advertised as a zombie survival game and now in an instant it isnt. All because one person decided he didnt want zombies! The comminuty of this game wanted zombies to stay but instead the developer did what ever they wanted. They took people's money and then gave everyone the proverbial middle finger. The updates they have added in the last few months have been lackluster at best. They changed what sounds your footsteps make THREE times (what a waste of time!). They added more items that have the same function of already existing items (sleeping bag vs. bed or revolver vs. 9mm). The only true update that has any merit is the update that changed how gathering materials works. Thats FIVE months of useless updates! During which they made enough money from the sales of the early access to develop a whole other game! The game has hit a very low point in gameplay after the feb 6th update so if you still intend on plaything this game do not expect to see the same gameplay you may of seen online. And as their "Early Access Game" states "things will change" so dont buy into the game if you intend on loving it initially.

It's such a grind. I had taken a long hiatus from the initial launch and felt like picking it up again after playing subsistence. Like I said it was fun for a moment there. Game mechanics + game mechanics * raiders waste of time. There's better survival games on the market.the game has potential. somethings are cool like building and some skirmishing. but placing items that don't want to go the ground the tiered leveling of walls is incongruent with the amount of cost it takes. To that effect i find it eternally easier to find rocket parts to destroy than it is to find gears to make the sufficient armored counterparts. So in a nutshell. This is not a game to played solo. You will simply get out played if two or more people have their mine put to it against you. Never mind the stupid t aspects of the game that come off as lazy add content fix bugs later.I think if I could give this a neutral I would and that'd be a fair opinion. Unfortunately for some reason we still don't have that option (despite the reviews of games can show negative/neutral/positive). Tl dr unless you are going to game it up with buddies and somewhat religiously at that I wouldn't recommend it.

review: I have mixed feelings. I love the game but its hard to not hate the player. The game is built in a somewhat toxic gamestyle. Nothing bad about it they did a good job at building a very competive atmosphere. Just don't get asshurt when you get rekt and told to git gud. Just git gud. Keep playing and making mistakes. Each time you get screwed you can take it as a learning experience and just not do it on the next server. My only issue is that I find a lot of admin abuse in the community servers. I wish there was a halfway between community servers and official. Some category for the professionally run community servers would be nice. Nothin is worse than losing cuz an admin is abusing priv. You can't learn from that. I also have a lot of ideas that would be cool for this game ie elevator gears/high qual/ rope/metal frags. can build into bases to go up a bunch of floors faster than opening and closing a ladder hatch each story.Cams that you can place around your base and check in on from a laptopCrude oil as a base defense. this would be nice to defend a weak spot in your base design or to kill doorcampers from above costs crude oil or low grade pour oil from base and light ground below on fire for a timechainsaw metal frags/lowgrade/wood/HQ can be used as weapon or to cut down trees yields 75 to 100 wood per 1.1 seconds (i think salvage axe is 50/1.25) breaks over time and can be repaired. costs low grade to run&gt &gt .... I might add more ideas to this list. let me know what u guys think

Was a DayZ clone now more of a Minecraft/Fallout clone. Alot of fun specially with mates. Lots of amazing social experiences to be had.Rust 2.0 is even prettier with a slew of improvements. However the development does feel as though it has slowed down and infact it often feels like there isnt alot of content to play with. Hopefully the pace picks up once more and this Early Access game can finally be complete and enjoyed in full.

review: Straight to the point Here are my positives ...Positive.exe has stopped workingNegatives (see rant below)Sources Sleep deprived me who impulsively bought this at 1 in the morningOk so here is my almost 2 hours of experience. Ive wanted this game for so long because i watched everyone play it on youtube (heres the kicker) 2 years ago. Things have changed. Its mechanics are almost undientifiable from past (arguable better) builds. As for the game it is very meh. It has its moments but materials are hard to come by. And the community oh the community. Its what you expect but worse. I was lucky enough to find someone at the begining who showed me the ropes and helped me get my bearings. then i died. Then a guy shot me. then another guy sworded me. another sniped me. one began to trade with me then killed me. a 8 year old treid to pvp me. i won but then died by a guy who was screaming profanity (use you immagination) and killed me. You see you cant walk 5 steps without being called a "naked" or if you are wearing anything anything at all shot. Most of the servers and 3 hours and up so good luck finding a server at the start. Also everyone acuses someone else of cheating. This could be fun with frineds but i havent had the chance to try. SO! try to wait for the devs to FINALLY pollish their game after 3 years or untill you have friends who own it.

review: Human Nature The GamePeople keep saying that "*********" s ruin the game. Kind of. Kind of not. Depends. Do you want to play for general kind of fun? Build something for yourself and then through that allow yourself to engage in "the end game"? You're going to have a bad time. Let me explain Do not look at this game like Minecraft. Do not look at this game like Garry's Mod (from the same people) or a shooter or anything. Look at this game like The Stanley Parable. It really is that kind of Game.This game is not about any of the game mechanics. This game is about letting you start from absolute zero and let life play out. You know some people don't get how closely this game resembles human life because they don't get what our lives are. You are born into a country into a city into a family. You're born into a wealth zone a religion a culture into laws and morals with a set number of possibilities before you that you don't really have to work so hard to achieve in relation if you didn't have those other things.This game is basically removing all the things people are born into. It has no nations cities or families. You're born into the wild. You aren't born into wealth or poverty into power or lack thereof. Much like in the cave on Dagobah you have only "what you bring with yourself" in terms of religion and culture and no laws. No laws whatsoever. An axe wielrding maniac or even a full pack of them may attack and raid you. Scam you mutilate everything you worked for. They can do it because there is no law outside going beyond what is possible to other players (hacking).The one and only adventage any player may have is bringing along friends and that infact can and is a problem often but only because of what most players don't realize in this game and the only reason why on a certain level in its current form the game fails to deliver it's pure idea of letting human nature take whatever expression they like.Most players don't quite "get" what "no laws" mean. People think "no laws" means you can do anything you couldn't before. While actually it simply means You can do anything. However people are so fixated on the "what I couldn't do before" bit that they often neglect entirely the other parts.Sure this is part of most games. You can't shoot up terrorsits with night vision goggles or turn into a werewolf or use magic. But that doesn't mean you shouldn't do what you do in every day life. If anything you should because the freedom of this game should shine through to most people why the world works the way it does. Countries' goverments aren't the sweating scared and irritated gun wielding madmen that some caricaturists portait them to be. They don't attack eachother for better reason than "maybe losing". It simply is often in the best interest of everybody to play nice.In a world populated by the same scarred sweating gun wielding and irritated madmen it would be like Rust. Then what is different? Simply that people have no reason to think anyone is going to be decent. They can all feel that it's better to play together with others but they don't dare play with others because who knows when they'll betray you? Infact it's best to just shoot on sight in most cases.Oddly enough in real life this doesn't happen. Why? Because if someone is a known murderer they're going to get arrested their life (literally or less so) taken away from them marked forever. There is not so much need to defend one's self because there is not so much sense in attacking someone else.Similar laws exists here but you're not born into them. You have to agree to them by joining a group in the game if you can that is. And it will always be on the group's terms not yours because there is no higher power than the group. If you're thinking "well that's like countries" you're starting to see what I'm getting at.This game is beautiful. Not because it's a nice game. Definitely not because the people going around murdering others "for fun" are doing the right thing in any shape way or form as a civilized person. But they are doing the right thing in what the game entails. The world has to have enemies in order to have a reason to work together. Later those enemies are going to be more basic such as supplies needing to be seccured in larger quantities for survival but now we have the raiders.The only true flaw is that it isn't neccessary to experience the loneliness of the world in this game and to truly hammer in the worth of cooperation by stripping players of the option from outside forces.So does it make it a good game? Yes. Does it make it a good toy? No. A horrible toy. For fancy free and pure fun this game is horrible. It's going to break you. But if you are painfully aware of human nature want to be painfully aware of human nature and/or want to fight to make it into the best thing it can be or revel in its darkness This is the game for you.Pro tip though If you're a ******** to other people withing the game's rights you might be playing the game right and good on you. But that doesn't make what you do any less of a ******** move. Accept that before you ask others to accept it's validness.After all being a "********" is by defintion that you enjoy reveling in the darker side of human nature. And before you ask what the actual word is under those stars I literally just put in 8 stars. Because any of the words you would mentally put there fit that bill.

review: Once I was hunting near my cabin. Two guys passed by being chased by bears. They later came back shooing arrows at me. They chased me through a myriad of crags and once I lost them and snuck back to my home I found them waiting for me there. I suprised one of them with a shot from my bow and we battled for a straight in game day. It ended with me doing hit and runs from within my house. They broke through and beat me to death with axes.This game is not for the faint of heart. Unless you play on a small server you will die. A lot. You'd do well to assume that anyone you meet will try to murder you. But that is part of what makes surviving so goddam satisfying.

review: Very good but doesn't update nearly as often as it should. you can say "But its Alpha" there are more games then i can think of that are in alpha and update 3 times as often and have some replay value. as soon as you get the Kevlar blueprints m4/bolt blueprint and have gotten the means of making c4. you are fairly untouchable in most cases as long as you don't act like an idiot. there is nothing after that and with the current community trying any superficial goal like being the community nice guy will get you a bullet in the back or rock to head. Playing as bandit is all that's going to happen because that's all the current end game promotes. "Have all the items? let's go test them on my neighbors house!" is how most of it goes. Lets be honest the game is pretty good i played a ridiculous amount of time and loved it. But i found a great community with an admin that cared. i made over 20 friends who i still talk to know that we have all quit the game. But before i found them i had a hundred hours of getting to end game or close to it only to be on by admin abusers or communities made up of a remarkable amount of little yippy kids that act like the little kids on consels do. great game needs more then a load of work though. for 20 dollars i would be hesitant to buy it unless you know you like this sorta game. Also PLAY WITH FRIENDS!!!!!!

review: I do recommend Rust although only if you have other people who will actively play it with you. It has a very large potential but a lot of the time is spent just doing small things like chopping some trees hitting some rocks and things like that. review: This game. Let me tell you about this game. I like it. It's a good game. Now I haven't been around since the early days. Truth be told I only just got this game during the sale of the winter. An ya know what? This is a good fricken game. Now the game itself is rather addictive. Collect resources build stuff survive and hunt. It's fun. It reminds me of my Eve Online days except it's much more to the point. And less... Not fun. LIke Eve was. And I got over 700 hours in that game but let's set our gaze back to Rust.Rust. You know what this game makes me think of? After that? Pure multiplayer fun and tension. Then again but let's not think about that right now. See the fun of this game is of that from my World of Warcraft days. See I enjoy the base game but it's the people that make it thrive. Those little unique interactions no computer could truly give meaning too. Give it a few years of course before Siri gets a hold of your blender and attempts to slice you off. To no avail of course unless you were unlucky and got a big one. I do not. Lucky me. Heh... Lucky me...Seriously my characters wiener is so tiny. Devs please give me a bigger As I was saying it's the people that make this game interesting. Forming bonds with your fellow man woman or whatever kin thing you identify as in a world that's ruthless and brutal. And yet we can still gather round and have a laugh at my miniscule Also as we torture naked men and impose our will upon them. Perhaps we'll even sing songs and stuff. I don't know. Grab some buddies and dive in. Trust me when I say this world feels me with a sense of adventure. Scale this unknown territory and take what's rightfully yours! I personally am a loner. Which is rather sad because people seem to like me but I have issues with keeping connections with more than like two people... But spamming the mic will eventually get ya some friends or at least some silly situations that will surely bring you joy! This game is pretty rage enducing when you take it too seriously so be ready to die and have fun interacting with the people of this world. Even more so if you dont have any friends that play this game... It's like playing an counter strike without other people. It's just not as fun. So as long as you come in ready to have a laugh please stop laughing at my I can promise you that this will be the finest experience you've ever had!Also devs may I please have another shot at the genetic lottery? My is way too tiny and people are making fun of me...

review: 3 days in. 24hrs played. I'm too old for this I've deleted it. It was fantastic though. This game is the anarchic paradise you probably don't really want but you desparately fantasize about. Anthropologists need to play this game.17th century philosopher English Thomas Hobbes summised in his seminal discussion that man in his natural state lives a life that is "solitary poore nasty brutish and short". Yes he lives in "continuall feare and danger of violent death". He speaks of principles like diffidence &amp competition for resources that explains this tragedy and proposes a social contract a binding contract one takes implicitly at birth to keep our behaviour innocuous and respectful and progress beyond the inherit state of war.Rust provides a time machine to a time where the social contract is a forgotten relic an indecipherable parchment long buried with civilised society. There are some quirks though. Rust's main characters aren't grizzled cavemen established feudalists or refined monarchs. The archetypal character in Rust is a 21st century upper middle class 15 year old autistic eating trashboy "Jimmy". He greets you with "hallo f* ggots" walks around with his out asking for help and proceeds to smash your head in with a rock when you offer him food. He scribbles c*** on the walls and draws pictures of Sonic. A few short hours in Rust and he is you.This game is a fantastic microcosm of the worst of humanity. It tempts you to be an and you better be an . Also it is shocking that the word "alpha" is attached to this game. Sure it crashes and graphically it isn't the best optimised game but that netcode. Hundreds of people in an outrageously large map communicating over mic flawlessly and engaging in not entirely terrible combat.It's also a time sink and will probably turn you into a bad person so probably don't play.
title: Rust

review: Do you love turning off a game knowing someone will undo any progress you've made while you're offline?Do you love the feeling when people in armor with guns laugh as they blow up your wooden shack with explosives?Do you love intellectually stimulating conversations such as if someone is "Mad bro?" or if so and so is a prepubescent with a high octave voice? Do you love beating people to death with rocks?Have you ever played the first 30 minutes of a game and thought to yourself "You know what I wish I could replay that completely naked and with my wee willie censored out."Then you have sadomasochistic tendencies and you will find them fulfilled in Rust's "vibrant" community.(My advice shoot everyone on sight especially when they come at you with a weapon drawn.)If you ignore the sometimes brutish community that make Rust's servers their Troll Bridges you will find Rust a beautiful survival game which is being constantly updated with new content by the developers. In my times running naked across the wilderness dodging bullets as I hobble together enough stone and wood for a humble hatchet and pick axe I sometimes stop stunned by a golden sunset or a tranquil grove (until I am shot through the heart and watch prone and helpless as my body is teabagged repeatedly by 4 players with AKs)Happy hunting.

review: Not recommended at all. First you need a really good computer and I mean that. I would say I have a fairly decent laptop if I tweak things I can play games at a pretty playable framerate. But this game I get 10 20 frames with tweaks. Anyway I can't really write a review just on FPS. Whenever I join official servers there is around 100 ping. That means if a person walks up to you and you ask them if they are friend or foe they say friend and decide to stab you in the back you don't really have a chance of winning because the ping is so high. You'll be at 30 hp before you see you are getting hit and what not. Lastly I logged off for about 5 minutes to tweak my game. I come back and I'm dead. I wasn't being attacked when I left or anything and I lost some pretty good stuff. So no I would not recommend this game for the price it is at at all. Save your money and get a better game.

review: The massive drop in players on the game RUST isn't for nothing. There's no words to describe how infuriated and disappointed I am with this game in its current state.http //steamcharts.com/app/252490Rust started out as one of the most amazing innovative and engaging survival based multiplayer game that I had the privilege of playing. The game had a sense of tension and doubled as a fascinating social experiment in an anarchist enviornment.The question you're probably asking is "you're saying good stuff about it. Why are you not recommending this game?"Simple answer The component system.Any sense of character progression and character development is completely destroyed making it impossible for people new to servers to obtain any fighting chance against other players because the zones that drop essential end game components is monopolized and controled by clans.The first crafting system the blueprint system was simple and effective. Not the best but certainly not the worst. The second crafting system the Experience system was tedious but still gave players a reason to keep playing. With the component system there's no point in playing you don't have any recipe knowlege that will make you stand out among your group/clan the game is 100% spoiled now. It's like having a cheat code in an old game that gave you all special weapons from the start of the game. Why play?Worst of all as stated before the places that have important components are controlled by clans. This means that a new player or someone new to the server is forced to visit high risk areas to have a fighting chance. If you lose your base and all of your stuff there's absolutely nothing to fall back on. There's no "Well at least I know how to make ____ with minimal materials." Not anymore.This game is NOT worth your money the player base is dying QUICKLY (and has been since the component system was released) and the devs don't respond to steam forum complaints at all.If you want a survival game that's better play Hurt World Age of Kings even Miscreated is better than this garbage now. The only reason people still play it is the same reason people still play WoW. It's for nostalgic purposes wanting to maintain loyal to a once great game.

review: RustSet in a post nuclear apocalpyse where the world is brutal and the people that inhabit it are even more so. You forage mine chop and kill to survive. Build bases to keep your booty safe and hope someone doesn't come along to take it and your pants.What Rust lacks in story it makes up for with the interactions of its other inhabitants. One minute you could be taking a nice stroll along the road next minute a naked person will try to smack you in the head with a rock. What do you do? Kill them? Make peace? Run away? That choice is up to you. Your adventures would also entail building a base that is if you want to keep all the stuff you find. Which may end up stolen in the future if you aren't vigilant.I find Rust to be a great game no matter how much people say that the community is bad. In my experiences so far I've met people who will help you and those that will destroy you. The game is all about your interactions with players without them it's just not as enjoyable.My personal rating for Rust is a 10/10 because it can be so damn great no matter how much you rage.

review: Ok well...So my first day in rust I did nothing died like 4 times and had fun doing it. Day 2 I call up my friend and we start playing rust. We built a little shack and didn't know what to do next. So we looked it up made a hammer and upgraded all our walls and door. We didn't know about blueprints so next we looked that up and ran to the water treatment plant which at the time we called "big broken tower thingy." So we got some blueprints and learned how to make wood armor and we thought we were so cool with our wood armor waterpipes and stone shack. We continued to get more stuff and then we went to war with people who tried to raid us and they had a clan so our shack went boom boom. Later we built a nice looking house and made it completely air locked. After this we kept upgrading and we didn't have much stuff. Next day which was the day before the wipe we found a massive compound with a little crack which if we tried really hard we could get through and we did. The whole base was left with the airlock doors open which we later realized is because the owners just left. We got tons of great things like AKs and Rocket Launchers/rockets and c4. We went back and stored our stuff. Then the next day we were raided somehow and lost it all. That same day the owners managed to find our base and hatched down our wood external walls. We then we threw everything we had at them. Literally. We opened our window and threw rocks and clubs at them. We managed to get them to agree to not use guns and we started playing what we called "dodge rock." We became good friends with them and now we all live in a massive compound we built together after the wipe.100000000/10 would play dodge rock again
