review: All I can say is...Wow. This is probably the best twenty bucks I've spent on a game let alone a game in early alpha..For being in this stage of development this is a very solid game. Only a few little bugs here and there that will definitely be fixed over time. The gameplay is smooth the way that guns function is on par with milsim (even a few things that milsims leave out). Only one minor complaint. Not sure if I just haven't found it yet but there should be more graphics customization options. As of now we only have a generic slider that has about six modes of quality.Very good game. Only got a few hours in but I will definitely be getting more.
title: Rust

review: Rust survival and no zombies! You will have enough trouble from wolves bears other players starvation and cold. Heavy on the crafting skills you start with absolutely nothing except a large rock. No clothes no food nothing. All is not lost however that first rock lets you whack on trees for wood and on certain types of boulders for sulfur metal ore and stone. With these you build your tools from a stone axe to hammers and pick axes your weapons from a basic spear to rifles ammunition needs to be crafted also and lets not forget your home something to protect you from the predators mentioned above and to store your supplies. Decent enough for the survival sims Rust has the legacy version that's very popular and has a known map and the experimental version that uses a key on each server to generate a map that's unique to that server.On the experimental servers the animals just were activated recently ... there are 2 main predators wolves and bears these will roam around a bit and what you thought was a safe distance may not be in just a few moments. Other animals such as chickens wild pigs (boars) and deer also appear usually in wooded areas. Boulders along shore lines mountain slopes desert and plains provide the source for raw materials. A sleeping bag provides a spawn point and building a house with locks help protect you and your stuff.A new addition in November 2014 was the "Toolshed" which when activated prevents another player from building within 50 meters of it. Friends can be added to the allowed list to permit the beginnings of a town and cooperative elements in the game.Getting started can be difficult get used to the fact that even a well equipped play is likely to be killed off by the local wildlife.

review: The game was great but it has been slowly getting worse over time by the game devs making the wrong decisions starting with the removal of the blueprint system. Components are an autistic mess to store and sort through there are so many of them vs just blueprint pages and resources. The devs keep implementing mini games to all aspects of the game from hit the shiny spot on the mineral node to the new "Learnable Recoil" they added recently. The mineral patch was annoying but turning recoil into a mini game was what pushed me to the limit and stopped playing the recoil needs to return back to what it was. The devs added in "Legendary Crates" which just give people free explosives to instantly destroy whatever base you have been working on a new player literally needs no time or investment on the server before he starts destroying hours worth of work players have made and there is no admin/server side configeration settings to allow servers to change/turn off those "Legendary Crates". Devs removed craftable pump jacks and oil nodes so there is really no reason to build in the desert for oil everyone builds in the snow for High Quality metal since the mining quarry can only harvest it in snow.These major issues need to be fixed and changed back to the way they were before. But until they do this review will stay and be a negative.
title: Rust

review: Sooo.....I got this game because I thought it looked fun and many youtubers I watch play it. I gave it a try and well it's fun for the first few days of playing.Pros Probably the best looking survival game IMO.Good customization(freedom to build how I want).Lots of players(pro and con I guess).Cons Hunger drops too fast.Wolf spawns are sh**.Too hard to survive for any length of time unless you get lucky.Spawns suck.Hard to find resources sometimes.My Story So today as in the day I wrote this I got back into Rust. After a few hours of playing (and dying) I finally was surviving for over 10 minutes. I had good enough things for a starter and was close to making my own house. Until I stumbled across an abandoned log cabin it was perfect. I checked for any other survivors to see if they were friendly. Btw this log cabin was far far away from anything else (Perfect for people like me who like to be isolated.). I scoped the area and no one was there. I went in started a fire and then headed out for some cloth. I could not find any cloth so I was gonan head into land. Now remember nothing was on this island but me and it was small enough that nothing should've spawned. Well when I took 20 steps away from the cabin a wolf decided to chase me (how did it get here?). I got away from it but was dying of the cold. So I made a fire then out of nowhere the wolf comes back and kills me. I spawn way to far away and bodies despawn quick. All my work was lost.

review: Nearly a year has gone by since I first played worth every hour for the price of the game. The devs are always putting out content which partly keeps me coming back every week I'm able to play. It's the enjoyment of playing with the people of a particular server I play on that I've I found to be a nice community that gets me wanting to play more. To which point I find It's a game that is much more enjoyable being play with friends. It's totally a rush if you want to play solo on a high pop server or if you're into more of a casual community style play there are plenty of "Role play" type servers out there for your enjoyment. I won't lie most people who play this game (that I run into on servers) are teens that are s and will kill you as soon as they spot you but every now and then you'll run into someone you'll want to add to your friends list and continue to play with.I love the way the guns feel in Rust I find it's not hard at all to control the recoil of say an AK but anyone new to the game is likely to think it's a bit much in terms of vertical recoil. I recommend people to join servers called Combat tag it's a very nice opportunity to practice using any of the weapons in the game not only guns and you can go against other players if join a lobby with someone.The building system is a bit dull when it comes to creativity but the devs are not finished with this aspect of the game and it's likely to be amazing in the end when the game is finished. Which is a down point in my eyes because they've been working on this game for many years and it's still in Alpha with many bugs and issues plaguing it like animal AI performance (fps wise) and a nasty community of cheaters (though you're not likely to really run into them). Playing on servers that are moderated by active server admins is a good way to minimize your chances of running into a cheater just be aware that playing on servers with admins whom actually play the game can be worry some because there's always an admin who abuse the system for their own gain.Anyways this getting a bit long. All in all I would definitely recommend this game to anyone looking to get into it just beware you're going to get hooked... you've been warned!

review: Ok So time for a reiview. Be rude not to I suppose. Especially after considering I built my PC to play this game after seeing someone randomly stream this on a camera on a PS4. I have some absolutley amazing memories of this game. (some tragic) I'm currently in a clan and have accrured over 550 hours of gaming. (this game is still in Alpha at time of writing)Let's keep this simple...In a nut shell This is this best game on Steam bar none. Each and every single negative commet I have seen regarding it can be reduced to bitter people whom have not took the time or the patience to learn the game find a good server or form a clan in able to survive. All these people have jumped on the busiest servers and expected to just instantaneously take over which will never happen (make no mistake this game is as ruthless is it is rewarding) and as a result all have come away bitter/sour mainly due to a damged gaming ego. Please do not fall into this trap you will deprive yourself of the best gaming exerience/social experiment Steam has to offer.Just to put this game in perspective...In essence this game has cost me in the region of 1500+ to play. IT WAS WORTH EVERY ING PENNY.

review: We are in very early development. Some things work some things don't. We haven't totally decided where the game is headed so things will change. Things will change a lot. The game was insanely hard for solo players already but now it is impossible. It is IMPOSSIBLE. I know for a fact that the devs do not play the game themselves because the changes that has happened are counterintuitive and disgustingly bad. If i was being asked to change the meta of building structures i would be capable of doing that in an intuitive healthy and enjoyable way. Anyways had hope until now. It's all gone. review: I have owned and played approximately 2 000 hours in Rust since early November of last year. Yes if you do the math on average I've been playing almost 40 hours a week of Rust. Yes I have a job and No I am not a neckbearded basement dweller. During this time I have played Vanilla rust on US East 1 with some time spent in 100 Airdrops and Combat Tags for gun practice. Rust is a very difficult game. A VERY difficult game both to play and get started in. Especially if you are a solo player. A popular Rust Youtuber KCMO said "Rust has to be one of the most frustrating games I have ever played. But I also find it to be the most rewarding game I have ever played because of how hardcore it is." For those of you that may be new to Rust check out this video from December 2016 a little under two months after I started playing. https //www.youtube.com/watch?v nnSZInxoMWMRust at it's core is a great game great concept good mechanics and interesting story. I've got so much time in Rust because I felt it was a great game and I loved it. I played it almost exclusively since I purchased it and I genuinely care about the direction it is going. Unfortunately that direction is not good.Being that the game is still in development coming up on 4 years now (You are not in "early development" anymore as your banner claims) a lot has changed since November of 2016. Those changes unfortunately have been in my opinion for the worse. I joined the game at a time where the XP system and blueprints 2.0 had been scrapped and the component system was coming into it's own. What a time to play Rust. I was able to make some friends and we began playing as a group. I have some very fond memories of solo bases in November December January and playing at odd hours to ensure uninterrupted farming as I was still very new. As I grew in experience I got better my base designs became more impenetrable and I have gone several month long wipes without being raided. Since then alot of positive new static content has been added to the game but the game mechanics have changed so much that the game is completely stacked against the solo and small group players and now favors large groups of people known as "zergs" and clans. This is even more so than it did before. They are able to farm faster build larger and get top tier weaponry and crafting supplies faster as a result of reimplementing the blueprint system and the absolutely cancerous hunt for scrap. The game is no longer fun and has become way to much of a grind. There was natural progression prior to this. There is just a slog now where a set back is monumental. A solo player can collect approximately 120 150 scrap per hour by running a road or visiting the larger rad towns and recycling EVERYTHING they get their hands on. With the implementation of the new blueprint + scrap system it is just too much and no longer rewarding. Prior to this there was a real sense of investment in time and reward. That is now gone as the time investment is just too much and this is coming from a guy who spent 40 hours a week on this game. The other huge issue is hackers. Rust is plagued with hackers. Active hackers using aimbots auto aim ESP speed hacks quick mining hacks and everything else. And passive hackers that are using hacks to gain a situational advantage. It's awful. The reports are not handled fast enough and there are no admins on official servers. (I've offered to be one multiple times given my time on the server). It's really a detriment to the game and Facepunch doesn't seem interested in fixing or addressing the issue. In closing I cannot recommend this game any longer. I have brought a couple friends into the game since I started but now it's just no longer fun. I hope that Facepunch Gary Newman and Helk (Devs) wake up tomorrow and see theses issues for the game killers that they are and revert to the November December January February March timeframe when Rust had it's highest peak players and things were awesome. TL DRRust was great in the Nov Dec 2016 and Jan Mar 2017 time periods and has gone downhill since. Changes to core game mechanics have been terrible. Some good static content has been added but the changes to the mechanics heavily outweighs that. Revert the mechanics fix your hacking issue staff your servers stop making the game into a grind balance your loot tables nerf the zergs blueprints and scrap system is cancer.

review: Rust is the best game ever IF the stars align and a few different variables are working together perfectly. Rust is the most frustrating screen punching rage quitting game if just a couple of these variables are out of line so let me tell you what these things are. Good Server admins people who won't cheat who make sure to ban hackers and greifers who keep the server up and running and stable. If you don't have this the server can crash your base gets hack looted your base gets trolled and you can lose and i'm not exaggerating easily over 50 hours of work. Thankfully it's not hard to find good admins and fairly stable servers and there is an anti cheat system thata as far as I know works. Server population density you want enough people to make the world feel alive and dangerous but not so many you can't have your own little piece of saftey where you can farm resources unmolested and monuments where you get vital materials aren't farmed out by big bully clans. This can be difficult and is subjective to whether you enjoy relative crowdedness or not but ultimately it's a tricky one to get right as servers can die off or bad admins can up server pop and make the 100 man server which was perfect density into a 150 man cluster . You have a competant team rust is not designed for solo play period. A lot of raiding tactics farming etc. is unarguabley better with more than 1 person even 2 people makes a huge difference. A small clan of 3 5 people is perfect for most medium sized servers but getting this is harder than it seems. Rust is a big time sink gather resources takes a huge amount of time raiding takes a lot of time and more often than not there will be a few less active members of the clan who aren't pulling there weight and this just leads to tension and arguments. To get a small group of competant players who are fun to be around and pull their weight is extremely difficult to do but it's core to having fun and not getting rekt in every gun fight. free time you better be able to dedicate your whole existance to this game because a larger % of the server than you'd think are doing this. Staying up for 2 days straight cutting trees and raiding bases of those who actually sleep IRL is the essence of Rust. If you work anything more than a part time job or are in the middle of exams then you should just not play rust you'll spend your time building a base and collecting resources only for a 7 man clan of no lifers to come and farm with UTTER EASE from your base. You'll lose everything and probably didn't even have that much fun doing it. In rust unless your winning it's not fun mostly. Farming is a grind building a base is a grind but it all makes the victory so much sweeter as the risk/reward ratio is incredible.now if these stars align! it's not impossible for them to do so then you will have one of the most immersive addictive and great experiences of your life. You'll meet great people and experience great memorable moments if the stars don't align you'll want to kill yourself throw your PC out the window and eat yourself into a diabetic death. Rust is war and like war it contain's ecstatic highs and heart wrenching lows.find those 2 weeks of freedom some friends a good server plan a base out and immerse yourself in this incredible game but be warned if the recipe isn't complete you'll want to rage quit and cut your own off in utter rage.

review: This game is incredibly addicting. It was the first game I purchased for my gaming pc and honestly I don't see any other game competing for the enjoyment it has brought me. I recommend it to everybody I know who likes gaming and they have all played it in most of the free time they have.This game is alot of fun since you can build houses or bases with spike walls floors walls pillars ceilings and even big wooden gates. If you develop successfully you will find yourself with guns worthy of defending yourself from animals people and of course people. People are dangerous which is why I mentioned them twice. People will begin to lose interest in the regular gathering of rocks and wood so they will attack others in the server for fun. Loot is also a big part as that's where all guns originate from.The online community is a problem as early hackers using aimbot influenced the way people react to skill. If someone is exceptionally good at the game they will be accused of hacking and if caught in the wrong server will be banned from that server and have to start over on a different server.There are only a few official servers and the ping is very high so community servers are attractive. The problem with that is owners of the servers and admins can act the way they want in disregards to the players.
title: Rust

review: Rust is a brutal world without mercy. The game has an amazing developpers team that push out weelky updates monthly huge updates and communicate with the playerbase on Reddit. It has a complex building system that takes time to master perfectly. You will have adrenaline rush during PvP you will rage when you die. You will also experience the ultime high when you outplay someone during a fight and loot their full inventory.Rust due to certain decisions from the developpers is pushing towards mass groups and zerging unfortunately. It used to be small crews of people playing now you have large groups (clans) on pretty much any populated servers which rolls over the weaker playerbase without any confrontation because we simply can't defend against groups of 8 zerging you without any skills.Recent graphic overhaul is a success Rust is even more beautiful and alot more stable on medium spec machines. The XP system was a try &amp miss BP system was superior and will be brought back with a different more refined system from what we know.Rust is not for casual players not in its current state. After over 1200 hours played best 20$ investment of my life for a video game. I just wished the game design wasn't pushing towards more groups and zerging because Rust is losing its true core gameplay.
title: Rust

review: When I first saw this game I was like "This here game is like Minecraft but in 3D" so I took the chances and bought it.But man oh man was I wrong this game was nothing like Minecraft!So esentially Rust is a game for online multiplayer only now that may seem bad but thats what it is your suppose to team up or go solo dont quit the game because when you do look for a hiding spot or someone might kill you esentially it wants you to spend tons of time on the dang game. But theres a catch you have a feeling of staying alive well in other games you also do but this game makes you scared when your mom comes over and screams to go to dinner your forced to log off all the time at dinner your wonder pondering if you are still alive and when you get back to the computer and you see your still alive whew your so relived. In Rust its a game about survival no minigames no nothing just survive. You can build houses making yourself hidden to all other players where will you live? In the open? Or in the mountains? Rust takes the feeling of the movie Lost where all you can do is make normal things such as stone hatchets pickaxes and.... Guns?! Thats right in Rust you can make guns while the process isn't as hard as say Watchdogs getting a $40 000 gun its still pretty hard to get some high tech stuff. While the game is still in its alpha stages I'd love to see what they will add in the game in the near future. Thats all for my review of Rust.
title: Rust

review: Since I first played Rust back in January 2014 I knew it was a game destined for greatness. An online survival game that revolutionise the survival genre. Since then I have forgotten about Rust. The legacy branch was placed in the back burner and the glitchy buggy mess that was Experimental took the lead. Since I left Rust Facepunch Studios have been actively developing it adding new content and fixes every week. One day Rust returned to my attention and I decided to see if it had surpassed its old roots legacy. And it has. Big time!The new Rust is completely unrecognisable from the old. Nearly everything about it was overhauled and redone from scratch and it makes full use of the Unity engine to deliver a paramount and absolutely georgeous experience not found in any other online survival game of this kind. Whereas Rust's original rivals such as DayZ have fallen into the shadows and others have taken its place Rust has continued to stay strong developing a strong and loyal community of fans as well as becoming one of the most unique original and memorable online survival experiences on Steam. For the sake of this review I will refer to the old Rust using the term Legacy Rust. Survival This is of course a survival game so how does the survival factor affect your gameplay? This time around Facepunch have put greater emphasis on the PvE aspect adding in different biomes with their own unique temperatures. If you're in the winter biome at night you will freeze to death if you're in the desert biome in the day you will burn to death. Unlike Legacy where the only major threats (aside from players) were hunger the incessant wolves and radiation now you have to worry about thirst and temperature. These added dynamics add greater depth to the environment and add a greater challenge. Furthermore the infamous NPC animals make their return and are made from scratch utilising better AI and animal specific meat (Bears and wolves no longer drop chicken breast.) Of course no online survival game is complete without its psychopathic inhabitants a.k.a the players. This aspect remains virtually the same as Legacy.Combat Combat has always been a major part of any online survival video game. It is the primary vessel for gathering resources from NPCs hunting others and defending yourself or just for entertainment. It is well known that Legacy Rust's combat was incredibly unbalanced. Those who wore full kevlar and used an M4 had an incredibly big advantage over their enemy and in most cases were unstoppable Now this advantage has been taken away with the complete overhaul of weapons and how they are used. The higher tier weapons such as the AK and shotgun are far more harder to find and craft leaving the Thompson (successor to the MP4A5) the handcannon the bow and various others. To combat this Facepunch also implemented better melee weapons including a bone knife and a throwable spear. This gives starting players a better chance for hunting and protection without needing to scour a rad town to get a weapon like in the old days because let's face it melee in Legacy Rust was a joke. Graphics and Design The visual aspect of Rust is what impressed me the most. The first time I tried new Rust out I spawned close to a snow biome and I was just breathtaken at the beauty. It is definetely a great looking game that makes use of Unity better than Legacy. There is more vivid colour lush vegetation and better looking forests. In comparison to Legacy this is where New Rust has changed the most. On ultra settings Legacy Rust didn't look too bad and had a sort of rustic charm to it. However it lacked any real colour as the dominant colour in the Rust world was a yellow ish colour something you'd see in Breaking Bad. As for design everything looks just like it's meant to. Clothes are no longer mere patches of colour to distinguish armour type but proper great looking apparel. It all looks crudely made and savage. Weapons are no longer professional looking but look the part Duct taped made of wood and stone and covered in scratches and bumps as if they were made by a bald psychopathic man. Conclusion Rust is an online survival game that is definetely worth checking out. If you hold your doubts because of Legacy Rust throw them away. This is an entirely different game that is constantly being added to thanks to its active developers and a strong loyal fanbase. I hope to see even greater things from Rust in the future.

review: (Before reading this review please do not give insulting comments towards me or to other fellow members on Steam) Rust is a survival game based on DayZ S.T.A.L.K.E.R. and a bit on Minecraft. The game is created by the Facepunch Studios the people who also created Garry's Mod. Now the gameplay is fairly simple after a while you've played it. The crafting system is slightly comparable with Minecraft as you need sometimes the same ingrediënts in the game. You start as a guy in a middle of a field or elsewhere around the map. Currently there is only one map if I am not wrong. You only start with 2 medkits and a rock. Gameplay wise you can slightly compare it with DayZ only without zombies. You fight against certain mutated creatures. You can also get radiation poisining if you are being attacked or if you are staying in a radiated town/city/area. You will notice that if you're screen starts to crackling a bit or if you hear that certain sound of radiation. Gameplay Score 8/10Overall the gamplay is fairly alright and simple after a while playing it. Graphics Score 8/10Graphics on the game is pretty much alright. It's not fully optimized yet but you can get okay FPS if you turn down the settings. I can run it for example on medium/highish settings. The game runs currently on a Unity Engine. The details graphical wise in the game looks good. It doesn't look blurry or not minecraftish blocks.Score 9/10The price for this game is uh well okay but honestly it is for some points pretty high for a early access game. I think the game could atleast be a bit more less. But that isn't my decision. Price Score 7/10My overall opinion about this game is that it is an early access game and things could change a lot at the meantime. This is just an overall opinion for me for now. PS You'll probably see that I haven't played this game for a while but I think some of the stuff when I played it are still the same.

So in the end with this exp patch rust became and mmo with full item drop and no space for little parties with little playtime avaiblity(basically as all mmos but in common mmo u still have what u farmed and there is no need to star over and over again with server wipes ).But in the end it is still a good game but it became very timespending.

review: The game does do almost everything it promises and there are servers with nice people who will actually help you get started in this game. But having your hard work constantly destroyed or having the same 2 people kill you over and over again for 3 hours straight does not count as fun for me. I really enjoyed the gathering and building aspect aswell as the brutality of the environment. I also did like that other players can have such a huge impact on your game but I think that there are just too many a******s that spend their time hunting newbies. As for the game itself There are some parts of the construction physics that are really unbalanced and filled with glitches. Some of the glitches enable enemies to build arround your Base and enter it even without them having construction privileges. There are glitches where you may get trapped in the ground making you unable to move. The only way to get out is to die.It takes a lot of time to enter the game. Even with my quite decent computer that fully lives up to the recommended specs.For me the price of the game compared to the experience of the game is not compatible. Maybe get it on sale and only get it if you have a group of friends to play with.

review: Rust can be defined with a single word chaotic. There's all sorts of betrayal success and randomness involved all packed together into a neat game. There are no in game tutorials you are basically a child you'll be surprised at a single wolf attack die countless times and often get murdered by other players just because they can or simply because you had a rock that they fancied. In short Rust is a psychological game at most where you decide who you should trust or shoot you may build your own wooden/metal home only to see it raided the next game. If you don't mind waking up naked and starting all over in the next day then it's definitely the game for you.

review: It's rare that a beta much less an alpha like Rust is this functional and this much fun. The minimal feature set even seems expansive enough because what Rust really comes down to is relationships and reputation. At any moment a meeting with another player can be anything from a friendly greeting to trading to cold blooded murder to unnoticed stalking. Rust removes the physical limitations between players and leaves it to them to decide how to interact with each other. It's a regular occurrence that you log in to realize your sleeping body has been murdered your house raided and everything but your researched recipes gone. And as Rust proves that's all the motivation you need to keep going. Whether out for revenge justice new allies or more efficient and raid proof building designs each death reminds all of us why we continue to play a game in such an early stage of development. Where most games would implement skills saves or some other kind of safety net for the player's character Rust forces the player to better themselves instead. Nobody's going to hold your hand it's actually more likely to be shot than held.Including the famed Garry of Garry's Mod the Rust dev team is one of the best I've seen at communicating with its players be it through general status updates responding to feedback or updating the beauty that is the public Trello development board. Considering the recent disasters of games labeled full releases that reveal themselves to be riddled with bugs littered with in game purchases advertisements and DLC and developed by teams that have almost no control over their project little to no QA testing and/or no ability to communicate Rust proves that early access can be one of the most effective ways to develop a title. I've paid $20 for a game that calls itself Alpha but honestly it's already earned every cent of that money. This is how a proper business treats its customers with honesty and respect. If you can only buy one game in all of 2014 you're reading a review for it right now.
title: Rust

review: I will tell you a story. I was just a regular Joe scavenging for items and after a while I build a small hut where I store my items. Once I logged back in the game and I found out my hut was raided doors blown to bits and everything was stolen. I found out who did it I farmed and I was preparing for my revenge. I got a lot of explosives guns and I spent hours and days farming and building. Then I came to the house of the guy who raided me before. I blew all his doors got inside his fortress took all of his stuff destroyed everything he owned. Then I took all his clothes and when he was lying there naked I smashed his head in with pickaxe. I made sure his building privileges were lost and invited some strangers to live in his house. I built doors so he wouldnt come back inside. I took my sweet revenge. This game is full of experiences just like this.

review: Feb 10 2015Brilliant! Something for every kind of survivalist. A beutiful visual experience as well. If you have not palyed this game by all mean do. If you have not played in a while then get in again on the "developer" side. (starts by default now actually) While there still are imperfections in this game it has most certainly advanced. I am happy to leave legacy Rust in the past! (I do miss the kevlar outfits though)If you like a fast paced game look for a server running mods. if you want a more methodical game experiance then "vanilla" Rust may be for you. Either way I suspect if you give this game even half a chance you will find reason enough to come back.Rust is often just what you make of it. If you are into big groups and working together then this can be your game. That being said I play solo almost all thee time and can always find a server that fits my style.

review: If someone were to ask me in a short sentence what rust is I would say 'Minecraft with better textures and move pvp'. In the simplist of terms that's what I think rust is.Is it good/worth buying?Yes if you have the time to play it. Rust is a game that requires many hours and a very hard grind to get the good stuff you have to go around collecting blueprint fragments and resources the majority of the time. Especially if you want to do any good raids (which will need c4 and rockets). If you don't have atleast 2/3 hours a day to sink into rust I would not recommend buying it.What are the negative aspects of the game? For starters it could still do with more optimization Secondly It has a extremely high amount of pvp it should have some servers where pvp is limited (so it could expand its playerbase by diversifying its target audience.Overall rust is a great game its biggest issue is most likely the fact that you have to play so much to be able to obtain the best things in the game (and only on the particular server you are playing on)

review: Still need to play this game more before I can feel entirely confident in my review but I can say that in the brief time I've been playing the amount of entertainment I'm experiencing is incredible. It's challenging and the community can be brutal but some minor effort in making some friends can pay large dividends. I've been playing with a close group of friends and over the course of the weekend we've become known on our server and have begun setting up a large scale base which we hope we'll eventually use as a staging area to get into skirmishes with other groups of people.It's hard to describe why coming back with a large haul of resources can be so exciting but mostly it's the risk/reward factor. Even something as simple as seeing a rock node in the middle of a field can get your adrenilin pumping because exposing yourself to attain that resource may cost you everything on your person. The best suggestion I can make is to do some reading on getting started as there's very little instruction. Additionally make it a priority to make some friends. In a post apocolyptic world your best chance of survival is to band together with like minded people. Rust does an excellent job of making this simple common sense idea a reality.

review: I played this game ages ago on a friend's PC and really enjoyed it. Recently i bought myself a decent PC with the intention of using it in the living room like a games console. Unfortunately this game does not get on well with the steam controller. After days of trying to fix it I have finally given up. Apparently people were using mouse software to counter act gun recoil. It seems to counter act the cheaters using pseudo random placement of the cursor after firing or auto kicking people who had the supernatural ability to consistantly refocus on the exact same pixel in the exact same amount of time after each and every shot was too hard. Instead they employed the help of Easy Anticheat which is supposed to block the use of any mouse that could allow scripting. The irony of all this is that the only time the steam controller touch pad actually works as a mouse in the game is to aim. It's impossible to get through the menus or crafting with a controller despite the fact that you're allowed to set control stick &gt mouse emulation before launching the game proper. To add injury to insult if you try to set the triggers to emulate a mouse click you lose the abilty to click on all of your HID devices and can't even quit the game.I will be avoiding products involving either easy anti cheat or facepunch studios until one of them owns this up and corrects it.

review: I'll will try to make this review the most helpful for the people who hasn't buy the game yet. In advance sorry for my english who isn't really accurate(I'm french). So I'll be covering different facts on the game and I'll try not to give my personal opinion about it. I got 247 hours so I know what I'm talking about.So first what is Rust?Rust is a survival game where the primary danger is the other players you start on an island naked with only a rock to gather ressources. The first thing you'll want to do is gather some wood to build a campfire for the night craft better tools to be more efficient and after start your own base. Once you have a safe base you can try to equip yourself with guns or melee weapons by breaking barrels or going in radtowns. The game become interesting when people try to raid your base with C4(or maybe you'll attack before). Then only your strategies can save you or teamwork if you're with friends. The game start to become exciting and you understand why you bought it before. You start to get scared of losing your base and all your ressources that you farmed for such a long time your hand start to sweat and you're are stressed like you never been in other games. You hear gunshots and soon the bip sound of the C4...Good things+ Incredible ambiance Variety of guns Unique Cool with friends No major bugs for an early access game Active devsBad things Community of s (+ It's fun to kill them) Farming simulator Spawnkill sometimes you spawn and get killed instantly by a full armored guy Near impossible to play alone Did I say the community is Really repetitive(goes with farming)Pretty much it I do recommend this game because it's really awesome if you have people to play with and it reminds me of the good times I had playing Minecraft PvP/Faction...If you liked my review be sure to comment my profile and Go see my steam community Blue Comet Discord https //discord.gg/H9zvp5xYou can also send me a friend invite to play Rust once you bought it )
title: Rust

review: I have a love hate relationship with this game. its good but every patch has made the game less fun to play and more of a chore. 1st they added twigging and ladder raiding not cool as now everyone can bypass all your defenses and go in through your roof. every time ive been raided its been that way the safest spot to put your loot is your 1st floor because nobody will bother going in that way. 2nd they changed ore nodes so now stone is rarer than metal. they attempted to tweak this by adding a increased chance of stone nodes in forested areas. this fix did not work. 3rd they changed it so junkpiles only spawn on roads. so having a desert base or a snow base screws you over on important components. if your not built up by a monument your getting nowhere fast. 4th..... the game gets progressively worse with every patch. its like they want to destroy the game. they take things that work away and replace the mechanics with something broken. i understand the game is still in an experimental state but its rediculous. 5th even with all this said i will still continue playing this game because im stupid and have no self respect (.

review: More than a 1000+ Hours in this game. I think its a good time that i will write my review of this game..Rust Legacy.Man a lot of you people won't even know how awsome Legacy was. The game was just so easy and simpel. There were so many hackers that didnt get banned but you didnt even care because it was just fun. I played like 400/500 hours in Legacy Untill the Beta version of Rust came out. And my PC couldnt handle it back then.Basicly what im trying to say is "LEGACY was awsome back then but not anymore not even worth trying."Rust Beta.So i've been playing the beta version since i had a new PC.Man i just fell in love with this game. Everything is just great about it. And the best thing is the delevopers listin to the community!!! Every week there is a update and if the community doesnt agree with a update they let them know and they devel. will try and fix it or change it. Thats just 1 + side of the game.Building is just better and way more creative than any other game i've seen or played. The PVP isn't 100% great in my opinion but its good enough for now.The community is just pure sh!te. There are some grownups but a lot of players are young and just trying the you off Maybe turning of the chat is a good thing to do if you can't handle young and childish players.So at the end i've played 1000+ hours in this game and its just awsome you have to get used to it but you def will fall in love with the game. review: In short it's great. It's still in alpha and it's just as good or better than it's competing games. It's a bit like Minecraft. Except Minecraft is friendly. Minecraft somewhat holds your hand. Minecraft is pretty happy. It has creative peaceful mode. Rust doesn't. Rust is mean. Rust drops you in the middle of a field with extremely minimal tools. You will die. A lot. As much or more than in any other game. (Except Flappy Bird which is in a league all of it's own. But I digress.) And whether you're killed by wolves bears or naked jumping men with shotguns you will keep going because you want to be at the level of your killers. All of your work days of gameplay can be wiped out within 10 minutes. Oh yeah did I forget to mention that when you close Rust you don't disappear from the game world? Instead you lie on the ground sleeping. Anyone can walk up kill you and take all of your inventory. Fun right? Now I know it probably seems from this like Rust is a mean terrible death trap. Guess what? It is! But it's a fun great death trap. And if you can make it past those first few hours and have a few friends who you know won't backstab you you'll be ok. And then you can be the naked jumping man with a shotgun who kills new spawns. It's great. Have fun!TL DR Buy it. Now.
title: Rust

review: If you love a game Full of kill on sight it makes DayZ look like a friendly gaming community this is the game for you! Ever wish that some one should just walk up and kill you literally 2 mins after freshely spawning in? Look no further! there are countles 13 year olds who will be doing just that! Then to call you a bunch of things and brag about how they just shot you 10 feet away with a gun well you only have a rock all well screaming into their mike with their high pitch pre puberty voices! Don't worry about combat logging because in this game you're charecter is always on the server! whether that means for a quick Alt F4 not to get shot or just to get off for the night. Instead of doing the logical thing of only laying down for a minute or so you will now be laying down from the moment you get off to the moment you are back on! Whether that means for ten minutes or 3 days! so dont exspect to be able to just pick up where you left off because odds are you are already dead! Not to mention you need incredible luck just to make it to the metal door stage. With all that aside Rust is very pretty and can be fun once you win the lottery of making it to the "I have a big fancy gun" stage. review: Rust is a game for friends because trust is an absolute must.While you can play solo you'll need several people at least to build and maintain a home and protect it from attacks as well as to raid others. This game constantly has you on edge staying alert of your surrondings is the only thing that keeps you from getting shot and loosing everything you've gathered. It requires a lot of attention staying away to long from this game will see that your homes defenses slowly decay from attempted seiges and natural degredation.The community itself tends to be hostile trust no one. Someone begging for food is likely trying to get you to open your door to break in and kill you. An inocent freshspawn with no gear is likely stalking you for a larger group. The built in push to talk button makes social engineering an interesting factor. Your enemy will likely try to convince you that they're a good guy before they shoot you. Or very rarly maybe they are friendly you figure it out.all in all this game stole 100 some odd hours of my life so I like to think that its a pretty good game even if it is still early alpha and lacking in a lot of ways. The core game itself though is solid.

review: Flying bears murdering doors and hard freezes...so why play? Because Its a BLAST! Not a game for the short tempered at the moment but the bugs arent important. Enjoy them while they last. Who else will be able to say "i remember i lagged into someones house and hit the jackpot.....and died there..."? But thats not the point of the game. Back door survival fear of your fellow player navigating by the sun and moon trying not to starve or get eaten all while trying to establish yourself in a dangerous world. If thats not a challenge what is? When thisw game is complete(almost) smoother gameplay and maybe even a few laws of the land will make this the best survival sandbox MMO out there. For now enjoy your bear chicken.
title: Rust

review: This game is one of the reasons I no longer trust pre release steam games. Garry (the creator) has been horrendous about keeping us updated. After the community got to him enough he began to give us updates but they are all in a tone like he's annoyed by the fact that people wish to know where their money is going. We make him millions and expect a paragraph a week in return not too much I'd say? Regardless the game has the most toxic community I've ever seen. The game encourages farming new people never giving them a chance to ever enjoy the game. If you're the first person on the server and you grind congrats you've just won yourself the game while making it 0 fun for anyone else involved.In addition to all of this the game has numerous bugs. Which is expected but Garry doesn't seem to be fixing them. He's adding in gimmicks like item durability which punishes new players and is working really really hard on an item editor!! Perfect! Now when the item editor is finished and released Garry doesn't have to do any work whatsoever just let the modders take the game and do with it what they please while he takes alllllll the money. Smart guy.Save your money.

review: First off if you are wanting to buy this game it is not really for casual players/people who are not going to play a lot throughout a span of a week. (Unless you play modded/battlefield) &gt P.S. THE COMMUNITY IS TOXIC FOR THIS GAME DONT CRY ABOUT IT IT IS WHAT MAKES RUST.... WELL RUST!Right when I bought this game in August of 2016 I really had no idea how it worked even though I was playing with friends the game was hard to pick up on. As I progressed and played the game mor each week I started realizing the aspects and building of the game. I started on modded because that's what my friends were playing and it was easier. At this time cave bases were a thing (and im not talking about the spaces for 2x2's and 3x3's I'm talking about the cave bases that costed 30 C4 to get into a loot room). Anyways playing the game solo when new is not really a good option especially if you have no idea what you are doing and it will be hard for you to pick up the game. I feel like now FacePunch is starting to take the game more seriously because they are consitently adding new things to the game every week whether it is new monuments guns optimizations or just new aspects (like twig building) or by just adding new people to their team. I respect them for adding the roadmap because now I know that this game will probably get out of early access unlike other games I think would (ARK DayZ) because I think those games are slowly dying out and the devs for those games dont care as much as facepunch does. If you end up getting the games there will be a lot of hard times and raging moments but through all of that the other aspects of the game is very fun like PVPing (and actually killing someone) raiding or just building if you are that type of person.I STRONGLY reccomend this game though if it is what floats your boat.

review: I've played the game for a while now and i feel like i should warn new players. Dont expect the game to be fun in the beginning. There are people with guns and huge bases everywhere and they shoot at everyone they see. You're basically gonna get bullied A LOT until you managed to build your own base. From that point forward you can start bullying nakeds. I regret buying this game. A lot of the people are genuine s. and i mean really. You just played for 2 hours and finally got some stuff together? they raid your base and blow it up with c4 for no reason. They destroy your sleeping bag so you dont respawn. No matter where you place your base people will find it and they will destroy it. Also avoid trespassing near buildings which is gonna be insanely hard because people built stuff everywhere. you cant even find a place to start a base. if you just think this is just a rant buy the game and try it out for yourself. prepare to get shot a lot even if you're an innocent naked with a rock.

review: Awesome game I loved playing it everyday but there are a few things you should consider before purchasing. If you're playing this and are still going to school you're going to have a tough time defedning your base. You have to be on everyday to repair your defenses and foundation (as they decay) if you dont play for a few days your house will crumble unless you're part of a clan that will look after things but trying to get into a clan is like trying to stick your in a cheerio. DON'T BUY IF YOU GET OFF EASY.... This game will make you violent demon from hell if you lose most of your good loot trust me. If you can control your temper by all means go for it but be warned there are little out there they will hack and grief your base and take your hard earned loot. This games got a long way to go there's a lot of work to be done but for the time being it's pretty good and fun IF you have friends. If you play solo its much harder. So grab some friends and play also this may ruin some friendships as iv'e seen good childhood friends turn on each other over who ate the last wolf meat or who researched the ak47 so good luck!

review: I'm probably still a noob in this game with my playtime and my experience but i still felt like writing a review about this game because the experience is very interesting to say the least.First of all I have never played PvP open world survival and I'm the biggest virgin when it comes to playing that kind of genre. So why the did I start playing rust? Simply answered I wanted a new experience and I got excactly what I expected The first 5 hours was me trying to build a base or even to get stuff to build a base and be killed everytime I saw another player. I managed to build a base but had no codelocker yet so we basically got (we is me and my friend). We joined a new server after wipe and my friend found some people who helped him get a base. We started expanding our base and helping those guys. In return they helped us and gave us weapons and ressources to enhance our base even more. I killed almost every naked guy I saw. Sometimes I spared nakeds when I heard them talking and stuff. I told them to go away and felt really professional when they did (hihi). First raid with our neighbours. Pickaxing foundations and trapping enemy in their base. It was fun. Friend got killed by spearguy I save him and get his shotgun and stuff back. Sweaty hands. I made lots of friends gifted my neighbours stuff and started to leave clothed people alive and made friends with them. Some clothed people talk to me and say they are friendly I open the door and they kill me. Sweaty hands. I trap them in thefirst sector of our small base and let them starve to death after shooting a guy. Mighty shotgun trap saved my Friendo was offline. I was sweating like After that all my confidence was gone every naked and clothed guy was not trustworthy and I basically got trust issues with everyone while my self esteem was suffering hard from being able to be raided and I was scared of going outside.Oh and they could improve optimization game ran like diashow with high settings (my pc isn't the best tho).TLDR Sweaty hands and trustissues.*Edit I can't go to sleep because I'm scared I'll be raided. Kill me please.

review: Okay. So this is probably or at least was my favorite game of all time. who doesn't wamt to get a small group of friends together amd attempt to survive? Sure there are hackers and they make the game just not fun at all because you're like "Yes I got my kev and M4 let's go house searching and suplly gathering" or maybe "Let's go after that supply drop" but when you go out you get cross mapped by a gun and the range is 10 times over the guns actual range yeah that is terrible like you'll probably rage if you're like me haha. Then theres raiding. Raiding is the whole idea around Rust dominaing a server but when you get offline and if you're built near civilization and/or the road odds are you're place will be raided by the time you get back on and all your work was for nothing. So this game is fun but also very competative. I recommend that if you get this game you get some friends to play with becuase if you're by yourself then you're basically screwed. Buy the game you won't regret it!

review: This game offers something that i can only describe as Fear slowly surrounding you and you get that Deep pulse you can feel in your whole chest as you find your self outnumbered 3 fold yet still undetected it seems unlikeley that you can wiggle your way out of this one...The excitement is sky high when you spot an other player close to you and you hope he didnt see you. But the excitement is quickly overshadowed by paranoia as you stock up on resources and you become scared of loosing it all. When caught by the sunset and visability slowly fades to Zero do you dare turn on your torch? Knowing that its going to stand out like a sore thumb in the pitchblack night!Yet here i am lurking from my bush making sure that old factory is abandoned before sneaking in looking for that Loot you so desperatly need while your radiation poisoning rises... Suddently you get jumped by a zombie and you quickly fire 3 5 shots and as the beast falls your hear the echoes of the gunshots fading out. Now your panicked as radiation starts becoming deadly you quickly scavenge the zombie and starts running... As you gain distance a firefight breaks out in the old factory behind you... you live to see another day...These are just some of the situations I'v come by in my first 22 hours of playtime... first of many!The simple thought that while im sitting here writing a review someone could be filling their pockets with all my resourses and spare weapons. Did i hide my safehouse good enough in that remote rock cluster? Was one metal door really enough to keep the bad guys out? Have they found my small hidden backup stash in the corner? Could someones hands be all over my sweet silenced M4 with with all the attatchments and pile of ammo? oh No! PS. #FacepunchI have some ideas that I would like to see added Sigh Crafting Just a sigh you can stick on a wall or on a pole where you can white personal mesagesNote Crafting Put a note in someones crate after you looted someone camp. And if you could ad a kind of "timer" so you can estimate hov long ago a campfire was used. (like a tracker poking in ashes... you get the point)Well... I better go make sure my loot is okay!/EasyToHate

review: I cannot stress the ammount on fun you will have with this game. What I recommend is that you join a server called combat tags and you are able to try out weapons get better and learn aimcones and spray patterns for specific guns. Then you will should join a battlefield server where you get to experience a 3v1's roofcampers ect and how to deal with them. Next if you want more high pressure situations where your blood gets pumping play battle royal. Its essentially the hunger games but in rust. After doing these for a little while or just jumping straight into the game YOU get to choose what you want to do next. There are so many different playstyles in Rust and you need to find which suites you best. You could be a painter or you could be a pvper and never farm or maybe even a farmer if you got time to kill. It doesn't matter what you do this is Rust you will make friends you will get betrayed. All is good because every Thursday is like a new game.
title: Rust

review: Rust is an fps survival game where you have to gather stuff hunt animals craft study explore. The world of Rust is huge there's no map or compass so you have to find your own way check the sun and mountains for directions this gives an extra level of realism to it because even if you know the map well it's still pretty easy to get lost.You can farm rocks for ore chop wood hunt animals for fat cloth meat leather. You can build your own shack or house if you have enough material you can build a fortress. On the map you can find little cities factories abandoned buildings most of these places have spawn points where you can find important loot bullets blueprints guns even but most of these places have radiation so you will need protective clothing or rad pills to spend enough time there. Oh blueprints you need them to be able to craft the more advanced stuff but you can also research with research kits and learn how to craft something that way. Basically the world of Rust is not really dangerous if you watch out for animals (bears wolves) and the heavily radiated zones. The fun comes in with multiplayer and you want multiplayer because gathering can be fun for a while but what's gonna happen when you have the biggest fortress and no one to protect it from? Boredom.There are around 4 5000 servers at the moment some of them are heavily populated ( up to 200 players per map ) others are almost empty. In Rust if you join a server you will have a character on that server you can build stuff gather resources study blueprints but you can't take your stuff / knowledge to a different server if you choose a different one you will have to start from zero.If you are new to Rust I suggest you to start on a less populated server preferably a friendly or noob server so you won't get killed in the first 5 minutes. What am I talking about? You will probably get killed in the first few minutes but that's Rust for you. The best is to find some buddies to play the game with alone it's really hard especially if you have to stand up against 3 4 bandits raiding your house and loosing all your stuff after gathering it four hours can be really painful trust me.After many hours of gameplay I have finally found a server where most of the people are friendly we have a village and events from time to time and the best times are when there are bandits on the server and everybody works together to protect our land. The game itself is not very complicated the basic gameplay can be exhausted after 15 20 hours but the fun starts when you find a good community with cool people.The game is still in early access so a lot of things will change. I keep checking the developer's blog and they are basically rebuilding the game so the next Rust is coming and it's going to be ever better. Can't wait.

review: I really enjoy this game but do have some complaints. I have 40+ hours on this game but definetely didn't enjoy the all. Some problems i had are noob killers. New players stand out so it seems that guys with alot of items simply murder them because they can. Another issue is you cant remove building pieces that you placed. I also feel they need to add more weapons and limit how tall you can build your house because those huge skyscrappers bother me. Now for the good stuff. Once you get started and aren't struggling every minute to survive this game i EXTREMELY fun and quite addicting. It's also great once you start a group. Once in a group you can feel confident and take on enemy groups. (NOTE dont get too confident) The rush of running from groups of enemies firing at you with assault rifles or evading groups of wild animals through the mountains is like no other. Considering Rust is $20USD I would say if you like FPS or survival games pick this game up.

review: I'll be honest... I loved this game when I first bought it. I enjoyed basically everything the game had to offer.... Mostly. You get to build and gather craft and hunt explore and advance. But at some point all of that gets taken away from you over and over again. I can only explain the frustration to others of how much it sucks to have your hard work taken away forcing you to start over. And then having it taken again. And then again. AND AGAIN. (I think you see the pattern) It wouldnt be such a problem if it wasnt this way on every server But it either is Or it's deserted. But lets say you do advance by some miracle. Miraculously surviving the onslaught. You get the best weapons The best armor recources and house you could want. Now what? Will you meaninglessly collect more build more or re explore? Oh How about this. This is a good one. Kill all the naked's you ever see ever just because you can it makes you feel good And because it's funny. )No but really Unless your goal is strictly to kill naked cavemen (or cavewomen) who dont have anything but a rock and a stick or to have the same done to you I just cannot recommend this game.

review: Generally I really like survival based games. I've enjoyed watching Rust develop over the last few months and lately their newest additions have really impressed. If you enjoy building and doing your best to survive in a post apocolyptic situation I would definitely reccomend this game.PVE players please currently purchase this title with caution. If you can find a PVE well administrated server you're golden to have a good time however the PVP servers or the PVP players trolling PVE servers can be quite frustrating. Overall this game will be better when private servers are more accessable and affordable.EDIT Updating this post since the newer additions to Rust have been made playable. I have to say that the way they have revamped this game is absolutely beautiful. While it still has a long way to go in development stages you can really see this game start to shine as of late. I love a lot of the new features the graphics are gorgeous and housing/shelter is so much easier/nicer to build!

review: I love this game. So many things about this game are great.Gameplay is a lot of fun. It can be tedious at times to get resources and materials but overall once you get set up it's really not an issue anymore.Making bases is pretty creative and you have to find all sorts of ways to keep your base from being easy to raid. Many bases end up with like every room in a 1x1 area has doors just to make the raiders waste more resources to get to the good loot.Raiding other bases is the really fun part though. You spend most of your time surviving and gathering resources so you can survive better but when you really don't need to worry about survival anymore you worry about keeping trust bonds and alliances with other groups in your area (Great way to meet new people). If those trust bonds you feel aren't worthy enough to keep or you feel like betraying them you just blow their walls sky high greet them with an Assault Rifle and blow them to the ing moon.Devs are good with keeping the game updated and glitches and bugs are ironed pretty quickly. I've seen better in other games but Facepunch isn't lacking when it comes to keeping the game good.Performance isn't much of an issue if you have a mid range gaming pc. I have a Radeon 270x and can run this game at 30fps on max graphics so I'm not complaining about the performance.BEAUTIFUL game btw.Roadmaps are realistic and can be achieved. They might be behind sometimes but they catch up very quickly.All in all game is amazing and I 100% recommend it.GG Facepunch.

review: Worth ItIf you've got friends that will play the game with you I don't think there's a better place to put your $20 (at the time). Having played more than 150 hours of the Legacy Build (The one seen in the "First Day Trailer" at the time of this review) it was a super welcome addition to see a full referbishment of the game's overall look and building mechanics It's a real piece of eye candy. The game is super easy to get into and should have you hooked after you're first night without a shelter. The crafting is made easy with large text and simple to navigate catergories and most of the items that you need to get yourself started with aren't incredibly hard to scout ingredients for.Player interaction is a bit of a grey area because in the end it mostly comes down to kill or be killed. While it's very rare that you'll encounter a stranger that either legitimatly wants to help you out by giving you some food or tools it's not impossible and for the times that you do encounter a crazed murderer who can't be bargained with it's relatively straight foward to deal with them as long as you've established yourself and play your moves right.Raiding or being raided can you give the biggest rush you've probably ever got out of a game when you've got a couple bolt action rifles (incredibly hard to come across in Legacy) on the line. It's common for me to be unable to get control of my mouse during a heated raid with friends because of how much I'm shaking IRL.Yes the game can make you feel like a pile of dirt when you've got your valuables in transit and a rookie comes and surprises you with the perfect shotgun he found but it's got a sort of lingering appeal that makes you want to do it all again.Overall it comes down to who you're gonna play the game with as it can lose some of the appeal that I just talked about if you're playing alone. Find some friends that are keen to play and you should be set for a couple 4AM late nighters. Definetly recommended.

review: 10/10 absolute must have!!!! Ahhhhh Rust A survival game that doesn't need Zombies Mutants Cannibals (Or any combination of the three for that matter) to leave you scared beyond reason. It truly encompasses what it means to be in the "Survival" genre. An outside threat shouldn't be necessary to make you wary. Starving in a forest through the black of night with wolves bears and other players all out to kill you and rip the blood caked rock from your mits should be more than enough to keep the adrenaline flowing. If you've played Rust before you've most likely experienced many a situation similar to the afformentioned horror. If not you now have a pretty basic understanding of the game. I would like to take this take to inform you of the evil that awaits you beyond the "Play" button. Never trust a fellow player no matter how much raw chicken or torches he/she gives you Never use a torch they're referred to as "Beacons Of Death" for a reason rock battles and base raids await. "Welcome To Rust" Every Raider Ever.

Once again though if you DO have a computer this game can run well on then I very much recommend it.

The crafting and base building is ok (stolen from fortnite) but other than that there is nothing to do apart from go on raids (world of s term i merely call it a stroll myself) to the same few locations again and again for the same limited items that currently inhabit this game. "Remove Zombies Remove Zombies Remove Zombies Remove Zombies" holy now there is absolutly NOTHING to do whats wrong with the zombies the only joy i actually got from this game was sneaking into one of these rad infested areas looking for loot dressed in a potato sack with my pet rock named eric and my pistol and a couple of rounds and then cautiously searching the buildings whilst looking out for and dealing with zombies whilst exploring it added a real sense of survival as the zombies were rather relentless and killed you quick. You could say "thats what other players are for a sense of danger" and your somewhat right but when you successfully defend yourself from a zombie horde and stand victorious over your fallen enemies they then dont start abusing you over the public chat system or shoot you the instant you spawn into the game with only your underwear and your pet rock. Other people are the real problem with video games all this online always connected to some other sod this could have been an excellent survival game but all its starting to come accross as is just counter strike with base building.

review: Addictive and engaging at first but the community will get on your nerves fast.Building your first house crafting your first set of gear and exploring the area for the first time feels great. The initial steps are rewarding and fun but after a while you'll realize that you can't escape the fact that this is a PVP open world game. In terms of success you get out exactly what you put in. And the average Rust player is putting more in than you. If you're picking up Rust just to play casually you will get steamrolled by groups of people whose only source of enjoyment is in annoying other players.I have a hard time connecting with anyone in game. I don't know if it's kids or just people who aren't the brightest but you could even be giving stuff away and people would still try to kill you with a rock right after spawning in. The chat is a nonstop stream of slurs and posturing (e.g. "i just killed two geared f****ts with bow headshots kill yourself n****r"). I don't care what language people use but it's symptomatic of a very immature playerbase.The two observable goals of Rust are 1) Prove that you're the best and 2) Make sure no one else is having fun. Two people once spent at least half an hour clicking on the wall of my hut. The chest I had inside was worth less than the 50 metal pickaxes they consumed breaking in. On another occasion someone waited at my doorway staring at their screen for 20 min until I came back from collecting resources. They didn't even end up getting anything but it didn't matter. The real prize is undoing other people's progress. Clans will have people taking shifts so that they can raid people as they go offline and not get raided themselves which makes casual play impossible.You might think I don't recommend this game because of the toxic community. In part this is true but ultimately I just didn't find a worthwhile goal to keep me playing.
title: Rust

review: Rust Short Review Like always There will be a short review and a long review Rust points! Overall 8/10 Graphics 8.5/10 Music 6/10 Gameplay 8/10 World 8/10 (atleast the standard map) I recommend Rust for... People who like Survival games People who like online games People who like raiding other people's bases People who like epic gunfights People who like gathering resources and building bases People who play ark I don't recommend Rust for... People who dont like gunfights/fps People who dont like ark People who dont like gathering resources and building bases People who dont like losing stuff/bases (when offline) People who dont like the system with all the servers People who dont like to play with other people Rust Long Review What is Rust? Rust is a survival game where you find resources and craft guns build bases and kill other players. The game is only multiplayerand works with a system that uses servers (like ark). Everyone can make one of these server (you can also make a private one for you and your friends). The game also includes animals random buildings to explore AI vechiles to take down and grab the loot from and ofcourse the other players Why did i buy it? Its a great game to play with loads of friends and very time consuming i really enjy games where i can put 100+ hours in and still play with the same excitement as when i started playing. i would really recommend the game if you have some friends that can buy it too its deffenitly not expensive for this type of game Whats the goal of the game? Build a base make guns and kill everybody then you can capture their items or base and use the items that you find to raid the next one. At first it might look repetitive but its always fun to explore new bases and find new loot! How does this game stand out? first The players. You can meet so many new players that eventualy become your friends. as example at my favourite server where i buyed vip at that server and meeted 4 people we started to skype together and joined the same clan now after 50+ hours with that people their almost my best friends ) How are the graphics the music and the world?The graphics are very good and its nice to run around in the game there are a lot of biomes to explore and every biome has diffrent cave's buildings and other cool stuff the music is a little dowpoint... let me put it this way there's almost no music. Whats bad about it? The music is bad the lag can sometimes be annoying but that depends on the server you are playing on. How are the devs/community?/b They're fantastic like i said its fun to meat new people in the game. there are a lot of people who are glad to help you )and the devs constantly add new content and make the game greater! How about mods/workshop content? you can buy some pretty nice skins in the steam market there are no other workshop things. Is it worth the price? Yep i cant recommend the game more its just so good! Thanks for reading and i hope you buy the game!

review: Let me start off by saying this game is amazing hands down.I clearly have a ton of hours on this game and for the most part I thoroughly enjoyed each and every one. After I started mechanic school along with my full time job I realized I had less time to play so I started playing modded servers with slightly increased gather rates so that I could still enjoy the game to the fullest but spend less time. Unfortunately servers wipe every week or every other week or if you are on a very unpopular server maybe even a month. I say unpopular for the month wipe servers because the game dies every single wipe usually about a week in that is why the weekly wiped servers are by far the most popular and most played. If you don't have at least 2 4 hours (depending on your luck/skill) to play consecutively then do not buy this game. When you log off your character goes to sleep on the ground and you are basically free loot. You MUST build a base upon starting on a new server or fresh wipe. This games main problem is how time consuming it is to be able to have fun (IMO) I'm honestly not sure how they would even fix that without completely changing the game so I'm not complaining about it I'm just forewarning anyone on the fence about buying this game If you do not have a solid chunk of time to dedicate to this game on a daily basis you shouldn't buy this game. If you have 4 6 hours straight of each day you need to occupy Look no further you found the perfect game. On a side not for anyone that is going to buy this game It is competitive and cut throat if you think you're going to join a server and find help then think again. You will spawn in naked with a rock and see someone with a gun and a huge base and think "awesome this guy can probably help me out and give me some starter quot WRONG! He is going to waste 40 bullets on you for some unknown reason just so you can re spawn naked with a rock to repeat the same process in front of some other s base.all in all 10/10
title: Rust

review: What can I say about Rust that hasn't already been said? The game is fun I can't stress that enough. It's the most fun Sandbox Survival game on the market (in my opinion) But the game has many flaws.The game is heavily unoptimized The game tends to become more playable with steady FPS with each update (generally every week or so)There is a ton of content to Rust and more and more content comes with each update. The community behind the game tends to be pretty awesome most of the time as well. The community is so creative as well. The game comes with Steam workshop support + mod support/Plugin support for servers. Sadly Facepunch (the studio behind Rust) Doesn't give out server keys Meaning you can't create your own dedicated server. You have to rent servers. If you're a fan of the Open world Sandbox survival genre Rust is a must. The studio behind the game updates it every week or two and releases plogs on the FacePunch Dev Diary. Warning If you don't have a high end rig You may suffer from Frame drops and lag.
