review: What can I say about this game that people already haven't?I suppose I should start by saying that this game is hard. Really hard at least for newcomers looking for a new survival game to play. This is by no means a "realistic Minecraft" in any way. Don't expect to be able to get far in this game fast by going solo or even with just 1 other friend to help you. As much potential as this game has I find it hard to play it without getting extremely frustrated by the fact no matter what you try to obtain to build a life for yourself in this game it can all be taken away with one well placed shot from a player more equipped than you (This is all based of PVP servers).I understand that that's the point of this game that it gives you the option to choose whatever path you take in this game whether that be good or bad but that's also the one of the game's flaws that can't really be changed since you run the risk of restricting the player to begin with. Unless you're just starting out 9 times out of 10 you'll just be gunning down every person that you stumble across. You kill them so that already sets them back in terms of items that they had on them and unless they had a spawn point and a decent base with extra supplies built up that means they start back from square one all over again. And even if they had a base built up I'm sure it would've taken some. if not a lot of those supplies to make whatever they had in the first place anyway. Killing other players off when you get the chance only gets you benefits in the long run.This is an Alpha though so I guess I really shouldn't be saying too much in terms of flaws this game might have since there is already bound to be SOME. I guess my only other question is "How can they fix a part of the game that should give you free will to decide without restricting the player?" I'm eager to see if they can come up with one.As for actually recommending this I would definitely do so but just remember one thing. This game IS NOT for the casual player. If you really want to play this game and get things fast play it with about 3 5 other friends if you can.Strength in numbers.

review: Rust... A game that I've put many many hours into &amp will do in the future but I like to leave it for a while for more stuff to be added.This game was hit hard when it came out for the first time &amp I hated it but when I came back to see the new and improved version of Rust it was great! The developers really listened to the community &amp that shows they do want to make a good game. They are also good because they update the game every 2 weeks so there will always be something new.There is a downside if you are an admin on a server then you probably come across people that call you admin abuser when you kill them or destroy their base but you ve collected everything the same as they have. This can get annoying for some people and does ruin the fun but sometimes when you see people really complain about it can be a right laugh so really don t let those people bring you down.Once you ve done everything and then the server wipes it can be a killer for you to start again but it can also be good but I do find it gets boring once I ve done everything they have and that s why I normally wait a couple of months before coming back to it as then there is more to offer.This is probably a top game that I like to play with other people and it s really good when you have a big group as people like to challenge you by attacking your base &amp always fun to find out who done it.My Pros Building Easy and fast to learn which is very good to have Combat With more weapons and guns in the game there is a big range that you can use to kill animals and other people so all good fun. Encounters Sometimes you make friends &amp other times you make enemies mostly enemies. Visuals The game looks very good and they keep improving.My Cons Kids But sometimes that can be funny. Replay Value Can get boring if you ve done everything before and just waiting on updates.This is a perfect game to play with your mates and work together to try &amp build an upbreakable base &amp become the tops ones in a server but be careful who you make an enemy as it could bite you in the butt.8/10

review: This game has elements of greatness and elements of terribleness. Overrall I think it's good. I *think*. I'm not quite sure because there are so many negatives. For example the game doesn't even work for some I had to download a mod that would let me launch it. Also the Easy Anti Cheat is horrible and bans random people and sometimes crashes your game. But at the core of this game is something amazing. The engine itself it good the look of the game is vastly better than a game like Ark Survival Evolved. If I had one huge complaint it would be to add more. More items because at the end of the day there's too much grind and not enough reward. You would have to grind for hundreds of hours to have a base made of the best material which is fine but there's not enough to put in that base. If there were just more things to do and to make I would say it's a great game. It's like Vanilla Minecraft. It's fun but you finish it quickly. Add more stuff.

review: Rust is a survival game created by Facepunch the developer that brought you Garry's Mod. It is currently in very early alpha and in its present state there is a crafting system in place that allows you to build bases weapons armour and explosives similar to Minecraft but there is also the tense pvp/survival elements will have taken their inspiration from DayZ. Being that it is in Alpha there are of lot of game balancing issues that are being addressed such as the ease of obtaining C4 and its ability to swiftly take apart peoples bases.After running around for the whole day in game you slowly gather resources such as food ore and wood and slowly piece together something you can call home. Depending on which server you chose this can take a fair amount of time and having this all blown up in less than 10 minutes can be immensely frustrating especially on larger building that can take many hours by multiple players to build up.So for many the prospect of having all your hopes and dreams go up in ticking explosions of death has led them to leave the game until it's further in its development cycle with many asking for C4 to be removed altogether.While understandable the threat of losing everything adds an element to the game that keeps you on your toes as well as forcing you to get better. Don't like being raided all the time? Build better structures! Don't like being shot at? Craft guns team up with others be friendly (at your own risk) and learn to shoot back!One thing you need to know is that you cannot trust anyone countless times I've encountered other players who have a "shoot on sight" policy but active communication can prevent this and a bit of wit charm or having a tactical advantage (you already have them in your iron sights or a friend does) can lead to fantastic interactions amongst players with each encounter being difficult to predict. It's this uncertainty that makes the game exciting some people are honourable they won't kill you if you're a noob and don't seem like a threat. Others see you as target practice and that everyone is competition for resources and has the potential to raid you if allowed to build up the defences. Then there are the final type of player although they're not really players in my eyes. The hackers and Admin abusers. These lot have a detrimental effect on the game and can literally destroy everything in seconds. It takes no skill or real effort and stems from a person s desire to be malicious and vindictive. The recent Cheatpunch and VAC bans have removed a lot but with each new patch comes potentially exploitable data and so hackers are removed in waves rather than instant bans. As the game progresses these problems will be ironed out so if you're put off then I would recommend waiting a little bit until the development cycle progresses. Gameplay has minor bugs and there are a lot of placeholders such as every animal dropping chicken fillets or red bears and wolves carrying flares and blueprints. Stability is good there is only rare frame skips and seem to be more affected by server lag as opposed to the actual game engine. There is also clipping in places and some of the shadow textures is a little off but the overall the game runs well and should only get better.Combat at present feels pretty good melee actually feels like you're smacking them with a rock and gunplay is simple but effective with the hunting bow and shotgun feeling particularly satisfying.Despite these problems I would recommend Rust even more so if you have friends or are good at making them. It's a harsh world out there even more so in Rust. Time should be spent looking for a server that fits your play style and you may need to go through a few before you find a community that fits your tastes.Rust is like so many other open games in that the amount of enjoyment you'll get from it is up to you. There isn't a linear path or a story as such and it's left to the player s imagination and interactions with others to make this game. If you can stomach the initial onslaught spawn kills rage speak from squeaky kids and griefing then perhaps you'll find a good bunch of people and you can change how your server plays and build a community that thrives. Alternatively you can play as the silent hermit naked stone in hand with nothing to lose and not a hope in hell of surviving for long.
title: Rust

review: Rust is a beautiful game of exploration and adventure wether you are scavenging old ruins hunting down animals or just harvesting log piles every moment of this game is always a calm and peaceful serene enviroment That is until someone decides to bludgeon you in or shoot you in the head. Or robs your house etc. The game itself is a great feel but it's the people that you run into that will ultimately make or break the game for you I have over 39 hours played and i have not once yet managed to sleep in my own house once without it getting blown up broken into or raided completely. I still enjoy the game but be aware "If you're so mad that you lost all your stuff then maybe you should get your 20$ back" Is a common saying used by the thick skulled ruffian raiders of many of the servers. Be prepared to hide Hunt and survive by the skin of your teeth because it's neither the rad bears nor the rad wolves that are dangerous It's the people.

review: Rust..... The game has had its ups and downs in development and you can choose to enjoy or whine about those ups and downs. Ive enjoyed them and when I havnt I take a break from Rust and let the devs figure it out. I love it and it has continued to be my favorite game of all time and I cherish it with my heart. The devs do listen to the community but overal it is their game and they can do what they want with it. Im not gonna list all the ups and downs cause most of the other reviews on here will but all im going to say is as long as the game is in early access the game will never be perfect but all it can do is improve. Not everyone will like this game it doesnt hold your hand through it all but if you can learn it and not scream at the devs when they jack up youll make it. Dont be afread to buy this game its worth your money in my opinion.

review: As someone with over 250 hours I can attest to Rust being an amazing game. However it does have flaws the game is designed for big groups and "Clans" emmerge which tend to dominate most servers praying on smaller groups of 2 or 3. Also sometimes no matter how good you are you get fed a plate of t and there isnt anything you can do about it. I would also recommend that anyone interested in doing the game for Youtube steer clear because content is often very hard to find. It is however a great game to stream. The PvP aspect of the game is done very well and has a crazy intense feel to it. The PvE aspect Is however not very challenging when you get to a point in the game were wolvers and bears are no longer a challenge but the helicopter would destory you if you challenged it. The game is also getting increasingly hard to run so if you have a weak computer I wouldnt recommend buying. The game also often has a grinding aspect and if you dont have any patience for that once again steer clear. Dev team is active updating the game every week which adds new things and helps keep the game fresh. Overall I would recommend you buy it but don't waste your 2 hour refund period because I might not work out.

review: What have you done!!This is so upsetting to see I only have two hundred hours but thats enough to see how the devs have totally destroyed this game. I must have put 150 of these hours in before the xp update when the game was playable enjoyable and fun. The devs have implamented a system that has destroyed what could have been one of the best games ever...The XP system. I am a full time worker and find my enjoyment of playing games in the evening i ran with a squad i killed noobs i had fun. Now i come home from work there is clans level 35+ burning and blowing everything in sight. This game is nothing any more the survival element has been taken away and replaced with a grind element. People dont even care for bases any more because they just get raided from the minute you build them instead you have clans fully geared with every weapon in the game just destroying everyone and everything. While it takes me 3 hours to get a metal pick axe....i mean come on. All in all this was one of the greatest if not the greatest ever PC game i played now its become awful. In its current state i would say dont buy it. Unless of course you have 12 hours a day to commit. check out Ark Wurm Xsyon all survival/crafting games that do what they promise and games where the DEVS have not totally ed the game!!Rant Over!

review: Rust is a very good game for being in the alpha stage. Similar to minecraft you start out with next to nothing and must gather materials to build a shelter and feed yourself. I have enjoyed minecraft so right off the bat this is what attracted me to Rust. The graphics are pretty basic 3D so even people who do not have top notch systems may enjoy this game. The crafting system is pretty simple and easy to learn. For people who need help there is already a Rust wiki with quite a lot of helpful information for people just starting out. The community isn't too bad either usually whatever server you go to you can find a few helpful or friendly players that are willing to help out new players. PvP makes this game shine quite a bit. While some servers don't have PvP for people who do not care for that sort of thing the servers with PvP allow for players to fight each other anywhere as well as raid each others houses and supplies. As this can be frustrating it also adds even more exciting for gamers who like a high risk high reward scenario. The fighting in this game is pretty standard of any first person shooter game. The only trouble I have had is a little issue with lag but nothing I can really complain about. The amount of detail put into this game is also pretty impressive. Having to make sure you don't starve or if you suffer a laceration making sure you bandage it so you don't bleed out. Those are just a few things that make this game impressive. As this is game is still in Alpha I'm excited to see what the future holds for this game.

review: This game used to be good. I loved it it made me feel in a game that I haven't in a long time and that's fear and paranoia. However when they released a brand new version with a new map graphics and items I just didn't enjoy it as much as I used to. At leased it gave you the option to go back to the original "Legacy" version. Then after a few years removed the Legacy version.I loved the Legacy version and it did many things better than the new version we have now. Me and many other people would agree. Sure it had some bugs and opimization issues but it was in alpha at the time. It was also simple but not too simple plus it had a haunting atmosphere that gives me chills to this day. Plus at the time a massively muliplayer survival game was new. Rust was made in the survival game craze when survival games were first coming to light. Being masively multiplayer gave Rust a certain feel of fear and paranoia that other games just could not replicate. The new version removes that atmosphere and just doesn't pack that punch.To be honest I never thought this game would be that sucessful legacy or no this game has flaws that drive people away. The fan base is also very toxic and the game could easily be classified as 'silly'. If you someone like me who prefers more realistic and serious games then this is definatly not for you.

review: After over 400 hours on this game (counting legacy). I have almost no complaints at all. Especially when you consider that this is still in Alpha. The developers update frequently to address known issues and their vision is incredible. Very few games inspire me to take so many screen shots and even after all this time I still look forward to playing. The is a fantastic game. If you are on the fence at all rest assured this game is well worth the money. My favorite aspect of the game is the way it brings out the different personalities and even moods of the multiplayers. Some days I find myself playing kind and helpful when I've had a stressful day at work maybe not so much. There are people who build empires and try to dominate the land by force there are communities who work together safty in numbers there are the ghosts who stay hidden accomplishing their goals and trying never to be seen. LOL I'll stop now. I love this game that is all.

review: There's not really any winning this game sometimes you're on top sometimes you're being fisted mostly the fisting part. It's a constant struggle whether you're playing solo or in a group. Sometimes you'll get screwed by your friends sometimes it's just some rando not willing to take the chance or just some s who've gotten tired of hunting the wildlife. Personally I fall into the second category. There's no telling whether or not a naked player is a helpless fresh spawn or just some naked dude with an assault rifle. Before the creation of safe zones your best option when encountering new players naked or not was nearly always to simply shoot them take their stuff and hope they don't hold a grudge. Sometimes you're the one dishing it out but most of the time you'll probably be on the receiving end. The trick to actually doing well in this game largely relies on having enough free time to take care of your base and your willingness to accept and plan for your inevitable sundry failures and recovering from them. If you can't do that you're going to have a bad time.

review: After what I can only assume was a shipwreck I woke up on a desolated island. I was naked hungry thirsty and at an utter vulnarable situation against mother nature. So I ran into the woods while I could. firtst night I was squandered by a heavy rain. Each rain drop was piercing my naked body. I quickly gather some woods to build myself a shelter. "ah it" said me. I give up trying and compromise on surviving the wild by eating mushrooms. Day 2 a fully geared guy runs after me at the dawn shouting "Waitaup ". "I'm friendly you " He shouted while running behinde me. "I ed your mom wai!". I was raised an orphan. I never knew my mother. This was my chance the chance to finally ask about my mother! So I halted and turned back. "Well " I said while gazing on my chaser being maulded to death by a bear. Alas he died. he could have been my father. I picked up his gears after the bear was gone. A map A shotgun a armour a key and some foods. I use the map to navigate my way to his place believing I could have found traces of my mother. After a day of walking I finally get to his hut. A large sign was by his door written on it "ISIS headquaters" and below it "May Allah enlargen your quot . As it seemed the chaser was a devout muslim. Before knocking and going into his house I checked the time to be sure he wasn't occupide with his prayers. Time clear. I could knock. As I tried to knock I accidentally opened the door. I had the key after all. I get inside his hut and all I see is sets of large furnaces with all of them being labelled with a boared "Fuel the furnace with a jew". How humble. I go furthur into the digs of his house and find his bedroom. The name of the bed was "Bin Laden's bed". Thereby I knew that the chaser was indeed Bin Laden. I waited in the hut for ten minutes twenty minutes an hour and hour and a half. The moment I had given up hope he showed up. He moved into his hut not knowing that I was there too. Okay I got tired of writing this review. you. The game is dope recommend it 9/11.

review: Rust is a game that can really get your heart pumping whether it's a regular bow fight or running into 5 guys with full armor sets and AKs. Never in my life have I come across a game like this that can do that. You easily find your self binging and grinding this game like a good Netflix series. You'll be going from one stone node to the next and before you know it you'll be building a huge base filled with loot surviving using any means necessary and having tons of laughs along the way. It's such an expansive game that always has room for improvement. Rust is arguably THE best survival game on the market right now and even though there are always a few bugs that you come across along the way it's still a blast to play. For being only $20 it is extremely worth the buy.

review: Independent British company Facepunch Studios has developed a network game Rust based on the Source engine which became famous due to the modification of Garry's Mod. The game was influenced by such projects as Stalker Minecraft and DayZ. The first version became an analogue of DayZ which Facepunch Studios decided to create because of the unreliability of the original. With further development of Rust hunting for animals crafting booking and other useful opportunities appeared.During the game process it is necessary to engage in the extraction of various resources animal skins food boards. The game has a starter set of items and the rest of the things can be created from the mined items or obtained from other players. For example to extract meat you need to kill the animal and to get the boards you need to use an ax or stone to beat the tree.The user must constantly struggle with various difficulties low temperatures hunger attack of people and wild animals radiation. The game has a flexible system for creating items of clothing buildings weapons. Such a system is called kraft or crafting it is quite similar to the games of 7 Days to Die and Minecraft.

review: I hop onto a server. Naked and cold I find mysef on the beach unable to remember my past. I was on a little island with some abandoned buildings of metal plated structure. I scavange around the little island finding some choclate and water. I find another naked human lying on the beach still asleep I thought. I kill the human without second thought and take the stuff she had. This was survival of the fittest.I batter a giant stone with my little stone. Mining it for a while I observe the horizon seeing clear sky Iceburgs snowy mountains. A world for the taking. I go on to batter a tree with my little stone to collect some wood. I craft myself an axe and swim to the main continent. I explore looking to find some form of furnace to smelt my ore I mined. Instead of finding a furnace I find another naked human being. He was alive and chased me with a spear and axe. I ran for my life as he viciously tried to hunt me down. I end up in an abandoned rail staton and I see a ladder to a roof. I climb he nearly got me but I escaped for the moment at least I thought. He wouldn't dare to climb as he knew I would've killed him if he tried to climb up the ladder to the roof of this demolished structure. "HA! That's right!" I shout into the chat (well I type it in). I search the abandoned building for loot. I see a crate. I walk up to it when suddenly a spear stabs me from behind. I got outsmarted. He caught me and gave me a quick death as he stole all my loot. 10/10. I recommend. This game is so much fun.

review: After my pc broke about a week ago I really began to understand what it meant to take something for granted. By this I mean that since 2013 I've been blessed with a game that I would call divine in idea and creation yet I've never written a damn review for said game. The game I speak of is... Nether! JK although Nether would be fantastic if it still had populated servers. Enough about Nether this review is about Rust. Rust is my favorite game in my steam library if not my favorite game played ever. I would consider Rust a second life for the typical gamer. By that I mean when you get really into Rust it will be on your mind at least half the time you're doing other Seriously If you've never been lost in deep thought while making a poop and you want to buy Rust. Some pros and cons I can think of off the top of my head Pros Looks beautiful. I consider Rust one of the prettiest games in my library. Even legacy has its charm IMO (a lot of people think it looks to dark/emo) Decent optimization. One of the most important things about games. Facepunch does it fairly well (at least you're not getting ARK lag) not exceptional but they're getting there. Cheap... Considering the content and lifetime of Rust I would consider the $20 stipend pocket change. Addicting. heroin Pass me the Rust. Rust isn't a game you're going to be forcing yourself to play. Diverse. Like building? Shooting? Melee? Socializing (eew)? Rust has something for everyone. Easy to have fun. DO NOT CONFUSE WITH EASY TO BE GOOD AT. Some of the funnest times I've had in Rust have been seconds after spawning on a server for the first time with nothing to cover my micro a rock in my hand.Cons Hackers. If experimental Rust hadn't usurped legacy as the preferred of the two we could bet that the game would still be overrun with hackers. I'm not saying there are no hackers there are just a lot less. Unpredictable community. Some might say toxic I however prefer 'unpredictable'. I actually love the Rust community as is that said I know people who don't play the game because they get instantly killed by players claiming to be friendly. Expensive. But earlier you said it was cheap what heresy! To be clear I consider $20 cheap for what Rust is now. Back in the days of legacy it was kind of a rip off. That's right Facepunch you dun just got called out. All in all the most fun you'll ever have in Rust let alone any game is when you're with friends. Whether they are covering your six in an adrenaline pumping firefight or singing a song about getting man butt around a campfire friends make Rust as fun as it is. I'll end this review with a shoutout to some of the best people I've ever met whether they be personal friends of mine or other players whom I shared memories with.To Mista and Farty two of my best friends IRL ya'll have been with me since the beginning. To Fireheart one time you said something so memorable about Rust that I turned it into a playlist on Spotify. In the past day we've had four days worth of adventure.To Liam I don't care if you're a redcoat you make memories like a yank.To The old legacy crew It's been ages since our fateful night of murder and yes everyone can hear you Software.To The Gary's Town group I'll admit I wasn't the best tenant but you guys were the best landlords.To The New Rust crew whether it be defending the pub or charging across fields we've had our share of fun and fury.To Everyone I've off you all are the majority congrats? I'm sincerely sorry but that's the game.

review: As of writing this review I have 130.4 hours in game 93.7 of which has been played in the last two weeks. So yes I am new to Rust but as you can tell from how much I've played I fell deep for this godamn game. I didn't like DayZ because I never felt connected with my character I didn't care for the ing massive map that only has stuff in 10% of it and the lack of animals and other players made it feel very spaced out. H1Z1 I have 178 hours in at the time of this review and I'll say that this game takes the survival game cake a thousand times over. It is NOT a better zombie game Rust doesn't allow you to race in a car as well but this game has a much more balanced gun system and bringing a bow to a gunfight the bowman can actually win. The base building is like nothing I have ever seen your character sleeps while you are offline so you can be killed by bears wolves and other players so having a base is actually important and quite easy to make a giant base unlike H1Z1. Rust if you are playing survival will make your heart rip apart losing your newly found pick axe and road sign kilt hurt just as bad as losing and AK and a full set of armor. When the verge of death becomes imminent your heart beats in your chest and you get nervous you don't want to lose what you spent hours collecting and no other survival game has made me feel that way so fast and with such intensity.Buy this game. Support Garry and team who are making Rust they update constantly and push new content out sometimes on the daily. Don't read any other review because I am telling you right now the "risk" you have in your mind right now doesn't need to exist. This game is worth every penny if not more.(average minimum wage in my state 7.25 so inorder for this game to be worth spending money on I want to play more hours than I paid for it. Say a 60 dollar game needs to be enjoying for more than 8 hours inorder for me to be considered worth it. In Rust I have 130.4 hours that means 945.4 dollars if I worked every hour I sank into this game. Which means yeah I didn't get that money but I did get a wonderful feel for such a ing ride.TL DR Bring friends bears suck buy the godamn game play on community servers.

review: Rust is a MASSIVE open world game with plenty to do and is quite realalistic. You start out completly naked (literally) with only a rock and a torch and from there you can build homes/bases raid teamup gather materials and if you can survive the other players long enough even end up creating guns and take over some of the well know "landmarks" such as the dome and light house which exists on every server. I believe this game is an amazing social experiment as well kinda shows how humans would go about if we all just randomly landed somewhere with nothing whatsoever. My only complaint would be that there should be an option for singleplayer. There are many servers out there with little to no players that you could go on to get a similar effect but these servers are still wiped on occasion and sometimes you just want to play RUST without having to worry about losing your base. Another thing to keep in mind is that this game is absolutely gorgeous...if you have the specs for it. It is still an early access game so you do have to keep in mind the optimization on this game is not very good (the reason why they suggest a GTX 980 in their recommended system requirements). I run RUST on a EVGA GTX 970 FTW and with the recent updates I have noticed an improvement in my framerates which normally average at about 57 66 FPS much better than the 30 40 FPS I was normally getting before. I highly suggest this game for anyone who likes FPS and open world games as it combines both genre's perfectly D

review: Rust is a very fun game as long as you dont get mad easily. Theres a variety of different ways that you can play rust including being a down right murderer to a simple explorer hunter or even a slave lord. It much more fun when you play with friends but it is still fine playing alone just dont expect to live for too long. I suggest playing Modded servers with TP (At this point in time) especially when with friends so you can meet up faster. All in all its a great game.Edit I still stand behind my review however as I have seen the game age I cannot say I have the same enthusiasm for the game that I once had. Facepunch and Helk have come a long way with this game but I have the feeling that they have strayed from their original path. 7/10 game.

review: This game...."Have you ever been very mad at a game? Multiply is by 1000 carry the 10 and you still wont reach the amount of rage this game inticapats" (RHINOcrunch)This game is recomended to anyone with a decent PC mine isnt very good but I still enjoy to play it even if i get killed because of lag or my game freezes. They listen to the community and are willing to fix things that seem small for example people were complaining about the grass because it dropped FPS but Garry N. was a bit slow to it didnt believe it dropped FPS. Next update BOOM! You can lower grass quality. Of course its not the most "realistic" game but MANY people enjoy it even my good ol Uncle Rhino said he has over 1000 hours and still finds people who are better smarter than him and gives him reason to improve and find new things to do. In conclusion this game is just a blast to play a need to play if you get this game it will be worth at least a try again it takes alot of patience and some practice to the PVP system since the guns act alot like real ones in which moving side to side makes it alot harder to hit someone and the recoil on them is hard to control. review: Lets see how do i describe Rust... Ah i know... BORING. This is Rust for those of you who haven't played. You run around aimlessly looking and hoping to god you find a bolder wood pile to mine materials off of. Then by the some shear luck you haven't starved to death by getting what you need to build your home and a fire to cook some food (providing you some how got lucky enough to even find some thing to kill to start with for food) you then start to slowly cradt bigger and better things. OH wait no you got killed by a mutated wolf who are every where and you cant kill unless you have crafted a much much better wepon. So back to the begining for you. So after 10 more tries of trying to get back to having a house because you starved to death because you couldn't find any food or materials to do any thing with and you just wasted hours of your life doing nothing. you start you journey to try and craft new and better stuff again . OH wait you got killed by another player back to running around aimlessly for hours on end and starving to death.This game SUCKS. i wish i could get a full refund. i cant believe i payed $20 so i could run around with my thumb up my rear for hours on end not accomplishing any thing because the games spawn ratio on the things you might need are so horrendous. Dont buy it. I should have never listend to my friend onb this one. I should make him pay me $20 for trying to coninnve me to buy this Trash.

review: So after 3.5k hours I'll update the review I did after 2k hours.Rust improves all the time and has come a long way from what it was as both a PVP and survival game its good but challenging... if you are ready for a survival &amp PVP challenge I'd say try this game just beware that part of that survival is encountering other players you can decide how many players you want to encounter by selecting either a high or low population server but either way you'll come across both good and bad experiences... some may try and kill you on sight to take your shiz others might want to talk and be friendly. Prepare for either possibility )I've only played rust for about 2 3 year now but a lot has been added to the game in this time and I haven't checked everything out yet. I will say the game is easier with a friend many people play in groups and it is a very challenging game to play on your own... I spent most of my game hours solo and I enjoy it but it's not easy. Anyways I'd recommend this game if you have time to kill I play on a weak PC and GT 730 and it runs.

review: I really like Rust. Since Minecraft came onto the scene there has been an ever progressing attempt to find the perfect match between graphics gameplay and the open world experience within the surivival game. I've played most of these kinds of games including DayZ and 7 Days to Die.Rust is the definitive title for the crafting survival genre and ultimately in my opinion the pinnacle of the search to create a better survival game. (no I don't count DayZ survival game I see it more as a survival simulator and also at the top of its class).Rust has satiated my desire for survival games enough that I am not interested in others. ARK is good if you want the aspect of animal taming and husbandry.Rust combines the crafting aspects of games like it with the pvp elements of DayZ that make it a fun relatively fast paced race to the top.This game has beautiful scenery without sporting the latest graphics and the experimental version improves on that even more. It's building system is intuitive and "realistic". PvP is terrifying and satisfying at the same time. Players can play how they want whether that means recreating civilization with your friends joining bandit camps with strangers fighting off those damned koreans or living as a hermit on the edge of society.This game is not for everyone. Not everyone can appreciate the glowing light of the master torch or the naked form of the new guy who just spawned.If you're up in the air about this game go watch some youtube videos. If you can finish a video without going "I must see more" or "I gotta have this game" then maybe just wait till it goes on sale or a friend pities you and gifts it.

review: I don't know what to say about this game so here is a recipe for pancakes Ingredients 4tbsp plain flour (about 100g)1 large free range egg½ pint semi skimmed milk + water (about 300ml ¾ milk ¼ water)Pinch of saltButter for fryingHow to make pancakes Sieve the flour and salt into a large bowl and make a well in the mixture.Break in the egg and stir to make a breadcrumby mix.In a jug add 1/3 of a pint of milk and top up with water to make 1/2 a pint (200ml milk 100ml water) this makes a lovely light batter.Add the milk and the water mix bit by bit beating constantly to avoid lumps.Tip *If you have a food processor just throw all the ingredients in and zap until smooth!Pop a large frying pan over a medium heat.Add a large knob of butter (roughly 50g) and melt.Pour the excess butter into a small bowl and reserve it for later.Using a ladle pour a spoonful of the pancake batter into the hot pan and swirl to get a full covering cook for about 1 min each side (it's ready when it's easy to flip over).Serve immediately with sugar and lemon or other exciting toppings. We love cheese and Marmite for an extra British twist! Delicious!!

review: This game is extremely difficult to reccomend for a lot of reasons. It's lack of content is mildly excusable due to the fact that it's still in Alpha however it has major repurcussions throughout most of the other gripes I have with the game. Nevertheless I do enjoy Rust and for the sake of giving Rust a fighting chance I'll cover pros first.First and foremost Rust has a lot of potential to it which is why I chose to reccomend the game. According to the Steam page this game is likely to change dramatically however whatever direction they choose to take Rust seems like it has some serious value to it. The freedom of crafting and building your own structures maintains a pleasant element of variety and the buildings being server dependant allow a different experience between each server. Unfortunately Rust has a long way to go before it can be valued as a reasonable purchase and any purchase in its current state is a gamble. I reccomend it because I feel that the game has taken off to a point where progression to a full fledged fully fleshed out game is imminent.In sharp contrast the game does reek of cons and many of them stem from either the community or the outright lack of content. Progression in Rust is fast and later in the game assuming you survive long enough it rapidly becomes a grind fest to gather wood metal and sulfur to further expand your fort or build weapons and explosives to attack other players (who likely have already gathered these materials for you). Because gathering necessary materials such as food and tools becomes so easy so quickly the game naturally drives you towards killing and raiding other players not out of necessity but out of boredom. The PVE elements of Rust are virtually non existant a mere hour or two into the game as any hostile NPCs such as bears wolves and zombies are easlity taken care of by a shotgun blast and conventional weapons can be found quite literally everywhere. Furthermore this abundance of weapons and ammo often leads to players having weapons but lacking materials such as food causing them to have no choice but to simply kill other players on sight because they need the materials. This vicious cycle often leads to Rust being an outright deathmatch at the game doesn't just lack an incentive not to kill other players it gives encouragement. There's nothing to be gained by sparing other players aside from a better reputation and the loot often outweight the risk and often times you can be killed simply because the player who killed you had nothing better to do aside from chopping hundreds of wood piles.Cons considdered I still reccomend picking up Rust perhaps at a later date. The game has a great potential but it doesn't warrant a $20 purchase unless you thoroughly enjoy a survival/PVP experience with a fast system of progression. The game needs work.

review: Imagine walking 6 hours across a boring grass filled campus to find your friends. You finally meet up with them only to turn around and be shot in the face. Everything you worked on in the process is gone and you have to do it again. This game is filled with so many nerds/hackers/ s that the entire point of the game is ruined. Admins have almighty tools that can up anyone and anything they choose and the huge amount of hackers have those tools also. If you are even lucky enough to live an entire day expect all of your stuff to be gone when you re login. Raids are almost impossible to avoid and if you get raided once all of your stuff you have worked on for X hours is instantly gone. The unbalanced and impossible to aim guns don't help the game either. You can walk up behind a person and point blank shoot them in the head and have the shot not register then have him turn around and shoot you once and you die. If you join a fresh server then your odds of surviving are very highly increased. You can find weapons and ammo and get suited up in about a day. After that you will have nothing to do and kill fresh spawns yourself. Thus the circle of s is complete. Basically the game is broken and the only small chance you have to even live is to join a fresh server and find a gun immediatly. Don't buy. You will be wasting so much time.

review: I want a refund!This game have potential if you look away from all the glitches the constant movement bugs where you get dragged back the major gameplay freezes / lags and the horrible oh SO horrible community.Though most of this is to be expected with an alpha the antihack / anticheat has seemingly not been fully implemented yet and you'll for most of the time be finding yourself face to face with an unstoppable 9 year old that found hacks on youtube.Speedhacks jumphacks and ESPtools (location tools) are very commonly used by hackers and there might be others that I don't know.At this point you might think "This wont affect me" "We got admins on our servers" etc. Private servers may have admins and they might advertize "no hackers". Keep in mind though since the antihack tools are this limited finding the actual hacker among a community of players on the server is as hard as a needle in a heystack even for an admin. Admins are not magic people chosen with psychic powers to find cheaters and for the most part they will show up too late or ban the wrong player.I thought the hackers wouldn't affect me that much so I went on a public server. Never..ever...ever go on a public server. There's no admins which means even if you got the hackers name and got video proof all you can do is send a report on their userprofile and hope for the best and my best guess is as long as they only got a few complaints nobody will look into it anyway.Yesterday me and a buddy got to my house and were getting ready to raid someones base. We were standing there all psyched up and had made ourselves an explosive charge each. For those unfamiliar with the game an explosive charge can take down walls and this is a really expensive thing to make.We leave my house and just as we head out suicide. We get back suicide again and again and again.A hacker went ahead and kept on suiciding us to take our items and even if they dont target us spesifically everyone in the general area will die from "suicide".This keeps happening from hackers who seemingly doesn't even want anything from you you just die over and over and over again.I cannot stress this enough this is the first game that's made me feel cheated after buying it. Do not make the same mistake I did don't buy this game.

review: This game makes you feel like you NEED to survive at all cost if you have a house already but if you're naked with a rock you won't mind dying so much that's why there's are alot of caveman like players running around trying to kill you. I'd say there's a 20% friendly and 80% SOS (shoot on sight) players in the game. It gets very frustating when you work so hard and then lose everything you worked for because of some who wanted your loot. For a survival game it is very fun the sound is very good game mechanics are a little wonky but it's in alpha so idc. I hear alot of people complaning about hackers but i've never encountered one so i think it depends on the server you are playing on. What i love the most about this game is the sounds it haves like footsteps gun shoots plane right above you behind you left and right everything. I've excaped some trouble some encounters just by running behind some rocks/mountains and just wait to hear their footsteps pass through and it feels so movie like it's amazing and very fun. 9/10 For a survival game IMO.

And the hit box on weapons is accurate.A difficult thing untill you get use to it is aiming the bow.Im not sure of all the things you can and might be able to craft but at the moment the game is really looking promising.Would highly reccomend.

review: Rust seems to be the douchbag game of the year if you are a you are most likly playing this game. The game is in an early alpha state a state where the creators like to whine and make excuses for the lack of updates. This game has a nice Fanboy base too so be prepaired to be attacked and berated is you dont say nice things or praise this game and instead decide to give your honest opinion on your experiance of Rust. Now with that said Rust has a lot to offer and can be a great game. I have over 300 hours in this game and can see its potential. It can be very addictive and mindlessly numbing to go out gather reseources and build a home for yourself. If you are an admin or server owner expect people to and cry about abuse if you play the game as well and seem to to do well. review: This game is perfect. I love the simplicity of it. It's still in alpha so bugs are expected. I have not seen any bugs so far except for server lag. Yes they have minor things to adjust like how someone else holds a rock like a pistol or how you can only get Raw Chicken Breasts no matter what animal you kill. I love this game. I hope they keep the simplicity of it but add a lot more features. I give this game a 10/10 because even though it's in alpha it's still one of the most enjoyable games on Steam. I was hesitant on buying it for $20 while it's still in alpha but it was worth every penny. You can do so much already. You can craft bows weapons and even walls to build houses. You can choose to hunt and gather food while your friends scavenge for supplies. You can get a team or survive solo against other players zombies and wildlife. The first few in game days are pretty difficult. My problem was that I had no idea how to find stone but I found someone that was able to help. This game is worth it. Every penny. GET IT.

review: This game is tribalism to the extreme. If you ever wondered what is what like to be a prehistoric man (with modern weapons buildings and other gadgets) then this is for you. If you are the blue shirt clan chances are you're going to have to blow the brains out of everyone who isn't wearing a blue shirt. 95% of interactions you will have with other human beings will result in your death their death or both.Rust is a game that is truly ahead of it's time in many regards. It's the only game I've ever played that consistently and frequently gave me goose bumps and made my heart race. It's the only game I've ever played that has made me feel genuine fear has made me feel genuine cameraderie between me and my partners has allowed me to feel anger remorse guilt accomplishment and many others. Rust is ahead of it's time because you are so pulled into the game. It's amazing.However the feeling you feel most is dread. Unless you have a large tight knit clan you will be killed you will be raided and you will be humilitated. The game is a ton of fun but it is also an enormous irritation. This is a true survival game. You will be killed by wildlife the elements and most frequently of all other players. There is nothing you can do to prevent this. At some point and more than likely several dozen points you will lose everything. You will inevitably lose hours of hard work to some guy who just wanted to kill you and destroy all of your things for his entertainment. I have had my house stolen from me yes my house innumerable times.Here is my warning. This game is incredibly fun but it is also the most irritating game I have ever played in my entire life. Think long and hard before you get this game. It is not easy to play. There are no holds barred. You will be killed. You will rage quit. You will lose hours of your time and gain nothing. If you think you can bare all of that it is also one of the most entertaining games I have ever played.

Dont believe a word anyone tells you in game they could be trying to trick you into revealing your base or showing yourself for a kill.3. unless your confident your base is hard to raid dont run directly to it take as roundabout route and watch your back.4. Expect to die/get killed a lot and to loose everyhting you carry.5. If you get frustrated or are easily annoyed then this games not for you.last but not least have fun.

review: Excellent game.The idea of this is similar to DayZ style games you need to collect things to survive as well as deal with other players around you these players may be friendly or hostile. You need to build a shelter with a sleeping bag in it to store your things and respawn to a familiar place when you die. These shelters can be as big or small as you like. The game is best played with friends so you can defend from hostile players gather supplies raid areas etc as a group.The game mechanics are great and the ideas are great and when its all working it plays great. But over the last few weeks french hackers have been lauching constant DDOS attacks on all public servers. These are incredibly annying causing the game to be unplayable for 30 seconds a minute per attack. These are being worked on and a patch went out last night that seems to have blocked the attacks. Along with the above issue my only complaints with the game is that the menu's are incredibly buggy if I enter the menu while playing to adjust the (very few) avalible settings that you can acess without the command line I will be stuck in the menu for at least 30 seconds leaving me open to hostile players zombies and wolves. The game also crashes more than I would like (once every few hours). These issues are to be expected of an Alpha though.I love this game and I heartily reccomend it.

review: This game is fantastic sadly it is better than many 'complete' games. This is what a sandbox game should be survival crafting resource gathering and running around naked with a rock from a guy with an M4 who has no reason whatsoever to kill you. This game is lacking in a few departments lack of enemies (only current are wildlife and bandits) less than modern graphics (which is completely okay with me considering I can barely run the game on low settings anyway). There are tons of irritating bugs like with the most recent update hitting a rock can kill you (guess they're one of the other enemies?lol). You will find yourself spending alot of time searching for resources places to build your humble abode away from prying eyes a nd of course exploring. Currently there is no real goal to the game nor do I expect there to be other than surviving most of everything to explore is next to the road (only one road relatively small map takes one game day to travel it all with stops for looting) and there isn't to much to explore to begin with. The game seems to reward people who have no life and play all day every day considering if you log off your body usually remains there for other players to kill and loot. I'm not to fond of this feature but understand why it was implemented. This is one of my favorite games at the moment and even though it can be slow paced at times and repetitive It is still enjoyable when you're not getting shot by someone who has way better gear than you for no reason (or killed by mining stone). The community in this game is USUALLY friendly i've encountered more friendlies than bandits on small servers (meaning a max of 15 players) This game is worth the 20$ I spent on it which is incredible since it's still in alpha.
title: Rust

review: Well I will be honest and say at first I was not to sure to buy this game. Early access scares me at times I've mad a fair few wrong decisions in the past. Rust from what I understood was a Dayz clone which shouldnt be held against it. I wasnt to sure how well this game will do in terms of keeping myself intrested.As I am writing this I believe i have nearly spent 7 10 hours in game on a single medium populated server (which i suggest finding one to start off learn the basics etc). At first I found it annoying I wasnt to sure what to do (no in game help but its in Alpha so i didnt expect any different) I spent alot of time hitting a stone against the large rock formations hoping to get the stone resources I needed to create axes and so on. However once you start to find your feet with the game you are up and running. I enjoyed the survival element of the game at first I stayed away from anything that moved even the wild boar. Once i got used to the wild life zombies and half naked people running around just like myself i started to really enjoy the game. Once you arm yourself with either a bow or a pistol it is time to run for those radioactive buildings and find some taste loot. On top of looking for loot by either killing zombies or searching through randomly spawned boxes a real neat feature that is in the current build is supply drops. From my understanding every hour or so a plane will fly over the map and drop several boxes of loot. This is very enjoyable more than I thought. The rush to beat other people to the drop to then meet face to face with another person brings a fair few challenges. However great.Lastly the player building. At first I wasnt to sure how this would go I wasnt to sure how important a 'house' was in terms of game play. After playing for several hours it comes apparnt that it is needed hell its your base of operations your fort your life line. So when it comes down to creating a structure to keep the enemy at bay I wasnt to sure how well this feature will be implimented. Again this is Alpha so I knew it wasnt going to be polished and very basic but saying that I was amazed at how well it works. Yes it is basic this is no Sims house creation but at its current build it has everything you need plus more.I will edit this over the Xmas period if I have more time to play the game. I will recommend this game to anyone as I have had a blast with it. I do hope updates and added features come into the game soon. I look forward to see how Rust holds up in terms of development with such games as Dayz but one thing is for sure this game has great promise. I wish the Devs all the luck with this game this could be a gem.
title: Rust

review: The key to winning in this game is to be completely cold hearted and patient. Moving in the dark is your best chance to aquire resources without being killed. Trust no one at all reguardless what they say. This game is a complete dog eat dog scenario. When you log out your character stays in the game so be sure to have a nice house to keep him safe. Since your house can be raided at any time even when your away. This is litterily the hardest survival game currently out However...Rust since release has gone through a complete overhaul of the old engine. This in turn has dramatically delayed the progression of the official release and has caused a flood of bugs that have made this game pretty unstable. Yet another example of developers getting too much money from alpha builds and deciding to stick it to the community. I recommend waiting a good year before even thinking about buying this game.

review: This game can be seperated in to 5 steps.These steps are from the beginingStep 1. Freshspawn farming When you first spawn in to the game you got nothing else than your rock some bandages and torch. You will need to set a base of operations in well hidden location and hope that noone will find it before you can fortify it to be safe enough to store goods. You will hit tons of wood piles and rocks with your rock to get enough stuff to make your first base. Process that is slowed by other players that will shoot you in hopes of getting your precious rock and some wood that you might have despite the fact that you just spawned.Step 2. Building the base and blueprint farmingOnce you have eonugh resources to build up your base and get a metal door for your hut so that not every noob in the region can raid your resources. This is the point when you will craft your bow and go farm some bears and wolfs covered in perioid and run through radiated towns in hopes of finding good loot boxes with blueprints or weapons. Your main goal at this point is to get research kits blueprins and weapons. And again the process is slowed a lot by your friendly neighbors with guns who want to kill you just for the sake of killing.Step 3. Gearing up and fortificationsAfter you find good weapons and make sure you can craft more of them(Really important! You will lose your weapons but you will never lose the knowledge how to make them!). You will need to make tons of ammo kevlars and guns and fortify your base better with some spikes or making a new metal base whatever floats your boat. Step 4. Raiding and killing .. and meeting the hackersYou have come a long way and it is now your time to hunt some newb meat and get easy materials from them. Or craft some explosive charges and go raid someones base. It is time for some pvp action. Sadly this is also the point where you will most likely start meeting a lot of hackers. More ballsy ones will be using stuff like speedhacks high jumps and flying. More subtle once will use nospreads and aimbots. The game is absolutely riddled with hackers.Step 5. Losing it allEventualy will come the time when your base is raided and you lose it all. Doesnt matter if it was by legit door bombing or by hackers. You are at point zero again and must start anew. Only good thing is that you still have all your blueprints. And if you had the foresight to hide some stuff and/or make a secondary base you might still have some gear up your sleeves.In the end this game is just massive grind and farm fest with occasional shootouts and ton of hackers running around. If you like grinding building and farming while your stuff are perioidicaly raided and destroyed. This is a game for you.

review: I am glad steam allows refunds!!!I got this game coz i thought it would be fun to play...It isn't...here what i have done in this game.1 when i started the game i had no friends and no help at all.i spend my time gathering stuff to build my home.when i had some items i was tired and i closed the game.when i got back into the game i found out that the game is placing my character in a sleeping position when i was offline so i was an ez target to everyone and i was killed and i lost all my progress!2 i started again trying to gather some materials i made a spear and i was ready to hunt some animals But the animals in this game can climb walls or go through some walls or rocks and they also have the powers of teleportation i dont know where they got this technology... some of theanimals are ninjas doing parkour... so my hunt didnt go that well... But it was funny to watch...(i died falling off a clif trying to get one deer).(and thats the only fun that i had in this game)3 i spawned close to my body so i didnt lost anything except the weapon that i was holding which it was in in the air for some reason then i cooked all the food that i hadand i died from a burned food... review: Chest our neighbor from down the road warned us of the incoming invasion. As they ran by his house the admin had told him that he had 7 people coming. Seven! I thought there was no way it was going to be more than 4. Tobit kept tabs on the parameter keeping an eye out for our first sighting. Meanwhile me and Dream began preping in our houses. Chest had made his way to the gate. The raiders opened fire on Chest but Dream came out and retrieved him hiding him away in the house. Now we're all posted up in our houses. Two of them blow through our forward gate and move behind a shack for cover. We start trading fire from our houses for a while but eventually all 7 raiders rush to Dream's house and quickly blow in the 1st floor. Bad move. Of all our houses Dream's is the most akin to a labyrinth. Over the next 2 hours they clawed their way through Dream's house. Tobit sniped through windows until the bandits put barriers in front of the windows after a couple close calls. I tried to sneak behind them but I got lost in Dream's house and spotted. After I was gunned down I respawned in my house grabbed my spare m4 and headed to my roof to fire at them through some of the windows on my side of Dream's house. During one of the bandit rushes on the rooms Chest gets picked off but Dream manages to slip deeper into his house. The raid goes on for so long several members of the raid begin to complain and want to just leave despite not looting anything of value. When we caught wind that they might be leaving Tobit set up right outside of Dream's house. They were out of c4 and sick of using grenades so they finally began funneling out of the house. It was pitch black as they left and they weren't expecting a sudden hail of shotgun rounds from Tobit.When the dust cleared 3 bodies laid at the bottom of dream's house (1 from the spike walls 2 from Tobit's gunfire). 3 in the house (Me Chest and a raider who had commited suicide). We made out really well and are now finished up a new metal building for us to all hold up in during huge raids again. This game is awesome.
title: Rust

review: I do not know what to say for this game. I have over 700 hours played on here and some of them were amazing times with friends. Other times i never wanted to play the game again. When i first bought this game it was way back after zombies were taken out of the game (i got this like a few days after). The zombies were so fun and people were complianing that they should add them back. Thid made me question the developers on weather they were really doing what the people wanted. But because i still just recently bought the game i continued to play and enjoy is. I started off with my friend and we didnt know any of the controls. It was hilarious having naked sex parties and jumping into the ocean for fun. Then we kearned a bit more and we started destroying everyone. About 3 months after i bought the game i heard that they were redoing rust and this new experimental thing kept popping up. I started getting mad. I paid $20 for Rust. Not Rust Experimental. Im talking about the good old rust. The one where there were so many glitches that it made the game fun. Now rust is a joke. I refuse to play the new rust because it is SUPR slow you die nearly instantly and the graphics are They dont even look real. Its just plain out dumb to mr that the developers wasted their time to make a game where half pf the rust community doesnt like. I love the old rust and continue to play it. But the number of hackers is driving me away. That is the nly problem with the old rust. It has an overabundance of hackers and you can barely get anything done becaue you wither get killed by massive groups or killed by hackers. I want to try the new rust but it has made a terrible impression on me so far. Hopefully the devs can see that the "new and improved" is a joke and a major mistake.

review: This game had a randomness to it that was charming. It was a rags to riches story sometimes. Playing day one on the old BP system and getting a rocket and a rocket launcher gave you options. Now getting to a weapon or armorded doors is a fantasy that casual players only see in their dreams or hallucinations because there is no way a for them to get them in the first two weeks. (Unless they have nothing else to do with 20 30 plus hours between wipe cycles)(Yes once you level up you will have to grind to level again if and when it wipes) The new xp system rewards soul crushing farming and makes the game feel like a second job.If you would have asked me to support this game pre xp patch I would gladly have done so. The old bp system kept the game random so you had a different game experience every wipe. Did it have its problems? Yes. But was changing the the randomness that was unique to this a bad idea? Yes. TLDR If you like to grind endlessly and pay to have a second job then this game is for you. If you are a casual player that does not want to grind like you are playing an MMORPG then I would not recommend this to you.

review: Rust has potential to be an amazing game. The crafting and building mechanics are excellent build a modest log cabin or hilltop castle with gun ports and code locked doors. Hunt animals for cloth meat bone and fat (used as fuel). The fact that there are friendly and unfriendly players is what really makes the game. Running around gathering resources finding rare loot and sprinting back to your newly built house is intense because at any point a player hunter could burst out of the woods and chase you down. It is these moments these random encounters that get your heart racing and coming back for more.Unfortunately there are too many hackers. I got Rust about a week ago right after a fresh server wipe all buildings characters and acquired blueprints are erased. This means everyone starts at square 1. Some buddies and i hopped on a server post wipe and built a decent castle. We all died several times during the construction of our base no problem that's what Rust is about survival. You mine hunt build defend die learn from your mistakes rinse and repeat.I log on this morning to scope out the Rust world my castle is looted. I inspect every brick no damage. I check all code lock doors no damage and no entry. How did it get raided you ask? Hackers used a third party progam (still available check youtube for a video) to fly into my castle and bypass my doors. until the hacks are gone i see no point in playing.Had i logged on and seen our castle destroyed it would mean we were raided with c4 which is cool as hell and part of the game. No qualms about true raiders seiging houses and castles without raiders there is no eminent danger and no andrenline rush. But knowing our castle was compromised because of cheaters? Sigh why would i play until the cheaters are gone?Because of the rampant cheaters flying around using map hacks door hacks and other cheats currently I would not recommend Rust. I am however excited to play when the final version is released and the cheats are (hopefully) removed from the game.
title: Rust

review: The concept is great... but how old is this thing? 3 years? And still in alpha... what a shame.They started it over about a year ago but some VERY VERY annoying bugs are still there such as Items falling under the ground. Mobs inside rocks (or sometimes even under the ground). This is annoying especially when you get killed by an invisible bear.Also cheaters. Yeah let's talk about cheaters The game was made with unity so its code is written in C# which means you can easily understand the way it works. So of course it doesn't require much time to write let's say a simple wallhack. And because garry is a terrible coder who likes to make fun of its clients and who's only interested in your wallet he bought a virus called Easy Anti Cheat (certainly very cheap).Why virus? Well... the way it works is simple it randomly takes screenshots of your game (+ the steam overlay private chat with your friends) and uploads it (you can see some public screenshots at eac dot krond dot org). Wow! Amazing! The thing is it doesn't even work! I've heard many complains about cheaters but never really believed these until one day I came back home joined the server and saw my storage room empty. How did they get in? They blew up a SINGLE metal wall the one that leads to this storage room.... so yea wallhack.If you plan to play on a private server with friends you trust (and who are unlikely to use cheats) then go for it. Otherwise well... prepare for unforseen consequences.
title: Rust

review: I've been playing this game a little over 3 weeks now and I've experienced the same thing over and over again At the beginning of my journey goof around gather resources kill and be killed until eventually I build a fortress and gather many firearms. It is at this exact point where hackers ruin everything. They go for the most powerful influence on the server and they kill him everytime he leaves his house everytime he logs on basically. This game is NOT ready to be released AT ALL due to hackers on every single server. I have not encountered one server where I haven't been bothered over and over again by low lifes who download a cheat engine and ruin everything. It may seem fun for a while but the irritation and the frustration eventually overrule the fun you get out of it. I quit because of this it's just not worth playing anymore. Sometimes I would be inspired and think "wow wouldn't it be cool to have a huge base and rule the town?" Well I end up doing just that. As soon as I get to that point though hackers screw me over endlessly. They just love ruining the world don't they?

review: I have a mixed feeling about this game but Rust is an okay game. The community bad just like the Counter Strike Global Offensive community but that's necessarily all that I can find wrong with it other than the rest of my Cons I have down. I'll go over a list of pros and cons in my own opinion.PROs The type of guns we can use (could use more but what is in the game is good enough) Blueprints and building Graphics are good but the constant random lag every once in a while made me lower them The idea of clans "Open world" (except not open world but big maps An okay survival type genre of a game Modded servers (better than vanilla in my opinion depending on what server it is).CONS Early Access (the game is never going to exit early access) Downed system (You never know if the person who shoots you down is going to help you back up or pick you back up then just kill you again so it's a failed system to me) Lag every once in a while at random (either my server or my internet acting up though.) Server maps reset work is never saved so that brings me to being bored of playing the game a lot. Community is horrible except for on some servers due to the fact that people who play CS GO come to the Rust community.Also if you're new to the game I recommend a lower populated server below 75. That brings the most fun in my opinion so you don't die every second in a 200 300 player server. I'll recommend the game but just stay away from big servers for new players unless you have at least 5 friends with you and some of you are good at the game.

review: *I have to re write the review due to it sucking a lot*Rust. Yeah you know that one game where chicken is everything. Yeah. It's actually a pretty good game. People have complained of being spawn killed and killed and killed and killed. But there are some servers that the community makes and official servers that allow it so that players can have no means of killing you. Unless if you're a sleeper then someone could kill you from then. (I don't know how people do the sleeper thing so don't ask) This game is simple for the most part and it keeps you wanting to play it until well you get mauled by a radiated bear and done with it. Anyways as I said the survival is pretty simple. You just need a fire a house and that's it for the first day. And some food. On the non PvP servers the players are pretty nice because they're most likley victims of constantly being spawn camped and just want to help the new players. A couple of things that could meet improvement in this game 1 Player's hunger and animal spawnPretty self explanitory if you played Rust. But if you haven't well here you go. When you spawn in Rust you have pretty low hunger that goes down pretty fast. And to top that off you're most likley not going to spawn with some animals. Probably a bear or a wolf is the closest thing you could get as food. If you kill it with a rock that is. 2 AirdropsAirdrops are pretty good for the most part. But I'm only speaking for the PvP included servers. Most of them have a 'frequent airdrops' mod on it so it'll make planes fly by more than usual. The planes usually have things such as guns guns and guns. On the PvP included servers imagine how that'll be. Ten airdrops a day including a gun for everyone to kill each other. That's a problem if you ask me.3 LagI really don't know if it's my graphics card that isn't good or my internet connecting to other server that sucks or maybe both. Even if you're on a close by server (East coast for example) you could still get into a lot of lag and glitches. I'm not saying that you won't be able to move due to lag I'm just saying that every once in a while there's unnecassary lag. I know it happens to all games but Rust has a bit more than most games.That's pretty all of the things I think that need improvement. The good things about Rust is basicly well everything else. The players are generaly nice on most servers the survival aspects are pretty good for the three basic things RADs Hunger and Health. If I were to rate this game I would give it a 7/10. It's a pretty good time waster and it makes you want to play the game more. I really like this game but if the improvements are met I would give it a higher rating. I hope this helps.
title: Rust

It's annoying and completely kills the game in the pvp servers (where you can kill other players). I would accept a few maybe but it's getting to the point where if you don't cheat you can't survive. Complete crap. Until they fix the bugs and potential hacks it's not worth spending hours building up a residence and getting things together just to get blown away by some dork who's hacked the crap out of the game.

review: This game is multiplayer. It's incredible how many people seem to forget that while playing. Rust is the first and only survival game I've ever played. It was hard at first adjusting to the new gameplay along with the glitches I had to learn through but now it's one of my most played games. I've made a ton of friends and haven't been this entertained by a game like this for years. You have to either have friends to play with or be prepared to play at a disadvantage. But one of the best things about this game is that even if you start out solo you can make friends and alliances and as long as you dedicate time to the game you'll do just fine. Hackers are still a bit of a problem though just about any game will have hackers. And if you rage or get salty easily or have issues with losing things this may not be the game for you. One of the most difficult things to get used to is when you die unless you can get back to your body and loot it then your is gone. You learn by losing you learn by being killed and getting raided and glitches killing you. The best way you're gonna learn is by mistake so get ready for some infuriating moments just remember it's still in alpha. Though one thing this game does really well is player interaction. While a lot of people will run around and just kill people or just farm and hide in base don't be surprised if a group of nakeds run up to you and start screaming for their gods to smite the armored one. Or if you're trying to raid a base and the defenders end up being able to do nothing but throw grenades out the window and chant for the greak Helk to save them. The player interaction in this game is unlike any other game I've ever played it's amazing to see how people react to others in relaxed and extreme circumstances. If you can play a game without raging at every loss and learn to adapt then I absolutely reccomend this game.
title: Rust

review: So lets weigh the pros and cons Rust is a game that has a really responsive Dev group Facepunch studios. They update the game bi weekly and show future progress and ideas on their blog as well as concept art. The creators really do enjoy the idea of this game and try to show how they really want it to be playable and enjoyable for all. The ingame UI is very well designed and the feel of the enviroments is always getting better with each passing update. The theme is wonderful and the design/style of homemade hobo type weapons is so cool. On the con side of things my main concern is that there is not real way right now to "harness" the community. Sometimes youll meet genuinely nice people who actually enjoy playing the game and working together if this happens the game will be quite fun. But that is rare usually youll find s and sadists who have elaborate plans to make you feel like when they finally kill you. The game devs have been trying to make it so people will try to work together but nothing so far has helped. Without something to draw people together currently the game becomes a like hunger games. People kill on sight just because they can trust me even if you surrender or pose no threat you will be killed. People would rather rush weapons and kill the unarmed and naked then work together and become advanced.TL DRYou should support Facepunch Studios they are great the game is great and the idea is great and i can see the game getting better in the future. But right now the community is cancerous and filled with people who use the game as an excuse to torture and bully others with no repercussions.
title: Rust
