review: Personally I love the game with all its constant updates procedural maps crafting and building. This game is what a survival game should be. Start with nothing and build your way to the top. Though the player base is about %90 12 year olds who decide that there only way to enjoy the game is to watch you suffer as they repetidly shoot your naked body to pieces. This said Rust has one of THE most TOXIC communities out there.Base building is fun though there are still a few placement bugs but that can be understood as it is still in early access. Joining up with your firends is one of the best things to do in the game theres nothing like building a huge base together and then watch as it is dstroyed in front of your on eyes by yet another bunch of savage kids who think that this game is only for ing people over.I would definately recommend this game to anyone who wants a great survival game. With all this said I HAVE NEVER met a community so TOXIC and savavge. If u see someone nice dont kill them. create a community that you want not have.
title: Rust

review: I played this game when it was initially added to EAG. It was fun but it needed work. So here I am some time later at least a year later because the game has been getting some new content released (via playthroughs) and it sparked my reinterested to see what had changed.I found out a female model was added thats great. I was initially confused that I wasn't offerred a chance to choose my gender on spawn. Turns out I ended up being a female so I went ahead and just continued on playing under the assumption that it was a random spawn thing.A few hours later and many respawns later I come to learn from another player that its tied to your Steam ID and THERE IS NOTHING YOU CAN DO ABOUT IT. I know some people don't mind playing female characters or whatever but I'm not one of those people. It ruins my immersion regardless of how little people claim it effects the gameplay. As I have now become aware of how it works and the sheer stupidity of it as a mechanic I'm going to be pursuing a refund on this purchase. Its absolutely ridiculous to me that they would force this decision upon people and they don't appear to be concerned about changing their course of action.Games these days SHOULD NOT be gender locked ever. Black Desert Online was partially bad BECAUSE so much of the classes were gender locked and I refused to play it for this reason as well. This game has somehow taken it a step further by FORCING a gender upon you based on something outside of your control and giving you absolutely no ability to change it.Therefore I'm not going to recommended this game any longer. I wanted to get a few of my friends interested in purchasing it and giving it a go with all the new gameplay/mechanics but that will no longer be happening.I sincerely hope the developers take the time to truly think over how irrational of a decision this was and will revert the change or offer some way to swap or I can't image myself trusting any of their game decisions in the future.
title: Rust

review: First I want to say that there is some what potential to this game.But the lack of care by the developers make it a really S***ty game. There are so many random hackers that you will encounter just being on the server. No matter where you are as long as there is a hacker in the same "town" or "forest" you will be instantly dead. It says you killed yourself but it is actually the hacker.Another issue if you play on any of the non PvE servers you will be killed on sight regardless of being online or offline. When you go offline your character's "body" drops on the floor and is open to be killed by other players. So lets say you play on PvP and you decide to log off cause you have a life and better s**t to do than to play this s***ty game. Even if you decide to barricade yourself in a nice warm house you are open for the world for other players to come r*pe your sleeping body and take all your possessions.Also the respawn rate of minerals and animals (and the rest of materials) are really slow that essentially you are f**ked. No maps or any form of directions in game also will kill you. You make a house? Yeah Good Luck trying to find that (the only way is either you run around the entire map for couple hours to try to find it without dying or if you somehow manage to get a sleeping back to spawn in your house after death (there is a cooldown time on how often you can rez at your house).Essentially I was right to think of not buying it and if it was possible to get a refund I would totally do it. Don't trust your friends who tell you to play this game they are just doing it cause they know its a s***ty game but they just want to dupe you too and/or just are stupid enough to believe that having other people on with them would make it better.

Then we had enough and marched over to their hideout that had been rebuilt by themselves we had asked them to come out slowly one man started telling us to back off and leave the area we had to refuse and we would stay put after arguing with this man we had fallen into a trap they had been hiding in the nearby mountains with assult rifles leaving that one guy as bait for us after one comrade fell it all transformed into a frenzy of killing from their base to the mountains bullets were everywhere. After a long and tense firefight it had all ended we had ended them once and for all. We went back to base to celebrate and eat chicken throughout the night. Sadly i had never kept in contact with them never to be found again.Amazing game creative and fun can't wait until they add more into it. 10/10

review: Product received for free. As survival games go Rust is pretty standard. Open world exploration base building PvP and PvE with other worldly dangers to worry about. There are some pretty neat features in Rust however that make the game stand out from some other entries in the genre.First of all I'm going to discuss how difficult Rust can be. Often and especially on official servers other people will be geared up and most people practice a kill on sight attitude regardless of your danger to them. In a game like this where you spawn with absolutely nothing getting shot at like that can be painful.Second I'm going to talk about the performance. It's difficult for me to run the game (Core2 Quad GTX660) on low settings but my friends (with a 970 and another with 970 SLI) have no trouble and hit 60+ FPS in all areas. It helps to turn down render distances and turning down settings dependent on location (outdoors indoors etc.) can help as there are multiple levels of quality for different areas of video settings.Third will be some gameplay. I think where Rust differs from other survival games is a) the interesting character generation b) the recipe discovery and c) the atmosphere. Ahh character generation. If you've already played Rust you've probably realized that you spawn completely naked. I believe it's censored by default but what fun is that? ) The character is generated in a way that you are given a gender and based on that gender you are generated that gender's genitalia and the sizes are pretty much randomized. So yes you can compare virtual with your friends. Recipe discovery is pretty interesting in Rust. If you've ever played H1Z1 you probably know that you discover recipes by throwing random junk into a discovery window and hope that you can make what you were hoping to discover. Rust on the other hand is a little bit different. You find fragments of blueprints on the map and combine them into larger blueprints to in turn discover recipes. The atmosphere of Rust is really unique. A lot of games have obvious backgrounds. Once again using H1Z1 you can tell what happened the H1Z1 virus came up and killed 99.99% of people and they became zombies. With Rust however it's confusing. It takes place in an apocalyptic stage of course but you can tell it's modern due to the presence of nuclear reactors and firearms. Speaking of firearms they lend to the atmosphere. They're mostly makeshift with parts from household items attached to build the body of the various guns in the game. It gives the game a vibe like Mad Max. Another thing there are airdrops from big C 130 type planes and even map wide attacks via Blackhawk helicopters. Why this occurs nobody can say for sure but it's eerie that these machines operate in the apocalypse like that. Overall Rust is a somewhat different experience from other survival games expecially open world ones. It's not particularly expensive and it has a great developer working on it. There are updates almost every week including updates inspired by community wants and needs. The game's unique atmosphere endless playability and this great community developer connection make it a great buy.
title: Rust

review: I've had some friends try to discourage me on buying this game but i recently bought it and to my surprise it's actually pretty fun. Sure there are some minor server lags but this is Early Access so i don't expect it to be perfect. There are some ideas i have that i'm going to post to the suggestions webpage that i believe will make the gameplay a bit better but all in all it's actually pretty fun. Sure you may die and lose your items but if you can get in with a good group it won't take you long at all to get your items back. I got killed by a dark zombie in the game wasn't able to get back and pick my stuff up in time. I was on the server with a friend that knows quite a bit of what he's doing on Rust and it wasn't long till i was back up and going. So atm i give it a 7/10 for an Early Access 7/10 is pretty damned good!

review: Ah rust what can i say about you? Besides the fact that its an amazing open world game even though its still in alpha. My favorite thing to do on a PvE server is to ya know build a community of other players and work together to help fresh spawns and hunt. I don't play PvP that much but when i do you can mostly find me building my house somewhere where no one will think to look and defending from raiders when they do find me. Now to talk a little about PvE. As a fresh spawn in rust you are put out in the middle of nowhere with your trusty rock torch and a couple of bandages to patch yourself up. The first thing that i think to do is to find split rad town and see if anybody is living nearby (bear in mind this is PvE). Afterwards just to gather some wood and metal ore get a furnace going and set up a small "hermit hut." As for the PvP. My first thought is "get as far away from this area as possible" if i spawn near split rad or hangar. Most people in my experience build near those 2 spots. So i usually run way the hell off the map or go way up high on a mountain range or something. Before being shot at multiple times from all directions i can get a few wood piles and rocks but as soon as i hear (or most of the times get hit) by a bullet i haul and don't look back. At least until i have a gun i *try* to defend myself against the normal 2v1 me being the 1. All in all i would give this game an 8/10. Not because it doesn't deserve a 10/10 i just want to see where the devs go with it. Hopefully it doesn't turn into one of those horrid games no one likes. And they bring back zombies.
title: Rust

review: Personally I love this game. I have given it only 8/10 for several reasons though which I will list below. There is a huge learning curve that accompanies this game for the first hour or so you may be completely confused on how to play but that is the same with most games. If you do figure out how to get started quickly it can take you maybe 30 minutes to get well established with a house etc. This game is very dependent on a number of factors including server friends and overall attitude. Some servers that you get on in the game have more hackers than others as indicated below. It is sometimes a challenge to find a server with good staffing and admins but once you do this problem is almost non existent. If you continue to have issues with it do some research to find a good server and try to befriend an admin or two so you know when they are on. This game is also very heavily group based. If you find yourself a good set of friends to play with it deters a lot of people from attacking you as well as making starting off easier. Try to find some people to play with and your game play will increase tenfold. I also put attitude here because you have to be okay with dying. If you have a problem with that it's not the game for you. People try to kill you. That's it. The game is kill or be killed or hide long enough to get settled. If you cannot get started easily try to find a friend or two to play with and it makes dying not as unbearable. Also the friendlier you are to others the friendlier they will be back to you (usually) with this in mind you can make allies and trade with others but it all depends on what your mindset in game is.

review: Rust is in early access since... a long time ago. Though it deserves appreciations as much (maybe even more) than any survival game.As a personal note of appreciation which I'll try to explain below I've been given this game by a friend and haven't been disappointed. At all.First of all Rust is a game where you HAVE to survive. The idea is to get and craft easy stuff then sort of upgrade it.You literally spawn naked with a rock and torch and... got no idea about what you do the first time (and usually more than just the first time).Pros you have all liberties and decide what you do always the world's space is only limited by the number of servers you play on leaving the game equals going to sleep the craft mechanics and the graphics are realistic seriously Cons long time players are really annoying you usually get killed from far by a guy with a rifle when the server has lots of players a bad graphic card lets you play the game but may make your gaming experience bad sleeping bags EVERYWHERE ConclusionEven in early access for Rust paying full price is worth playing full time.Just find how to play best on a full server ? ... or on an empty server ?

This game is true hardcare decption based on pure b*!!$h!t. If you're use to playing online games i must tell you this is nothing like the games you've played. First you start of with a Stone trying to make it in a large sized island Using this rock you can then go gather resources like wood stone ores etc. When night falls you otta be inside because for those who already play this game they are pretty fully equiped and youre probably not as every new player spawns naked with a stone and torch. The game concept is nice similar to those you'd see on minecraft just a bit more realism and perks guns and other cool stuff.If you're a parent reading this for your child i would not advise this game as it can cause sever anger issues Alot of kids on this Game often rage when their base or house is broken into robbed or even destroyed this causes alot of conflict and regular issues. The name of the game is RUST please know its meaning $$h0l3$ RAGERS CON ARTIST.Sure there's gonna be some nice people here but you gotta be careful not everyone is your friend or foe. Overal game rating 8/10Building $h!t is pretty cool the gun fight is almost as great with the devs constant updating and reviewing their crappy work you get a pretty good experience. There's tons of server to play on if u suck at one try another!There u go my review on rust!

review: You won't find a worse community of players than the one that plays Rust. On large servers everyone will hunt you for the small amount of weak supplies that you spent hours collecting due to barren areas with incredibly low amounts of resource spawns. This game is in alpha for a reason it's far from finished and is just too difficult to play unless you have friends to join you on every session. That being said if you have friends who own it/plan on buying it band together and watch each others' backs. If you don't have friends to play this with wait until full release of this game to even consider it.The recommendation is for players who play in groups only. Not recommended for solo players.

review: I just want to say first off that this games is good seems like a load of fun when I first saw it. But I'm not here to tell you how great the game is. I'm here just to say the problems that the causes game no theres no major glitches or lags like the second you start playing the game it freezes or when you try to walk the frame is still or any hackers no I'm just telling of how difficult the game is. If the games is suppose to be this difficult then forgive me I didn't get the memo so starting of why the game is difficult is the size of the map. The map is really large for instance I've played on a couple of maps with say 100 people I did not even see 1 palyer out of the 100. Now the main cause of all the problems that I have in this game is really because of how big the map is. So that brings me to my next problem of the game... resources. The resources it's not like say Regin of Kings where you don't have to look far just to get something to upgrade or craft something. The amount of resources what I mean by resources is minerals and food are extremly hard to find when you first start off in the game all you get is a rock and torch which now with a new update your equipment has a health bar which means that after a sertern periode of time it will break and you won't be able to make a new one now the problem with all this is that all you see is trees plain fields mountains and more mountains. But when get more into the game you see that it's impossible to find the resources to make for instance to make a hatchet you need stone but as much as you try to explore you never find the resources to make it. All your left off is some wood that you gathered and you have a food and water bar well like any other games that bar starts to decrease slowly and once that bar is at zero you start to slowly die. So what I'm trying to get out here is that the resources are impossible to find and once if your lucky enough you find a resource you wil proably meet your end from starvation dehydration or you get killed by an other player. Or one last thing that might lose your chance on getting the resources you need is the rock that your given at the begnning get destroyed from being used too much. Now brings me to my third problem which is the food and water. When you first start off you get a little tiny but bearable amount of food and water in the food and thirst bars. But now comes the probelm like the resources discussed in the top the animals that are in the game are way too little for the size of the map and there are no fruits. I have played the game and through my experince which is not that much I have only seen three too four animals. one being a deer and the other being a wild hog. Well lets just say I was not able to kill the deer but the hog was easy. Now in Rust the only easy weapon you can get is a wooden spear by collecting wood but with out getting any more resources to craft other weapons the wooden spear is the only weapon your going to have. So that means your going to have to kill a deer in the game which is alot faster then you are with your wooden spear which clearly once you have seen one in experince you need a weapon that shoots long range. Now to get al ong range weapon you need to find specific types of resources which are the ones that are impossible to find. Next comes water to keep this one short and sweet I'll just say you not able to drink water in your begnning stage of Rust. Now there is of curse a way to get water but it is unknown the me. So like I saud before the chances of you finding these sort of resources might be too late.

But just for being in alpha this game is great and i would strongly recommend it to all my friends.EDIT Everything about my previous review still stands for players who are new to the game. Yes it is fun but becomes quickly boring w/ the lack of attention the developers of this game put forward. I have lacked to find any new items or any new gameplay mechanics that could make this game more fresh. i would say their is still some sources of creativity with friends and I would still reccomend this game to anyone who has a lot of friends to play with.

review: Rust is an extremely fun game to play together with friends. Playing it alone is one of the most cruel experiences you will ever feel but if you're into that kind of thing don't my words of caution stop you.The game really succeeds in delivering that feeling of isolation and helplessness making it almost unbearable playing solo (mostly because of other better equipped players with their better equipped friends). In the few days that I have played I have had to start over multiple times however once you stabilize a bit and make yourself a good safe home the game feels a lot more satisfying.From what I understand the graphics got improved recently and the animations are quite good for an early access game. The devs seem to be updating it very regularly so there is no fear of it getting stuck in alpha. Also the music is really amazing and adds a lot to the whole experience.

review: I had spawned for my first time in the world of Rust I struggled to get started but finally managed to get enough resources for a stable home and a weapon. I asked a few friends to join me on my adventure because I had no idea what I was doing after following the road for a bit we had managed to group together and I brought them back to my place (a small shack with a fire sleeping bag and furnace.) Over the next few days we had started to build an empire we traded with new spawns and in exchange for 100 wood we would give them 9mm ammo or 556 ammo of their choice. After feeling safe and getting comfy in our new home I felt like nothing could stop us we were living it. Well changed fast in Rust. When I logged back in my friend had told me that we got raided he said he captured a screenshot of the assualt. The screenshot captured 10 men running in a field towards our base in full kevlar. When I returned to my humble home I was shocked at the stairwell leading to my roof and the walls missing inside of my home. I typed in chat that day that I would get them I would kill them. I got a response it read "k". Since I will leave out all of the details we had a couple more run ins with these bandits turns out we weren't the only ones. There was about 3 4 different groups that joined us. Sitting at home in my newely crafted base I heard a *tick* *tick* *tick*. " me" I whispered then quickly typed to my alliance. So I knew it would take them awhile to get here I called out to my friends we had to hold our ground. having about 3 sets of kevlar and 100 556 ammo all together we got out our weapons and fought. Before we knew it we were pinned downed inside of our own home with our 2 explosive charges in the back protecting them. At one point I sat there looking at the barricade the only thing that held them from us. Watching my teamates friends get gunned down through the sides of the barricade I was fed up with this We were nice guys sure we had done some at one point but no man wants to do those things I had to kill. These bastards did it for fun not because they were forced to no no no because they wanted to. In that moment I knew I was not going to lose my base to some s. I got my hatchet out and broke down the barricade we came rushing out shooting all of them we lost some men and so did they we blocked their exit so with the loot we got from them we fought harder. Killing all of those bastards our backup arrived after the battle our home littered with backpacks. I felt like it was real like I fought for something I was moved. Never let anybody no matter what gear they have take anything from you also be nice to others and somebody will have your back in those situations. After the battle I captured a moment a moment of celebration a moment that is rust. This http //prntscr.com/2md7eo Thank you all for listening 10/10 game.

review: My grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 8 years old when my mother said to him If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate you have to stop immediately. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me Don t ever smoke. Please don t put your family through what your grandfather put us through. I agreed. And now I still have never touched a cigarette. I must say I feel a slight sense of regret for never having done it because the community in this game gave me cancer anyway.

review: I totally recommend this game to you but... Not really recommended to raging players and I m gonna tell you why.Rust is a realistic survival game. You have the official servers the community servers and the modded servers but I will only talk about the official cause they are the "normal" servers. You start with a naked character just with a rock and a torch. Every item in the game has limited use in this case a bar telling you how much you can use it. BUt you need to watch that carefully cause sometime it will break. In this game you can mine hunt and kill other players. Yes I should have mentioned this in the beginning but this game is ONLY in multiplayer. And there is a bad part in there. If you are new to this game be very careful if you start in the middle of the servers timing. Because every 2 weeks (I think but no sure) The servers restart so everyone has a chance to start over withou being killed by other OP players already with full armor pistol or aks etc. So the bad thing here is the number of players. Cause the servers have different slots. The minium I think it s 25 players and maxium I think it s 300 or 350 not so sure. That means that the bad topic is the number of players you are playing with because 90% of Rust players will kill you with no mercy! Seriously it s so hard to make a team with other people. Some can accept but There are like 80% of people that betraid you in a team. And I think no one likes to be backstabbed that way. Anyway if you want to survive in this game I totally recommend you to go with one or more friends cause more people you get more easy to kill the others. But there are bad things to. You re gonna need to SHARE. And as more friends you play with more ressources you have to share so harder for you to survive. You also have a health bar a food bar and a water bar. The food and water are SO difficult to find it s really stupid. Most of the water you re gonna find in salty water (water of the ocean) so I would recommend you to go to lakes and craft a bottle ASAP to keep water with you. But so survive in this game you need to be super lucky in where you spawn cause seriously you have NO idea of the map s size. The food I will recommend you to llok for is mushrooms that normally give you 5 water 5 health and 25 food. Coll huh? And you re lucky that they are common. You could actually kill other players and eat their skin but that would make you a cannibal. And one of those takes out 30 of water which kinda sucks. If you find animals... forget. All the animals in this game attack you. Besides they are super rare. You could find like 2 animals in a range of 2 killometres...(not kidding). If you are a starter just grab your rock and find for wood asap. You can find trees or some wood in the ground. The thing that I most hate in this game is when you are really good equipped and somehow someone kills you. Reminding that if you die you lose... EVERYTHING you have! EVERYTHING! In the game you can also get airdrops that contain really good stacks and monuments around the whole map. Hope this was usefull. Be aware of the dangers and try to survive for long as you can! Good luck!

review: Rust Hobbes Was RightHave you ever wondered if Thomas Hobbes' philosophies still hold merit in the modern day and age?Do you long to see what life would be like without the firm hand of the state?Do you fancy yourself a good person? An enlightened and upstanding human being that cares for their fellows?Then wait no longer for I give you Rust! The post apocolyptic misery simulator that shows us just how much we need society to keep our animal instincts in line. Your day begins as follows You walk up naked and alone and in between 9 30 minutes you'll be dead having accomplished nothing at all. In all likelihood you'll have been killed by the animals that walkaround on two legs(this is a grave insult to animals since they are nowhere near as barbaric as people). You'll then respawn to repeat the process! This game has recieved Satan's approval as a subsitute for hell.Worse still is that the game teaches us something that we should distrust the people around us and kill them for no better reason than they could kill us. Yes this is proof positive that we truly flawed and pathetic creatures for even in a game do we revert back to animal natures. Thank you Rust for teaching me how much I truly do value the bootheel of the state on my throat for it keeps me safe from all the other monsters that live around me and who would kill me if the constraints of society were lifted from them.If you too want to experience this existential awakening and be butchered(virtually) by your fellow human beings then buy this game now!Misery awaits you too!This message approved by Thomas Hobbes.
title: Rust

review: This game is definetly not a game you want to play when you want to have a good time. Its not made for beginners at all. The moment you spawn there are like 4 other guys trying to kill you with rocks. They even have the time to follow you like 10 mins to get nothing out of it. If you made it out of the beach and start gathering crafting material just forget it waste of time getting killed 10 out of 10. Average lifetime is 3mins. Youre running around trying to find your mates. Killed by suddenly appearing wildlife creatures out of nowhere or people with bows/crossbows or even guns. The moment you can effort to build a base is rare. When you finally made one you can sit in there like hours because people are just waiting for you to come out and steal your key. Fun fact I've never seen people actually leaving their houses or getting into their houses but in the moment they do they're suddenly fully equipped. I don't really get the mechanics of the game but I never saw people really farming stuff they suddenly have it. For me Rust isn't a survival game at all. Its pure PVP and mostly cancer. Wasted 20 .Guys don't spend your money on this Game. There are much better games.

review: This game is a very cruel game of survival. It is very well crafted with an amazing customization value of being able to create structures and place them wherever you want on the map. The concept of everything corroding after time of inactivity prevents massive clutter to popular servers so unlike most mmo games with building the most popular areas are not crammed full of things created months ago remaining an eyesore. The most dangerous things on this game is yourself and other players. I commonly would die of fall damage jumping off things that I shouldn't have and being ambushed and murdered by other players. I mean murdered. Players are cruel and unmerciful on the game rust as the game is designed to be. Nothing is permanent. True loyalty is priceless and you may find truely amazing individuals that you can trust. Rust was a very good experience that also came with much anger and greif. Come with friends.. it makes a difference.
title: Rust

review: So far i have been killed on sight by anyone equiped from a Rifle to a Pistol to a Bow to even a Rock. I had no clue getting killed by a Rock would be so shamefull... Over all i still have yet to craft a single thing ( beside a campfire) because i get murdered by people with out hesitation. Dont try to yell out "Friendly!" cause they might backstab you later on down the road. Only time a guy was friendly to me was when he letted me in his Small House closed the door then told me to "take off the pants" (when i didnt have any pant on) and then he butchered me with is hatchet. Overall the game is ok (i guess). i cant really judge seeing how i have yet to even build a small house. If anything i recommend getting friends to play with you. My whole 1 hour of gameplay consits of getting chased by groups of people yelling at you to take your pants off. The Community is silly but hey i couldn't help but chuckle a bit getting chased though the wood by pants less people.

review: Roughly 80 hours on record but the problems in the game are super obvious once you hop in the game. Like other reviewers has mentioned the community is extremely toxic people killing you on sight doesn't matter if you're obviously a fresh spawn people are cursing over the chat/when they're killing you.Adding to the fact that the game is packed with hackers it makes the game really dull because these hackers has already gotten the C4s and AKs they will just blow up any houses they see along the way even if its just a little hut and these are all on official servers. It makes the whole game pretty pointless after a few days.I do enjoy the game the building the farming and seeing your tiny little house evolve into a mini castle being friendly and guiding new players on the beach giving them tools. These are all the good sides of the game but every once in a while these toxic players crashes everything calling out racial slurs targeting a certain country's players calling players C*NT and all sorts its like the most horrible people you can meet on the internet plays this game.I recommend the game but this is definitely not a game to play on a long term basis it's easy to get frustrated and sad in the game it's only fun if you go in and just spend a short couple of hours. Buy it when it's on sale instead.

review: Product received for free. So this is my third iteration of this review on 11/16/2017. Since I have heavily been into Rust again I figure I may as well give a new update.This game is not for everyone. I know this because I have introduced a lot of friends to the game and they have all stopped playing almost immediately. It is high stress you will lose a lot if not everything constantly. Like any job (which this game feels like at times) you will need to take lots of lumps to grow. Once you get past the lumps (after say about 200 300 hours worth of lumps gulp) you should be fine. You will find friends whom have suffered the same abuse as you all equally as off looking to raid the talking squeakers off the server. I have over a thousand hours in the game and some of the best people I've ever played with in video games I've met playing Rust. While most of the time it feels like a grind some of the moments in Rust are well worth it. Online raiding someone (which happens few and far in between) generates some of the most adrenaline in any game I've ever played. Fending off counter raiders while simultaneously shooting the people you're raiding is an experience and a half. Some people get that same kind of high when they offline and finally reach that precious loot room and some people groan when they realize they wasted 20 rockets to find a crate full of Improvised Balaclavas. Either way there is some way you will have an enjoyable moment in this game. I've played a few survival games obviously not to the degree of Rust but they all don't feel as polished or open as Rust does. Using the ALT key to look left or right certainly helps with your increased paranoia and is a feature I wish were implemented in every video game. To me that is one major defining feature of Rust that separates it from other genres. Not to mention the flexibility you have in creating your bases. There's rugs bear rugs included lamps chairs pretty much a ton of things if you're into the whole role playing thing. A few things like box placement and other items needs a bit cleaned up but otherwise they've made it way more intuitive to build lately.Now despite the mostly positive review there are drawbacks. For one weapon mechanics have definitely taken a step backwards. About six months ago they decided to start reworking weapon mechanics. Rust was definitely one of the more challenging games to get aiming right but I felt after about 3 5 months I got it right. I mastered the semi auto and slaying smaller zergs was one of my favorite reasons for playing the game. However they ditched this system in favor of a more noob spray and pray friendly system. Instead of being that guy who could control his AK and knock people off easily from 100M or more you'll now get randomly headshot by someone who has no idea what they're doing from the same distance 5 shot bursting. Pistols have way too much recoil now (the P2 is almost useless now) and well..just make it a point to get an AK. Almost every other gun outside of the LR and Bolt aren't really going to top an AK. I'm definitely disappointed in the direction they've went with guns to the point where I PVP significantly less but it's not enough to cause me to stop playing the game. With that being said I hope they at least make it a little harder for those guys that hold mouse 1 and get instaheadshots in the future.The pacing is also slowed down drastically with the revitalization of the BP system. Unless you are playing on a server that rarely wipes BPs (or never does) prepare to grind hard to find components. This can be seen as a good thing for about...the first 2 wipes. Then that large clan will have every BP while you probably have about 1/5th. So for 3 weeks they essentially just have to farm and find components to completely wipe everything out. And if you play on a server that wipes BPs fairly frequently...well. You're going to be grinding and finding BPs a lot. There really isn't a big advantage for either but for me I prefer the monthly BP wipes so you can at least have a couple wipes of having quick startups even if you have to prepare your for an offline beating.Anyways while this game certainly can be really stressful at times I would recommend it for anyone wanting to get into something new and different. I have thousands of hours in Counter Strike among others and was looking for a change of pace when I was introduced to Rust. Since then it has been my primary game. I absolutely recommend starting off in an empty ish server where you can learn to build bases and farm components free of worry. Then move to 20 30 people servers or solo duo trio servers eventually till you get good enough (or find enough friends) to play on the big boy servers. All in all if this game is too hard or you think it sucks you're probably just a beta male anyways.

review: Rust is the ultimate love child of DayZ the TV show "Naked and Afraid" and of course Minecraft. The pixelated worlds and mobs are replaced by a lush woodland scenery viciously mutated animals zombies and griefing players. Your character is plopped into the world butt naked with nothing but a rock and a medical supply kit. From there on out it's your job to survive which is a lot harder than it sounds. You must collect wood and stone build a shelter hunt for your food and gather supplies and guns in order to survive. Once you've finished that checklist it's time to fight off other players who are trying to steal your When you die if you haven't crafted a sleeping bag and placed it inside your house you will start from scratch with nothing in your inventory butt naked again. If you did have a sleeping bag placed you will re spawn at your home with an empty on body inventory. Your stored items are saved at home in storage boxes. Rust is an amazing game for killing time or pretending to be like Bear Grills. You can beat the of of people with a rock and try to survive the "after effects" of a massive nuclear war. I rate Rust 9.5/10 even in the earliest stage alpha it's an amazing game.
title: Rust

review: As an early access game Rust has a ton of potential but in the same vein many things going for it serve as a detriment. Pros Build complex constructs from materials in the world around you seriously complex entire fortresses can be made with fortifications like locked doors and spiked barricades. Large number of craftable items and discoverable blue prints to further expand your crafting list. Modify weapons with craftable attachments to make them even more powerful.Cons The game world isn't evenly distributed. Some areas of the game have plenty of resources and others are completely barren of anything of even relative interest. I spent alot of hours simply wandering around simply trying to find resources other than trees/wood. Food is very scare and you'll end up dying of starvation if you don't happen to spawn in the proper area There is no map of anykind. Though this can ve viewed as a virtue for the sake of immersion having some way to navigate this vast empty landscape other than the sun would be helpful. I mentioned before that you can craft massive structures in this game which is cool but since there is no offline mode (another con) you have to share crafting space with various other users 100+ on official servers. This combined with the fact that resources are only available in CERTAIN AREAS of the play area everybody tends to build their constructs in the same area this makes the place crowded after awhile and frame rate drops WILL occour in these congestied areas. And since vital resources only spawn in certain areas there is very little incentive for a player to leave that area end game resources take several hours to get to even after building a shelter and crafting the best weapon and armor you can. (explained below) Since this game is online only if a newcomer comes to play they are doomed. Theres no real defense against veteran players so the majority of time you play the game it will simply be running or hiding away from players who have end game gear. Even if you build a shelter and a locked door quickly that locked door can be blown down with enough force and all the materials and items you spent hours crafting can be stolen. With that said I would say there is a severe lack of balance and counter play. The combat system is pretty lack luster you can hit opponents with melee even when they arn't visibly within range and vice versa There is no strategy to fighting besides clicking rappidly and moving around and hoping you get your opponent before they get you. End game is pretty lack luster after you get all the top tier weapons all theres left to do is gun down other players so it basically just turns into DayZ without zombies. Conclusion I like the game but it has alot of work to do before it becomes competent and an experience everyone and anyone can enjoy.

review: This is relevant to the game as it is on 1/19/2014. It's very rough but it is fun BUT do not say a word in chat...ever. Look at wiki or ask a friend. The hackers are rampant. I have learned that if you don't talk they can't target you for suicide hacks. I think they can also teleport to you and then there are aimbots that will insta kill you with one bullet (which is basically impossible at range).So if you buy this now don't speak it sucks because you want to help new players but only use voice chat.Updated 2/6/14 That suicide glitch is gone so it's safe to talk in global chat now. Cheaters are still rampant but not as bad as before. The "official" servers are a 100% joke as they have no admins so they are filled with cheaters. My suggestion is to play on a modded server running Rust++ or Oxide with active admins. Even with active admins admin abuse is a problem so you have to find a good server. If you can find the right server with the right admins and the right players the game is amazing even lacking so much. I also suggest starting on a server with 50 or less players at peak times. Trying to get a start on a server with even 75+ people can lead to you dying a ton. Don't just think that all people killing nakeds are jerks either because at around 100 players there is a subset of people who will pretend to be noobs and run around naked with M4s and shotguns. At this point anyone who gets close to you has to die. Your biggest defense on a populated server is to give people a WIDE passage and don't look at them after you've spotted them. If you keep staring at people they get nervous and shoot.

review: The last time I played I made more progress than ever since buying it. I quit the game while I'm in my house for safety then go to sleep (IRL). My huge house was surrounded by a fence with a gate and spiked walls. Maximum security right? When I returned to the server the next evening and spawned in the middle of nowhere I was baffled. When I returned to my lovely secluded home I heard multiplte voices coming from inside speaking Russian. When I got closer to the house I noticed nothing was broken so I knew they had to have clipped inside or something... To be sure I ran up to my door yelling the Star Spangled Banner. A naked guy came out with a pistol and instantly exectued me with a headshot. I needed evidence to get them banned so I got the owner to come there invisible and watch as they killed me with aimbot again. The owner only banned 2 out of 4 of them because the others weren't cheating. The last remaining guys got my IP somehow and I got DDOS'D.I've been getting randomly hit offline now for months by angry Russians. 9/10

review: Rust is making gaming history. This game has been in Early Access for quite some time and is at the top of steam charts for good reason. Constent Updates from Facepunch have really made a difference in the quality of this title. They are truly dedicated to bringing this survival game to life. I just recently tried this again and I am very excited as what this has become. This is my favorite game now. At such a low price this is a title that all computers can run and all pc owners should haveHow will you Survive?Rust gives us the nearly impossible task to survive. This beautiful brutal world is litered with valuble resources and only you can determine your fate. Building a shelter is no easy task and once you have encountered your first neighbor killed them you might just survive long enough to stave off your hunger and thirst before that gets you. Stay solo in the shadows and gather resources undetected team up with some buddies and stand tall to defend your base. Gather a raiding party and take all the loot. Anyone who plays survial games need only play this. The possiblites are endles and every part of playing this game is great. FacePunch shows true dedication and skill to keep a game this old alive and interesting. Thank you Facepunch!

review: RECOMMEND X 1000. Even in its alpha release this is still a 60$ value game. And it's only 20 and only going to get better. I'll chunk this review into sections of gameplay and be as honest as possible.Things you need to know before I describe early game The game's resources are respawning node based. If you find 4 rocks and 4 wood piles in an area after you loot them all they'll come back in that area. The wandering nomad style doesn't do that well in rust there's a lot of empty landscape with no nodes. However all the spawning locations are near well off areas. The game is "Find an area with decent resources and settle down" focused. Explore once you're on your feet.Early game You start with nothing and the very early game is kind of gimmicky. Hunger is a factor and the only source of food in the game is killing animals. The animals fight back and like I said you don't start very well equipped to fight them. One animal does give more than enough food to set you up for mid game and if you find a pig (doesn't fight back) you're on easy street. If the pig you find is a near a bear though....eh? The current solution to this is an exploit that I honestly hope they keep around. Once you get enough wood to build a shelter (you can either hit trees or search for wood piles that give 100 wood in 6 seconds and then expire) you can stand in the doorway and animals will treat you as inside and not attack you allowing you to safely kill hostile ones. Kind of a trade 50 wood for safety against animals and easy food mechanic I like it.Mid game Once you're not going to die to starvation mid game is all about building up and teching. You start crafting better tools move out of your shelter into the very well done house building system get a furnace and workbench made and all of a sudden the materials you get from mining rocks can be turned into guns. Neat! With guns it's pretty easy to start looting the zombie guarded and irradiated cities and you start looting research kits and rarer gear. Research kits can be consumed to teach you how to craft an item in your inventory basically you loot rare and learn how to craft it forever. There's a LOT of items you don't know how to craft at the start.End game Dog eat dog. End game is all about building huge fortresses storing your most important items and taking your "less important" guns and food out to kill other players. Terrorize an area of the map killing all the nearby players and looting their houses until everyone you don't want around leaves. And then claim that as your own. Build a huge wooden shaped house in the middle to show your dominance who gives a you've got 15 wood pile nodes all to yourself now.It's in alpha The next content patch when I'm writing this review is talking about adding wrecked vehicles you have to fix up similar to DayZ. The game has the same maker as Garry's Mod and there is noone i trust more for sandbox content. Even the other aspects of the game it's suffered DDoS attacks the day before I write this review and look at how down to earth this post to the community is http //playrust.com/ulink ddos attacks/. I've never felt less fed with empty to buy time in my life. That was posted on 12/27 and on 12/28 Garry worked with the company and now the DDOS is gone. Hot damn.This is getting pretty ing long so SUMMARY The game is rediculously fun solo or with friends is 20$ is only going to have more and more content added there's no developer I trust more to make a fun alpha into the best game out there and be completely down to earth and NOT A LAZY PIECE OF with addressing and fixing issues.

Once that issue is resolved I imagine the game should remain playable enjoyable and a very solid game for the future. Also buying the game at $20 to get forever access is not a bad way to start. I'm happy so far. 8/10

review: This game is a love/ hate realationship. Stating off as a solo player u will find that getting a foothold within a server is full of frustration menstration and masterbation. All the progress you make will almost always become lost when you log off to play the game call "Real Life" because.... well raiders. BUT once u start making mates within the game or start getting your mates involved it soon becomes that one Girlfriend that will always keep coming back. You become so involved and invested that all you want to do is spend time with her and build your realationship. But when something awful happens (you get raided) you begin to question your entire life and existance. Is it worth the pain and suffering on trying to fix the mistakes u made? or is it easier to just walk away and find another Girlfri... uh uhm' Sandbox survival sim. This game by far has to be one of my most hate to love and love to hate games. But once you start to get a good foothold it can be endless hours of fun and once you're strong enough you can become the biggest Megalomaniac to ever walk that server... unless u get jumped by a bear... those bears man.

review: Product received for free. I'm honestly so glad I got gifted this game for free because I actually considered paying money out of my own account that I was saving up for a house rent for. Boy was I lucky.I'll try to keep my cool here but from the 2 hours I've played I personally cannot stand this game. At all.I've only played 2 hours in this game. It is extremely impossible to progress in this game because of the absolutely nasty and toxic community of the game. Servers FULL of spawnkillers and trolls that have nothing better to do but repeatedly spawnkill newly respawned players on the beach. Your character has a hunger bar but there are almost NO animals to kill for their meat to cook. I get it it s supposed to be an intense survival experience but give the player the chance to even get to grips with the basics.The game might have good graphics but it is abysmally optimized. I have an 8GB RAM MSI laptop but still I feel like the screen is tearing everytime I make a single step forward in this game (and people complain that ARK is awfully optimized but you easily get 60FPS on a lower end laptop on the game by simply changing a few graphics settings). Also if you want to join a server be prepared to have a lot of time on your hands as you will have to wait for a legendary time to join a server. It took me HALF AN HOUR to join my first Rust game.You know I m sure Rust is probably a well designed game if you took away these disadvantages but for me they really make me not enjoy the game at all or even want to carry on with this game. I recommend there should be a single player mode for the causal player to get to grips with all the basics. If I bought this game instead of getting it gifted I would think I definitely did not get value for money whatsoever and would have demanded a refund ASAP.
title: Rust

review: So.... this is it huh? Rust Well I don't usually write reviews but rust is such a unique title that everyone should experience to the fullest. My overall aim for this review is to persuade the person saying "Hey is rust even that good of a game." *glances at release date* ʘ ʘ"Um.. what the actual F***!" That was me initial reaction too in all seriousness! I did not expect a game from 2013 to be so FUN! The aspect of survival and communication to building bases and raiding is the wonders that make the game so relevant today! The replayability is amazing and what people don't understand about the title before they buy it (no prior knowledge) is that you play on player hosted / official servers that have a wipe shedule meaning every thursday official servers will reset and everyone starts with a torch and a rock fighting to be the first one with a base. To servers that wipe rarely and have less players but a good way to learn the mechanics of the game and get an in depth feel of what to do and what NOT to do.I have 910+ hours in this crazy game and I don't regret ANYTHING! It is my favorite game today and if you might not be interested please leave a comment and maybe give it a thumbs up anyways because I am going to direct you to a couple of games I enjoy other than this title. Such as WOW Arma III CS GO PUBG H1Z1 Kotk Fortnite Rocket League and that's pretty much it.GOOD LUCK!

review: It was the 23 of May on a warm sunny day in the middle of a field. The air was windy and carried a scent of mexican in it. Off in the distance I could see an ocean and a few cliffs. I was placed here on a secret mission codenamed "Operation Heartbreaker" the objective of my mission was to collective data on a bunker in the south. For some reasons I lost all my clothes and only own a rock though. As I traveled through the landscape I met many locals which after trying to communicate chased me through the mountains with stone hatchets. After escaping I decided to head north but to my surpise a giant airplane randomaly dropped a bunch of crates on this tree. I dont know what the the imbecile was doing but i thought it free When I got there i found c4 shotguns and wood but im not entirly sure why they had wood and guns in the sam shipment. upon my departure the server went down then rolled back so i said it and uninstalled.

review: I have been debating on whether to buy Rust or DayZ for a few weeks now. I've read through many pro/con discussions regarding Rust vs. DayZ. Where DayZ seems more zombie centric Rust has more of the survival/scavenging/crafting aspect that I find more entertaining. I bought it last night zoned in started hitting things with my rock to collect materials. Collected a bunch of wood like almost 400 logs. Then I started hitting rocks to get stones I pounded on those boulders for a long time nothing happened. That's when I realized that I had to find nodes and not just the mountain rocks. By this time I was already down to 800 on my food so I set off to find critters to kill and eat. I'd like to say my first life in Rust didn't end with me wandering around dying from starvation but I'd be lying. Rust is unforgiving and mistakes early on can lead to an agonizing death.Next life I zone in and I'm instantly attacked by both a wolf and a zombie. Dead. Sometimes it's not the choices you make but the choices you're handed that decide your fate.Next life I wander around and find some friendlies who give me clothes a bow food cloth and tons of starter stuff. Awesome I'm not starving have a shelter and starting to carve out a life for myself when I'm out hunting and I'm attacked from behind by a zombie. Dead again.I respawn and try to get back to my corpse so I can pick up my newly acquired loot I'm totally lost but finally manage to get to a landmark that I recognize. I'm near starving when I get to my backpack when yeah that zombie that killed me is still nearby and he eats my naked cold newb self.Next life I give up on the backpack. Back with my rock in hand I get my logs and my stones build myself a shack and campfire inside but I'm still hungry. I set out trying to sneak up on pigs and deer manage to get a couple whacks at a deer but it runs too close to what I think is a bear. I let it go and focus on the piggy. Here piggy piggy piggy. I flail wildly trying to land a blow on the pig but I keep missing. It's getting dark. I'm down to 600 food hungry and cold. But finally after about five minutes of chasing that little bugger a very satisfying wet thwack of my hatchet hits paydirt! I start butchering the pig getting animal fat chicken breast (?) and cloth glorious cloth! I make it back to my shack fumble with trying to get the food on the campfire accidentally eating raw chicken and getting poisoned. Throwing up food down to under 200 now as I get it on the fire. Not only am I starving but I'm poisoned and losing health. Health hits 65 waiting. Throw up some more health at 50. I'm watching the fire waiting for it to be done I'm starving I need it I need it to survive when... it's cooked! Oh the glorious pixels of cooked chicken breast harvested from a pig that I ran down and killed with a hatchet! A hatchet that I made! I munched down on it watching my health and hunger start to climb. I could almost taste it and the glorious satisfaction of bringing myself back from the brink of starvation was so rewarding. I ate enough to fill my health and food completely sitting next to my fire during the night cozy listening to footsteps outside and gunfire in the distance. I would not be dying today. I was going to make it to tomorrow.At sunrise I'm up. I had enough cloth to make a bow and enough stones/wood to make some arrows. I made quick work of the deer that eluded me yesterday harvesting food logs and minerals at ever opportunity. I didn't venture far from my campsite both in fear of losing my way back to camp and running into undesirables. I made clothes a sleeping bag some fuel and cooked up a mess of chicken and built a storage bin in my shack to hold my inventory just in case I wander out and get killed I'll still have a stockpile out there I can find.Eventually I found some friendlies again who gave me some supplies more cloth some blueprints nothing too far up the food chain but things I could eventually use when I decide to go on the offensive against the zombies. But nothing in game was as satisfying as surviving that first night making that first kill and setting myself up with a sustainable campsite.Other bonus is I'm on a PVE server which is awesome for learning the game. Everyone is friendly so you don't have to worry about griefers shotgunning your naked self while you've only got a rock.

review: I have almost 1850 hours into this game so I can't make a claim i don't like it. I have seen it transform from something great to a failure and back to a good game again. Would i pay full retail for it? Absolutely not. But i am cheap and do not like to pay full price for many if any games. The graphics have really come along well most of the game play has improved(save for the way barrels are placed now. sorry i liked the old way when i started of areas not just up roads). Anyway it is a good game for PVP and PVE alike. I run a server and the addons are superb for the most part. You can make the game what you want it to be. I haven't played a strictly PvP server in quite some time so cannot make too much of a review on those. The builder and Pve servers i play on are decent though for the most part. I would like to see some kind of sanctioned quest line or something introduced. Steam achievements are ok i guess and unofficial servers can set up extra content with some effort but it would be nice to give people something to do other than gank you for a rock and 100 twigs. Overall though I have to say I do like the game for it's simplicity of play and the fact that much of it is what you make of it. I bought this back in 2015 on a recommendation and for the most part don't regret it. I only paid $4.99 for it on a deal though lol. I would not pay the new retail price for it if i had to get it again. There are tons of games with more depth for less cash. But having said that it is a good game with many facets to it. It is all what you make of it. You like brutal PvP then there are servers for you. You like to just build gather and survive there are also servers for that. It is what it is. Either you will become addicted or you will get buyers remorse and flame it on a review. If you are a in PvP though it is not for you. Crybabies are not welcome nor coddled. you will be harrassed until you leave. Take the spear in the head get naked again and move on. It's just a game.. Oh and i will click recommend but not for this price. WAIT FOR A SALE.......................

review: To begin with in this review I'd like to say that this game definitely uses "Early Access" as an excuse for good reviews... Not going to happen. This game has been up for 3 years and it's disgusting to see the lack of content that it has.This game has the content that I always wanted in a survival game but not the content that a survival game needs. Let me elaborate on this.It allows you to draw on maps write signs with your own mouse typing them on the keyboard and send notes to other players. You can't simply delete an object in an instant any building mistakes will cost you. You can repair your weapons instead of going straight to making new ones.Despite all of these features which are rarely seen in your average survival games they do not include the basics. For example the logic to this game is so dumb. Last I recall deers are not made of chicken. And I don't remember Wooden Spikes hurting you when you're hitting it with a long melee weapon like a spear even if you're as far away as you can be from it. But it's not all just logic right? No it's not. But what's the first thing you should do in a survival game? Find food and water. In this game that is too easy. And the fact that Food refills your water as well? Please there's no survival to it.The only survival I know in this game is surviving from the attack chopper every once in a while or raiding/defending from other people.Do I enjoy it?Sometimes. I love the whole concept of the game. I enjoy trying to survive and build a base with walls and putting up signs writing notes. I like the leveling system and what not. However they NEED to improve. They've pretty much gone back and forth on this. This game NEEDs more content.Would I recommend it?Definitely not. This is a one time playthrough game. You'll rack up 50 hours and begin the get bored of it. I hope that one day this game will change my mind but I have a feeling that'll be in roughly 9 years time.I would recommend that you check out it out every so often until you feel like it has made some progress to the point where you believe it has enough content for your liking. As of now this game is not worth the price. I'd pay 3 for this kind of game.My rating 3/10 Needs more survival content.

review: The screenshots on the store page don't do the game much credit honestly. If you wish to see for yourself why this fairly pricey game is so fun without paying yet I'd recommend checking some Let's Play's on YouTube. I was skeptical at first as well but checking some video's did help me make the choice and I found out why this game is so much fun. What sets this game apart from other games is how relentless it is and not due to the game itself but more because of the players who play it. A fellow player can either be a friend but more likely an enemy. It's a game of trust and outsmarting those who you do not trust. Death does not mean the end it's the stuff you gather that helps you survive and you must hide them well spread them out if necessary. Once you get the hang of it you'll find yourself gathering Blue Prints to make new items and eventually you'll be trying to make the most inpenetrable fortress of Wood and Metal. Or maybe you prefer more thrill and raid other bases.This game is still in Alpha and yet so much fun already word has it the map is also only a part of what it'll become this would be cool. Last but not least the game already brought up 7.5 Million Dollars so hopefully the creators will have enough motivation to turn this game from an Early Access into a finished product.

review: This game is a very specific sort of awesome. First two stories from my introductory minutes of the game I spawn in the middle of a field with nothing but a rock a torch and a half empty stomach. In the distance I see a pig this is actually quite unusual and lucky. I run up to it it runs away. I follow it ultimately crouching crawling and encircling it. I am the hunter primal death incarnate I will have meat. I am no more then five feet away when suddenly it runs. Have I scared it? No there is a bear behind me. It eats me. RESPAWNNo pig in site I wander around for a bit. Suddenly someone approaches. We keep our distance and chat briefly. Upon learning I am new to the game he offers me some food. He throws it on the ground and steps back. I approach and look down to pick up the food.He bludgeons me on the head with a rock. Dead.Make no mistake this game is hard unfair unforgiving and unbalanced.It's also the most FUN I've had with a game in a long time.I spent my first night huddled around a fire. I could see about 10 feet into the world the rest was darkness full of noise. Was it leaves in the wind a wolf (that I can't fight off) or someone with a gun (that I also can't fight off)? I didn't know but what I DID know is that it wasn't a scripted level approved "random encounter" that I could fight off It was either the leaves or death.It turned out to be nothing and I spent the whole night cowering in fear of the darkness just like a real cave man might.If you want what I think of as "sim city with zombies" there are a TON of games out there for you. If you want something unlike anything you've ever played before keep an open mind and jump on in to Rust.

review: In an era that mixes the hunter/gather society and the modern era there is much to do in Rust. When you take your first breath on the island of Rust opening up your eyes you are met with a rock in which you have the urge to name Wilson. You look around born into this world with nobody else so you take it that you too must be family of this rock that it was this rock that gave you life that you are a rock and you must be as naked as the rock you're holding. You eventually figure out that you can swing the rock and decide to see what happens if you swing it at a bear. Not good. As you find out Wilson isn't strong enough. You become nearly dead. Bleeding. Suddenly you hear a high piercing noise ring through the air into the bear's skull. It's dead. You turn around and get a glimps of an object who can stand on two legs covered in what looks like bear fur. It's obviously not a rock and doesn't hold a rock like you do. Instead it looks like he is holding a black stick a black and shiny stick with a hole at the tip and funny things sticking out of it. The strange object vocalizes saying something you can understand "Nice d1ck f 66ot!"The last thing you hear was the same sound you heard before the collapse of the bear. You're dead. You're p15sed. You must learn how to build a shiny black stick such as that object's. You must get your revenge.

review: A great game it is addictive and you can have a great time with it. The developers really wants you to play once a day. Other people raid you unless you have a very secure base. If you are not in the server for a while your base will decay which basically means that it will disappear it's good and bad because it saves server performance but it also forces you to play once everyday basically.The game suffers from hacking and glitching at the moment but we all know that this is an early alpha and we are a part of the process. The developers knows what they are doing so my faith in them is full. If you have alot of spare time in your life and feel that this will be a good game for you then go for it i totally recommend it. Please don't mix this game with dayz.. It's the same genre as dayz but the community is completely different. People will shoot you all the time and saying that you are friendly doesn't work often. I'm saying this because most people whine about getting shot all the time. My point of the game is just take it or leave it! And please.. don't play alone because you are most likely going to have a bad time. It's a teamplay game and surviving solo is very hard!So to summarize i recommend this game. If you have some time to kill do it with this game!

review: What can I say about rust besides it being one of the most exhilarating experiences I have ever had the frustration level and potential for salt is extremely high. Starting out the learning curve almost feels endless and making mistakes while other players are looking to take advantage of every situation possible can lead to a rage filled cycle of naked farming for hours dying to a geared player and losing all progress. Starting in a server or near the wipe date is a MUST. It allows you to feel the brief period of time (about 2 days max after wipe) where the entire server is farming/building instead of trolling/raiding. When joining a server late being taken on by established clans while still extremely under geared is almost an impossible feat. The community itself in game is toxic and to not be trusted for the most part. Rust revolves around it being a dog eat dog world and the community itself really reflects the mindset. Trust no one and be prepared for the backstabs. With that comes a double edge sword Once I found my group of people or a clan that I was welcomed into I really found a tight knit rust family. That constantly had players on and knowledgeable people to ask. Unfortunately the game can be horribly rough for solo players and would not recommend until extremely familiar with building tricks and layouts. In a nutshell Rust can be a very rewarding and exciting experience. Hearing people off in the distance while mining and hiding in a bush while the attack party walks by looking for you has made me shake more times than I can count. Even blowing open a wall to find yourself in some one else's defended loot room looking at hour's worth of work can be quite exhilarating but its a give and take. With the rush of thievery comes the disappoint of logging on to see your own house has been devastated while logged out. Pros Exciting Trolly Epic Clan Exp. Great base building Cons Trolly Hard Learning Curve Toxic community until you have found friends Salt &amp Rage potential
title: Rust

review: Good game very robust controls and pretty easy to learn. The community is pretty bad on this game though they will help you via chat but when you meet someone in person it's just KOS (Kill on sight) every time and without second thoughts they will kill you even if all you have is a stone and they have full gear. The game needs some more improvement for sure such as the raiding. Raiding is far too easy and you can't have anything to defend your base for you while you're gone or no notifications to tell you that your base is getting raided and all your loot is going to be disappeared by the time you get back to your base. Without a few friends on this game it is going to be very very difficult. I had to make some friends along the way to make a good base where we are able to defend and stuff. The game could be better and allow a system to benefit those who are allowing fresh spawns to do their thing without being killing constantly. You should be able to have some sort or automated turret or pets or something to defend your home while you're offline. But all this can be done in the final product I suppose.

review: i miss the old days i miss killing bears and wolves with my naked buddies. I miss roaming the grasslands where it was vast and quiet. I would find a nook between mountain rocks and build a shack to survive the night. I miss hunting hogs and chickens while looking out for boulders to appear and race my friends to repeatedly swing out picks and gain riches. I miss running from naked crazies and baiting them towards my allies to ambush. I miss sweet talking noobies to invite me over while the pack slowly follows and jump him when the door opens we would take everything and leave him stones and torches mayeb a some pork thats called chicken so he can eat in sorrow. I miss the old days when it took time and skill to get a gun and slowly grind to get C4 explosive. once we had c4 we became the gods of the server raiding the weak and sometimes overcoming the other tyrants. I miss those days its all over now.

review: This game covers a wide range of play from super aggressive official servers to more laid back modded servers. Can you run into s on all servers? Yes. Will you run into s on all servers? Probably but there are some good ones out there with good Admins who keep abuse down to a minimum. Rust can be fun. You can solo play or bring along your friends. Don't care for the server you're on? Go join another. Are there bugs? Of course it's an Alpha game. But the devs are working on it constantly. (though I wish they were working faster on keeping the bears and wolves OUT of my house lol! Live/die and learn!) All in all once you find your fit among all the different types of servers you will enjoy the challenge of Rust.Edit After the latest update I have to negate my thumbs up. I recommend NOT playing until they get the serious flaws of newest update fixed/changed.

review: Rust is one of those games where if you like building and playing alone then don't get it. I have a large group of people. My whole base i armored and it can easily be destroyed over night when your asleep. Basically im saying don't be surprised when you get on and your base is destroyed. The community is also kind at some points and then some are jerks so watch out for that. The game though without all of that I would give it a 4.5 out of 5 because the game has a great building mechanic and crafting is simple. There are animals and players to kill and some animals attack you. Overall though play the game its worth the money and I think you will like the game.*UPDATE* Don't forget that along the way you will meet people who are worse than you and will claim your hacking. Just remember that your better and those people who brag and think they own that random server you just joined make sure to destroy every inch of that base so you can show them who truely owns the server and when they say that was our backup base go look for the other base only realizing they don't have one except for that small wooden shack with a chest and a furnace that they called a base. When its all said and done talk to them in chat and make them realize they should just refund the game because they don't have on no one. Well thats my story that happened this week. It was pretty fun. But no seriously es up. Thats how this game is played.

review: Tense hair tuggingly frustrating... yet beautiful.I grabbed this game cheap on the Humble Bundle and i'm absolutely loving it so far. In the 19 hours that i've played i've been raided numerous times while offline been chased butt naked into the forests while carrying nothing but a rock by men with assault rifles and have been a shoulder to cry on for victims of slavery and ..This game is not for the faint of heart but by god is it good.I've played a good number of games in the genre from DayZ to H1Z1 to Miscreated yes Rust is the only one i've ever played (excluding the early launch of H1Z1) that plays and feels... fun. Every encounter every area is a grand new experience which is only heightened by your friends and the community which you're embarking into. Aspects of the game such as the ambient and atmospheric soundtrack are also extremely memorable giving a real sense of immersion in these large open worlds.I have to tip my hat to Facepunch on this one for the great job they've done so far and I cannot wait to see where this title goes.

review: Rust used to be a very fun and addictive game but the devs made a lot of bad choices They removed bp system and introduced a bad exp systemThey made front and back door sides take the same damage (almost zero that is) from tools so base building was dumbed down to honeycombed cubes where the side you entered didnt matter cause you cant melee a badly placed door anymore.Javelin aiming animation changed to an idiotic one where you cant aim so they went from ok to useless focus shifted on the 'pro' guns (bolt AK semi auto pistol)Access to bolt rifles and AKs got easier so when a server wiped everybody had a bolt on day 2 so everybody just camps rooftops with a bolt.The only positive change made these last few months is in the fps optimization which made the fps double for me.All in all i loved this game but i cant recommend it anymore.At least not at this state.
