review: Pros n Cons List AMAZING GAME!!! It's super fun to play with friends not as fun solo but still great. One of the Best Building Systems i have ever seen. There are alot of pros and cons thought. (I Rate 8 out of 10 in the current state of rust)PROS Hours worth of game play Lots of replay ability Easy to get set up within 1 2 hours(Okay tools and good base) Easy and nice building system Clean crafting GUI Lots of Guns and attachments to choose from(Including different types of bullets. e.i Explosive HV Normal and Flaming) Many ways to raid Easy to get a hang of(The basics atleast) (During christmas)Gifts spawn that give you basic tools Wood is VERY Easy to get(So its easy to get a full wood base build really fast) Lots of servers to choose from PVP system is pretty good(Some hit boxes and balancing issues) Easy to run but still looks amazing Food barely goes down When out of food or water it takes a while to die Lots of levels of progression You can spend hours playing and not get bored Its isnt that common to get raided(If you build the right size for the amount of people you have and you build it right) Can be a two day build a base and raid experience Or a two week build a masive base and defence experience More than just 1 play style Lots of good base designs that work very well(all people build different bases You will barely ever find two of the same) Airdrops give lots of good loot and are fun to fight for There are PVP only servers like Battle Royals servers Exactly like a easy to run version of ARK but without dinos Can get down to $10 CAD in mid week sales. (Also $13.34 CAD on Cheap Fun and easy to runCONS Animals can run through walls Bears are OP and will kill you in seconds if your not armed Water is a pain to swim through Lots of grinding Sleeping bags take 5 min to respawn you Hard to find servers for late game(Most servers wipe every monday) Lots of toxic players(Lots of KOS and Griefing) Pitch black at night(Torch doesn't help that much) VERY hard to find stone But when you do you find alot 90% of raids are when you are offline Not much melee Weapons Helicopters..... Lots of massive groups...
title: Rust

review: Игра затянула меня еще на открытой альфе хоть и лагала безбожно (частично из за слабого ноута). В общем суть проста тебя выкидывают в открытый мир с одним лишь камнем двумя бинтами и факелом. Камнем надо пилить деревья на дрова и долбить камни на руду (только одиноко стоящие круглые камни респавнящиеся рандомно по карте я же не одупляя этого 3 минуты долбил скалу). Из деревьев делаем простенькую халупу с ящиком для награбленного и идем добывать еду иначе скоро окочуримся. Камень меняем на каменный топор. В альфе пока есть медведи волки олени и кабаны. Чтобы не парится и гонять кабана бейте волка и после перевяжитесь бинтом. Просто мясо есть нельзя или обблюешься надо жарить его на костре Из больших камней добываем собственно камни медную руду и железную руду чтобы плавить руду необходима специальная каменная печь дабы избежать непоняток с ней в нее тоже надо запихивать дрова. Железная руда лежит в основе всех дальнейших ништяков далее строим верстак чтобы клепать огнестрел и патроны к нему. Кстати не забудьте сшить одежду она дает бонусы к защите от разных типов урона. Вскоре вам покажется что вы уже слепили все что только можно а вот х"й. В особо опасных радиоактивных зонах с зомбями лежит самый вкусный лут от антирадиационных костюмов модулей и карабинов до собственно чертежей к ним. Чертежи хороши тем что их стоит выучить раз и потом хоть миллион раз вас убьют вы все равно при достаточном количестве ресурсов соберете то что выучили. В ощем могу сказать что для альфы игра очень даже ничего купить стоит но конечно приготовьтесь к бесконечным патчам и обновам (дотерам не привыкать). Из плюсов это все плюсы DayZ и майнкрафта вместе взятых из минусов невозможность сносить свои дома из за чего карта всегда нагромождена квадратными хижинами что несколько раздражает надеюсь исправят. Ну и типичные минусы альфы присутствуют. Желаю удачи ребятам из facepunch а вам приятной игры.

review: I've played my fair share of Rust I got the game before the remake that is available now and it's safe to say I've played enough to know what I'm talking about.In it's core Rust is a beautiful and solid game with a good dev team who care about it and try to make it better every week with each update. The game mechanics are good if a little unbalanced and "wonky" at times.But this is where the real ugly comes in. Rust is as you know an early access game and it has been since it's release in almost 2 AND A HALF YEARS AGO! It has been 2 and a half years and the game is still stuck in ALPHA! Here you have a game that has been in an alpha stage of development while at the same time being accessible to the public for 2 and a half years that is absolutely unacceptable. This quickly ties in to my second problem with the game the perfect unbalance of player progression. Rust is survival game in which you start with nothing and need to build your way up so you'll be spending hours on end gathering resources to make your base and acquire weaponry. But the problem is that there are other players. And this makes for 2 thing 1 Rust solo is absolutely unplayble as you will definitely run into groups more often than not and lose everything you have resource gathering will take an obscene amount of time and there is no way you will manage to defend your base properly from again groups of players.2 Rust in it's current state is simply a deathmatch with a survival and crafting gimick implimented.I have tried several times to get back into Rust and enjoy myself but I just can't seem to be able to anymore.I definitely don't recommend you buy Rust in it's current state or ever for what it's worth.

review: Do I like rust? Short answer No.Long answer?It's a fantastic game with lots of people around you but to even attempt to solo/duo in this game in any server that isn't heavilly admined is pretty impossible. You can spend as much time as you want on this game and still end up at square one you HAVE to invest a solid 8/9 hours into it in one sitting to be at a point where people won't raid you when you go to bed.And if it so happens that during that 8 or 9 hours that someone who has no motive other than to make your time then my friend you're back to square one.People say "oh but it's just rust!" no it's not it's a ing fantastic display of a social experiment give people the ability to be s to people with no reprocussions and this is what spawns.I hear all the time oh rust legacy you used to be able to meet people have fun help each other.Nah. Not now.So do I like rust? Sure when there's 10 of us to farm quickly and get a base built I LOVE rust but to spend your time on your own? no.Don't purchase if you're a solo player.

review: I've played enough of this game to give it a full and honest review and seeming as they recently changed a huge game changing feature I feel it's the right time to do so.Right where to begin.Rust is a highly enjoyable time spending action filled multiplayer game. The game can get very dry and boring without friends though so I recommend you not playing solo unless you enjoy the lonliness. I've spent hundreds of hours on this game with my friend and we always go back to it no matter what.One thing we're starting to see quite clear on is how the game has been updated very slowly the game is rarely updating the NEEDED updates.Cons Slow on needed updates.First loading screen is very VERY slow. (You have to do this every time you load into a server for the first time since the client as been open.)Frames are poor.Certain bugs they never seem to fix. Even if I spam on reddit about the problems. (past experience and present.)The games been out for like 4 years and I'm still yet to see many HIGHLY requested things.But that being said overall I do enjoy this game and do recommend it but bare in mind your prayers may not be answered for at least a few months with bugs/things you want to see. (They hinted cars a year ago and we're still yet to even see transport.)So yeah. 8/10 would be a 10/10 if they weren't slow/uninterested with community requested items/updates.Edit Game hasn't been fixed for 7 months for Mac users so don't buy if you will be playing on Mac.
title: Rust

review: Rust is a cruel game like trying to wank 2 minutes after you have already climaxedI find it really hard to put into words how much I enjoy this game. My first experience was terrifying. I woke up naked and alone on a beach only to be chased for five minutes by a naked man with a machete until he cut me down. My next attempt at survival went slightly more smoothly. I sucessfully made a shanty! Ensuring my little hovel was adequately protected I logged off with a confident mind. I logged in the next day to play and once again awoke naked and alone on the beach. My beautiful home had been destroyed and I had been murdered in my sleep. I began to detest the other players. I lived in fear. Cold and naked. I HATED the "raiders". I didn't understand why they wouldn't let me live my life. Over the next couple of weeks I struggled to survive living in the fringe of society. I studied the collapsed ruins of once great bases and forts. I searched feverishly for blueprints. I stalked other players learning to sneak around unnoticed. I watched. The server performed it's monthly wipe leaving me with the blueprints to success. Using the knoweldge I gained from exploring raided forts I was able to build myself a fortress ensuring that I did not make the same mistakes as the ill fated survivalists of the past wipe. I farmed for what felt like days. I created weapons. I murderd anyone who DARED to settle within range of my sniper tower. I ruled my kingdom with an iron fist. I have become what I hated.

review: Well what a game this is. I think this game is very fun and rewarding but only if you put the hours in and have a group of friends to play with. This is not a game you can reach the top in if you do not have lots of time for the game and lots of friends. Also be prepared for the reality of these sorts of games were if you die you will lose many hours of work. Maybe even days or weeks of work. If we compare it to a game like DayZ yes you die but you only lose gear and your location which you can get back in a couple of hours but in Rust you could be raided while you are not even on and find all your stuff gone. On the good side though the game is fun and has a real sense of progression which makes it worth the money. The graphics are good and it is very atmospheric especially at night. Overall i would recommend this game but be prepared for lots of frustration and setbacks in particular if you are playing alone or if you dont have ample time for the game.

review: Rust is by far the best game I have ever played alpha or not. Of course there's a few things to be fixed but once again it's in ALPHA. This game is loads of fun and I can play for hours on end without getting bored simply because there is Always something to do. This game is not for those people who are too kind Rust will destroy you. Though the instructions never say anything about killing everyone that's typically your 1st option. However making alliances proves just as useful. I would highly reccomend playing on Community servers at this point in time because hackers are an issue but can be banned from Commmunity servers.I MUST STRESS that you trust nobody in Rust. The only people you can trust are those who you can inflict damge on in real life and still be weary of them too. Your ally can turn on you very quickly if given the opportunity. Rust has successfully changed the motto to "Keep your friends close your enemies closer and your Rust friends closest of all." Sleep with one eye open folks. Best game ever.

review: Okay usually I don't write reviews as I honestly just play the game and have very little patience or time to do this but I think rust desperately needs an unbiased review. So here it is This game is AMAZING as an alpha one of the best damn games I've played the biggest problem are the hackers which you have to expect given this games release was only about 5 months ago. For those of you who want to fix this the best thing you can do at the moment is pay for your own server and only invite your friends. It's expensive but if you want a hack free environment it's really all you can do at the moment. Now as for the game itself YOU MUST BUY THIS NOW! Support Garry and his team! Buying this game will go towards helping develop this game and fixing it's few but heart wrenching flaws. So do I recommend this game? ABSOLUTELY! Does it need anti cheat software? Of course! But it's just an ALPHA! So those of you complaining that it needs anti hack software must understand it's no different than when it's less appealing but commercially sucessful counter part Minecraft was first released. When Notch released Minecraft it had a crazy amount of bugs but now it's paved the way for awesome games such as this to exist. Okay so now that that's out of the way let's talk about the gameplay.You start out with a rock! That's right an ordinary rock and must build a shelter or else believe me... you won't survive. This shelter doesn't last however as someone can just get on once you've gone to sleep kill you and take everything you worked for. Location and structure of your buildings are EVERYTHING! Being raided sucks but when you've gotten used to the fast paced world of rust it's not that bad. Blueprints teach you everything you need to know when you first start out you'll have hardly any tools weapons or resources but that all changes when you grind for hours to create an awesome assortment of the finest items you can expect in a post apocalyptic world.Battles are sometimes exhausting but fun running through the woods to escape your predators gives this game a touch of reality that you would expect from this altogether depressing setting. Gathering friends to wage a war against other bands of enemies and looting their goods is not uncommon in this game and if you are playing solo chances are you'll want to make friends pretty quickly. Airdrops are sent in from the sky by the administrators of servers to help balance the world but beware solo players! You can expect to be shot at for attempting to pick these up. So as for the pros Amazing building sim intelligently executed CoD like gunfights!And the flaws Desperately needs anti cheat software! Needs better records of who is taking advantage of this.This game has given me my life back! Not really but as far as games go a one time fee of 20 dollars? You have to buy this. Buy it now!
title: Rust

review: After playing some more I have a better opinion on this game.The last review I left was about bad RNG and that this game isn't "finished". I'll forgive the game for that. I think the one thing that just sucks the most is knowing that someone just kills you while you are offline. The feeling of losing everything you worked hard for is such a downer. This is not what I play games for. I play games the way they are meant to be played for fun and I am not getting that from this. The toxicity of the community ruins this game. All it takes is a few bad apples to spoil the bunch. Unfortunately for online gaming in general bad apples are commonplace. All you need is ONE person to bust through a wall (they have all the time in the world while you are offline) kill everyone while they are prone and can't fight back loot everything and vandalize everything you worked for.This sinking feeling sucks. Save yourself from this experience and do not buy and play this game. I do not care about the developer's vision of "a very realistic game" because this is NOT a fun feeling.

review: I've been playing this game on and off for quite a long time. I personally enjoy the game but only sometimes. This is because the core gameplay is very simple and yet very rewarding and satisfying. However progression in the game is a complete mess. As farming for blueprints can be the most agonizing thing known to man. But when you do git gud the game starts to get bland. I've personally never really enjoyed pvp in survival games so when you become all geared up pvp is the only thing left to do. Pvp consists of 90% gankers and 10% newbies with no equipment. I personally try to avoid confrontation of any sorts. This however has limited me to playing very nomadic like (roaming constantly). This means that I'm never really able to properly gear up and build a large base of my own and I usually have to rely on shoddy wooden buildings for shelter. This of course leds to many deaths by either bears or freshspawns. Even though I personally find Rust difficult to have "fun" with I can still find it interesting to play. And as a result I find my self coming back to it even after swearing to never touch it again.I do recomend this game but only if you have a large group of people to play with unless you don't mind getting killed unfairly and having to constantly run about naked for hours on end.&lt 3

I spent most of the early hours of this game running through radiated areas completely naked with nothing but a few fire sticks and my trusty rock named Wilson.The aim of the game is to not get rust on any of your metal items. The easy part about this is that WIlson is made of stone so you're practically unstoppable. You spend a large portion of the game cutting down trees and killing animals because f**k greenpeace. Eventually you build a house out of twigs mud and tears only to have it blown to bits by a**hats with C4. When you leave the game you do not actually leave you simply go into an induced coma where you dream of real life only to wake up back in the land of rust where some 12 year old has kicked down your door violated your comatosed body and taken you for everything you have. The moral of the game is to always sign a prenup. 3/10 would more than likely not dine again IGN

review: I got Rust after reading about it and I wanted to see if it was as much a sociopathic experience as I had been led to believe. Oh it was.The fact is Rust is typical of games like 'Day Z' and other 'Open World Survival Games' that have promoted early access and have yet to establish groundwork evolving between server wipes. There is a great deal of Rust which focuses on resoruce gathering and that stuff but it really boils down to your ability to find a group (preferrably large) and then murder the hell out of anyone else during raids. Yep you learn how to build etc but it doesn't matter You cannot go it alone in Rust for very long and even your allies will eventually either get fed up and quit or you will. There are good things about Rust I said it was familiar to Day Z but I think it takes those elements and builds in more survival and on one level it forces you to cooperate in situations you wouldn't want to. Rust's receipe system is okay I've seen better but Rust handles it well. Combat is attrocious and cheating remains a big issue. Aimbot city at some points reminding me of the aborted APB launch on how many people at one time or another use aimbots or a few other cheats. This is the biggest issue It's never about survival or combat and neither matter when you're dealing with the uncertainty of what you do and people whose only goal is to eat you....which actually happens with surprising frequency.So until Rust is fully supported and released I can't really recommend it. I like a lot of the ideas about it but I get frustrated with the combat system the survival mechanic and the cheating in it. You're better off with something else but hey that's my opinion

I WILL KILL YOU!Neighbors call cops!10 police officers and a SWAT team blow down your door because you cannot hear them with your headphones on while you did this Gather resources!Craft new tools!Chase a deer!Give up when it teleports through a rock!Lay your foundations!Get befriended by a fellow human!Get shot by that fellow human!Police surround you and tell you to put your hands behind your head!You say what are you doing here!They say do it now!You say in a rage that you can acheive only by playing rust NO!You stand up and bash them with a replica rust rock!You hop out your window while avoiding gun fire!You get in your car and get into an intense police chase!You are going around 150 mph on the highway in the opposite traffic lane!You are still in a rage from playing rust and pull out your emergancy gun in your glove box!You start shooting at the cops while heading towards an airfield!You grab onto a lifting off helicopter and shoot and take the heli driver hostage by pointing your gun at them while holding onto the helicopter with one hand!You feel your grip slippingYour hand slips!You are falling to your doom!You somehow survive with only paralyzation in every part of your body except your arms!You go to jail for 80 years!You get out and go home!You turn on your computer!You load rust!Gather resources!Craft new tools!Chase a deer!Give up when it teleports through a rock!Lay your foundations!Get befriended by a fellow human!Get shot by that fellow human!You die from a heart attack!10/10 would play again!

review: When I finally bought this game I was so excited.I started playing RUST.After ten minutes after I saw how the game is I wanted to delete this game forever...So i explain a little bit you find 3 trees where you spawn.You make a hammer.You take wood.Make a shelter.But wait! review: Takes 10 minutes to load to main menu assuming it didn't crash to desktop before then. Takes another 20 30 minutes to load a server assuming the game didn't crash when I picked a server. Then if I'm lucky enough to actually get into a game the game crashes my computer entirely when I open the menu to check keybinds. The game also completely refuses to load to main menu at all in windowed mode.This is completely unacceptable especially since I'm not running a toaster. I'm not throwing this trash on my SSD to make it load slightly quicker because the load times shouldn't be this long to begin with. The framerate was choppy as hell despite running it on fastest settings and it looked terrible on all settings. Instant refund after it crashed my computer. I don't know what I was expecting buying an early access survival game.

review: Great game! Would recommend it to anyone who is debating on buying it trust me it is a purchase that is worth it. The game is still in Early Access yes but the game does not fail to entertain me and suprise me with new things no matter how long I play it I always find myself in different situations and if very fun situations. You can either choose to go regular survival with no PVP or add a little bit a fun and play some PVP where the fun never really ends. The grind of the game is pretty hard unless you are looking to go the easy way and join a server with easy ways to get stuff but in general the grind is fun and with friends its even more fun. Making a base getting everything ready going out to raid and then getting raided in return is actually satisfying even if you do lose a couple of battles it is still a very enjoyable game and I will continue to play it.The game keeps getting better and better and the developers do not look like they are in any shape to slow down.

review: Welcome to Rust. A game were everywhere you look BAM! man holding a rock flailing in the wind like a branch off of a tree. Assuming you don't bash his skull in and make a nice skin tuxedo out of him you may greet him. He will respond by bashing your skull in with his rock. Now he has two rocks. You respawn. You want revenge. You may decide to play it safe and run away from other players. Or you could be Leroy Jenkins and smack people with your rock. Hunt a pig and question the logic on why it gives you chicken breast instead of bacon or anything else that pigs give you. You will also make some nice clothes to hide you flailing branch like Or maybe you want your victim(s) to stare blankly at you dong while you bash thier skulls in. Maybe you'll cut down a tree with a rock and find some other rocks to make a sweet hachet. Now you're ready to deal some damage. Then you realise you've spent an hour or two deciding how you're going to do this. Rust is a thinkers game But at the same time you can just bash people's faces in with a rock. Weither you decide if you want to be a supreme overlord of the world and then flee from a wolf or a bear or a ZOMBIE BEAR! just try to get by living far away from civilisation or just wandering the land stopping when you need to or you could be the pillaging of the server and just kill everything in sight. Play it how you want kill everything or a peaceful person who helps others until the people getting helped realise they can chase you and kill you unless you are smart and drop it all and leave. In all seriousness Rust is a great game missing a few features that will be added soon like more weapons and armor a craftable map that shows you where you are and a icon system to let you know where you're house could be or towns. 10/10 would play again.

review: If you can get in a decent server that suits your needs and steer away from the official servers then I think this game is definitely worth the 20 bucks. Its pretty exhilerating once you get enough loot and weapons to comfortably wander the map with good defense. But on the other hand in the official servers you will constantly be dealing with Modders and Hackers doing all sorts of different things to gain advantage over everyone else whether or not its flying or suicide hacks. Its not new user friendly game as everyone with a gun will shoot you because they dont trust you which means dont trust anyone with weapons. It also helps alot to have a mic as well. A mic in any game helps actually but for this game it is even more crucial. I give it even though it is in alpha a 4/5 stars. Not a must have but with recent patches and the updates this game should be able to compete with DayZ during the final release as long as the developers listen to the community and fix things accordingly.

review: The hackers on this game completely ruin the game however they already have a new plan in place to rid of them so ignoring the fact that hackers steal your stuff every three days or so this is the greatest game I have ever played.I started out playing this game on my own for around the first 45 hours or so (my hours logged are not even close to correct) and the game was really fun I set up a little hut with a wood door multiple times and was raided every night no matter where I set up. I upgraded to a full house with a metal door and thought I was ontop of the world until two of my nieghboors who had shouted at me "Im friendly Im friendly" which are words you will learn to never trust in rust shot me and blew my metal door open with explosive charges.I releized then I would need a bigger house in a more secluded area and starting at square one again like I had never even played the game before I convinced six of my friends to get the game. Within three days we had a seven story house full of guns and ammunition only to be hacked three sepereate times now. Our house still stands the hackers just take everything inside. So hopefully when the hackers are banned we can continue living in our large house daily fighting our nieghboors and killing people just trying to get a metal hatchet of their own. But until then a daily loggon to open doors and prevent the house from decaying is probably all ill be doing for the next three weeks.

review: Similar to the TV show 'Lost' after playing Rust for a while it's clear the developers have no idea what the final iteration of the game will look like. First the blueprint system was removed and was replaced by the XP system then it was put back in again alongside the XP. There are frequent tweaks here and there new items and places to explore.On the one hand you could say the devs are listening to the players and changing the game accordingly on the other you could question whether or not they have a clue about where Rust is going and what it'll finally look like. The game is still in Alpha and that doesn't look like changing any time soon. There are some performance issues I have a GTX 970 and experience the most horrendous frame rate drops from time to time.Despite all these issues though Rust is a brilliant game. It's raw terrifying exhilarating frustrating and down right annoying all at the same time. The community at times can be awful think ten year olds who kill on sight when you've just started. But if you find a good server get a friend or two you will have an enormous amount of fun.

review: Bad google translate for developers I strongly commend and recommend this game but I would like to draw the attention of developers at a very important problem so this review is red. Rust and without the help of a very demanding applications in which so many elements that they require strong computer rendering. I am the owner of the i7 processor and GTX 980ti and it would seem to me to complain that?But the problem is that Rust works exclusively in windowed mode. Yes you heard right only windowed mode. You say yes no I play in full screen the author you stoned! But alas no Rust just run in windowed mode to full screen without border. You ever tried to play CS GO in windowed mode? FPS drops below the mouse becomes unmanageable and kill someone becomes very problematic. All because Windows does not allocate enough resources to the computer windowed mode and furthermore in the case enters the vertical sync. What it is? It is built on Windows technology that adjusts the number of frames transmitted image at the frequency of your monitor. For most people the monitors operate on a frequency of 60hz. Some believe that 60 Hz is equal to 60fps 120fps some what but not the essence the main thing that Windows is cutting staff. Mouse becomes unmanageable and the rotation of the camera in the game is waiting for frame synchronization so even if the game you 300fps it looks only at 60fps and disable vertical sync window for the application is not possible!Computer Resources in windowed mode go nowhere the processor and graphics card are burning hellfire developers are trying to optimize the game released patches to improve FPS but the whole thing in windowed mode. review: Ignore most of the bad reviews. A lot of them are complaints how they get raided or the xp/level system. Summery of this game is building up a base and raiding other bases. Simple. If you get upset you got raided maybe this game isn't meant for your.The game is server base with a strong community of servers. Don't like taking forever to gather resources and leveling up? Play a modded server that increases the Xp and resource gain. There is no need to complain about taking forever to level up with all these options. With that being said I never played this game when it was real early in the release. I never played when you had to locate blueprints to unlock for crafting items. So I wouldn't know the difference for unlocking items. But I don't see an issue Because again if you have an issue with taking forever to level up grind to unlock items. You can join servers that offer x3+ xp gain. To conclude rust is an fantastic game to play with other players wether it be becoming allies or making enemies. Yes being a solo player can be a bit difficult when there are other players on a server that are teaming up. But aye that's a life of a spicy boi.My overall rating of this game is 8.5/10 10/10 if you play with friends.

review: Even though this game is reviewed as positive dont be fooled. This game is full of wonderful mechanics graphics gameplay and Items. However the Community is the only issue with this game. I recommend this game to anyone thinking of getting it for the reason being that its massivly updated its nothing short of a masterpiece in survival games. As you can see i have a bit of hours put into this game and alot of that was fun times playing with friends. But as a big tip too new players. Find an empty server to start on and enjoy all the game has to offer first. Nobody on this game will help you or be nice to your face. Even if you just have a rock they will kill you. I spent about 2 hours testing different servers for peoples reactioons. In every server i tested i would be killed by some random person in 5 minute intervals. So please dont look at this and dismiss the game buy the game play it on an empty server once your good join a populated one with a friend and be prepared to die a lot. These people are masters at killing at this point. So dont be suprised if you die as much as i did. Besides all that this game has many amazing features to prevent you from getting bored and many things to do its hard but its a survival game so thats how its suppose to be. Play it and you will see its amazing gameplay and replay value. But again dont be suprised if you die A LOT.

review: A pathetic "game" that hardly meets adequate standards of any of it's many genres. The first thing you will notice after buying this game is that you must wait an excruciating amount of time before experiencing the beautiful amazing title screen who's beauty definitely justifies the 5 minute wait and makes you facepalm and say "Wow that is a completely reasonable amount of time to wait for many paragraphs of text involving the game over a diarrhea coloured background. Now I can join any random server to start from scratch again even though I have 400 hours spent on other servers (about an hour on each one ) but they are constantly being wiped so none of my information is saved. But I enjoy spending ALL my time scavenging a wasteland swarming with redneck gun owners who will go out of their way to shoot a naked defensless new beginner." After the titles screen there's yet another 5 10 minute wait to join servers. The game's only have decent feature is the music but still... Meh. Also the "open inventory" hotkey by default is fkn tab. Feck you rust. I don't understand how anybody finds enjoyment in this rubbish game is it because they like to stare at wangs? I'm sure it is. Let's compare this game to Ark Survival Evolved a game superior in every way. Time to launch/join Rust 10 15 mins Ark about 4 minutes. Title screens Rust 4/10 Ark 7.5/10 Music Rust 6/10 Ark 7/10 Optimization Rust 8/10 Ark 10/10 Graphics Rust Mediocre 6/10 Ark Amazing 10/10 Gameplay Rust Nothing to do if you can survive the players you still can't build unless you walk a few thousand miles 1/10 Ark Quite Fun depending on how you play it 8.5/10 Environment Rust fgts only 0/10 Ark Friendly people but there are sometimes server Alphas 7/10. Overall rust is a waste of money that will bring you no entertainment and waste space on your PC.

review: this game used to be amazing before workbenches became a thing since it meant that a solo player could atleast have a chance to slowly work his way up without the need for joining a clan but after the devs added them in this game the thought of playing solo is unthinkable . the game has just become a game of who can have the most people in thier clan.let me explain why. so before workbenches as long as you had the ingrediants for a recipe you could craft that item which allowed players to not be as vulnerable when they just spawned etc but after the update workbenches became necessary to progress through the game and unlock the ability to craft certain recipes which wouldnt be a problem if you didnt need so much scrap to just to craft the workbenches and unlock the recipes which by the way take forever to find and collect. This update not only made it so much more tedious just to be able to make a base weapons and tools but it also caused players and clans who already have those crafting recipes to have an absolutley monumental advantage. So to combat with this most players now are forced to join a clan or play with thier buddies since playing solo is basicly just pointless since you'll always either get your base raided because you won't be able to gather enough scrap or stone to upgrade thew walls of the base or you'll just be flat out killed by a group of players with ak47's.I'm guessing by now you are thinking " lol wut a nub can't just kill that group of players" but it is much harder than you think because a bow and arrow is the only ranged weapon you can make without a workbench and it can take 3 hits just to kill a player with no armor with a bow which means no matter how good your aim is there is no way you can handle those many players with such powerful weapons.it's a shame really how far down the drain this game has gone since that update.and that's not even it. Did I ever mention the hackers? Because they are EVERYWHERE especialy the official servers because there is never any moderators there. Which makes this game a breeding ground for hackers and script kiddies.Combine that with an absolutely revolting fanbase of manchildren and 8 year olds who do nothing but spam the N word in chat and scream at maximum volume into thier microphones when you encounter them than you have yourself a game that ( untill the devs rebalence the gameplay) belongs in the toiletbowl. I reccomend to wait until they fix everything.p.s most of the positive reviews you may see now were posted before the devs added workbenches

Die unless they play on controllers and have hand tremors and you are a god Archer/Stick Poker2. Take what you want but PLEASE... don't kill me!!"The SWAT commander looks over at his officers laughs pulls out his side arm and puts a bullet between your eyes After killing you they loot all your savory chickenWanting to make it look like an accident the team turn on the gas to your stove puts tin foil in your toaster then cranks the setting up to burnRunning out with bags of chicken your house explodes behind them in slow moFew Seconds Later... You wake up naked on the beach... you wonder has this all been a dream NO! NO! NO!! you tell yourself this has happened and will happen againDisparaging you look around wondering what should I do nextAfter a minute of admiring the sunset you get up and start walking into the seaNever to be found again

review: Back in June 2014 is when I first purchased and devoted my life to the legacy version known as Rust (Alpha).I may not have as many hours as some others who have posted here but let me tell you why.I loved the Legacy version of this game it ran fine on my old 'gaming laptop' with 8gb of ram and a 720m fine with 60fps most of the time and little to NO drops at all. When Legacy stopped being updated and they moved to the 'new and improved' version of rust I was sceptical but optimistic. Turns out the newer version of rust didn't run on my old reliable laptop and so I stopped playing for a few months until it was better optimized. Skip forward 3 4 months and it still didn't run above 30(ish) fps. I then played it again for a few days just to get a feel for the new version and when I found my lack of fps a struggle when fighting I opted to quit rust until I had a better computer. Skip another 2 3 months and I had just finished a custom computer with a gtx 770 i5 4690k and 16gb ram.Beauty I thought I'll be able to run rust easy with this and they'll have optimized it more in the time I've been gone!Wrong. Even my new computer struggled to run rust at a steady framerate. I tweaked the settings and barely managed to get my fps to hover around 60. Which was fine I put a fair few hours into rust during this period was active on mainly one server and actively waited for wipe day and updates like a kid on Christmas. But it seemed with every new feature implemented the devs drew further away from optimizing their game.And although there was always talk about performance increases and fixes in devblogs I never saw an immediate improvement in the game's performance a game that has been in early access for over 3 years and has seen no 'massive' improvements in optimization. Which is one of the core features that simply turns me off rust everytime I try to get back into it.Which is why I cannot recommend this game. EVen now with a GTX 1070 there is constant stuttering during gunfights massive lag spikes for no reason at all and random drops that make it nearly impossible to play this game sometimes. And I just cannot understand why they insist on adding paid cosmetics into a game that has barely had any massive performance enhances since it's change to the new version.I have not played rust for a long time and I doubt I will until some sort of progression is added and stability gets a major overhaul. Unfortunately that's just how it is with early access games but I look forward to playing rust when it is optimized and I feel the same excitement I felt during Legacy.

review: I ve played this game since Legacy (shortly after it came to steam) and i am still playing it.Some reviewers have said that the "new" rust has lost what appealed to the players in the old rust and i agree. HOWEVER they have focused a lot on bringing the "new" rust closer to what it was and they are doing just that with weekly updates.The Dev team is very dedicated and skilled and although they receive some critisism for not listening to their players i have to say i am glad that they are careful about what to implement and what not to implement. If you look at the suggestions coming from players there is about 20 game breaking suggestions for every good suggestion.The fault the devs did when they made the "new" rust was that instead on focusing on developing the game up to the same point as the "old" rust was they focused on adding new things instead resulting in a game that you easily got tired of. But they have fixed it now and i can frankly say that i have more fun on new rust now than i ever did on the old rust. And the best part? Its getting better every week.Some might be wondering why they made a new rust instead of sticking to the old one well i will answer that with a short as possible answer without getting too far into the details.Legacy rust had an old graphics engine and that meant that it had its limits when it came to what could be done and what couldn t be done by the developers. It also got very laggy on big servers with lots of players and building objects. There was also the problem with the fact that when the game would be "finished" the graphics would be outdated and the game dead shortly after. So the devs decided to "move" the game over to a brand new graphics engine called Unity which opened up a lot of new opportunities and possibilites. The servers can now support 500+ players instead of 32. You can have 500 000+ objects compared to 2000+ on old rust. The graphics are out of this world compared to the old version building system is better gathering system is better. Every single thing is better or being improved for the better.And that is why i give rust a 10/10 not because its a perfect game far from it. But because the Devs do whats necessary to make the game into what it should be and continuously keep working to improve and add to the game aswell as cleaning up bugs and whatnot.Pros Very good game Stable and very playable 100s of hours of fun (value for your money) Infinite possibilities Fun game to play with friends good fighting system good graphics Being improved on a weekly basis Devs are blogging 2 times a week about whats being done to the game and in the rust community. (google rust dev blog)Cons Crappy community Lots of russians and most people will kill you on sight. Finding a good partner ingame is hard and will take time. But its all worth it in the end. People will betray you once you turn your back. This game teaches you one thing NEVER TRUST ANYONE. If you give people a chance to raid you they will. the "new" version of rust is very playable and can give you hundreds of hours of fun but it is still far from complete expect bugs and funny situations. The game has a rather steep learning curve but it is not hard to learn it by yourself or with a friend. That feeling you get when you come back from a gathering trip only to be killed right outside your front door by a guy who has been waiting for you in hiding for the last hour or so. IT WILL HAPPEN so be careful.again 10/10 would recommend to everyone even my mother in law.
title: Rust

review: Rust Legacy is what I will be talking on. If I could describe it then I would say that it is the equivavant of smoking crystal meth whilst huffing paint. During the summer holidays I played for two weeks with a friend. On the third week I met a new friend and that is where it got bad. We met other people and because it was six weeks morning to night 24/7 we formed relation ships that shaped the next 3 weeks and a bit after the holidays. It got to the point where my friend I had known for a year turned on me for someone we had known for a week. Relationships broke relationships were made new people came to the server in groups and ed us over and making us not trust eachother hackers made us doubt our friends and it was just a genuine emotional fest. In the end where it was like the end of a ing battlefield no one was left together people were split the server had closed and I had not spoken to my friend or the new one i met for over 5 months. I quit most games I played with my old friend and attempted to pass my exams as I did not want to fail. After another month when I failed my exams anyway I came back to my friend. We talked about the rust legacy and how it was the 6 weeks that had morphed life as we know it. Now as stupidly camp as this sounds I miss the rust. But yea 10/10 Would do RUST LEGACY crystal meth and huff paint again.

review: Rust is an amazing game with its own unique gameplay! The graphical details are outstanding! Considering this is only an Early Access game it truly is unbelievable. The DEVS are hard working and try their very best to release new patches each week to improve the expierence for the players. The team have been creating a product that is bug free and as optimized as it can be in the alpha stage. For only $20.00 it's a steal.Its a game that you SHOULD buy if you're into the survival genre. Of course like any other survival game people will raid you and take everything you've worked towards. If you're new to the game it will happen a lot more frequently due to the base designs you build. Each base is unique and can be broken into in multiple different ways. The more experienced builder you are less chance you will be raided. Servers do get wiped to keep performance at high standards. I do only have a small amount of time played on RUST but any update the DEVS release affects the community and does not put anyone at a advantage or disadvantage each player is able to access the same things. (It all comes down to skill.) They release content they feel is ready each week although their sole focus is on optimization and debugging.You really do get what you're paying for.

review: Alright...it's been over a year since Rust came to early access. It used to have a ton of players (still does but like 40k less players than a year ago). The reason for the lack of players is because well..Facepunch decided to majorly overhaul Rust with an experimental build. While the older version (which can still be played) got left to rot.Here we are a year later. There's the Legacy version (Rust 1.0) and then there's just Rust. Which is the majorly overhauled version. There's a procedarily generated map waaaaayyyyy better graphics and the game runs smoother. Now if you haven't touched Rust since Legacy then there will be a huge learning curve for you. It's literally a whole new game but it's still a ton of fun to play. (I'll add more at some point in time but the final verdict will remain a 9/10)
title: Rust

review: I have bought this game looking to have some fun with my friends. We joined a server called "Asylum Island IP 192.223.26.16 28021 &amp 192.223.26.16 28015." After playing on this server for the first time we started to notice the admin of this server abusing players. He continued to bully people in the game chat and kicked/ban anyone who said anything in reply to his malicious comments. This server offers in game rewards for people who rate his server which is ranked 48. I feel like this game is terrible for the simple fact we as the players can't voice our opinions anywhere and report the servers the game hosts. Overall I do enjoy the game but I have ran into a lot of abusive admins which make the game not fun. Please take into consideration when purchasing this game that you will run into trash talkers and abusive admins. Please whatever you do do NOT join that server i posted. My friend was banned for being a so called "Whiny Baby." If you enjoy survival games this is definately a fun game but the game devs don't give you an option to report servers for abuse. So far ive been looking for an hour and haven't found a way to report that server. I decided to write a review hoping someone will take action since our opinions didn't matter to Rust Servers.net who harassed us for posting in their forums about the situation. They did not offer any soultions to the reports of abuse. Rust Server.net was very unprofessional with dealing with our complaint about the server they host on their site. Do not try to complain to them or rate the servers on their site. The admin will delete your comments if they show any negative talk about the server you are complaining about. They only let people comment who enjoy the server. Server List.net is a terrible site. They are rude and do not like complaints sent to them. Over 20 people were banned today for disagreeing with the admin abuse and malicious comments. I am complaining on here now for the simple fact there is no where else to complain about the game and it's servers.
title: Rust

review: This game has been in early access for an extremely long time and while it has changed an awful lot in that time it is still an extremely buggy game with leaks and often unplayable due to a large array of crashes.I have given up waiting for this game to become stable and I am tired of reading conversations amoung players time and time again about how it isn't working. Here are the most recently things my community said about Rust in a very short conversation 'it wouldn t connect' 'mine crashes whilst loading a lot' 'Stable rust?! Now that s a trick' 'all of a sudden I got random crashes while in game' 'crashes while loading as it becomes unresponsive' 'weird hard crashes in game though'.Only one person I know plays it regularly and the rest check it out occasionally and always come back with the same feedback. I've played it for many hours and I get the appeal I do. But enough is enough I will not blindly love a game because the premise is good or because of brief moments of gold with friends. They made those moments not the game.It also has and increasing hacker problem the community is largely toxic and the game is SO unbalanced it makes mid/late game progression impossible without having an army behind you that literally have no life outside of the game and play around the clock.If you get it for free fair play but don't pay for it.Rust a rage inducing 2/10.

review: A truly remarkable but in no way unique addition to the survival/builder genre that took hold in the eyes of gamers ever since Minecraft came into existence. For many people they desired something more realistic more hardcore and even no they search for it. To say this is the desired game is a lie. I like this game and I want to like this game more than I do but ultimately this game has been in early access for 4 years. FOUR YEARS the developers have been updating it and that's great except like many many early access games it is and will likely forever remain an early access game. What this means is that the developers IE facepunch get to be lazy SOBs who leave game breaking bugs in the game while adding content at a snail's pace. Will most of these problems be fixed? the likelyhood is no because 4 years on the bugs are still there. The game is very entertaining the gunplay is impressive and the things you can do with the building system in the game is equally impressive but sadly you simply cannot be successful by yourself in this game and dont' expect to get anywhere on your own. The game is ridiculously pitted against new players without so much as a tutorial to aid you in figuring anything out. There is no Singleplayer and multiplayer is either modded or extremely large servers where most players have already build dozens of large bases next to each other. The likelyhood of you spawning next to (or inside as I once experienced) a player base is extremely high on populated servers. It's the community and the glitches that ultimately kill this game for me as well as features in the game that actively penalize victims in situations making it virtually impossble to defend a base if you get killed before you can react. The problem ultimately is the community is possibly the worst and most cancerous group of underaged plebians you will ever experience in a game far worse than anything you'd see on facepunch's other notorious game Garry's Mod a game I have sunk more than 1500 hours into. AI animals do a ridiculous amount of damage a wolf can kill a player not in armor in 2 3 hits. AI animals run faster than you making it impossible for you to escape as well. They have an extremely large aggro range as well and tend to camp your body so it is impossible to get your gear back. Also if you die you might as well count all your gear as a loss because you will never get back to your body in time to get it before it despawns. Bodies despawn in 5 minutes and the average timer on a sleeping bag to respawn is 5 minutes. All of these frankly stupid features ultimately work against you and defeat the purpose of having your gear drop for any reason other than people get to jeer you call you various racial slurs loot your body naked and carry on their way while you wait to respawn for another 4 minutes. Or you could spawn randomly which always will put you at the opposite side of the map from where you died and often puts you in the same place if you die next to the random spawn. I experienced being spawncamped murdered and looted by the same man 27 times in a row each time the man taking the time to yell racial slurs at me and wait for me to respawn. My "random" spawn put me in the same place and he shot me and yelled at me and waited for me to spawn again. This continued until he ran out of ammunition and decided to leave. There are no such thing as "good" admins on this game. I have yet to experience an admin that banned users for abusive offensive or disruptive behavior. I have yet to see anyone punished for ridiculous actions not limited to camping bases and spawns just to ruin other people's experiences. However if you can get past all that maybe find yourself a secluded place to make your base and manage to make something you might have a short time of fun before a player inevitably raids you while your offline. Either that or the server will reset and you will lose all your gear and have to start over. 4/10 the game needs serious work done to it to make it more enjoyable for anyone who isn't a troll specifically anyone who wants to play with any sence of dignity or decency. Game breaking bugs frequent crashes random disconnects a bug that crashes the game by editing video settings broken OP wilflife you cannot possibly beat without top tier weapons. Possibly the literal worst most toxic community any video game has ever seen that actively works against new players. Forever in early access lazy devs not finishing their game after 4 years. Limited content limited weapons the presence of microtransactions for skins in a early access game. I want to love you Rust but in your current state that's impossible.

review: I regret picking this game up. There are basically three resources that I've come across. Rocks trees and animals. And each of these resources give out three or four different items. The idea of the game is to survive but so long as you don't get stuck in a zone with no animals at all like I did you can pretty much survive with utter ease the only real threat being other players. Once you get guns though other players tend to leave you alone. You've won the day! Now what to do with all your free time?I don't know talk in world chat maybe? It's hard to feel alone and desperate for survival when people can communicate across the world in order to trade/sell items call in for back up or just chat.Since I got bored of "survival" I tried to go the Minecraft route of just making things with my ultimate goal of making a bridge or tower to unreachable places in order to make a huge beacon fire... but I found that incredibly limiting given the tools I had. (The fact that I kept dying because I couldn't find animals for food and bed didn't help this either)I bought it and thus I'm stuck with it but I hope in a year or so maybe there will be something akin to role play servers with no world chat and increased difficulty to get guns or something to actually do.Edit Also... The inherent goal of "survive" really doesn't mean a whole lot when death isn't much more than an inconvenience. There aren't any consequences to death... and as it stands I don't even know how you could implement any.

review: Thoug currently playing in an early alpha phase this game isn't bad. The pve servers could use a bit more excitement in them maybe some form of objectives to reach for? I'm a gamer that likes to have a purpose in the game I'm playing. Tasks to achieve checkpoints to reach. It's a personal form of gratification that I'm playing the game correctly and making it worth my time. That being said I have a firm belief that this game will be at the top of it's genre once complete given how far the development has come ALREADY. It will be very interesting to see how far this game progresses. A few things I'm hoping the address Map system in place.(mini map of sorts) Navigation system. (compass) Clock/daylight tracker Team building/grouping/alliance building method.(Especially when building and using doors.) Basic cross hairs or aiming for the Bow.All of these things being more 'creature comforts' to gamers than NEEDED. However will make things a little more player friendly.Can't wait to see how the game comes along in the future.

review: Rust is an online PVP survival type game similar in a lot of ways to titles like 7 Days to Die or DayZ. The main difference in Rust is that unlike the other aforementioned survival games the only threat you'll face here is that of other players. Therein lies my problem with Rust the player community.I was gifted this game and spent about two hours trying to learn how to do stuff and get a feel for the game. I say try because the online community for this game was not helpful unless you count murdering you on sight as being helpful. When I asked for help in the chat I was ignored. I was later sent to a "noob friendly" server by somebody on the forums where I was again killed on sight then camped and spawn killed for an additional fifteen minutes before I quit out in frustration. This is after calling out the people killing me on said server who proceded to troll and taunt me and the admins who did nothing about it.In these types of survival games where your opponents are other people I understand that you can't and shouldn't trust people. It's the nature of the beast. But when you run into three people and all of them have machine guns and armor and you're just a naked dude with a rock then it's only fun for one group. Guess which one it is. In short if you're looking for a competivite PVP survival game then this may appeal to you assuming you can survive long enough to learn anything / gather the materials to last more than twenty minutes at a time. But if you don't want to spend your time doing the same things over and over again because of people with itchy trigger fingers spend your money elsewhere. I'm just glad I didn't spend any of my own money on this game. TL DR Version This game could very easily be called "Sociopath Simulator" because you will die over and over again not make any progress in learning the game or gearing up in it and generally be exposed to the worst kind of uncaring rude disrecpectful people the online community has to offer. 1/10. Wouldn't on this game if it was on fire. Even if I was R. Kelly.

review: Rust is a survival game created by Facepunch Studios. Inspired by games like DayZ Minecraft and Stalker Rust aims to create a hostile environment in which emergent gameplay can flourish. The aim of the game is to survive. To do this the player should gather resources. Hitting a tree with a rock will give you wood hitting a rock with a rock will give you rock and ore. You can then craft a hatchet from the wood and rock allowing you to gather faster. You can go out and hunt a variety of wildlife such as boars chickens rabbits bears wolves and deer. Once you have killed an animal you can butcher it to gather its meat and skin. You can craft a fire using wood and cook the meat inside the fire. Then you can eat. You face two major dangers in game. Rust is a multiplayer game so there will be other players trying to survive in the same way that you are. Unfortunately for you they can find you kill you and take your stuff. Fortunately for you you can kill them and take their stuff. Or maybe you can make friends and help each other survive. Rust s world is harsh so you might need to make friends to survive. The environment is not kind. Bears and wolves will chase and kill you. Falling from a height will kill you. Being exposed to radiation for an extended period will kill you. Starving will kill you. Being cold will kill you. I've been playing this game since the old version and i can tell you that this game is super fun. If you like survival games you should buy it.

review: Just about hitting my 100th hour. I never played legacy but I have seen a bunch of gameplay. Graphis are amazing but are hard to run. I have a 780ti OC 16 GB of ram and a i7 377k OC to 4.0 GHZ and I play the game on max. I average about 60 70 frames but in the most recent update it has droped to about 40 50. As well are there are MASSIVE lag spikes that hit randomly for me and my friends. We have played on many diffrent server so it wasn't one server. The game is fun but I do recemend playing modded servers. With higher gather rates and instacraft I don't have to spend an hour getting wood just to make a shack house just to get raided a day later. Another thing is they have weekly updates which is amazing. but garry and his crew don't seem to listen to the community. I mean they sometimes do but when ladders were added more then 50% of the community did not want them. They were never removed though... Anyways I recommend this game if you have a beastly gaming PC and don't mind spending the time and effort to maybe just get raided and lose it all.

review: Rust is more than just survival its a way of life. I might have spent over 100 hours on this game but i'm sure only a dozen hours proves to anyone that this game is phenomenal. At the current position it's it (an early alpha) people have made this game one of the most popular on Steam currently. The community of the game is of course very mixed many are very friendly and easy to get along with although there are some terrible people who take advantage of those who have less resources than them. In future updates i expect there to be more of a balance within the community. I dont know how this will be done but if they create this game this quickly they can do anything.Of course there are several pros and cons for this game as listed below Pros Addictive Good for people who want to play a game with other friends Fairly frequent updates Very popular Easy to play all dayCons Updates even if done frequently are often let downs with only minor adjustments Very mixed community Only an alphaEither way i'm sure most people that buy the game will be 100% satisfied with the game and is totally worth the money.Happy Surviving!Fusion.

review: You know it sucks buying broken games. SO BUYERS BEWARE!!!Game is broken on the servers ran by facepunch. They don't admin or have active GMs on them. (servers ran by people normally have active admins to ban people) Therefore people are abusing the clinet in many ways. HACKS is the biggest example. Other huge problem is the severs can be forced to crash. (this is an OLD SCHOOL CONNECTION GLITCH) I joined a sever not knowing it was active with cheaters. A group of friends and I were raiding the biggest teams base on the server while they were offline. No sight of them at all. All of a sudden the server goes do due to too many people trying to log into the server. (its a 200 man server and only around 60 people were on) So the server goes down. takes an hour or so to reset. (ONCE BACK IN I WAS THE FIRST ONTO THE SERVER) I'm back in the enemy base (alone while my sleeping mates try to log back in) All of a sudden here comes the MAIN cheater running in guns blazing (within 30 secons of server being back up) HE HAD NO IDEA WE WERE IN THERE.... GHOSTED THE SERVER CRASHING IT THEN COUNTERING OUR RAID WHILE EVERYONE LOGS BACK IN!? (THIS IS AN OLD SCHOOL CONNECTION GLITCH THAT CHEATHERS HAVE BEEN USING FOR YEARS!) It is nearly impossible to prove who did in beyound being in the middle of the action. (due to online proxys the company cant ban the IP or USER doing it since it's not there real IP) THE RUST COMMUNITY HAS A NAME FOR THE GHOSTING GLITCH! They all it DDOSing.... (so the biggest team on this server has gotten that way by cheating Crashing the server everytime they are about to lose something huge) ALSO REPORTING THE CHEATERS SEEMS TO BE A WASTE OF TIME!!! There are KNOWN cheaters on most servers.... Why doesnt this company deal with cheaters? Not sure. but IT MAKES AN EXTREMELY WELL BUILT AND FUN GAME..... HORRIBLE!!!!!!!

review: We Spawned. We were naked. We had rocks torches and nowhere to go. me and my friend sprinted off into the distance flapping in the wind as we ran looking for hemp wood and a place to call home. After being on the run gathering resources for a few hours we decided to pitch up tent next to a rock. We had sleeping bags and after 3 hours of flapping about finally made some trousers and hid our manhood from one another. The next couple of hours took a turn for the worst. someone was knocking at the door...one man slamming our (wrongly placed) backwards door down screaming some hateful words of death through the keyhole. I looked at my half nude friend...surely our time is up? surely we are done for? We built a home here We slept here even made our first pair of pants together here...all for this our sure demise.Wait gunshots...and the agonising scream of a man. Then the door flies off and enter two men that had saved our lives."hello kind sirs" i say "hello" they reply"you have saved us we owe you our life!"after this we decided to travel with our new friends and watch them slaughter half the server with weapons we could only dream of having smashing down doors killing nude men. I couldnt help to think that only 4 hours ago i was one of those nude men just looking for a place to call home and some pants.Our story ends here still on the run still half naked and still yet to find someone other than the two heros of the story that dont want to blow our heads off.7/10 would buy again.

review: This is a love/hate game. Before going into my review I'll say I'd rate this game a 5/10.. which makes it hard to recommend or not recommend. I am a casual solo gamer with bad connection. These aspects make it a bit difficult to enjoy the game but it can be fun. If you're in somewhat of a similar situation as myself I suggest searching for a PVE server so that it isn't so competitive and you can explore and build more freely. The less people on a server the "safer" you may be. This seems to be the best alternative to a "single player" experience that I've found. The game has a decent amount of bugs or things that make the surviving aspect of the game a bit hard sometimes. Aggressive animals can spawn in your base.. which makes me a bit paranoid just entering my base. They can also go up and down rock formations and such as if they weren't there.. this makes it difficult to kill animals or even avoid aggressive animals. There is an attack helicopter that patrols the map and will show you no mercy. Even if you are in a decent hiding spot outside of a base it will most likely kill you. I've tried hiding in thick bushes or behind a big tree and often it doesn't do anything..Using a mic is almost a necessity because typing in chat is usually too slow to communicate with other players who may be looking for someone to kill and loot. There are main locations that spawn random loot that is very useful. These areas depending on how populated the server is may be guarded by other players. Be cautious when exploring and don't be surprised if you get robbed or killed. I personally set a sleeping bag before getting too close to a "town" in case I die. Be aware that the community is often hostile. If you want to play this game you must be patient and expect to die many times. Playing with friends will offer a better experience with this game.

review: Rust is probably one of the best games you will ever play with friends granted that you know what you're doing and you have the time to commit to it. That's the review in short. Continuing on Rust requires lots of dedication both physically and mentally to obtain most of its worth with the game having a relatively steep learning curve and high skill ceiling which you can reach to after playing for a while in and with the deadly environments and blood thirsty dangers both automated and player controlled the game will provide you with. There will be times where the game absolutely pisses you off and times where you'll love it to bits. Playing the game for two hours and then quitting is simply not enough to decide your thoughts about this game.To play Rust you will need time. Lots and lots of time. Rust is probably best played when you're on some sort of break or holiday from your job college or school or any responsiblities you have as Rust just needs so much time though this is mostly the case if you're playing alone as a solo you will almost always benefit from playing Rust with friends. Tell your friends to get Rust. Tell your friends of friends to get Rust. Tell your friends' families to get Rust. Once you have all join a server and start bashing rocks and build a massive ing base. The higher your numbers the higher chance you have of survival and the faster progression of tools weaponry and state of living you will experience. Attempting to play the game solo is basically hardcore mode and I wouldn't recommend it unless you enjoy dying lots falling behind in progression compared to others and being reared by Rust's community. This leads the review onto Rust's community. As you've probably gathered from other reviews they're we get it. They kill on sight murder new spawns as a sport and then think they have the right to flame in voice chat afterwards with you knowing the fact that behind that screen they're simply either some pre teen that long stroke sprinted home from school sweat covered to play with their ten man zerg or some young adult that recently gathered their only ounce of confidence from insulting others in Rust. Absolute tards however there are gems within the said community. Sometimes you'll run into a few friendly people who'll want to talk help you out or even join you on your survival adventure. But most of the times people will try to kill you as the thought of looting your lifeless corpse for your long worked for gear is greater than the incentive to be a good guy. To combat this you can simply join their ranks. Kill everyone you see take no prisoners show no remorse become a bandit. Though don't be a about it be respectful.Once you know what you're doing in the harsh world of Rust you'll find that gun fights are amazingly adrenaline packed building bases from all the resources you gathered is satisfying and simply roaming and looting is both fun and adventerous. It will probably get you addicted.Rust unfortunately has many many negative reviews that I feel to some part are unjustified as people just apparently don't want to dig for a resolution and would instead slander the very hard working devs whom of which update the game with content and fixes monthly and care about the game oh so very much. You'll find that most of the reviews complain about server loading times how hard it is to play optimisation the time you need to dedicate and the community. Let this review set these things straight In terms of server loading times there is an easy solution. Browse for other servers. It sounds dumb but it's that simple. It would seem that people especially new players try to join official servers because they're official. Don't bother. They're typically the ones that have full server slots and are filled to the brim with players that are toxic. Official servers are not user friendly and are definitely a no go for new players. Even I have never joined an official server before. I would recommend looking at community servers within the community tab in the browser if you're looking for the vanilla Rust experience. This leads onto How hard the game is to play. It is indeed a very hard game to play but there are a few options that you can choose to help you get into the game. You could begin by joining a low population or empty community server to get into grips with the mechanics of this game without the nuisance of players trying to kill you. You could also join a 'creative' server which gives you unlimited resources and can be found in the modded servers tab in the browser to work on your base building skills. The Rust wiki and watching videos also helps. The optimisation sucks in this game but turning down your graphics can actually be advantageous to your survival as there will be less clutter and noise on your screen so it's easier to spot things out. However the point of this part is to tell you about the fullscreen launch command. Rust doesn't actually run in fullscreen but instead fullscreen borderless because backend reasons. You can however force Rust to run into fullscreen mode to boost your FPS and reduce input lag. This can be done by right clicking Rust in your Steam library and pressing 'properties' pressing 'set launch options' and copying &amp pasting ' window mode exclusive' into the prompt. WIth this command Rust is forced into fullscreen mode. Beware of alt + tabbing out of Rust though there is a chance it can crash because of something something Unity engine and your desktop will probably freeze. You can try and reach the task manager to kill the Rust process but once again it'll be pretty hard to do with a frozen desktop. Just don't alt tab out and you'll be fine Rust definitely requires lots of time to get the most out of it. If you don't have loads of time to play Rust you can choose to play on modded servers which can be found in the modded tab in the browser. From there you can find servers with increased gather rates along side other things. An upped gather rate essentially increases how many resources you would obtain normally by using a multiplier. This means that you will progress significantly faster and overall do stuff in the game sooner than you would in the vanilla game. You can't really change the community of this game but you can definitely dampen the toxicity of it. By choosing the right server with the right people the dickish force the community usually throws at you can be reduced.Once everything clicks for you in Rust it'll quickly become one of your favourite games ever.P.S. No Rust will not run on your Intel Pentium and for all the people with NASA computers complaining that Rust runs at 30 FPS at lowest settings you many wanna you know get your machine checked out.

review: In the beginning I thought Rust looked really interesting and fun but I CANNOT deal with this bugty game! Literally very few mintues while exploring a crash occurs. (Red text error textures due to invalid parameter) I went online and tried to search for a solution but I couldn't find a solution. However I found many paying gamers experiencing this issue without a fix. This makes the game impossible to play! Whenever a crash occurs you go to sleep until you come back online. During this time a bear boar or another player most likely will come along and kill you. Effectly negating the time you spent gathering resources. The overall playerbase is extremely negative heartless and "repeating" raiders. Surprisingly the offical servers are worse in terms of admins and player base compared to the community run servers. For the people who have this "crashing nonstop" bug Rust becomes impossible to play. All progress will be lost if you die without a base. A base will be impossible to build if the game crashes so unpredictably every so often. I seriously wanted to enjoy Rust with my friends but it's difficult to have fun with a negative playerbase and bug crashes.
