review: so let's start the review i started playing the game on a recommendation from my two of my friends recently and started playing on a kinda small server with them (usually around 20/200 are on at most whenever i log on) there's a pretty large clan that is pretty dominating on it we built a good base so were able to hold them off after they do a good chunk of damage when they attack. the building is fun and the game can be pretty enjoyable once you get things going. however when going to a larger server the people on are almost all toxic KOS is way too common and you'd get killed even if you're naked with nothing but the rock and torch. not saying everyones toxic just today i helped out a guy and he gave me so much good stuff in return. the balance of the game is pretty bad honestly with people already being fully armored and player hunting and securing supply drops in a clan within a day of a wipe you can build a base and then come on the next day to find that your dead bed gone and base grieved if your unlucky naked and with nothing left if you are. not sure how the xp system was or the BP system was but they sound a whole lot more balanced than how the game currently is. aside from that bears glitching throught your walls into your base and killing you has gotta be fixed cause that can get frustrating quick. the live die repeat within a 10 minute span cycle due to a bad community while it can't be completely removed is a big problem. At it's current state the game is good but can be better. solo players better steer clear of this game because unless you join a clan or have friends it's gonna take you alot longer than it's worth to actually just feel safe enough to log off even only for an hour or two or being afraid to leave your house at the mere sight of another player.im not not the best at reviewing but my current verdict on the game is that it's not worth it. the gameplay and constant player KOS mindset will make you feel that the game is getting stale quite quickly and from what i've found so far is that there are other games of the same genre on steam that can be just as enjoyable if not more for those who don't like how the game is so far or are discouraged from buying it due to the current state of it but are looking for a good way to enjoy a few hours without being frustrated or paranoid that something will happen when you're gone.p.s in case someone with with something like 6k hours (and i've met a few) comes and tells me that i don't know about how to enjoy it or you gotta sink a hundred more hours into it before getting good or something NO im not gonna do that. i like playing games to relax from the stress of the day or to stave off my boredom i'll be starting university soon and for the proffession im aiming for i won't have time nor the inclination to do that. this is a new account so and i tend to hop between consoles so while it may not show i've played alot of mmo's rpgs first person and third person games to pass the time and can honestly say i don't feel as much enjoyment or accomplishment playing this game compared to others. that is my honest opinion. i'll sink more hours in this game to try and change my opinion on it but unless there's a drastic change i don't think i'll be playing it once the end of the month hits.

review: This game is realistic fun and very time consuming. Hit a tree with a rock a rock with a rock evolve to doing the same thing with rocks tied to sticks! But do I reccomend this game? No. In game you'll probably get mowed down by some people who've been on that server for a while and have guns and crossbows. Or you'll get slapped to death by a rock or a bear as you go to the bathroom or your inventory. These are mechanics of the game designed to make the game more difficult and make acheivments feel better. I actually liked these features but will never experience them again. Why? Because the game started crashing during startup conveniently after I had more than two hours of gameplay (Steam's strangely short refund time) and would not let me fix it. You can check its files restart your computer spam the "Play" button until you lose feeling in your index finger but it will still crash.I would recommend not buying this item at least until the devs solve this issue (and remove the god forsaken twig update). Who knows maybe I'll be able to play it again too.

review: People often pick on poorly optimized games.I don't since i feel as long as the game is fun then it don't matter.But how can you be developing a game since 2011 and it can't even run on even medium graphics on a nvidia 970?The game itself don't even look good and is really barebones when compared to what other survival games there are on the market it might have been on top back when it first came out but its fallen behind far behind.Ark Survival evolved is a good example a much more fleshed out crafting system runs much better (not perfect but 10x better than this) It offers a larger variety of animals and overal just looks and works better. This game is just a relic of the old days with nothing to it that makes it a worthy purchase considering the wide variety of other survival and PvP games you can pick up these days.It also don't make the game look better that its such a mess and have a crate/cosmetic microtransaction system.

review: I got somewhat 250 hours in this game and i just decided to write a review for it.Game has a lot of potential some of it hidden. Rust is better played in a group of 3 to 5 on a medium or big server with constant rivals at your doors and glitches on your back. It's been in early access for quite some time now but unlike other games this one actually has updates (weekly). Devs aren't afraid to change gameplay mechanics to see how it plays out in the end this is Early Access after all. So how's the game up close?Gameplay is simple in its basics. Just survive. Kill build (optionally tho you can even survive without a base) farm (a lot especially if you're alone) and do whatever you want. Currenly as of beginning of 2017 there is no end game content or any specific objective to do. Most people tend to raid once they have reached a certain level of development some just build the biggest and baddest base around and stay in it occasionally killing someone from their roof and most of the players are engaged in pvp content whether they want it or not. No one is protected from having his аss handed to him just because he made a wrong turn in the forest and walked up on a gang of 3 ruskies with ak's and full armor. This is why the game is best played in group that way you can have an actual objective in game to have fun together instead of just building a base or raiding someone.Graphics optimisation all of that are changing constantly and for some the game would be unplayable but that's only if you have a very old pc. Currenly i'd have about 40 fps on high on r9 270x and i5. But since it's early access and unity together means that there are a lot of bugs and nothing can save you if you suddenly freeze during a firefight. Happens occasionally.Sound eh it's alright. Music eh turned it off.Potential a lot if devs keep on updating as they are game will (probably... hopefully) leave ea with a lot of content and ready to conquer steam charts.

review: This is the best open world MP survival ive ever played.pros 1) Huge open world (procedurally generated)2) can build bases from gathered resources (wood stone metal fragments etc.)3) lots of servers (official community and modded)4) easy crafting system You need to collect blueprints to unlock crafting recepies however you do get basic ones by default.(NOW REPLACED BY XP SYSTEM)Loads of craftable weapons like thomson shotguns assault riffle rocket launcher semi automatics and even hunting bows. You dont rely on chance of getting loot like in DayZ for example.5) good graphics and sounds6) Realistic gameplay No zombies in this one. watch out for wild animals and players.You can die from starvation dehydration bleeding cold wildlife drowning bullet to the face helicopter to the face...and more...Swimming will make you wet and freeze you faster.7) Only EARLY ACCESS game that is worth getting out there devs release updates every week and are constantly working on improving the game.cons 1) unstable client (can crash every 5 to 60 minutes) which gets annoying after a while.2) buggy animals They can get stuck in a place and do nothing untill provoked.They can glide throught the terrain being unable to get hit by you.Bears will sneak up on you and stab you in the back when youre chopping some wood...3) The client isnt optimised very well. im getting about 50 80 fps with lowest settings on a dual core g3258 4.2ghz and 2gb Vram as well as 8gb RAM comparing it to "mad Max" for example which runs at 100 130 fps at lowest settings and looks 10x better.

review: Rust is an open world survival game that runs on servers rather than multiplayer adding an interesting twist on the gameplay. It's a game that whilst many people complain of its lack of safety and its constant PvP disallowing you from any sort of steady and safe gameplay I believe that Rust is a game that really displays human instinct at it's purest. WHen faced with a situation where the other person has a gun and might either be trying to make peace or trying to kill you your instincts tend to give you the choices to react rather than your logical thinking making quite interesting and tense gameplay especially when every corner you turn could be your last depending on what you find around it. The game is by no means faced paced or action based although certain situations may require some fast thinking before you get shot for all of your items. The game primarily revolves around collecting resources to build a house to survive the various enemies in the open world and to defend yourself from any wandering players who may fancy an extra item or two in their backpack preying on the newer players. Form relationships and alliances with other players build a house together topossibly get backstabbed and stolen from later on! Hire somebody as a mercenary and loot radiation zones full of zombies together! Be a bandit and blow your way through other players' doors with explosive charges to get at their secret stash of guns and loot! Build and impregnable metal fortress in the center of a field commanding attention and respect from all! Or build your house far out of the resource zone in the barren plateau or high up in the mountains where nobody would ever find you! The possibilities are endless in the massive world of Rust.
title: Rust

review: As of today 1 20 16 with over 150+ hours I cannot endorse this game. I endorse the potential but the game itself is shallow and lacks any form of immersion or character.Rust is currently a player survival simulator. In the beginning of the game you will spend a great deal of time gathering materials by (1) using tools to gather them directly from nodes or (2) killing other players you find walking around and taking their stuff. After you finish gathering materials you will ultimately craft weapons to kill other players. That is the end game of Rust in its current state and honestly that has been the end game of Rust since its creation.GAMEPLAY CRAFTINGThe crafting system in Rust is shallow but effecient. It lacks any form of character to separate itself from other games such as Minecraft Reign of Kings 7 Days to Die or any other "survival sim" on the market currently. Objects require a minimum number of materials and you select what you want to craft from a list on the side of the screen. If you have it you can craft it. Materials are readily available throughout the randomly generated maps. Need fuel? Need wood? Need metal? Have no fear because material nodes have no fixed spawn points. You can literally live in a hole and never have to travel anywhere in particular to obtain special resources other than blueprints.The blueprint system Rust employs makes it a bit more involved which is a good thing. You go to monument/dungeon sites on the map such as an abandoned trainyard and collect actual blueprints or blueprint fragments which you then study to add craftable items to your crafting list. Blueprint fragments can be used to learn low level items or upgraded multiple times each time giving you a rarer blueprint opportunity. At first this is exciting as you lurk through abandoned buildings trying to learn new things to craft while you hear gunshots and people killing eachother around you (if you play on a populated server). After a few hours of gameplay constantly obtaining new blueprints you are done with this portion of the game. You will be able to craft gear that can effectively kill other players and that's what the game boils down to.GAMEPLAY PVPThere is no PVE in this game. Starving to death is not possible unless you intentionally avoid every opportunity thrown at you to not starve. You could die to a bear in the game but once you get even the basic revolver bears are a joke.Your life will be taken by other players and you will take their lives as well. Repeatedly. In its current state you do not need top tier firearms to kill other players who are wearing full armor. You could potentially end someones life with a bow even from the beginning of the game if your aim is alright. Put any firearm in the hands of a decent FPS player and the game quickly revolves around just landing your hits no matter what weapon you use. I have killed people with the waterpipe shotgun (basic weapone veryone can craft) while they used fully automatic rifles. And to be fair it is VERY EASY to obtain fully automatic rifles even on vanilla non modded servers. Just travel to a monument/dungeon while completely naked and open boxes. Eventually you will find the blueprint for the firearm itself. Bam. Done. Now you just get some metal from any rock on the map and craft a gun. Proceed to murder. Done with the game. GG.GAMEPLAY CONSTRUCTIONRust has moved away from cube building to fixed object construction. Minecraft for example uses cube construction. So does Reign of Kings. In Rust you lay down a foundation object which can only be placed at certain elevations and build adjacent to that elevation. It essentially tells the game what level is the ground floor or "level 0" on a plane. Keep in mind that foundations have to be a certain distance from the ground. It becomes extremely difficult to construct *meaningful* structures with this system. Because of that bases repeatedly look the same over and over and over. All of them are the same ugly flat pieces of planks/stone/sheet metal. You lay foundation select the wall option put walls up put whatever up and all of them are the same.At first you may be tempted to construct a building with separate rooms for all of your operations. This is stupid unless you don't care about losing your stuff. The only way to destroy a player made building that is protected by a toolbox (Rust's version of a protection block in Minecraft) is to use C4. This explosive might seem rare in the beginning but can be easily obtained by running naked to dungeons and hitting random boxes until you find the blueprints. Any building made out of wood can be destroyed by hand made tools. This automatically removes wood as a viable structure because anyone can break into your home. Stone requires C4 to be destroyed. But only 2 of them. If you only have 1 layer of walls anyone with the blueprint for C4 can just blow open a wall and take your stuff. This means everyone builds two types of structures TOWERS and HONEYCOMB bases. A tower is just...a bunch of levels going up with doors at every level. A honeycomb base just has door after door after door. Both of these attempt to force raiders to use all of their C4 before reaching any of the real loot.Think about that. The number one way to defend your base is to force the enemy to use waste all of their ammo. And it doesn't work. C4 is easy to craft for anyone who has an hour to gather materials. Let alone a group of people working together.IMMERSION Everything in Rust lacks character. The first time you walk through a trainyard or water treatment plant might seem amazing. But after an hour or two you quickly feel as though everything lacks a soul. It is hard to describe. Nothing feels valuable in the game itself. You cannot craft any objects which might feel like you belong to the world. Chairs tables bathrooms aesthetic objects etc. are almost non existant. You can craft a very limited number of clothing pieces (some of which you can now buy on the market for real life money by the way$$$!!!). You can craft placeable signs but why? All the ones I have seen are filled with bad drawings or just telling you to die in a fire. As of right now there is essentially no RP server and I do not see how you could even have one.PC REQUIREMENTS For some reason even fully tricket out computers can have problems running this game. If you have 4GB of RAM do not even bother trying to run it. I have played this with 4GB of RAM and with higher end PCs. Something is wrong when a game like Minecraft can give Rust a run for its money in the graphics department after downloading a texture pack. All while running far better. If you have a minimum requirement crap computer you should totally expect 5 10 minute loading screens with studder lag all over the place.OVERALL Rust sucks. I'd rather eat burnt toast. If you just want to run around the map looking to shoot another player who doesn't know you are there then sure buy the game. The combat is not particularly difficult to master for anyone who plays FPS games. If you are looking for something that has a soul and depth pass this up for another 2 years until they actually create a game with it.

review: Years ago when rust came out as early access i was extremely excited and bought it in the first week as i am a big lover of survival mmo's. It was buggy and needed so much work but i could say "yea work in progress" and i spent a ridiculous amount of time playing the game. I loved raiding being raided and running for air drops with awesome alliances and teams. I have to say it has been some time since then and i decided to revisit the game hoping to have some of my good old rust fun times. Hahaha was I misguided and naively hopeful! I ran the game to then have it crash at the loading screen three times! when i eventually loaded up a server I found it to be ridiculously jittery and unplayable so I went to change my settings in graphics and guess what...... it crashed again! After many attempts I have decided to give up on ever being able to play this game again. Maybe it's my graphics card maybe the game is just poorly optimized but there's no flipping way I'm going to sit here trying to get it to work. I am so disappointed as i really did believe this game to be so full of potential and promise only to find something worse than the starting product! Seriously it's pretty shocking there are other survival mmo games out there that are well worth the money. Do not buy this failure of a game. I may be being overly critical but i used to enjoy this game so much and now I'm struggling to play it.

review: This may be one of the most brutal games I have ever played. First ill talk about the game itself or the idea of the game the game is fun at first. As the game goes you work really hard to get the things you want like guns and stuff but its pretty well impossible to get them because every time you find one a few seconds later there is a group of guys well equipped that kill you for what you ask? For the possibility that you have something good on you witch they probably already have or better. Anyways after hours of playing this game maybe even days you may have something decent going or so you though you did until someone comes along and EASILY destroys your house and takes all your stuff using the overpowered C4 or rocket launchers and for what? Just to cause you misery so there you have to restart all over again... fun stuff. If that hasn t made you not like this game yet then maybe I should tell you that the servers all do a blueprint clear about every month so that means all the thing you thought where solid and couldn t be taken away from you is now magically gone including your house... if it already haven t been raided. Now onto the technical part of the game they have a TONE! of bugs and problems to work out and i understand that it may still be in alpha but that makes the price of the game really unjustified and overpriced the game at this point is maybe worth 5$. And lastly the people The people that play this game are real holes they will kill you for no good reason and will destroy everything you have for fun then as your dying you get to listen to them trash talk you.

review: For my first hundred hours I played on a community server learning the ropes. However I didn't like the 2 week blueprint wipe it had in place so I changed to official servers primarily UK2.To my great disappointment it kept on going offline over and over again for no estimated time. Developers are silent nobody knows for sure what is going on. The same is happening with other official servers like EU 1 2 3 or UK 1 2 3 likely some others too. This is apparently happening for some years now.While servers going offline is an entirely normal thing lack of communication and explanations of any sort from Facepunch is not and is saddening in the very least. As I write this UK2 spent 3 hours online and 54 hours offline in the past three days without any feedback whatsoever.The game itself is great but their server handling is extremely poor.

review: Rust by far has the most potential of any game I have ever played. The evolving plotlines within this sandbox world are dynamic and real. This game will immerse you. It is worth every penny. That all having been said... these are some of the problems I have seen while playing Rust I hope the devs will focus on these soon.1. Hackers2. FPS drops during firefights3. Movement and actions reloading and using certain items can be unreliable at times.4. The grind... the vanilla game is a full time job wether your solo or in a large group. I spend more time wacking trees managing furnaces / quarries crafting gunpowder armor and weapons then I ever do actually playing. For those of you looking to buy this is an awesome game with a truly hardcore spirit. This game will teach you things about yourself.One more thing and it's important... this is the only early access title that hasnt burnt me. The devs are upfront and honest and puttting out content every week.

review: This game is not that great. However it's one of those games that draws you in making you spend more time in it than you realise. At the time I thought that the bugs and terrible AI were acceptable because it was early access. The problem is these problems still persist months after release. After revisiting Rust after 2 months I expected big changes and wonderful new weapons and gameplay elements. Nope. The game was pretty much the same. If you wish to play with friends as a one of thing it's good for that. The spark doesn't last long because of lack of updates making the game feel repetitive.If the game went through good updates making new features I would recommend it the fact it's barely changed after months makes me not hopeful about the future of the game.

review: Si te gustan los juegos donde perderás una cantidad increíble de tiempo enviciandote este es el indicado...!El juego constantemente esta actualizando lleva en su fase alpha mucho tiempo hemos visto muchos cambios a lo largo del tiempo algunos para bien y otros no tanto pero bueno esa es la idea del "juego con acceso anticipado".Su interfaz y modo de juego no es para nada complicada basta ver un pequeño tutorial de lo mas básico y estaras listo.La cantidad de servidores disponibles es impresionante lo cual es bastante bueno y malo ya que a veces tardaras en encontrar el servidor mas adecuado a tus gustos pero una vez encontrado no pararás de acumular horas.Hay un detalle en cuanto a la optimización del juego y ahí desde siempre rust se ha visto en problemas es algo exigente así que si quieres tener una grata experiencia del juego lo mejor será que te informes sobre las especificaciones mínimas necesarias.La comunidad dentro del juego es sumamente variable desde el personaje pacífico hasta aquel que apenas spawnea y ya te quiere matar con una roca así como de muy variadas edades (si hay ratas).En conclusión vale la pena comprarlo y tienes una amplia cantidad de videos en internet para poder darte mas idea de lo que es rust pero aun así siempre acabas descubriendo mas cosas...

review: Rust is a first person multiplayer game the game is currently in Alpha but it is become an amazing first person survivla game.In rust you spawn wiht a rock and gather resources to buil tools hunt build bases find guns hunt and of course kill and raid other people.Graphics Facepunch studios did an amazing job wiht the graphics and has some of the best grass i have ever seeeen.The gfx lighting and shading of shadows adn textures is simply outstanding.Combat Combat is an incredibly fun option in rust weapons can be found in wepaon crates or in blueprints which you study to build the object in the blueprint.guns have recoil on them making it harder to aim and guns can be equipped wiht mods to help in combat if it has any mod slots on it of course.Experience I have had a great experience playing rust and from the moment i bought it i loved the game instantly.rust has proven to be good and cannot wait to see what it will be like in the full version.

review: This game as of writing this review is still in Beta.But even though it is still in beta it is by far the most feature rich of any of the survival games.Performance is getting better with each update they do while the graphics are among the best of the survival games too.If you want to build pretty houses and cool stuff then go to private servers because on public servers you will either get raided the minute you log off or you'll be shot on sight just for mining rocks while naked.The servers are force wiped every month so keep that in mind.EDIT The game is taking a long time to get fully released however they are doing really good work with updates i just fear it may be too late and the playerbase will get bored before all the content is added thats just my speculation though.TL DR If you want a hardcore survival game where everyone shoots on sight then this is your best bet.

So you try and gather some wood but just when you're about to get the last of the wood from the tree it crashes on you again. The Expiremental version handles it much better but there is no easy way to know if you're starving and I couldn't find an animal to eat. And stay away from the test levels because if you go in one you will probably spawn in some weird prison with others and if you get out you will be killed immediately. I was pumped to play this game but with so many crashes with no help I wouldn't reccomend it to anyone until it gets fixed.

review: You wake up on a beach hungry thirsty no clothes no weapons no hope a rock and torch on your belt is all you have to build one of the safest places for you and your to be friends and acquaintances.This game teaches persistence not giving up when you have to grind and to take charge of your life and sometime of others as well. While there are no objectives in the game I felt it was normal for me to ask of a well off guy to provide me with 'employment' I get him wood and stone in consideration of food and shelter tools to be provided and maintained by the employer.This employer can be a slave driver or a leader s/he can help you grow into making your own base or just leave you to fend yourself when there is a raid.Everything happens without any objective or guidance. You are in the game world like you are in the real world more vulnerable as there is no family or protection that a child usually recevies until he is eased into the real life. This is the beauty of the game.

review: Rust a game that should be out of alpha by now is in my experience a terrible game.Let me tell you why.I joined an official server like normal. Started running around for wood finding it difficult to find trees (it being dark didn't help either but I could see silhouettes). I proceeded to use that wood to craft a camp fire. That's the first task list done.Then comes an even bigger problem. Now I need to find stone which is even harder to find. I found plenty of sulfur and metal but no stone.Then after dying 3 4 times to other players and 30 minutes of playing I finally find stone. Unfortunately at this point I stopped caring about the game.The pace was completely ruined and there was no enjoyment to be had.Not to mention how completely starved the server was.Trees were few and far between and stone was nowhere to be found. Oh and not a single animal was seen during my play session.While I was told it was only a few days from "wipe day" which is apparently where the servers reset making all progress on the server moot and frankly making anything done in the game pointless. I must admit all interest I may have had for this game is gone. It may have been a sour first impression but I did not find my time here enjoyable in the slightest.I'm sure "end game" is infinitely better but when the servers aren't set up to allow new players to get a foot in the door once the server has been going for some time then I'm unsure whether that'll ever be something I'll experience.In conclusion I would rate this game 1/10 simply due to there being no enjoyment to be had during my session with the game.

review: This is a story of a man's first days in Rust.Day 1 I woke up to find myself in a place that I have never seen before. I found a man with clothes and a gun he told me to come with me or he'll shoot me. I didn't have much to loose but I followed anyway. He took me up a mountain and put me in a room I couldn't escape from until he came to give me food when I killed him with my rock. I took his stuff and walked down his hallway to get out of the house. The man came back and tried to shoot me but I was too fast for him and beat him with my rock for a second time. I found his bed and shot it until it disappeared. Under it I found a small bag with a better gun and bullets. I then broke out of the prison and used the wood I found in his base to make me a big house.Day 2 I was walking about when I saw a bear trying to kill a naked man so I ran over to help. My first 2 bullets killed the man and the bear was saved. But then the bear betayed me and tried to eat my leg so I shot it in the leg until it died. I used my rock to harvest chicken from the bear and I got enough cloth to make a sleeping bag and put it in my house. Day 3 I was in a town which give me loads of radiation posioning and I had an idea. I rounded up all the naked men near the town and got them to run around it until they died. One of them tried to kill me and was shouting into his mic "I'm going to kill you " I shot him in the knee and forced him to kill his friend who was running round the town looking for pills. After a minute he also died of radiation posioning. Day 3/4 I woke up during the middle of the night to a ticking noise coming from outside my house. Some people were blowing up my door! I grabed my m4 and put a flashlight on it and crept downstairs. When they got into my house I walked behind them as they each went into different rooms. The first one thought I was in his team before I caved in his skull with my hatchet. The second one was shooting my sleeping bag so I waited until he turned around before I shot him with my m4. The third one tried to call for help when he saw me. He only had a stone and some cloth armour so I took him prisoner. He kept telling me how his buddy's were gonna come kill me but I would shoot him with my bow if he didn't stop. I keep feeding him and making sure he dosen't die.110/100 Great game
title: Rust

review: Product received for free. After around an hour and a half of bad spawns scarce resources and short lived ventures into the more inhabited areas of the map I ran into the first friendly player I had met in Rust. I had initially spotted him pretty far away but I paid no real notice to him as he had a rock equipped. Eventually he got close enough for us to clearly see each other and upon the realization that neither of us were hostile we both pulled out torches as a mutual sign of peace (or the highest possible level of non aggression that can exist in Rust). I dropped my old hatchet for him as I had just finished crafting one with metal and he gave me some food as a sign of good faith. After nearly 30 minutes of searching and scavenging we had pooled enough resources to craft us each some minimally decent gear. We knew that if we wanted to progress any further we would need to mine boulders and a lot of them. I used what remaining materials we had to put together a 9mm handgun and several bullets though I reminded him it was only in case we really needed it. I had decided earlier during my many unwanted experiences with bullets to the face that I would try my hardest not to run around slaughtering every newly spawned player that I came across. A few minutes out from camp we had encountered a player with a hunting bow. I had been running with my hatchet out so I quickly took out the handgun in my inventory and pointed it in his direction attempting to scare him away. When the player was far enough away we continued up a road towards a few stones. The area was surrounded by trees so I opted to stand guard with the handgun while my friend mined. Just as we were moving on to the next boulder I heard the gunfire start. I turned around to see a player with an assault rifle gunning down my friend and before I could land any shots on him he had already begun shooting me. It was at that moment that I remembered I hadn't even crafted a sleeping bag for the camp as that was one of the objectives of the trip we were taking. I typed into the chat thanking the friend I had made for all of his help and asking the player who had killed us if we had been intruding in his area or something along those lines. He simply wrote "Sorry guys D" This is the single problem that I have with games like this. Why does it have to be "shoot on sight?" That player had obviously taken us by surprise and was better equipped than us. Even if he had a justifiable reason for approaching two very poorly equipped players (which he really didn't considering we were in the middle of the woods and he had pretty much all of the gear you could need in this game) he could have easily told us to cooperate by either putting away our weapons or just leaving the area. But of course he comes around sees some players trying to gather enough supplies to get to a stable point in the game and decides to go out of his way to approach us and use unecessary ammo for a hatchet and a handgun with four bullets. Then to add even more of an insult he adds an apology at the end as if he had no choice but to shoot two unexpecting half naked unprepared players. All in all though I do see a lot of potential in this game and the good in the community does shine through every once in a while. I just wish that people would realize that they don't need to go around killing players who haven't had the chance to experience the game. People like that are the single reason why so many players on steam feel that they wasted money on what would otherwise be a great experience.

review: This game is awesome Rust can seem very hard for first time players but just hang on and you will get the jist of things. Im going to share my like and dislikes about Rust. LIKES Tons of different servers you get to choose your own pace such as modded servers community servers or just plain vanilla. Rust is very addicting if you like it the mechanics of this game pulled me in the second I layed my hands on the keyboard. "Imagination is key" Rust lets you use your imagination what I mean is your base can be themed you can have a fireplace with a rug in front of it a grill outside you can make a kitchen if you want maybe even a family room with a christmas tree. The point im making is rust gives you the simple freedoms of building your base the way you want you just got to work for it. Rust has absolutly amazing PVP if thats what your into some servers are dedicated to PVP Battle Royal. In Rust you have a varity of weapons. Tons of different types of guns traps and melee weapons ROCKET LAUNCHERS AS WELL! My favorite part of rust is the occasional raiding ill do once in a while just to get stuff without working for it. UPDATES Rust has been very clever on what to add in the game the past few months. FULL MOON I love rust added this night doesnt have to be dreadful. Before they added this I had to wait in my base during the night. I would even pull out my phone to pass the time.DISLIKES The Blueprint system is very clever rust made it so everyone doesn't have an advantage but in my opinion some of the item such as metal hatchets are a pain to get sometimes but you will most likey find a hatchet in a crate instead of finding the blueprint itself. I think the blueprint system should be only used for guns or explosives. LADDERS I think ladders should be put in the TC mechanics it's annoying seeing other peoples ladders on my base. HUNGER this is not a huge deal but I always find myself in need of food way to fast. I recently found out that people can access your research table and workbenches through walls rust needs to fix this.Overall Rust is my go to game

review: An amazing immersive game that I would recommend to anyone. When you spawn run immediately to a tree and chop as much wood as you can with your hand rock then mine some rock with the hand rock when you have 50 wood build a wooden shelter. Another 30 wood will get you a door. This is a basic guide to your first shelter in rust. Unless you have a bow or a gun stay away from other players (unless you know them) bears or wolves. With your hand rock hunt for some pigs or elks these are great sources of food and material to build a bow/sleeping bag. When you have enough fabric build a bow. With this bow you should be able to take on wolves (if you're brave then you can try taking on a bear) and other weak players. Until you build or find a gun stay away from other players who do have guns. 99.9% of the time they will be trolls and kill you on sight. Gather resources to build bigger safer houses raid buildings kill players and upgrade your technology to stay alive. Good luck buy rust.

review: As someone who has played since the early early days of rust legacy in 2013 I can tell you the game has had its ups and downs not only that buts its entirely different from its origional form and has been at the forefront of survival PvP development. Now days Rust is a hybrid of nearly everything it has been slowly improving and filling out the development until its completion. I am currently writing this review at the time of the Blueprint/ component update and I would like to say this is the best version of rust I have played in a long long time. But there are some drawbacks the game has been out for a long time so people treat it like science they know exactly what to go for and how to do it fast so building and raiding is a bit unforgiving. The community can be a bit toxic and there are the occasional hacker on servers (most if not all are community driven). Overall Rust is a fantastic game and id gave it a 8.5/10 for all its worth.

review: I've been playing Rust for about 3 years now I started with Legacy and now I'm on the current iteration. The game has a lot of potential however the creator of the game Garry Newman is an alcoholic and literally tells his playerbase to stop playing this game. It has been in Alpha forever with no Beta release in sight. You can spend money on skins though! The community is pretty toxic I have made a few friends along the way but the majority of players are the kind that get off on griefing others. Base sabotaging item despawning naked killing racist/homophobic trash talking and just general cancerous attitudes are prevalent. You have to be in a group to get anything done otherwise you will die from pvp or raiding. Solo players be ed as far as Garry is concerned. Animals they run through walls into boulders into your base and they can hit you from 15 feet away. They literally programmed the A.I. to detect when they are in a headshot crosshair and to move the opposite way. You can make a horse do the friggan two step with a bolt action rifle from a mile away. Bears and wolves somehow know to avoid running directly at you when you have a gun but if you are a naked with a spear they will maul you from out of nowhere. The game development is fragmented as hell with Garry and his team seemingly ignoring most players requests and releasing whatever the hell they feel is important at the time. Weekly Dev notes include a lot of "we did this obscure computer programming to fix something that we ed up so that we can put something we know you don't want into the game a year from now" and "we know you won't like it but that's tough quot . I'm talking about skins and the component system which requires you to bang on barrels for hours. That is no exaggeration you can spend HOURS banging barrels just to find a scrap you need to make a certain weapon. I've had a lot of fun with Rust and I've always hoped it would keep improving I feel like I was the victim of a very long cruel joke.

review: This game from anew players point of view not a veteran is great! Many complain about the clans ruining it etc well yes and no. Lets back up.You start the game with little skill a rock (mine and cut trees) and torch for night time. You skill up and build a base. At first it will be basic and yes it will be raided quick. Just dont put too much effort into a base until you can build metal doors and combination locks. At that point even as a solo player you can build a decent base that will put off most raiders. DO NOT put all your items in one base build more than one. Have a drop box in a bush away from your base with basic survival gear.Just a little though and a solo player can make this game great fun also start to learn how to build traps and incorporate traps and lures into your bases. Or just build a trap house )It is fun but be warned Rust is a hostile environment and you will find a lot of effort will be ruined by other players. Accept it and move on you will soon be doing the same to others!

review: I've put over 300+ hours into this game and I have absolutely loved it. The BP system works well but has its own flaws. There'd be times that a friend and I would run to Power Plant in search of Pipe Shotguns and Revolvers but only find barricades and planter box BPs. The community blows major as well. You have too many whiny 12 year olds that found this game from Youtubers like Vertiigo or Ser Winter nothing against the Youtubers and people who will door camp you for hours on end. I understand that it's a part of the game but it is utterly annoying. Currently the servers seemed to be either under a DDOS attack or FacePunch has terrible servers. I went to US West 3 because US West 2 has been shutting down for hours randomly and it was quite irritating. As I join US West 3 the server shuts down and has still been down for 20+ minutes.Overall the game is an amazing game and definitly gets the blood pumping. In its current state though it isn't worth the 20$. You may be able to find some good community servers or modded servers but the vanilla experience is the way to go.

review: I hardly ever leave reviews so this means that I either really enjoyed Rust or really despised it.It's the latter sadly. I tried for a very long time to like this game but I can't force it. It's like a horrible on off relationship.Unlocking cool blueprints is fun server wiping and losing everything is not. When there's a cool update I try to join in the fun having to ignore abuse russian and russian abuse hurled at me. I try to avoid servers with hackers which usually results in me playing by myself. However the gender forcing update has turned me away from this game completely. This has nothing to do with sexism or misogyny. I just feel that choices like this belong in the hands of the players.In short I do not recommend this game there are beter places to spend your money if you want a survival game a decent community experience and the freedom to evolve your character as you wish.

review: this game is what you look for in a survival game. yet it is only still in an alpha. This game is a cross from dayz and minecraft a lot like how 7 days to die is except this is more of a dayz type of a game then a building aspect game. The game is worth the $20 since the amount of gameplay that you get out of playing it since you start to become emersed in the game as if you where surviving. as i say that this game aint for someone who just has time here and there if you are going to play this game you will want to have at least a week of spare time to play it to the fullest. this is like 3 5hours a night if not more if you are going all out. With new updates every week or so this game has new things in it for you to discover as you build and thrive. you also know there will be a lot more content to come as its being made by garry (the dude who made g mod) so always be expectiong more. All in all if you are looking for a survival game this is it.

review: The game is disgusting. For the time this game is in development 20 bucks are pure rip off. Played the game the first time when it was new on Steam quitted because of all the griefers and raids while being offline. The day before yesterday I reinstalled it to give it a new chance because there indeed some greater changes. Except of the performance which is still awful. And not to forget to mention the attack helicopter. It shoots equipped players (with three or more clothings and/or a ranged weapon) and attacks bases (to work against "campers"). No equipment allowed? No base allowed? So what is the sense behind this game then?This game is just terrible I wish I could flag it somehow so people get a warning before buying it!Das Spiel ist grauenhaft. Für die lange Zeit die es nun schon in Entwicklung ist 20 Euro zu verlangen ist purer Wucher. Habe das Spiel erstmals gespielt als es noch neu auf Steam erschien gequittet wegen der ganzen Griefer und den Raids während man offline war. Vorgestern neu installiert um ihm eine zweite Chance zu geben da sich ja einiges daran getan hat. Außer der Performance die ist immernoch genauso grottig. Dazu nun die Neuerung des Attack Helikopters. Er schießt auf ausgerüstete Spieler und deren Basen. Wozu dann eine Bauen? Wozu looten? Das Spiel hat dadurch keinen Sinn mehr.Einfach grauenhaft ich wünsche man könnte es flaggen damit andere Leute vor dem Kauf gewarnt werden!

review: TL DR Imagine Rust is DayZ but every other player is a bandit and you have a radar stuck to you This game is promising but the experience of being a new player is so painful that It makes me not want to learn how to play and that was while I was on a tiny 15 person max server. I would only recommend this game to a person who is willing to go through 150+ hours of torture to even be able to protect yourself.Base building is nice but PVP is where the really hits the fan Nobody in this game has any mercy or sense of decency at all to the point where 80% of the people on most servers are willing to camp at spawn beaches and snipe new players if given the chance. On top of that It's stupidly hard to kill or even defend yourself from a top tier experienced player (compared to how easy it is for you to be killed) you'll be dead before you can manage to fire your first arrow/ bullet which leads me to the topic of the hit reg. While looking at the game's engine from a purely observational view it's pretty good. Once it's being put to the test in a real game however that's when you see flaws. This may have just bene bad experiences but Every time I've gotten into a firefight with anyone the enemy has always twitched around faster than I could move my sights which could just be a sensitivity issue but I doubt it.

review: This game has given me some of the most memorable moments in gaming. Me and my work buddies still talk about stuff that happened 3 4 years ago in this game. The human element of this game makes for very unique experiences. There have been very few times in my 20s where I am playing a game as the sun is setting and still playing as the sun is rising and every time it has been with this game. You can play for 12 hours straight and when you get off it is not because you really wanted to you are just starting to feel like a irresponsible scumbag and have to make sure your wife didn't leave you. I would say though there is little chance of you experiencing the full magic of this if you play by yourself. Recruit a few buddies and set aside a weekend or two and you will know what I am talking about.

review: I got this game when it was early access. When it was early access this game was 20 or something bucks. I got it on sale when it was 10 dollars because that is how much I think this game is honestly worth. Rust just pushed out of early access It's nice that they got out of early access but this game still feels incomplete. Seems like they pushed out of early access to boost the prices of the game. Now you gotta pay 35 bucks because it's a "complete" game now. Game began to recieve hate because of tool cupboard that punished players if they did not constantly join and play the game which I think is kinda stupid. At least have a base wipe function if someone hasn't played the game for a week or so and is inactive but doing this forces me too constantly add materials. Also part of the reason I stopped playing this game is because I built a really cool base but forgot to add materials joined the next day and everything was broken as if someone bombed the out of it. I feel that the tool cupboard function should be removed or at least have it so I don't have to shove in so many resources that I gather on my own...

review: "how do I optimize" the gameeven after the full release they havent optimized this game MINIMUM specs are an INTEL CORE I7 and 8 GB RAM. To make things worse the recommended specs are a better I7 model an GTX 980 and 16 GB RAM. Almost nobody has a $1000+ PC because no other game requires specs this high.You might notice my 17 hours played. Barely any of that was spent playing the game. Almost all of it was loading screens. When you open up a server the game runs EVERY SINGLE ASSET IN THE GAME before you can play. My first time playing it took 2 hours for the game to load. Every time after that it has taken me one hour to load a single server. What if you pick the wrong server? Click cancel! Oh wait every time you try to cancel the game crashes. Fun.I'll update my review when they make this game accessible to people other than patricians which is never. Learn how to optimize or hire some better developers.

review: Género Es un juego de supervivencia donde empezás sin nada y tendrás que ir consiguiendo materiales para poder sobrevivir crafteando podrás construir una fortaleza armas cazar animales y enfrentarte a otros jugadores. Historia ( 1)Carece de historia. Gráficos (4/5)Calidad gráfica muy variable dependiendo de la versión del juego en las primeras era aceptable y se podía correr en una pc con recursos medios/bajos pero en las nuevas actualizaciones sólo se puede jugar en una pc de gama alta mejorando los gráficos pero no creo que justifique por la calidad final. Jugabilidad (4/5)Shooter en primera persona muy bien equilibrado y con diversidad de mapas diversos tipos de misiones y accesorios para el personaje/arma. Resumen (3/5)Lo jugué desde las primeras a las últimas versiones y desde la BETA y puedo decir que es un gran juego hay muchísimos servidores pero es un juego que puede cambiar de un momento a otro y hay que jugarlo con dos condiciones 1) Jugarlo con un team de amigos porque las 24hs van a atentar contra tu jugador que si muere pierde todo lo que tiene equipado.2) Dedicar muchas horas en recolección de items y equipado de tu casa porque también es muy facil sufrir un raideo y que en unos minutos te desarmen la fortaleza.Pese a que es un juego que recomiendo y me parece muy entretenido se termina volviendo un juego muy monótono y resulta aburrido en un momento.

review: The game isn't worth it. 1. The game is still in its "beta " stage which should technically be called "alpha"2. It's a terrible version of Day Z/War Z with a terrible building feature attached to it. 3. Terrible community 4. No supervision5. Nothing to do6. game is choppy and full of lagIf you would like to read my rambling on these issues please keep reading. If not you got the point. There are only 3 ways to survive in the world. 1. Be one of the first ones to own the game (or be one of the first ones on a new server)2. Work together with a massive group of your friends (don't trust anybody else in rust)3. Hack I included the last part because hacking is all you see in the public servers. Hackers rarely get banned even if it was obviously hacking (example killing everybody in the world at once).Players must also be on several hours every day in order to not lose everything. Buildings will decay after 1 day and players will constantly attack your buildings. It's not a game worth spending an hour on why would I want to spend hours each day? Now let's talk about the community. It's TERRIBLE. It is far from a noob friendly environment. The servers are full of veteran players hunting down noobs cursing and harassment. Since these veterans are well ahead of most people in the game they go around using C4 on almost everything and will destroy your buildings everytime. There are no mods/admins to help you out and no matter what happens (harassment hacking) you're on your own. There is nothing to do in the game. The map stays constant (different servers don't have different maps). You can run around the whole island in about 20mins so you know it's a small map. This forces players to build close to one another and the limited resources instills an agressive nature in everybody. Rust prides itself on the "building" aspect but this just adds to the poor quality of the game. There is no elaborate building structure you can make. Resources are scarce and it takes too much to build anything. Players attack each other's structures so there's always pathching up to do. After the first few people on the server acquire C4 the server is done. The same people will control all the resources and there is no progress for everybody else. There is also no end game and once you build your structure that's all there is to it. The rate of decay is soo high that if you're away from the computer for more than 1 day you lose EVERYTHING.Lastly the game is just made poorly. The graphics are plain and look like something from the late 90s. The player motion is choppy and movement is unnatural. Melee fighting is not an option because it's so choppy shotguns or guns with high fire rate can only guarantee your opponents death. Well just don't buy it.

review: It was a late afternoon at the nuclear power plant... I was looking for gear in this seemingly abandoned area when I heard a distinctive sound of a chopper nearby. I quickly ran into one of the buildings thinking hopefully it wouldn't spot me and gun me down where I stood. I was on the second floor by the window when I heard a person screaming over their mic getting mowed down by the helocopter. I felt bad for them even though i knew they would probably kill me the second they knew of my existence... I thought he had died. A few minutes passed until I heard footsteps across the hall. He... Miraculously survived. My thinking was cut short when I realized he was running at me with a shotgun in his hands I screaming in the mic "OH GOD PLEASE NO" as I ran down the hallway getting shot once and losing more than half of my health... I found a crack in the building and hopped out of their getting the hell out with the chopper still above looking for prey whilst the man who tried to shoot me said" Come back mien Fuhrer we must finish the third reich" Knowing I would get ripped to shreds if I stayed out for longer I had to go into a building connected to the one with the crazed psychopath that tried to kill me. I ran to the second floor into a broken pipe system ran to the very end where I found a man with only a rock and torch. He greeted me nicely at which point I told him to shut the up because we were bieng hunted by a madman. He didn't take my advice of hiding still and moments after he walked out of the pipeline I hear "SQUEAAAAL LIKE A PIIIG" followed by a sound of a shotgun. It was the same monster as before! with only a little bit of health the day transsferred to nighttime within seconds. I could still hear footsteps outside but I was fairly positive he didnt know where I was... yet. In the end I decided that if I did die from jumping out of the small crack in this pipeline that was be a better death than that of this sadistic creep so I jumped and miraculously lived. With this accomplished I ran the hell outta the plant opening a small green crate on the way. There was an assault rifle in this box... It was time for redemption..........................................................................................................................................................

review: Well i heard lots of good things about this game So i decided to buy it and give it at try out People told me oh yeah its way better then Dayz standalone. Now let me tell you how much this game does not even compare closeley to Dayz. 1. I turned my graphics up to max settings on everything and the grass details were pathetic. You spawn with a rock 2 meds and a torch I found a building and thinking that i could easily break in cause you know a big boulder would be able to take down a simple wood wall but no that failed me misserably Then i found no tools around the map and learned you had to build everything Now how is this a post apocolyptic enviroment? No items can be found and you have to make everything your self Now it took me a couple minutes to figure out on how to get wood But then i figured it out i smashed a tree with my rock.. Now you are seriously telling me i can get usable lumber by smashing a rock on a tree? That is the most un realistic thing i have ever ecountered. If anyone tells you this game is better then dayz They are absolutley full of them selfs and should actualy play DayZ because even in its alpha stage the graphics are 10x better and is just more realistic then this naked man game. I do not recomend this game for anyone either then the little child that can put up with the horrific unrealistic interaction. Waste of money in my opinon.

review: I enjoyed Rust for a time... Great game.... I played it WAY more than enough to justify what it costs. Maybe I'll play it again if it gets more interresting... The XP system sounds promising... I read the Dev Blog regularly to see if anything has been added to make me want to play it again.... The game got old for me after a few hundred hours of play... Lost interest in the game mechanics.... Too repetitiveBut the thing I like most about Rust is that it changes over time.... If you get sick of the game the way it is you stop playing for a while and when you pick it back up months later or longer and it feels like a new game with many new additions to explore... The constant and regular changes are what I like best about Rust and what I think adds some serious replay value...What I don't like about Rust is that Bullys rule... It's a dihck dominated game... The community of regular players mostly consists of people with severe unfriendly attitudes who take advantage of and pick on players much weaker than they are... There is a critical lack of players with cool great to play with attitudes (After writing this I read some of the other reviews and I agree with all of the ones describing the community as "Toxic".... It is VERY toxic azzwhole psychopaths reign supreme... It makes the game not so fun... Completely ruins my urge to want to play)Overall it is well worth the investment if you're looking for a game that you can put some serious time into before losing interest... I highly recommend Rust

review: The trailer makes Rust look like a PS2 game. The trailer oversells it.As soon as you install the game you will be asked to install third party system monitoring software a fact that is not mentioned anywhere in the Steam store page. If you agree to that you will be greeted by the Flash wrapper that surrounds the actual game. If you agree to use the flash wrapper you will be dropped into a world of mashed potatoes that very roughly reflects a post apocalyptic earth.This world of mashed potatoes doesn't have a tutorial documentation or even any action other than 'throw your rock away'. (Literally that is all you can do by default. There is a rock in your hands. You can throw it once. Then it has left your hands and no button of the mouse does anything anymore.) Yet it has microtransactions to purchase guns after you've already bought this game. They're good to go on microtransactions. Man there are so many microtransactions.There is an inventory screen ripped off of Minecraft at the bottom of the screen. However it is superfluous seeing as you can't pick up items.But there is a crafting system. You will be able to tell this by the sheer number of ten story tall swastikas that dot the landscape. (The $20 early access fee doesn't cover moderation it seems.) These swastikas are the only straight lines you'll find in the mashedpotatoverse.The only thing I can say in this game's favor is that it doesn't have audio chat.If you're looking for a beautiful survival game go preorder The Long Dark. In that game you can pick things up and use them two innovations that Rust is not quite ready to tackle yet.

review: The relaxed theme the charm and the simplicity has been beaten out of Rust Legacy. Now this sluggish and chaotic version looks good but is such a harsh experience in comparison that it's practically a different game.Bloated with so many things that the initial experience consists of rubbish like being prompted to wait for skins to download and being killed at spawn by animals and other players(if you didn't die before you even had control over your player) while trying to get to grips with a steep learning curve.Not being able to run Fraps and the Steam Overlay in the same launch is souring. The saying "less is more" seems to escape the devs where they could have spent these years making the game functional(as a program and in its mechanics) rather than say "hey wouldn't X be a great idea!" and now you need an SSD to have anywhere near proportionate loading times but remains fairly slow even on an SSD.Why add a chopper if it will blow up your base when nobody's even in it? Or when you can't even figure out why it shoots you as you try to hide from it. Why have a bear in the game for such a long time when it kills players through walls? Why add fatal temperatures and radiation when the distance of a few metres take you from warm to freezing or fine to fatally radiated?I've survived bleeding to death while underwater for a minute at 20hp while being shot and other times died because I was running through an open field and got radiated. Game mechanics like this are a mess and are being left in their current state rather than reverted to something workable until they're fully realised.In Legacy you could slap a building down anywhere(even late into the wipe) and produce some revolvers. But now to have even a slim chance you have to start as soon as a wipe hits otherwise you get flame raided straight away and it has to be close to barrels(weapon components) or you won't be able to even produce revolvers. And you'll need to build a tool cupboard quickly otherwise you can get griefed now much worse than what would happen in Legacy.You now have to build a code lock to lock your door which makes the game much more difficult starting out compared to the Legacy door which locked for you as soon as it was built. Anyone can steal your door even if you have a tool cupboard down. If you can't build a code lock(which takes metal) then you're stuck with a wooden key but you have to keep it on you to open the door. Maybe this mechanic isn't seen in other games because it's complete trash?As a solo player you can't have a base anymore. As soon as you die with your key on you someone can take it and steal your base. Even in a group someone has to stay inside the base to be a door opener which reduces the experience of one player to sitting there being bored. In Legacy you didn't have to worry about these things which I think makes this version of Rust an objectively bad game. How do you manage to get a code lock if the wooden keys you rely on until then are a failure of a mechanic? Why make bases so difficult to make yet so easy to raid?You'd think hiding in grass/behind rocks or skulking around at night could make things easier until you're in a stronger position(code lock + guns) but trying to be sneaky will get you killed by what seems to be an epidemic of wallhackers. If you want to report a cheater then you need to go through the unstable recaptcha system. Wallhack prevention seems to be stuck on the shoulders of server admins but surely with all the money in gaming a better system could have been implemented.Seeing at night is in itself a broken mechanic as one of my friends complained about not seeing anything while my other friend in the same moment next to us on different hardware/software could see clearly. Leaving base during the day can be a hazard as there's a chopper that goes around shooting players for no reason even spawnkilling them. The jump puzzlest are bad some being downwards(makes jumping not work half the time) and some cave ones are blocked by the rocks above you. I've done jumping competitions in Counter Strike for fun and still loath the Rust jumps.When I play the game more towards the balance of roleplay I won't be able to produce good weapons and even if you get a bow headshot someone can easily survive that. If I play the game more towards the balance of deathmatch meta(get in first build near components) I can amass guns which easily overpower other players but those mechanics are so out of balance that nobody joins a server after the first 12 hours of a wipe so what's the point of having guns on a dead server?Even the survival element of Rust which took its DNA from Gmod Stranded and DayZ mod has been squeezed out by the addition of poor mechanics. There's sentry guns and an AI tank and a chopper. The tank was supposed to help fix the game but left it feeling even more like a Battlefield title. They've shown the vehicles on the store page but the experience is actually closer to just getting killed by arrows while you're trying to make a bow...If you run out of torches and can't see just suicide to get one for free. Need animal fat? Suicide. Low on health/hunger/thirst? Just suicide. Don't like your random map spawn? Suicide. The survival theme loses its immersion by the mechanics pushing a deathmatch/suicide meta at every turn. After all these years of development surely the game should be welcoming streamlined optimized and intuitive by now. But instead among all the gripes I've left out it's a mess that only offers rewards to the experienced groups which control the high value areas of the map with dozens of guns with which they'll find worthless when they have nobody to shoot on their empty server the next day. The game caters solely to those competitive groups yet for some reason large clan bases were nerfed by "upkeep" so there's no playerbase this game now satisfies properly...It's a step up from Legacy in terms of graphics and combating flyhack cheats but otherwise it's a complete disaster. I've played it with friends but they had to be competent deathmatchers for us to get anything done. Even if you start on a trio server with 2 skilled friends as soon as it wipes and head to a quiet spot you'll still get attacked straight away.If you spend your time building then you'll get flame raided before you upgrade from wood. Many players are only interested in attacking what others build and not building themselves so why were they given the tools to attack so easily? Then the new community pushed the roleplayers out saying that the roleplayers weren't even playing the game anymore but still visited the forums to "complain."What Legacy had with easier starting and hard raiding Rust is now about difficult starts and easy raiding. It's no surprise that servers only last a matter of hours when Legacy offered an experience that would go on for days or weeks. The inclusion of roleplay items like signs makes no sense in such a competitive game. You might enjoy this strange deathmatch oriented version but what's to stop them changing the gameplay dramatically again to attract a completely different playerbase to buy copies and leave their old playerbase behind?

This game really aims for the realistic factor more then just a "survival" game. I would really reconmend this game. The one thing you have to understand is that it is in Alpha. Also you have to live with the fact that one moment you could have all the stuff in the world and be like the "king" of the server and you go to sleep in your "secure" house. review: Rust is an open world multiplayer deathmatch game with base building resource gathering and survival management mechanics borrowed from games like Minecraft.As an early access game Rust is still struggling to find an identity even after shifting focus away and mostly removing it's formulaic PvE elements in favor of adversarial Player vs Player gameplay. The game balance is currently weighted heavily in favor of players who choose to participate in clan or large group play since it provides a massive and clear advantage over the slow grind that solo players or those playing in small groups experience. Unfortunately this has the side effect of encouraging players to bypass entire elements of the game's early and mid game progression. Joining a large group of players that have already established themselves and acquired the best gear allows new players the benefits of jumping effortlessly to the top of the food chain against other players. Playing solo or in a small group is a severe handicap and merely a lesson in tedium.I believe the concept and mechanics of this game would be more condusive to shorter periods of time between server resets (ie. 1 day 3 days or 1 week) in order to avoid large groups of players over fortifying servers against the possibility of small group or solo play. Depending on the server you will begin weeks if not months behind other players who quickly have the ability to erase hours of the tedious grinding required with little means of defending yourself.Accelerating the harvesting of resources building requirements and other massive time sinks would also greatly diminish the uninteresting early game progression so players do not feel forced in to joining a large team of players to avoid the danger of losing all of their progress.Understandably a game like this will never truly present a level playing field and the game presents an exciting concept to players despite the unclear direction of the game's development...However I can NOT recommend a game that unintentionally encourages new players to ignore or bypass a large portion of it's content and progression in order.to effortlessly gain an overwhelming advantage.
title: Rust

review: Rust is tons of fun. I really rather love this game. The problem is it's inundated with hackers and getting worse and worse in that respect all the time. Create a big base gather a lot of resources build yourself up into something worth noticing and 100% guarenteed you're going to be hack raided dry overnight. Being successful in this game without hacks requires hours of risk and hard work and until you get there it's basically just a repetitive manual labor sim. Once you get past that stage of the game things get really exciting but not when hackers who did none of the hard work go flying into your base and clean out your days of toil in an instant. It's happened to me and the people I've grouped with way too many times. If a hacker chooses to clean you out or worse aimbot camp your base instantly shooting everyone in the head who comes/goes your game is essentially over until they get bored/get full and move on. It's highly disheartening and there's really no recourse as after getting banned the hackers just buy the game again from Russia for 5 bucks and they're back.

review: This game is a masterpiece and the updates are only making it better. This is by far the best game in the "Survival" genre. You start out with a rock and a torch and the main goal (at least for me) is to build your way up to have the top tear loot in the game. Going on raids taking down helicopters and pvp is some of the best action I have ever had in a game. The developers have weekly updates fixing the bugs and issues that players have found. All in all this game may be a bit grindy but the way that you can get attached to it is like no other game. Amazing worth Facepunch yet another top notch game since Garry's Mod.
title: Rust

review: I read the reviews here on steam before purchasing the game and knew how cancerous the community can be but a mate and I decided to team up and give it a go anyway. We met some chill and helpful people but they were few and far between. DO NOT buy this game if you don't have a large group of friends to play with. You will constantly be ganked by players who may as well have a nuclear arsenal compared to your rock. Totally nude with your bird dangling in the wind with only a rock in your possession? GANKED. We managed to stay alive long enough to acquire enough resources to build a small base. Night time fell and we were surrounded our base demolished and ganked in the pitch black as we were trying to escape by players with nail guns. The game is unoptimized and runs like crap. I made it crash just by changing one of the audio settings on a $2500 gaming rig. I'm sure there would have been plenty more of them if I hadn't of uninstalled this turd from my computer. Unfortunately I can't refund a game just because the community is trash. For the love of god don't make the same mistake I did by purchasing it to "just give it a go" because you will regret it.Update My mate had friends who were well established on one Rust server. So I reinstalled the game and we built a base close to theirs. Things were going smooth we had fortified with rock walls had a ton of wooden chests with the items we had spent quite a few hours gathering but there was a weak point our wooden door with incredibly low durability. To get a metal door with a code you need a large amount of scrap. To get the metal door you need a furnace which also needs a large amount of scrap among other things which takes time to scavange and can be difficult to acquire. So what happened? Highly geared players used a flame thrower on our door while we were inside broke down the door then rushed us with machine guns and jacked everything. This is the problem with games like Rust and Ark. Experienced players who are well established and geared to the teeth can completely lock you out of the game. THIS GAME.
title: Rust

review: First off sending props out to Pizzly Bear and his team at overkill gaming for putting together one fine legit server. If only it stayed low to medium pop I would still be playing Rust. Totally legit team no admin abuse and super ultra responsive admins on the team. As for my review of Rust in general great for like 2 weeks then you wish you never spent money on it. Baiit and Switch...I bought the game for Zombie survival and they removed the zombies shortly after me starting.Survival turned into Oh crap it's bedtime I hope my base is still there when I wake up. Oh no someone broke into the first 2 floors of the base while I was sleeping. I have to go to work well crap by the time I get home the other floors will surely be robbed and the remaining asshat tourists will break all my equipment. omgwtflol I will start over again tonight... Sweet base fixed I got all the crafting items in game researched...wtf what do you mean server wipe? Awww sonofa well it don't matter anyhoo those 13 year old Mickey Mouse Club doods came back and told us they planned to break into our place as soon as we go offline to work/sleep cause their parents are crack heads and they are skipping school again... Thats ok the stupid bears they change the Zombies into aren't creepy or even hard to farm. Ill be back up and running in 6 hours and soons i sleep someone else will gank my crap and start their own base to get robbed another 6 hours later.Pretty much sums the game play. Whole playable area is far to small no more zombies no real pve aspect aside from building which is fine but don't go away with your family for a weekend cause all your crap will decay if you don't log in daily...I haven't seen an update in ages wasted my money Rust should be looking at 7 Days to Die on how to do things right.That is right 7DtD is a far superior game in most ways and I have seen more updates and good changes for it in the short time I have played then has come out with Rust and Dayz combined.

review: I really wanted to like this game...I mean really really.However after they took out the zombies and then removed the "demolish" feature from the hammer there was really no point to the game at all.On a PvE server you literally have no challenge whatsoever...the only "enemies" are the wolves and very random bear encounters other than that nothing. It takes forever to dehydrate or starve and there is no cold/hot factor or even stamina for that matter.On a PvP server you flat out just get owned. Start the world off butt naked and get mowed down by someone that has been building their character forever ya' rock versus machine gun...that's fair.Until they start updating the game and atleast start putting some enemies in the game I can't recommend it at the moment unless you just like to build stuff.Oh yeah a HUGE part that bothers me is that there is no mining in the game. You need rocks? See that big boulder over there or that mountain side teaming with rocks can't touch them. You can't mine off of everything you see not even close to it...you have to find these smaller round boulders to hack at...no gardening no dirt/sand/clay...just trees and the small round boulders. Very tedious.
