review: This game is eternally gonna be on "alpha" its been 3 years since it was made available and hasn't really made any progression I regret buying this without knowing it was on alpha state but thanks to this experience I always double check to make sure the games are not alpha. Don't waste your money.Gameplay If you are solo this game is not for you if you are group of 20 or less guys this game is not for you... you basically put hard work into building your base gathering materials and creating weapons for hours and hours just to have your base raided when you and your friends go to sleep in real life next time you log in you find your naked spawning near a lake with no resourses around just to die of starvation. You start out having a basic lot of blueprints already at your disposal you get to find more as you venture into random generated maps yeah all servers have a unique RNG map so everytime you join a different server you don't know where the resourses or farmable cities are located there is no minimap or gps to guide you around you can only hand draw your map but shame on you if you get killed it gets taken away and you have to start it all over you can't copy it.If you want your assets to last for a little longer you need players on your group of all time zones that way your base is always defended and I only say "last for a little longer" since servers get swiped on 2 different occasions 1. The server owner has time interval swipe policy 2. All the servers get forced to swipe because the game developers add or tweak something at least once a week.Also hackers are running rampant on the official servers. TL DR This game will always be alpha early access you never get to keep your character progression for more than a week.

review: This game is really fun to get to know the ropes and is immensely satisfying as you learn more build an awesome stone shelter and begin to actually find stability in the game. However if you don't have any friends to play with or make any friends in the server you are in it's pretty isolating and hard to work against the grain of much more experienced groups of players around many corners which won't hesitate to shoot you for no reason. It's frustrating to go on a solo run get a bunch of valuable resources and then get mauled by a bear who creeps up on you like a ninja. So maybe you get frustrated and quit for a while then you want to come back to your progress. Nah it's deteriorated or the server wiped got to relive all of that frustration again of rebuilding from the humble place of being naked on the beach with just a rock. I got my $20 of value out of this game I think because I just wanted to try it and I had a good time for the 20hrs I did play. However it has little allure to replay especially as a solo player.

It s weirder and less polished than the competition but that s part of the fun.

review: I really liked playing the game. Clocked about 1200 hrs. Since the introduction of the components system with scrap the game is very slow to advance in unless you are in a (large) clan. Which makes the game really unfair. Shortly after a server wipe the balance is ok but after 3 to 4 days in vanilla servers the game is so unbalanced that there only remain a few dominating clans. When playing solo duo or irregular this game has become impossible to play (survive). The last 3 months I have not gotten any further than owning a waterpipe shotgun. This is no match for a 5 person clan with AK's running around. I've deinstalled the game with the intention not to return. As almost all Rust players I met online have done already. RIP Rust!

review: First few minutes I thought its a nice game I got on an empty server to learn how it works get used to the mechanics not much.I have a friend who has the game but didn't play it that much either so I thought it would be a good idea to just see what we can do.After learning how to build and other mechanics we went on a more populated server to see how the community is.1. Life "might not be resembling the game"I walked to a harbor. I found a melee weapon and a beanie then in the distance i saw a person.I hide behind a little wall but it already was too late he saw me and shot me I survived but then he came up to me and killed me with a cleaver.I was laying on the ground not dead mind you and said I was new and I don't get anything... he didn't react... he already walked off.2. Life "might as well talk to people"so I found a couple of guys seemingly nice at first. they just were naked and raided an already pretty damaged house.I went up to them and asked if I can join them. one said sure if I can find something I can keep it.I found nothing they destroyed the box they where looting and went off... at least I thought.I turned around and saw a guy running up to me and hit me with a stone. I said "hey stop that" and he said "oh sorry and walked back.. his friend though came up running and hit me with a speer "you are not my friend !" I said "I didn't want to be his friend." then I got killed.3. Life "well.. I try again..."A big building. huge and well constructed. I walked up and said hello when a guy with a wolf mask came out shot me multiple times with a ... nail gun? I think? anyway that was my shortest life with only 24 seconds.4. life "stand back!"this time I was more careful. I tried to find a spot where I could start building I built a little house and quickly got hungry. I went out to a Gas station and found a couple of good things to eat ! ... then there was a guy coming up to me... "hey whats up"I only said "hey please stand back""whats the matter? don't like the people?"I swung my stone at him " I said stay back""hey don't be so violent"he got out a club and beat me to death with it... yeah. I guess I don't like the people here.I would really love to enjoy the game... it is fun. the gameplay is solid... but it definitely is not something that you can join easily. the .. community kills on sight even when you are no thread at all...

review: This is game is amazing no secret it's one of my favorite games if not the favorite. I love everything about it! Fighting raiding scavenging through rad towns various monuments building hunting and there's just so many things you can like about this game! The developers are also amazing they read and listen to their community's feedback do things that are better for the game. Of course not everything is perfect there are few things I don't like about the game one of them is that you really have to dedicate your time if you want to get or achieve something like get explosives good guns and that's going to be really hard if you don't have much time. Next thing large groups you'll meet them on almost every server and if you're a solo player or play in small groups which is by the way extremely hard it's going to be rough fighting against them and they also can get materials much easier and faster so they're going to be geared faster and now because of the new XP system which I like but I hate the fact that's it's really slow the large groups can level up much easier because of the XP share. But after all the game is only in the alpha state and considering that it's really an amazing game as it already has so much stuff and I'm sure the developers won't stop working and will make it a great game!So I really recommend buying this game especially if you have time and friends to play with!Oh and by the way there's many servers with various games like battle royale the walls and such so if you'll feel you wanna try something new give it a go.

review: The ak47 recoil needs to be like how it was in BP system. Right now almost any other gun in the game cant touch an AK. Its really overpowered and it closes the skill gap. What they are doing with the game now is they are opening the farm gap. What i mean by this is they are making it so that you have to farm for hours upon hours in order to get anything you want. One thing is in older rust you could get something like an AK or a rocket etc. out of a barrel. Now the best thing you can get out of a barrel is a spring or something that you can help use to craft an AK that you need to first get the BP for and the level 3 workbench. Not to mention the resources you need to farm. There is no more getting lucky and being excited that you found a rocket in a barrel. The game has been turned into a linear farm fest. You cant even try to chance research an item anymore you have to go farm for enough to get it garunteed. Solo in Rust now is ridiculously hard. In one wipe you have to farm 2000 scrap just to get workbenches. Then you have to farm scrap for any BPs that you might need. Remember that ak i was talking about? Thats gonna be another 750 scrap to research. And its the same amount for all other high tier items. I wish the developers would take a more pvp oriented approach to the game which made it so fun instead of making it a roleyplay simulator. Every week in the devblogs they focus on adding useless items and features while the core elements of the game suffer. Rust is not as fun as it used to be and anyone who has played the game as long i have would know that. Currently the developers are catering to the noobs in the games development. Rust's most experienced players with thousands of hours are abandoning the game at incredible speeds because of what they are doing to the game. And gary/helk saying that people with thousands of hours should stop playing the game isnt helping the experienced player base. What i think Facepunch needs to do to fix this is to start listening to players with thousands of hours. Honestly i have barely scratched the surface of all the problems rust has but these are the ones i encounter most frequently. The one thing that really bugs me and i think is the reason old players complain alot is because all the biggest problems in rust now are ones that werent always problems in older rust. Im not complaining because the game has always been bad. Im complaining because the game was the best game i ever played and it was ruined.
title: Rust

review: In this game you play on an island where everybody is exposed and can kill or be killed by anyone at any time. There's no teams or guilds only spoken agreements between players through vocal proximity chat. The gimmick of Rust is that everything anybody has is up for grabs. This means that if you die your entire inventory guns clothes resources etc. can be taken by whoever killed you. Furthermore the houses you build can be busted into and even taken over by other players which in turn leaves you a fresh spawned man or women naked and with nothing but their trusty rock. This twist on open world quickly produces a sense of urgency and risk in the player spawning from a fear of loss of which makes the game both exhilarating and rewarding. Risk vs Reward is what Rust is all about it makes you think hard about every choice you make.Coincidentally this gimmick unintentionally provides an small insight on basic human behavior.Since everyone has the power to kill everyone else in Rust player interaction is incredibly stressful. This makes folks feel on edge constantly for fear of getting gunned down or back stabbed potentially leading to a loss of hours worth of work. Because the island is basically a giant open world PVP battleground and the backstabbing is so prevalent trust becomes a major facet of gameplay. Unfortunately because the majority of the player base is unashamedly tempted and shows no restraint or respect for their fellow player's hard work the game becomes a true exercise in endurance tolerance patience and ultimately survival. To that degree I'd say Gary is successful with Rust. But at the end of the day by some freak chance Rust to me has become a social experiment that shows you the true nature of human beings when provided opportunity with a lack of tangible consequence.Pros Building is fun and intuitive World is gorgeous Many different server types including Battle Royal and Role Play Gunplay is solid Audio and ambience are immersive Potentially hilarious player interaction (player personality dependent) Playing leads to lots of fun stories you can tell your friends Frequent Updates Active and communicative developers Procedural generation works greatCons Buggy Animals clip through walls which is scary when a bear all of a sudden starts beating on you through a boulder. This also makes it hard to chase critters you need for resources. Players have a tendency to view others as loot pinatas instead of fellow players Success seems to favor large groups. It's hard to get end game anything as a solo player or small (less than 5 person) group. Devs don't seem to have much of an idea on what they want the finished game to be. What they have works and works well but there seems to be some misdirection when it comes to a vision for the final product. They keep implementing massive overhauls to key progressions systems. They went from loot+resource dependent crafting to a leveing system ala Ark then to a component system and now they're retooling resourcing and rebalancing item crafting yet again for mid 2017.Massocists would enjoy this game or people good at shooters. It's a pretty harsh survival game.

review: oming from many hours sunk into Rust I really tried to like this game. It offers so much opportunity to improve on other games in this genre but in the end you are much better off giving it more time to see if it will develop. As it stands right now it is not worth your time or money. PROS + The graphic style while a little cartoonish at first does work. It looks nice and objects stand out in gameplay.+ Emphasis on survival. You really can die of hunger and the elements if you do not take care of yourself.+ It is satisfying to build up your equipment. No blueprint BS just build and buff your stuff.CONS It is DEAD online. You need to enjoy working by yourself and getting your hat handed to you by the one or two quasi clans on the few servers that sport more than 3 people online at any time. This is a major problem that causes the other cons to spiral down even quicker. It lacks direction. The devs have abandoned V1 and now work on V2 which they call Experimental. Makes you think it is a beta version right? Well it sure is but it is the only one with anything new too. The Devs change course seemingly update to update on the game direction making major shifts. This has made the game have a continuous learning curve and rendered most online guides useless. More than anything this game really does not know what it wants to be when it grows up. It has begun borrowing from other games like Rust but sometimes without offering any new twist on the ideas. It lacks a community. Remember when I said it was dead? Most players have left until things settle down. No one is bothering to write guides etc. when everything changes in short order. Long time players are split between one group that wants it to be more and another that tells them to shut up and let the Devs work. The Devs have apparently said they have made the decision not to try to rebuild the player base at this time and work on the game mechanics instead. This is a terrible mistake and might really mean they do not know how to bring them back. It has meant that the two remaining camps are now just an echo chamber and it is hard for new ideas to emerge from the community which to me is one of the major benefits of early access.
title: Rust

review: You wake up with the sand on your face the ocean waves slapping against the shore. "Where am I?" you ask yourself. Standing up with a rock in hand aswell as a torch on your belt you feel lost. In the distance you hear gunshots. Yes those were gun shots. You decide to travel the opposite way of the gunshots. Finding an open field you see a group of naked individuals six or seven of them.. They had all gathered around a rock and were ramming the rock into the ore. You were about to approach and introduce yourself before another naked ran down to meet them. The screams were the worst part the group had turned to meet the newcomer and ran at him with rocks... he stood no chance. They all began to slam the rock into the naked body harvesting his flesh and bones. I watched as they gathered around a campfire and began to jump around it. The fresh human meat cooking over the fireplace the blood dripping into the campfire. Your breathing begins to pick up looking to the left you located a shady forest you decide to run in that direction. Leaning against one of the numerous trees you rest for a moment. You hear voices in the direction you ran from it seems the group was migrating this way you didn't take any chances. You ran through the forest hiding behind every rock but the group was following close behind. You saw a building in the distance deciding that was the safest place to travel. Running to the open door you place a foot on the floor you hop up an Killed by shotguntrap.entity

review: My grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my father said to him "if you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate you have to stop immediately." Tears welled up his eyes when he realised what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My father said to me "Don't ever smoke. Please don't ever put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 23 I have never touched a cigarette. I must say I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it because this game gave me cancer anyway.

I kinda think about it as 3D Minecraft because ur always chopping wood and mining those ore nodes so that you can build that monster base. Unfortunatly though through all of this fun of building the best base ever you log out than go to bed. The next morning you get on and join your server and to you're supprise you see that xXxSagginSwagin69xXx has killed you with a bear.prefab. Other than the completely rude and mean community that never wants to offer a helping hand Rust is a great game. I reccomend it to everybody that likes survival games and wants a little more out of them. If that community could grow up a little and not kill on sight it would make things even more interesting.

review: Once upon a time. There were three lost RUST players. Amoor LB and Bluekfc. They ventured throughout the woods past bears wolves and infected to get to their destination. What they thought was a small mountain but was Mt.Everest. Amoor and LB ventured from the highest point of the mountain and saw numerous supply drops come. Sidekick Bluekfc was on the sidelines to cheer them on as they went to seek a place to build shelter. Once they finally descended down from the other side of the mountain they went and searched the nearest hill for a place to stay. A mountain filled with lushes resources they settled upon the hill top where they can see anyone venturing through the land of RUST. They built there house with separate doors. They built what they needed and finally built the perfect home. Amoor and LB are now set for there adventures into the land of RUST with their trusty sidekick Bluekfc. This is the story of Amoor LB and Bluekfc as they walk into the land of the unknown.

review: Rust. A game where naked people stone you to death. A game where horses and stags can run right up a vertical cliff and bears wolves chickens and boars run around in little circles. A game that has barely changed in 10 months. Where to begin?Pros Fun Community Support (Mods and the like) Steam Hemp has made getting tools and weapons SO much easier without having to chase a horse over 500m just to get cloth Game is great to play with friends Game is great to make friends depending on how you play and what servers you play on The game has a long life span especially for an alpha in "early" development.Cons Broken AI Game has barely changed in 10 months Game has been out since 2013 yet still claims to be an early access General Community Sucks Feet stick out of buildings STILL Storage boxes still stick out of buildings (Last time I tried) Physical Keys (in game keys) are broken in the sense that if you have more than one they both lose their key abilities and they become a waste of wood Vanilla resource gathering is horrible Paper maps act like keys in the sense that if you put more than 1 in your inventory they all break (lose their data) Devs add experimental things before they are finished (Too Hot 40* C in a desert. 0 to 40 instantly huh? Hyper realistic and it doesn't do anything gameplay wise. At least from what I can tell it doesn't hinder teleporting) "Too Cold" happens everywhere there isn't sand on the ground super annoying. I don't want to have to build and heat up a fire just because it looks a *little* chilly outside if that. On the snow this would make much more sense. Crouching down to mine nodes is annoying Mining recoil (screen looking up while chopping/mining) is really irritating. Maybe for certain tools like the salvaged ones it makes sense but for the full metal tools it makes no sense Forced Wipes. Why? It would be amazing if you had a Minecraft Launcher system in place where you can set up a server for any version and the launcher can launch Rust in any version Rust Launcher is not necessary. Put those graphical settings in game Loading Times are awful Optimization is horrible but it's getting better Graphics look like a dog's and are non existant at the lowest settings. It's like 1 large pixel with the same bland color over and over at those settings. Don't test it you'll be scarred for lifeI wish that the devs could give the building system a major overhaul. I'm talking near Halo Reach Forge World level building but all in a smooth easy to use and fitting to the game system. If you could custom fit pieces of wood and stone to areas it would make building incredible. Imagine the type of homes you could see instead of honeycomb here 2 doors there square here round there etc. If you're thinking about getting this game think about it some more. If you have friends who actively play the game talk with them. The game is much better with friends so if you have any to play with it's recommended. I recommend this game only to those who are truly interested in these types of games because that's just about all this game can appeal to really.Final score (IMO) 5/10The game definitely has its faults but they can be looked over if you play with friends. The game's still in development but it's being very slow at least in these past 10 months.

review: Their is many things wrong about this game. One building is if you want to destroy a wall its essintially impossible and if you misplace an object oh well that object is gone. If you lost your keys from someone and you are trapped in your house with no resources welp you just have to break a wall to get out. Also the community is . I was about done with this game so i decided how about i give my house to someone if they did not kill me but no they just would rather kill someone who has nothing than go to a house with guns turrents chests full of loot and food. Also if you want to make a team that probably wont happen because 99% of the people their would kill you immediatly even if you have no loot at all. Its more of a deathmatch than a survival game. Also this game has been out for five ing years and its still alpha wtf. Oh and also if you dont want to play a deathmatch game and play a singleplayer rust well basically thats since the only enemys are bears and wolves which dont really harm you if you have a sleeping bag nearby. This game would be so good if people dont try to instantly kill you everytime you see them. When I play a survival game I want a game were people try to make friends and work together not just player on their computer killing eachother for absolutly no reason. Overall the game is great without the people and the building part but since the game is basically a multiplayer game its because of the community.

review: Okay so I buy this game download it instantly and start playing on a newly wiped server. Although I'm not experienced with survival/crafting games I follow many YouTubers who are experienced and watched over 100+ hrs of playthroughs. So first things first I chop down my first tree to make a single paper which I will make it into a map. Then I proceed to chop 10 15 more trees to finaly come across a stone vein. I mine the surrounding stone veins aswell and then start looking for a nice cozy place to set up my first base. At that point I had around 6 7k wood and 8k stone which was more than enough for me to set up a 2x2x2 base with all the fancy window shutters and all. I was the happiest man on that server in the mornings I picked mushrooms and hunted. Through afternoon I mostly mined stone iron sulfur and refined them at night. On my 3rd in game day on the server I heard a really loud noise coming from the havens. As I look up I see a huge box deploying its 'chutes and falling. I do the math and realize that it just might land right on top of my house. So I get inside my house and wait for the box to drop. Then I start hearing footsteps followed by gunshots and screams of agony. As I look out from my window I see Hans equippinng ze flammenwerfer roasting anyone that gets in his way. The Box finally lands with a thump on my ceiling. As I try to climb my ceiling hatch I hear Hans he says "Never gonna give you up Never gonna let you down Never gonna run around and desert you" YOU JUST GOT RUST ROLLED to be free of the curse buy the game and add me on Steam so we can play together *winky face*

review: Frankly this game is a complete waste of time. I got into it from watching some youtube videos about it. Seemed challenging. Building + Shooter. It is a really cool concept for a game. Unfortunately there is a tremendous amount of grinding involved to get anything(8 16 hours for basic tools weapons and a tiny base/room which will be raided and looted as soon as you log off) and all progress is lost in mere seconds. After 40 hours you may have a chance to use decent armor or even a good gun at which point you will turn a corner and instantly die and lose everything. The good guns are way too overpowered and everything else is just garbage. The game consists of two types of players The 14 year olds with 2000+ hours invested who run around in groups and instantly kill and steal and noobs who have nothing because they keep getting griefed by the 14 year olds. I've never played a game this grindy with zero sense of satisfaction. Maybe It's because I'm not an and I don't like to grief people. Take my advice and spend your time elsewhere. I only wish I had realized this sooner and I would be getting a refund.

I first experienced this a while back then it was fixed by the devs now it's back.Also What's up with the lack of sticky's or moderators pressence in the Steam forums to even today? Yeah sure most Rust players will lead you to check their official forums and blog dev but this is Steam man show some respect for the people that supports your work. Bottom line is that this is a nice game you better join with some friends or you gonna have a really bad time playing alone but in this current state you need a beast of machine in order to play it. review: This game I have played since Legacy since then it has been massively overhauled no more shiny new assault rifles a new game engine new tools and weapons new ways to build and I hate to sound Clieche' but much much more! People who have played the "new rust" a few months ago like me may have hated it now it is a completely different game. Actually like many other people I have my own awesome story.I was in the process of building my base and I have some very crude walls up that can be destroyed with a few hit of anything. That is when I hear footseps it is night time so I see the shadow of the guy outside. Suddenly he bursts inside with a spear I am waiting for him and attack him with my own spear. We trade blows and I get killed. Luckily I had put down a sleeping bag and as he is looting all my smelted metal from th furnace I respawn at it. Me being completeley naked now I come at him swinging with my trusty rock he take me down again but I am not dead. I am lying on the floor wounded with only a small chance of recovery and a large chance of death. Yet he never did finish me off and with a remaining 5/100 hp I attack him with my torch (I had dropped my rock) and to my reliefe he is finally dead I recover all my stuff and his too al while quickly securing my base and upgrading it in case he or someother people decided to pay me a visit. I have a few more stories like this to tell some coming from the same day however you probably ge the point. )I rate 9/10 for the reason that sometimes this game gets me really off with the morons who will KoS you. But even after a ragequit from this game withing a few hours of playing some Elite Dangerous or World of Tanks (Both games 10/10 sorry for the advertisment of two unrelated games I just had to) I come back begging for more and I always have fun. The msot satisfiyning thing is making a base and defending it/ servicing it against the crowds trying to break in.

review: At the time this review was written the game was in alpha so all technical hiccups aside this game is going places. EDIT 10/2/2015I have played this game (as vaguely stated above) since a very early release of it on steam. Even then it was solid. As of right now I would like to say a few things that makes this game stand out. 1. The Dev team. It is so relieving after scowering the webs for games to play to come back to this game. The Dev team not only CARES but seems to be extremely passionate dedicated and not to mention talented. Everything I have seen come out of this team has been gold. Anything that fell short was promptly removed and brought back with a much more apealing 2.0 version. They take the time to make things the way they should be and take NO t. It is teams like this that deserve the money they make off of their games. 2. The atmosphere. Just the general feeling of the game. It feels like you can play it either very laid back or binge. Now I will say that survival games tend to attract the type of crowd that doesn't appeal to everyone out there. Plainly stated most of you guys are total when you play the game. But it's the ones you run in to that ARE NOT that make the game 10x worth it. The community is decent as well. You can get a lot of support through the website if need be. 3. Attention to detail. The graphics in this for a $20 game are phenominal. It just looks nice. Most of your textures and such look fairly good and like I said before anything that falls short is brought back with a better version later. So looking back seeing how far this game has come I can see it being an amazing official release for the people over at Facepunch. When/if the game comes out of alpha it will attract an even larger following. I have confidence that these guys will bring to the table a type of survival game innovation that we haven't seen since the dawn of Minecraft.

A lot of people have been writing bad reviews just to spite the developers and try to get the game developed to cater to them because they got used to having end game content on the first day of a cycle but primitive fighting is quite fun also and the end game content was always intended to take a bit to reach. review: Rust is a survival game all about killing people farming resources and breaking your way into peoples bases. Food water and the environment aren't very hard to deal with. You can play the game however you choose to. You can kill others for what you need or grind for it yourself. There is a lot of grind in this game depending on how lucky you get. This game is much easier and more enjoyable for most people when you play with friends. If you play this game alone its basically playing it on hardmode. Don't expect people to be friendly just because they say they are.If you have hopes of playing on any server that has more than 10 people you need to learn how to use the weapons most importantly the bow.Every servers map is randomly generated so every new server you join there will be something new to explore.Cheaters do exist on this game. However they are only common on official servers (except for rustafied). Whatever you do don't play on those servers. The developers for this game are some of the best developers on the face of the earth. They update the game WEEKLY with new and fresh content. They seem to be truely passionate about this game.After 2000+ hours of gameplay I can say that this game is the best $20 I have ever spent. Not even a cheap hooker can give you this much fun.You will die and lose everything you worked for. But that just means you get to restart and have fun doing it all over again.

review: This game is......unique. Never once have I ran around in a field with a bunch of naked men and had so much fun. Finding friends and making new ones can really expedite the process that is achieving good gear in Rust. You need certain tools and supplies to craft your first hatchet. With that hatchet you can then create a shed which turns into a cabin which turns into a mansion. Then you get greedy. You start attacking other players and participating in the game's unique PvP and gunplay. Overall for an early Alpha this game has a lot in store for the future.

review: So I've had this game for like 2 days and i have 18+ hours on it already. In my opinion... If you got DayZ and didn't get to have much fun with it wether it be because of being killed by other players or by zombies before you could even get any weapon to protect yourself with. Rust has just been so much fun. Resources are normally around everywhere but it can take a while to find things like actual guns but I was lucky enough to run across someone else's things and picked up some guns and a lot of ammo. So I had a pretty good start. I eventually met up with my friends and we have a group of about 8 9 people and we've established ourselves a couple nice fortresses we've gone on some expeditions finding resources hunting people down going on search parties for air drops and the occasional negotiation with other players in the game. Overall this game can either be pretty fun or boring by yourself depending on how you like your games but with friends you just can't go wrong with this game. There's strength in numbers.I completely recommend this game to anyone who likes survival/exploration/building/first person shooters because this is everything jam packed into one and its great. 10/10 Would raid again.P.S. Forgot to put the little flaws that you will find here and there like the noclip bears that hack through small hills to maul your toes as well as me only trying out one server which is where my friends are so I'm pretty sure not every server will be as pleasant as ours but check out the server im in the admin is really nice and wants more people in!

review: Im going to be really honest with rust...Unless you have a tank PC DO NOT BUY IT you cannot run it otherwise BUY IT Edit Rust is a fantastic survival game which does require a fair amount of computing power to run in CPU and GPU terms .However it isn't too taxing an adequate gaming PC or even entry level could probably run this game. Personally even with a compelling bottleneck from the CPU I still manage anywhere from 40 100 with this game at maximum settings can even play it at 1440p and 3840 x 2160 above 30fps! For early access still (very controversial) I'd say it's not too badly optimized.The gameplay itself is unique in its own way. It gives its own twist on the survival genre and offers a vast PVP environment with a variety of unqie weapons some with advanced physics (the RPG). This makes the player need to adapt and learn a new skill to use particular weapons something which other games don't include. Furthermore the graphics in this game are not terrible. The textures are low resolution however the sky clouds and lighting effects are second to none. They're obviously not the best but they make this game look amazing! The rise of the purple / red sun before it has fully rose up is sublime! Overall Gameplay 9/10 Graphics 7/10 PVP 8/10

review: Let me tell you a little story.A long long time ago in a galaxy far away there was a man called SirMinus. SirMinus was an expert at survival an expert with weapons and an expert hunter. This is my tale.&gt Me and my ally Conkers create base.&gt This is the largest base on the map.&gt We have a large prison an area and guard towers complete with auto turrets.&gt I tell Conkers I'm heading out to sort something out.&gt I leave our base and head a couple miles south and see a base.&gt This base is ing large not bigger than ours though.&gt I set up a little camp and prepare for nightfall.&gt The sun vanishes behind the mountain.&gt Darkness falls.&gt I pull out my rifle with a 4x scope and silencer along with a laser sight.&gt I aim over across their base and see a man on the roof.&gt Their base is lit up with lanterns and furnaces place is lit up better than a well rolled joint.&gt I aim my laser sight into a darker park of their base in his view just to get his attention a little.&gt Kid jumps behind a furnace for cover.&gt Extinguish my campfire and move around to the other side of their base.&gt Set up another campfire and light it.&gt He looks around to the second campfire.&gt Move again to the left of their base.&gt He continues to follow wherever he sees the campfires.&gt Slowly moves towards their base.&gt Takes off all clothes.&gt Puts weapons away.&gt "Help me please! I'm being chased by guys with guns and torches! I have high quality metal if you help me!&gt Guy replies.&gt "No go away!"&gt I hear a Irish kid inside saying "Let him in I saw their torches lighting up from around our base."&gt "Yes thats them! They shot me and I'm almost dead! Trust me please I have no weapons. They want to eat me."&gt Irish kid opens the door and lets me in.&gt "Thank you so much. Here's the metal."&gt Gives him metal.&gt Irish kid speaks.&gt "I trust you now don't make me regret it please."&gt "Don't worry I won't."&gt They turn around and begin making a cell.&gt "What's that you're building?.&gt He replies with "your room for your safety".&gt "Fair enough."&gt I head upstairs quickly and authorize myself on his cabinet.&gt He drops some metal on the ground.&gt I pick it up and quickly craft a code lock.&gt The guy who firstly replied to me at the door speaks.&gt "I'm gonna add a food hatch for you in the cell I'm coming into your cell a second."&gt Irish kid shouts.&gt "I dropped my ing metal somewhere do you have it Minus?"&gt "Oui oui"&gt I drop the metal and he enters the cell.&gt Bingo.&gt Run out of cell and pad lock it.&gt Lock them in.&gt Run upstairs and destroy their beds.&gt Irish kid screams.&gt "Wtf you kill yourself I ing trusted you!"&gt I laugh loudly in mic to rustle his jimmies even further.&gt I spam nazi music in mic.&gt Message Conkers in steam to meet me at the coordinates.5 mins later..&gt Conkers knocks on door.&gt I let him in and he runs upstairs to avoid being shot by the kiddies in the cell.&gt He convinces our prisoners that we are going to let them go if they drop their so we can trust them.&gt They do it.&gt We pick it up.&gt We go upstairs and loot their whole house. &gt Craft C4 and blow half their house up.&gt Kid is screaming "I'MMMMMM LAGGGGGING"&gt Conkers shouts "shut the up you disabled "&gt We place C4 in their cell and close the newly installed hatch.&gt Me and Conkers leg it out of their base.&gt We crouch on the hill with my first placed campfire and sit back eating the meat we scavenged off their base.&gt "Isn't this a romantic lunch?" Conkers says.&gt I myself laughing.&gt We finish up our food and hear loud shots from the base.&gt "Let's finish up here".&gt Conkers detonates the C4 in the cell and the whole base goes up in explosions.&gt We see one body fly out of the base into the air.&gt We do a 21 gun salute.&gt Place signs with the players name on and hold a funeral ceremony.Fast forward three weeks..&gt Me and Conkers are in our base.&gt We are just messing around building.&gt We hear a knock at the door.&gt We head to the roof and realize it's a new player.&gt "Can I come in please? I'm looking for a base." says a familiar voice.&gt We let him in under gunpoint and lock him in a cell.&gt We are just walking around on top floor when we hear a gunshot but it didn't faze us.&gt We continue to walk when all of the sudden Conkers is headshotted.&gt I turn around and see the new spawn their with a pistol.&gt Conkers is dead.&gt "Remember me yer ing "&gt It's the Irish kid.&gt I shoot him in the chest with my gun.&gt He is wounded.&gt I act dramatic because it's a semi RP server.&gt "You son of a . You ing You killed my best friend!"&gt He whispers into his microphone gently..&gt "You killed mine."&gt I pull out a revolver and kill him.&gt I head out to the graves me and Conkers had laid and I add a new one with Conkers' name on it.&gt I'm walking towards my base.&gt Boom!&gt Whole base explodes.&gt "What the ?!"&gt Hear a voice behind me.&gt "There was two of us learn to count."&gt I get headshotted and die.This game is genuinely the most fun I have ever played. I have also hosted a prison event on the game if you would like to check out the video here it is.https //www.youtube.com/watch?v uo5kjA_7RNo
title: Rust

review: Look. Rust is far from perferct. Like most games it has it's flaws. The fact is though the devs are constantly working on this game and they really listen to the players. On top of that the community is varied and wild (often in the best kind of ways). This game brings freedom choice and a wildly good time especially if you have a couple of buddies to mess around with. It's even worth it to take a crack at creating your own server. Take it from me if you haven't played rust... grab some buddies or dive in solo and try this game. The only review that matters is your own.

review: The game is fun at first but then it's just a cycle of building raiding. and getting raided. They really don't do much in terms of game changing updates. They've upgraded visuals and they've added new guns constantly but it's the same game with the same cycle and after a few times of having to restart and do the same thing over and over it's not fun anymore. You can play this game for 10 hours and you would have experienced more than enough of what the game has to offer. After years of being in alpha they yet to officially release the game or even fix performance issues. Unless they make a major change and take the game in a new direction I don't think I would ever play it again.

review: At the time of writing this the game relies on EAC (EasyAntiCheat) which seems to be the cause of incompability issues with specific items of hardware. Upon starting the game and completing the initialisation of EAC seemingly random inputs started to happen making any interaction with either the game or any other program impossible until the launcher is force closed. If your hardware supports input macros you might want to check for issues with EAC before buying. Luckily there were other games in the bundle I got this with.

review: All I can say great game. First off this game is basically a simulation of what it would be like if you were put out in the middle of nowhere. Except you have no clothes material or food. All you get is a rock. And add zombies just to make things interesting. Preferably I like to join smaller medium sized servers (15 20 people) just because the risk of dying from another player is low. In my first three runs at the game I was killed from falling off a cliff getting mauled by a wolf and eaten by a zombie. After that I learned to avoid these vicious natural disasters but soon I died from hunger as I could not catch a deer. However on my 5th try at the game I successful killed my first animal built a shelter and fire and began harvesting material at an exponential rate. Now many hours in the bears and wolfs run away from me. The zombies flee to the radiation zones to avoid me. And heights? Well they still killed me once more. But besides that I feel like a man of the wild. There was a day and age when I murdered anyone I saw on sight. But I soon realized that Rust was more than slaughtering your fellow mates. Instead of murdering them I helped them. I gave them wood shelter fire food. And behold they gave me stuff back too. In fact I got my first m4 from a guy that I met down the road. I lived peacefully in the mountains harvesting wood and metal to make my skytower. I had suffiicient food and fire to last for days. I had shotguns machine guns pistols axes and explosive charges all at the ready. Why? I feared a dreadful day would come and those in the wild would invade my home.And I was right.It was a calm afternoon when the attacks first took place. Out in the fields fifty or sixty yards from my front barricade a group of 3 men were roaming. I put out my fire too late. They had noticed the smoke and flames and ventured up to the guarding barrier. "What do you want!?" I yelled down to them overlooking them from the second story of my building. They did not respond. Instead they began climbing the rocks to the side of the barrier and within ten seconds they were over the wall. They ventured up to the wooden spikes that protruded outward and hurt anyone that touched them. "Please go away!" I told them but they insisted on moving foward. Against my knowledge one of them held an F1 Grenade and BOOM! my spiked barrier was done with. I did not hesitate to shoot. As soon as the second barrier was cleared I whipped out my m4 and blasted away. Like ants the three invaders scattered behind whatever they could find. They were out of sight. Unknowingly they snuck behind my house to the back enterance the only door in my house made of wood not metal. Luckily I was only on the second floor and heard them axing away at my door. I sprinted downstairs and took out my shotgun and perched myself right on the otherside of the door. E that is the button to open the door. As soon as I pushed E I fired my shotgun rounds. BAM! BAM! BAM! BAM! It only took four shots to kill the threesome. I quickly rebuilt the door out of metal and then went on the offensive.Their camp was only a few clicks south of my house and by late morning I had arrived. I had struck at the perfect time. It appeared as if the threesome were offline. With my superior pick axe I mowed down their front door. Like the grinch I stole everything they had to offer (most of it was stuff they had stolen from me). They had immense ammounts of metal and wood and gunpowder which would all eventually contribute to the war effort. As quickly as I had raided their house I was quicker to leave. Fleeing back to my house to make the nesscarry defenses. I knew they would come back. A few hours later around late afternoon the party game back to attack. I had not had the neccessary time nor resources to restablish my front barrier but I had managed to fix my spiked wall. Not having a grenade the three person party sought another way to the enterance of my house. Unable to find an alternate route they were forced to change there approach. Instead of going around the barrier why not go over? Behold they built a small ramp that they could get high enough to jump over the spikes. Because of the spike's nature the ramp and jump were a one way trip. Foolish boys I thought as they sprinted toward my front door. I would be able to quickly gun them down especially with the extra ammunition from the earlier raid. My predicitions were correct. My m4 tore down two of them relatively quickly and the third barely reached the door when I shot him in the head. Another successful battle. I went outside to harvest their goods and recover all resources from their dead bodies. Afterward I went back inside and fell asleep feeling rather safe tonight. Boy was I wrong.I had made a serious mistake. A tragic one too. How can a man be so stupid so that he forgets to lock his doors. Yes while I was offline for a bit the threesome came back to find a rather pleasant surprise. ALL THE DOORS TO MY HOUSE HAD BEEN LEFT OPEN! They called it the raid of the century taking everything I had to offer. My weapons gone. My wood and metal gone. My food gone. My rare armor gone. The next morning I nearly threw my computer out the window. But behold I may have lost the battle but not the war. And so I continued to play and rebuild all I knew and loved. That is where we are today. I seek revenge on the house that stole from mine. Wish me luck.

review: Rust. Where do I even begin. For being a "3/10" game according to some reviewers it is an incredible game.Rust is a survival based game where you do whatever it takes to make it to the top of the food chain. With that being said you need to be able to betray kill on sight go deep and everything inbetween. All skills can be brought to the table when it comes to playing Rust.Important things to note are that you need to stay resilient you can't be afraid to die and hit that respawn button to go out and try again you can be afraid to lose what you have if you don't use your guns or best loot you can't progress simple as that. With time comes experience and with experience comes skill. This is a very skill based game with a small mixture of luck. You need to have quick wits to make it to the top of your server.Overall I would highly recommend this game to anyone who asked about it. It is a great experience and I have enjoyed every single hour I've put into learning the game because no matter how much time you have you can always learn something new stay humble you never know what someone can teach you.

review: Naked and Afraid....That's how you feel when you first wake up on the beach. If you lucky enough to have the game running of high settings (not potato friendly) you have an quick opportunity to admire the scenery before sprinting towards the nearest woods or stockpile of some sort to start collecting resources.This hardcore survival game has began...This game will show you no mercy both in the PVE and the PVP.If you not being shot at or having your head smashed in with a rock then you will be attacked by bears boars and wolves.You will have to manage health hydartion and hunger. Don't freeze to death in the snowy mountains or dehydrate in the desert. And watch out for those cacti at night! they pop out of nowhere...There is no tutorial in this game so it requires persistence from you to learn the basic mechanics of the game to hunt eat and build to survive. You will have to learn the hard way unfortunately and it will take you many deaths to get there.But everytime you wake up on that beach or sleeping bag and you realise what went wrong you will continue to get better. Continue to play and you will reap the benefits of knowing how to play the game.You will get raided and killed many times from other players but this is part of the game and soon enough you will be raiding and killing someone else. More than likely you will enjoy it as much as they did.If you really want to improve your game you will be googling wiki'ing and watching many youtube videos to see how to get the most out of this game.Building your base doesn't have to mean a 2X2 with a wooden door. There are many ways to build awesome strong bases and coming up with new base designs to make it harder for raiders can be really fun. There are many resources for this.Playing with friends can bring a few new elements to the game that solo play can't. Soloing has it's place in the game but with friends you can boost each other during raides carry more explosives and rockets for the raides and walk out with more loot from the raides. Playing with friends can be very fun.Don't worry Lone Wolves solo play can also be great.So learn/research the basic mechanicsDevelop those survival skillsContinue to play and improveHelp other players that need help what goes around comes around in this gameHelp a naked out once in a while I'm sure they would appreciate itGood Luck and Have FunHighly recommended

review: This game would be enjoyable if end game wasn't reached in 2 hours by a huge clan who proceeds to run around the map and destroy anyone who is trying to progress. If you find having hours of work destroyed by a clan of 10 in a matter of minutes with no counter play (in most cases) fun then rust is the game for you. Even if you run into a team of people at a similar point in terms of gear if they have a lot more players than you you usually lose even if you're way better than them. At its current state it's fun for a little bit until you realise the repetitiveness of the game and how bigger clans will always win. I wouldn't recommend buying this game at this point unless you intend to play on servers with your friends or small community servers. Or maybe huge clan wars and no lifing is your cup of tea.

review: I have not played this game as much as some of the other people have (currently clocked 167 hours in it) but from what I have seen in this game from both Legacy and the now normal version. The one true word to describe how to survive in this game is Teamwork. If you go at the game solo you die that is just all there is to say. You need a team unless you have a whole day to waste gathering materials and hunting by yourself while praying to your hand rock that the person with the "end game gear" doesn't see you as a threat and put a bullet in your head or a blade to your throat.Rust has many features which make it one of the best games I have played with my friends especially in clan wars. It is able to easily be PVP/PVE because of the challenges in it. Hunger is one of the major survival elements where you can just beat someone you find either dead or asleep with a rock and eat them over a fire (literally) Legacy had it to where you had to brave the radioactive wasteland while hearing gunshots and explosions either nearby or far away looking through the ruins of older civilizations or through the loot buildings hoping to find something of use.Player interaction is one of the most terrifying things you can do in the game. Majority of the time it will end with bloodshed even if you aren't a legitimate threat to the person. I have been lucky enough to find and meet some people who were willing to help those weaker than them by giving them guns and other supplies. You should not try to "Good Samaritan" in this game by helping someone you see dying because the community in Rust is now just a bloodshed in a heartbeat. Even if you do get saved by a random person its just so he can pull either the false security or the bandit card when he helps you get good gear just so he gains more.Raids were made too easy with the stability and decay feature since random parts of your base will despawn/break if you want to focus your life on something other than a base that will fall apart due to decay.The helicopter was an aspect added to Rust to make the PVE system more balanced by having a REAL threat given to the players with the better gear since the heli would target them unless a "lower tier" attacked it. Normally the helicopter arriving would just be used as an "easy pvp" since it will fire rockets at buildings which would outbalance the raiding even more than it should be since people could blow up half your base with a heli and raid you when the event npc decides to leave them alone.The worst aspect of Rust is the community on most (not all) servers. Some people will help you out or offer you shelter for a while if you are lucky. The most common thing that happens when you join a server is someone will join and either hack and kill everyone or you just get hunted down the minute you join by a large tribe/clan. Most of the players will constantly live in fear of everyone that moves/lives. Most of the end tier people who own the huge clans will normally have a "kill or be killed" view on anything but themselves. The now normal version of Rust makes killing people who just joined worth it even more since they drop food (human flesh) and bone fragments which can be used to make armor.Rust has some of the better graphics I have seen from many games making a breathtaking sight before you get a bullet between the eyes or a feast thrown before you and your clan.Don't get this review I made wrong Rust is very fun to play it can be a great experience if you can join a good community server where its a balance of raiders and friendlies. I would have to say Rust isn't worth the money due to the genociding hackers and the overkill armies that just butcher people before they even blink.
title: Rust

review: Right now Rust is a giant mess in my opinion. The interface (particularly when you try to favorite a server) is broken. The new "Play Rust" has some neat graphics but I would much rather have the old rust be the focus. I remember reading once that they wanted to start from scratch and eliminate a lot of extra code they threw in so that it things would be easier. I wish they would have just edited legacy rather than craft this new thing and that's mainly because to me the new interfaces items crafting capabilities and other edited features are confusing. The old Rust was straight to the point interface. Anyways even the old Rust has its clear issues. The game's been in alpha for over a year now and they don't have a hell of a lot to show for it. I'd prefer if Facepunch would be quiet about how many copies they've sold and how well they're doing. Focus on what matters here a little bit. I will not recommend this game to a single soul until it is 1. Playable2. Challenging (because of the game mechanics not bugs)3. Enjoyable4.Operable in AT LEAST most aspects. It is an alpha I get it.Until then if you're deadset on this game wait until the 4 aspects I just mentioned are parts of this game. Until then save your money or spend it on a game that plays and plays well.

review: It's tough to rate up I'm going to but only with the understand that this game will change things later on (it could very easily do so). My first complaint is how unbalanced it is you play long enough get a gun you're automatically more powerful than everyone in existence well the one's that don't have guns anyway. My second complaint is the community horrible and terrible community there are a few good people but the bad ones massively and I mean massively outweigh the good. It's in alpha so unless you have a few dollars to throw away I would suggest waiting until it's more polished. But if you wanna toss some money at the game and help with development have a few friends maybe and don't mind how unbalanced it is and how the community can curently abuse the system to abuse new players then go for it. Now after all this you might ask why am I giving this a good rating? Well because all in all it's a great game communities bad games in alpha so it's not perfect but the caveman style art the graphics the unique touches the devs put into it the beautiful lighting all of that deserves a thumbs up. But remember just because I rated it up doesn't mean it's ready for purchase and it doesn't necessarily mean it isn't I'm going to leave that decision up to you based on the facts I provided you with.Edit On second thought not sure I can upvote this right now it'll probably change in the future when the games more developed. Reasons stated above.Update 1 Recently tested out the 'new' Rust. Still the same mostly graphics changed took a big step back because they needed to rebuild the game and honestly the "rebuilt" version runs far less for me than the original supposedly "broken" version. Ironically the broken version was the most stable imagine that? Anyway until this changes not recommended. Find another game until this one is playable trust me and you'll thank me later.Update 2 Game is still in some aspects. But to be entirely fair the game is a lot better. The devs clearly busted their on this and that's why I think it deserves my up vote and so I changed my vote from down to up. Good job devs!

review: Such gathering much dongers so naked 10/10 good game. You spawn completely naked and only have a stone torches med kit. Sometimes you meet other players that tell you in voice chat that you got a nice and then they shoot you in the face. This will be one hell of a game. With all the upcoming new contents and features it'll sure be a masterpiece. Highly recommend for people who are searching for a survival game in the wilderness. You have a good friend or maybe 2 3 who would like this too? Ask them to enjoy it with you! Together it's much more fun. The first 2 ingame days maybe a pain but with friends you can easily build things up. If you are more the "solo survivalist" no problem! Search for a hidden place maybe behind some big or small mountains where it s unlikely that someone in the next days will come. Build your little shelter for the first ingame week and begin to harvest wood to begin to build you dream survival house. Let s go hunting! First for animals then for humans. Better don't run up the streets the first week without a gun. Things can change very fast.A sunny wood harvest day can easily be a struggle when doing so.But check it out yourself! Résumé Rust is an absolute blast when it comes to a survival game!P.S. You kill pigs for chicken 11/10

review: I have spent a decent amount of time in Rust. Me and my friends made bases defences and weapons. But one day i wake up and find myself trapped in a metal box between my 2 doors. There were code locks on the doors that i never placed. I couldnt open my doors. Building privliges were revoked. Being on a modded server I was able to teleport out and walked for 20min back to my base only to see my friends and I town destroyed. They were killed and their bases demolished. But I was left alive with my base. I telported back into my base and broke down the door using only bone clubs. I find my stuff almost untouched. I search around my base. I find someone sleeping on the 2nd floor. His name was Toast. I looted him and killed him with his own Long Sword. His bed was named Hijacked Base. He kept me as a pet. He should have killed me in my sleep.10/10 would take it personal again

review: This is not a good game. I'm going to get that out of the way at the start. I highly suggest against buying this game. I usually enjoy survival games but this one is not good. Pros * Survival game. I usually enjoy them. Cutting trees mining rocks building a house murdering animals.* Runs well. 70fps on high settings with GTX970 8gb Ram i5 4460 on a HDD.Cons * Awful community. I've been killed on sight while wearing nothing a couple minutes from my spawn maybe 3/4 spawns. I've had one person help me then I logged out and logged in an hour later to see I've lost everything.* Non existant balancing. You spawn in about 1/6th food and water and half health. This means a bow spear sword and machete will one shot you. You have no chance against somebody with any of these. If somebody has one and you don't you lose.* If you get down to low health (5 I think) you get wounded. You can't do anything. You're just stuck until someone heals you or kills you.* Cloth which you need a lot of in the early game is very difficult to find. You have to find marijuana plants which are pretty rare or kill animals. I didn't have pants until I had a decent sized house about 4 hours into playing.* There are no animals. I've killed 4 wolves 3 boars and a handful of deer in my 5 hours. That 5 hours was mostly spent hunting.* If you throw a spear and pick it up it doesn't go in your action bar. It goes in your inventory. This means you have to go into your inventory and move the spear to your action bar if you want to use it. Just annoying.* Voice chat is a bit odd. You have to hold it for a second before it starts picking up your voice. It always cuts off the beginning of what I say.Overall I give it a 3/10

review: Surprisingly good!I bought this game with fairly low expectations All these new early access survival crafting PvP games seem buggy half finished and feature lagging. They were all the same games to me. The graphics are decent but so poorly optimized that even a good mid high end PC suffers massive FPS drops the gameplay becomes repetitive and boring after a few hours and combat is more or less off the table as glitches and lag makes it nearly impossible to enjoy.Even though the game has been out a few years now I recently began to hear positive things about Rust in particular and suddenly started seeing friends playing it. So why not give it a go to at least give the old preconceptions a solid test. Luckily Steam offers a full refund within two weeks of the purchase and as long as you haven't played the game for more than 2 hours so why the hell not try it out?Expecting to play it for two hours to then return it I booted it up found a somewhat random official server with a decent ping and then began to mess around with the graphics settings for an hour trying to optimize it as much as humanly possible. I then played it... And played... And played... And suddenly 6 hours had gone by eliminating my chance of a potential refund. Still with a hint of scepticism and a pinch of regret I then decided to find a proper server to start on for real (wasn't to happy about the one I initially found). I then stumbled upon a guy on the Steam forums who sought players for his new modded server. He seemed pretty cool and genuinely quite friendly so I gave it a go. Fast forward 2 5 weeks (and 92 hours of game time) I am now an admin on this server that has gone from 2 players to about 50 since I joined and I'm ing loving it! The game is fine and has somewhat busted my negative assumptions about it but what really keeps me going is the awesome community we have managed to establish. I log on for the gameplay but I stay for the social aspect. I only just started playing a few weeks ago I have no idea how the game was before then but NOW it runs smoothly on my 3 year old mid high end PC. Combat works not too laggy or glitchy. Gameplay is fairly varied and rewarding. The attention to detail is impressive considering the scale of the game. The game is generally quite intuitive (especially crafting and building) yet elaborate. And the developers seem active and occasionally adds some new features and/or bugfixes even within the short period of time I have played.I really like it. And granted my low expectations from the start I'm very pleasantly surprised about how good it actually is. I haven't really tried any other games that shares the same genres as this but one thing I can say is I definitely recommend Rust. 8/10

review: Great game. People that bi*tch about the community are just that bit*ches. Never played an official server. I swiftly found a server (MSS Noob Friendly) that was easy to make friends but still had action. You don't need your friends to play this game you can find them in game but be hesitant. It's updated very often bi weekly I think. Always adding new cool sh*it/better game play. Never played Rust Legacy and don't care guns are more fun anyway. Getting raided/dying sucks but thats the game. You can literally spend 3 hours gathering crap to start up a home and BAM wolf runs up and mauls your sorry butt. But don't let that lower morale once you get the hang of it you'll be slugging 5.56 ammo and lettin em bounce around in the bears/wolves heads. Building is very simple and satisfying. You can build your base how you want but you'll learn the hard way that you need to honeycomb that fuc*ker up. Not much to the inside of your base in terms of home decor besides paintings/signs but you need most of the room that isn't honeycomb for boxes anyways. (Look up noob videos)PVP is intense and very amusing. Fire fights can and will get INTENSE. Some players try to avoid PVP at all cost. When you die/are getting raided depending on how well you've got yourself going you will feel the heat. It's cool and realistic how you can hear gun fire from pretty far away depending on the type of weapon being fired. You'll know if someones knocking on your door with a MG42 that fuc*ker is loud. You know when someone is getting raided in your area because you WILL hear the explosives going off. Thats when its safe to assume somone is most likely getting r ped and or murdered and probably eaten. Playing on a server that wipes monthly worked well. I would go hard and if I got fu*cked or fuc*ked over I wait until next wipe to start fresh. No big deal. Overall have had fun with this game its really promising. I can see myself continuing to come back to it on and off in the future. It's a bang for the buck for sure.

review: I've installed the game started it logged into first server looked around trying to figure out what to do...After a minute or so I've discovered how to open up inventory there I've found out that my character is butt naked female. This is so triggering to me as a snowflake kin this is to me like someone branding me with a branding iron.0/10 unplayable.Okay... I'll be serious I've had this in my library for some time now and I've finally decided to try it out. After I've logged into the game for the first time I've noticed something. The hand animation and model felt really weird and after couple minutes I've find out that my character is female so that might've been a reason for my brain putting it into uncanny valley or it was just the weird animation not sure... still makes it hard/weird/odd... to play this game for me.Why doesn't wooden hammer do any damage? I've accidentally hit my finger with hammer while gardening couple times in past and it does causes damage. Hitting something with wooden hammer should cause it damage. But in Rust it doesn't.Since the game doesn't provide any guide at the start I've went in with a minecraft ish mindset bashing trees with a rock worked bashing rocks with a rock worked but bashing animals with rock for food didn't worked too well and I got killed.Since I wasn't able to gather any food from plants and the hunger bar was getting too low I gave up on this.I don't know if it's my experience from other games or "instinct" but this game just didn't ticked with me.Outside of this I've found it odd that the game is having big frame rate drops at times for me on 1080p running at the "Fantastic" Graphics Quality settings since the actual graphics and physics don't seem to be that complex. I'm running i7 6700 with GTX 970 ( 1528MhZ) and 16GB of RAM. During those times the gpu usage just goes down and the cpu usage stays as it was when there weren't issues present so my guess is just a poor optimalization of loading new stuff in.

review: Product received for free. Rust.Absolutely fun! you get to claim your own little peice of land and build your own house/base. The new xp system is great. I think it needs improvment but i like it a lot more than i did the blueprint system that i got to play for a short while. When you start out with a rock and a torch naked on a beach I didn't know what to do. i was taught the basics and got comfortable with everything. my first pvp fight my heart was pounding in my chest. needless to say i lost but it was still a good experience. Fun game would recommend it highly.Some issues i've noticed. Decay can be really painfull.If you have all the time in the world to play the game you can become king of the hill. If not you get by as best you can.Team based game solo is tough.

review: I've bought this game however a few days before June the game stopped working. It'll hang on "Receiving Data" and you cannot load into a map at all. I'm already got a thread going on with multiple users experiencing the same thing. We've tried everything possible at our ends to fix this and we've even contacted the developers. However they do not care at all. They give us the same method to try but it does not work and when you reply to them explaining how their idea did not solve the problem they will not answer you anymore. This probably has been around for a very long time I've opened a ticket on the 2nd of June and a week later sometimes on the 9th they gave us this "good for nothing" solution. It's been 2 months and still haven't heard back from them. The game is unplayable and therefore I DO NOT RECOMMEND this game to anyone because once you pay there' s good chance you'll never be able to play eventually. I too was able to play for 2 weeks or so and then no more. It's a shame and really disgusting how these developers value their customers. It's repulsive and I'll always remember that Facepunch Studios cannot be trusted.

review: Don't buy it now if you got it a few years ago then you got it at the right time. Used to be a fun game to play with your friends or alone you could play a couple of hours a night have some fun and get some weapons and do some raids. Now by the time you have managed to make your first C4 your wife will have left you the dog will have died and that white pair of underwear you haven't changed in a week because you were out farming high quality metal ore 2 bits at a time are now stained so yellow/orange they could be confused with Donald Trump swimming in fanta. This is all fine if you're a vampire or something you have a millenia of time on this planet so whats a few hundred hours a month building houses to find a hacker has blown it up and destroyed everything you owned you can just start again no real dent in your life. Also how anyone can stand the loading times to get onto a server is beyond me. Just the other day I managed to plant pick and bake a potato in the time it took to get onto a server only for the game to crash as soon as I woke up. Anyway I guess I'd recommend it if you are a single unemployed vampire with a lifetiem supply of underwear and a love of potatoes. Otherwise go play something else.

review: &gt Decided to get back into Rust&gt Remembered that Legacy is down&gt blam! I hate New Rust&gt Oh Well might as well give it a shot again&gt Holy they really fixed a lot with this&gt Plays for about two weeks&gt Lots of betrayal drama raiding and hilarity&gt Haven't enjoyed Rust this much since early 2014&gt Group up with clan of decent people&gt Fight other clans&gt Losing&gt Pretty much single handedly unite several clans to take on massive Russian clan&gt Most raids on bases consist of four or five people at the most&gt Our raid has about twenty five&gt Nothing is left of Russians&gt We own so much of the Island that nobody can get close enough to us without being seen and dismantled&gt Run a fair kingdom where the keep owners of various clans protect the noobs in return for their labor&gt Sever wipes&gt Mad scramble for position on map&gt Absolutely no communication&gt Take initiate and run towards resource spawns to create a forward supply base&gt See noobs building and decide to kill them&gt Friend and I sneak up and and knife a dude to death before dueling 2v1 against a naked dude with a spear&gt Kill the guy cut the dead up use their body fat to make fuel start melting resources down into usable parts.&gt Steal house fortify it hold it down for nearly 10 hours&gt The morning comes and the Russians raid several outposts including mine&gt My base doesn't fall all the way everybody rallies towards my base&gt Everybody busts gathering to take out the Russians&gt Lack of leadership creates slow process which ultimately leads to us being bombed into dust&gt Call for emergency meeting refute government of current clan&gt Call of elections and power reform&gt Get voted into top leadership position&gt Create a system of checks for me where two other people in power can override my decision. &gt Reform group retreat across map with as much stuff as we can&gt Build tower on small island&gt Unite the as of then unknown factions in securing our section of the map&gt Meet about twenty people who built an honest to God village about 1500 meters from us (practically our own back yard)&gt Call their place "Peace Town"&gt Place has a market hotels homes rain catches farms and even a friggen courthouse where they decide on laws and hold town meetings&gt Before we can formalize an alliance a small clan attacks us&gt Small clan sieges our base on Island&gt Meanwhile Russians continuing their advance across the map as they slowly destroy everything and assimilate it into their farming network&gt Get raided for the second time that week despite holding the enemy off for several waves&gt Rationalize that the only way so much material could be used is if unknown enemy clan is fighting for Russian clan&gt Realize they're about to own the entire server&gt Begin to call in every favor I'm owed from various allied and neutral clan&gt Each one is engaged by unknown forces that are incredibly well armed&gt Island Tower (which we had began to call Alcatraz) gets sacked by a small group of people who had next to nothing an hour ago&gt Kid in said group claims to be a "Mercenary"&gt What an idiot&gt Intentionally griefs our base&gt Realize its late call up group running Peace Town to let us crash while we rebuild&gt Finalizing treaties and preparing to hand off control to other members when the village is attacked&gt Rockets flying everywhere&gt Somebody offers me shelter and I take it&gt Somebody lets it slip in the server that people have discovered a glitch that lets you duplicate items&gt Explains everything that has happened so far&gt Watches as people are firing rocket launchers at log cabins&gt People are PvPing with rocket launchers&gt Leader of the Northern (Russian) front gets into teamspeak to tell us he has unlimited rockets&gt All hell breaks loose across the server&gt Everybody has rocket launchers&gt Naked people are firing rockets at each other&gt Night time darkness is penetrated by the streaks of rockets flying everywhere&gt Massive bases crumble as everything is blown to hell&gt All the members of the Peace Town fight back with their own dupe rockets&gt Dupe raiders build a two story wooden homes to fight from in North Peace Town&gt South Peace Town fortifies several small shacks into a one big fort&gt Everything in between is caught in a crossfire of incendiary AK barrages and Rocket volleys &gt Peace Town is being torn apart by the war&gt Water Catches are in shambles&gt The Courthouse has massive holes in it&gt Rocket crashes into the big hotel and guts it revealing Peace Town members hiding&gt Dupe Bandits hose them down without mercy&gt Can hear the screams of men and women as they desperately try to get away&gt None get out of the hotel alive&gt House I was hiding in takes a stray rocket and blows a hole in the side&gt I walk out and witness the carnage in the streets&gt Bodies everywhere&gt fires blazing from incendiary rounds&gt Few survivors left are running&gt Three armored bandits round a corner and hose me down&gt Screen fades to black as I hear somebody screaming "They're breaking in THEY'RE BREAKING I *BOOM*And that is why even when totally broken Rust can be amazing.
