review: It has been a really really long time since I played a game for ten hours straight juste because I was into it a lot. Although Rust is in alpha it already is highly playable and a lot of fun. Yes it does not forgive any mistake (like saying peacefully hello to an armed player D) but once you've learned how its world works and once you've make yourself a cosy place to peacefully think about your world domination plans it really gets on.The first time you break into a player's badly secured house to raid it (instead of actually being the poor victim) you can only enjoy it. Well until it's your turn to be chased !A bunch of fun especially when playing with a friend and rejoining somewhere on the map.It really has a huge potential to make a very entertaining but at the same time quite hard survival game.I just can't wait to see what further updates will bring to this game which is already playable with fun (the only thing is maybe a little emptyness but again this is only an alpha so it's rather impressive what we can already do !).A must have or a "must have in the future" if you're afraid of purchasing an early in development game.

review: Product received for free. I truly gave this game a solid chance.Gameplay wise Rust is incredibly fun. Updates feel meaningful and transformative making players excited when new content is released. Micro transactions only affect cosmetics. This game really ticks all the right boxes.Some of the best moments in rust come from the tension trapped in your shoddy little shack whilst people scramble outside trying to find a way in travelling home with an inventory full of resources jumping at every shaddow. This game lives and dies on the players immersion. Immersion is a core and key tennet in a survival game because obviously survival only matters if you care about the thing you're preserving i.e. the character. This is Rust's MAJOR mistake.Forcing me as a white man (AKA the scum of the earth) to play as a dainty little asian girl really does not instill in me a sense of self preservation. Every time i open the menu I see her and am reminded that it is not me hiding inside that shack it is not me vulnerable outside with an inventory full of resources...it's this asian girl. Suddenly I'm not so afraid suddenly im not so immersed.If the lack of character customisation was simply a consequence of this game being in early access then I could understand but the developers have expressly said that it was a design choice. Their reason? Because if a player goes on a rampage and kills people they dont want him to be able to change his model and re enter the world incognito. Fair enough. Almost a good answer. Of course it doesn't take a genius to ask the question "Why can't we customise our character upon first launching the game then have that player model locked to our steam ID?". It's not really rocket science is it?Really it's just lazy game design. Lazy programmers. "Rust is not a game about identity. The objective in Rust is to survive." Garry Newman. Well i can do that without your software. I 'survive' everyday. I survive everyday IRL so that I can continue to do fun things. So to what end do I survive in your game? If survival is the sole purpose of the game what gives that survival meaning? We play games so that we can simulate environments and scenarios that we cannot experience normally. The beauty of a simulation is that we can define and customise the parameters. Why take away choice? Why reduce the effectiveness of your simulation by arbritrarily limiting its potential parameters? Maybe I'm wrong. Maybe immersion doesn't matter in a survival game. Maybe I'm the only person who thinks this is an issue. If you read IGN Gamespot or any other gaming journalists you will certainly be instilled with the sense that you are being unreasonable and are part of a small vocal minority. This is obviously a very effective political technique called 'spiral of silence' (worth a google). In a time where complaining about being a girl in a video game WILL be called sexist where complaining about being black WILL be called racist I'm not too surprised at the silence. The truth is I think it's a bigger deal to players than you may think. It's quite stupid to say (as Garry Newman did) "We're more concerned with the opinions of people actually playing the game". Surely the best thing for the game AND its players is a larger playerbase? If ALL the people currently playing aren't bothered by the forced gender and race (which is not at all the case) then surely they would not be bothered by the customisation either? But adding customisation would remove what is currently a huge barrier between the game and its potential market. By demanding people play without "identity" you're effectively telling roleplayers to go themselves. What sort of player is left after you remove roleplayers from a survival simulator? PVPers. That is the current state of rust. All the players want to do is kill each other. They don't care if they die they don't care if they have an awesome base they just want gun play. Which is stupid because there are better games for that. So there you go roleplayer player base declining because of lack of immersion PVP playerbase declining because there are better shooters out there(cough cough with character customisation).Rust Great game terrible developers dwindling player base. Not worth it.

review: Alright people I have a lot of reasons why I do not recommend this game but I will remind you right here A I did not want this game I wanted something to do with my clan mates that isn't just TF2 because I am sick of TF2.B I had this game bought for me and gifted to me by Lamb so I could play with said clan mates.So let's jump right into it shall we?1. I enjoy the creativity in this game. A lot of houses I made I ended up getting lost in because I made it so big.The things you can do in this game WILL sink a lot of hours however. If you do not have the time for a game that will more than likely generate 20+ hours you WILL NOT want to purchase a game like this.2. I hate the idea of Early Access. If I get banned from Steam for saying that I really don't care. I have 100 games but I will let ALL of that go to waste on this opinion that I have about Early Access. If your game aint finished and you don't have faith in your product GET SPONSORS! If you are just starting on your own two feet Take even more time and even try create a website for yourself advertise in places like Youtube Facebook and many other revenues if you cannot get on Steam.The reason why I hate Early Access so much is that it seems to promote buying a game before it is even finished. I HATE that idea. It gives off the vibe that "I don't have enough faith in my game that a concept that has been done already I don't think I can pull it off as well as the game I am using my ideas for". To me it gives off the vibe of "Give me money before this game is out and I MAY or MAY NOT release it". I want a sure thing. I want to buy full games and DEMAND refunds for them when they are bad. I don't want half a game. I don't want bite sized pieces. I want a game in its entirety. If you don't know what you are doing with the game and you are releasing it bits at a time I CANNOT trust you. Now let me remind you I had this game bought and gifted to me. I had no real interest in the game other than for something to play with my clan mates.3. Whether this game is Early Access or not they still haven't learned how to "destroy structures properly".Sometimes they glitch out and stay there and you cannot destroy them or do ANYTHING with it. Sometimes the wall or roof will glitch through the floor when it is being deleted and insane tearing will occur. I expect 2015's standard for games to AT LEAST be competent. Crysis 3 was out in 2013 (alas not on steam) but revolutionizes graphical fidelity balancing replayability and integrity. That was 2 years ago... (yeah it was a different kind of fps but it has guns in it like Rust so it's still a first person SOMETHING.) Has humanity not learned since then? Have people not observed and noted that "2003's graphics are 2003 standards not 2015 standards? Perhaps I have too much faith in humanity then...4. A MAJOR issue a flaw of the game becomes the main reason why I refuse to play this game any further. Rust updates itself literally everyday. With tweaks patches major bug fixes additions sometimes stuff you never see. The ONE gripe I have is this. They refuse to stabilize their coding when it comes to generating maps.I spend nearly 10 hours on the clan server I am affiliated with on my house with containers sleeping bag food storage entrances and exits walls to rooftops windows to doors all the knick knacks and patty wacks you can think of I spend a fair while on it being OCPD and all manipulating the environment and surroundings around me destroying and rebuilding to get the perfect house done right.1 day of a patch was all it took for the coding of generating maps to change therefore it resets EVERY MAP KNOWN TO MAN THEREFORE ERASING ALL MY HARD WORK!This FRUSTRATES ME TO NO END! All that accumulated knowledge ideas planning structural integrity ALL OF IT gone down the public restroom in a matter of minutes of downloading an update. It has happened 5 times now and I refuse to support a game any longer that wipes people's progress at the drop of a hat.If you are an OCPD like me you will do the public a solid and NOT play this game. It drove me up the wall and it will to you too. I don't even think on official FULL release this game will even satisfy most people. Unlike others I had no trouble with hackers because I only played on the clan server group I am with so no worries there but when you break the creativity flow and freedom EVERY TIME YOU UPDATE my patience will wear thin and I will stop supporting your game and your bad practices. I will recommend that opinion to my friends as well.Do NOT buy this game. Not now not before and not in the near future. Do NOT buy early access games. You encourage developers to be lazy with their work and lazy with their customers. Do not support this game and its development when the developers say themselves and I quote "Some things work some things don't. We haven't totally decided where the game is headed so things will change. Things will change a lot. We might even make changes that you think are wrong."I'm sorry but when your idea of "making things that you think are wrong" are "glitching pieces of wall floor and roof freaking out into the floor causing massive tearing" and "wiping your creations and maps out every update" well you get no sympathy or support from me when your "plans" fall flat on their face because you had no idea what you were doing and executed it poorly.**Edited 19 Jan 2016** So looking at the store page again it's been a while since I played the game but now I can say for certain I do NOT support a game who does micro transactions while STILL in early access alpha.
title: Rust

review: The first thing you must know about this game is simply the fact it is in ALPHA. That means there is very little do do in Rust at the moment but what you can do is fun. You are playing with and in most cases against other players to survive and gather/horde as much materials or weapons in your base as possible with as many people as possible. Read what a game is about before buying it. You start off with nothing but a few bandages a rock and torches. You need to use your rock to gather a few stone and wood to make a stone hatchet before you start doing anything else. Once you have your stone hatchet your life is 300% easier as far as gathering materials you can now take on a single wolf by yourself with that hatchet to gather what food cloth and if your lucky animal fat you will need to start off with. You will need to use a few bandages but that is what they are there for right? I then recommend before doing anything finding a secluded area to build a wooden shelter and the materials needed to make a stone furnace a workbench to craft faster and a metal door. Make a campfire and cook some meat to eat then you simply need to make a bow and a few arrows to gather the rest of the cloth or animal fat and hope you can find the rest of your metal ore. You will need 80 100 metal ore 300 wood for planks and 30 40 wood for fuel in your furnace to make a single foundation wooden house with your much needed metal door. Wooden doors can be destroyed by axes while metal doors need 2 3 explosive charges or 11 13 F1 Grenades to break and can not be destroyed by anything other than explosives. Grenades roll down slopes so add foundation to your base to add a ramp as well. Base building is not all that hard you can figure it out. Resource piles are your friends. You will find 3 different kinds of rocks they will be in fields and once identified you will be able to pick them out no problem. Each rock gives more of a specific rock resource than other rocks but will contain all three in most cases. Next are piles of logs these will be your best friend each has 80ish wood in the pile. Much better than 1 2 wood at a time off a tree right? You will also notice in some areas an odd static like sound will play that sound means that area is effected by radiation. These areas are your second best friend you will be killing radiation animals and looting buildings or any crates you find for materials or more importantly blueprints. Rad animals drop most of what you need and ammo the crates will drop research kits and guns. Use a research kit by a workbench with anything you are unable to craft and you will be able to craft it afterwords hold shift and use it on another research kit to make one that has 3 uses. The rest I leave up to you the Rust Wiki will cover all item uses and what is currently available.Experimental In the Experimental version everything looks promising still easy to troll the community however. There are only bare basic features and visual updates on the Bolt Action Rifle Axe Rock Cloth Shirt Pickaxe and animal/player models. It may be my card but you can barely see players unless they are 5 feet in front of you otherwise you see chunks of the model and what they are carrying. Wood structures fall apart when they are destroyed as of now they are blue blocks. You can place walls without a foundation and before you can build it you lay down a plan that looks like the start of laying down dry wall. Afterwords you use a hammer on it to finish the structure. Other than that stones and furnaces look the same you need stone to build a few things no metal just yet so furnaces are just kind of there. You can swim but do not drown yet and they added thirst that you can not quench. Lastly they updated UI and landscape as well so far so good but there is barely anything to do besides KOS and build walls. You spawn with a bow four arrows 200 ammo for your Bolt Action Rifle a shirt one chicken a campfire and an Axe. You can build a Pickaxe Furnace bone knife wood foundation walls and pillars.

review: Early access game showed a lot of promise but as of August 2014 has been overshadowed by other similar early access games which show more promise (7 days to die Landmark ...). Rust has delivered a constant stream of development updates and they continue to work on the game. So any money spent buying the game seems to yield improvements. At the current state however it's a lackluster building game with a boring grind of resource hunting. The crafting system is minimally developed. And at any time someone can shoot you blow up your house and take away all your many hours of resource hunting. I havent read the developers blog about the intentions of where this game is going but with the steady stream of improvements it has the potential of becoming awesome. I'm mixed on whether to recommend it or not but as is it's not enjoyable to play for any length of time.
title: Rust

review: Oh my this game is an adventure that's for sure.This is one of the few early access games that will see daylight. Ever since it hit early access it has continuously been worked on by the beautiful dev's of Facepunch Studios. This game started as a zombie survival game with radiation. Now zombies are out of the game and won't make a return radiation is only a mechanic in BR and they have recently added a xp system. The game has improved and will continue to do so. This game is a survival game where you face off animals and other players. It has a building system where you can create strong bases to hold your equipment and for a place of safety it has base raiding a recently introduced xp system and it is the best survival game on steam as of now. The xp system was added a few days ago and has its problems. However it is being worked on and they are continuing to add things to the game and balance things. Graphically this game is amazing but it is also taxing to run on even high end hardware. As a solo player this game can be quite infuriating at times since people will make large clans but in time you can gather xp and craft weapons and armor to get payback on the folks who kept killing you. This game has a big sense of progression. You start off with a rock and as you level up you end up with full sets of armor and a highly varied range of weapons. This game will give you some of the best gaming and social experiences you will ever have.TL DR It's highly worth it. You will get a lot of hours out of this game and the dev's consistently add new content to this game and listen to their fans. Please give it a shot. Convince your friends to get the game and play it together. It will be worth it.

review: There is no single Player to this game at all. I would not count that against this game if the community wasn't so toxic. Here is how my play session went. Spawned was killed immediately killed by another player who had also just spawned. (Killing a freshly spawned player gets you close to nothing.)Spawned again. Ran around looking for food for over 20 minutes. Found 1 mushroom which did little to help. Did not see a single animal to hunt and died of starvation.Spawned yet again. Finally found a chicken after being chased by another player for about 5 minutes. Killed chicken. Finally found some stone to make proper tools. Finally found a few deers and hunted them successfully. Made Pants cooked food moved on. That took roughly 45min to accomplish.20 minutes go by while looking a place to live away from players. Mining a rock. Out of nowhere a player takes shots at me. I run tell him I don't want any trouble. Guns me down anyway. Dead restart from scratch.If you are playing with friends then it is probably great. For people that tend to play by thereself most of the time like me should stay as far away from this game as possible. Even tho I got this game for 50% off I would still rather have my money back for the time being.

The red or orange coating that forms on the surface of iron when exposed to air and moisture consisting chiefly of ferric hydroxide and ferric oxide formed by oxidation.2. any film or coating on metal caused by oxidation.3. a stain resembling this coating.4. any growth habit influence or agency tending to injure deteriorate or impair the mind character abilities usefulness etc.5. Plant Pathologyany of several diseases of plants characterized by reddish brownish or black pustules on the leaves stems etc. caused by fungi of the order Uredinales.also called rust fungus. a fungus causing this disease.any of several other diseases of unknown cause characterized by reddish brown spots or discolorations on the affected parts.6.reddish yellow reddish brown or yellowish red.verb (used without object)7. to become or grow rusty as iron.8. to contract rust.9. to deteriorate or become impaired as through inaction or disuse.10. to become rust colored.verb (used with object)11. to affect with rust.12. to impair as if with rust.13. to make rust colored.adjective14. having the color rust.OriginOld English rūst of Germanic origin related to Dutch roest German Rost also to red.

review: You either die a hero or live long enough to become the villian.This agme is a slippery slope and there are very few people I know that remained at the top and I commend them. This game is pure evil it will warp you into a sick and twisted shell of a person you once were. It is a literal social experiment of a post apocolyptic area. Let me go into more detail. I started out rust like every othe beginner optomistic and enthusiastic. I worked hard gathered resources and had fun. Eventually when I met some other players I was excited and was killed on the spot and looted. Rinse and repeat a few more times you cant trust other people. I worked hard and built my base to only be raided every day and start from square one. Eventually the constant stress of making it to my body to get back my stuff the base raiding and the all around distrust of the players got to me. I too became a raider I would kill people on the spot and steal there stuff break into there bases and decieve beginners. This one time these new kids asked me to make them an ak47. They gave me the materials and let me into there house which was a big mistake. Once I made the ak47 and the ammo I proceeded to kill them all and take everything in there base and also destroying there respawn points and locking them out of their house. This is the kind of that happens in rust. Save yourself the time and dont become an evil person like me. Eventually I quit and now 8 months later I am back to normal. Heed my warningDO NOT BUY THIS GAME!!!

review: Rust. Where do I begin with Rust. Well I've been addicted since I purchased the game although that might not be universal. When you begin playing Rust you find yourself naked on an enormous island with a rock a torch and two bandages. From there you have to brave the wilderness the smoldering irradiated remains of human society and other survivors. At the very start your objectives become little more than self preservation. The basic needs of food and shelter (and therefore cooked chicken. Everything tastes like chicken in Rust). Then you meet another person. Or if you're unlucky a group of 6 men wearing kevlar vests and carrying assault rifles. Although the game is a "survival game" where you need to gather food and other materials to survive it is really one about human interaction. Meeting another player is an experience that can be defined in many ways. It depends on the interaction. It can be really friggin' wierd. It can be violent exhilarating and unfortunate (being beaten to death with a rock is not pleasant). Or you can make a new friendly neighbor or a new teamate to base with. Losing loot that you invested a significant amount of time gathering due to raiders or bandits can be frustrating at first but it is eventually something you learn to cope with and recover from quickly. You learn how to get even. The building system is also fairly good despite the few oddities that exist (pillars are indestructable?). The irradiated towns provide the chance to find and learn to create higher tier gear. So far the game is looking pretty good in my opinion. 10/10. However I do recommend that you play with a group of friends. Not only does a group give you a greater edge against hostile players it also increases the hilarity that ensues within the game and is generally just more fun. EDIT The above review refers to the "Legacy" version of Rust which is still my prefered version at this point in time. Much do to the fact that it is the one I am most familar with. I prefer it for other reasons as well there are certain features that I enjoy that are not currently implemented or are not implemented in the same fashion in the current version of Rust. However the current version has its merits and there are many good things about it including it being much prettier and having procedural map generation. Both versions of the game are available to play with the purchase of Rust and both versions have many many servers full of players every day. Regardless of which Rust you think you will enjoy I highly recommend this game. Still a favorite &lt 3. 10/10

review: I've played this game a lot over the 2013 winter holidays. As of writing this the game is still in an early Alpha build. Rust is an addicting game. There's a constant urge to gather/craft/horde resources to further progress your place in the world. Servers are persistent. Your base and all of its belonging are subject to raids 24/7. It s the closest thing to a PvP oriented Sandbox MMO since EVE A difficult comparison to draw considering Rust is an FPS game and not an MMO. However server can be as large as a few hundred simultaneous players and the player structures are persistent so in that sense Rust accomplishes the same feeling without actually being an MMO.Conditions are harsh. Just surviving the environment can be a difficult task and the first few hours of gameplay will be spent just learning to stave off hunger the cold and natural predators. Survival quickly shifts to the political nature of your neighbors. Do you trust no one and hope the rest of the world overlooks you? Or will you align yourself with a group for mutual protection? There is no right or wrong way to play. The choices you make very much impact the server you live on. The content in this game is purely from the interaction of players. In that regard the game is fully playable and enjoyable even in Alpha. Having said that there is much more to look forward to as the game evolves to extend depth in every mechanic that drives the gameplay. Improvements to gathering crafting maintaining items building defending researching I can only see this game getting even better over time.
title: Rust

review: Probably the greatest potential for a game and the highest opportunity for the game to evolve into something special and unique. Truly a diamond in the rough for sure. Looking forward to seeing where this game goes in the future I know I'll be part of it.Edit July 1 2014I don't play the game as much as I use to now. Hopefully with the new rebuild that Garry and crew are working on I will be reinvegerated to conserve as many resources and build another house that will probably get raided. But all in good fun ).Edit Feburary 20 2018The game is released after years in development and after a two year hiatus I have picked it up again and I'm updating my review. Like I said earlier the game grew on its huge potential and provided a very unique experience. There are a lot of Survival/crafting/building games out there since 2013 but all of them fall to the might that is Rust.Rust is a polished game and a lot of people will condemn it for brining a "unfinished game" outta Early Access. I normally counter this argument by saying why would a developer put a finished game in Alpha?Anyways the game is polished and even better it feels balanced. I feel like a player and his 5 friends can still be on the same level as a group of 10 people because of the changes made. They improved map generation by putting in certain aspects of the game that forces players to roam and pvp more often (one of the early complaints in 2015 was there wasn't enough of this). They provided probably the best way to tech up in the game and it has end game. Raiding and roaming in Rust has never been better.Highly recommend this game.

review: It really ing sucks working on a house for hours only to get killed in your sleep or have your house despawn after an unannounced wipe. I just got done rebuilding a house for a few hours with a friend This was after we built a huge base the night before only to lose it to a wipe.Llogged off for a bit only to come back and find two s in my house and get told "raiding was allowed" What the is the point in me even trying to make anything interesting when i'll either lose all of it to a wipe or have it ing stolen by trolls who just roam raid.I will not be touching this game again any time soon until content or fixes get added to change the gameplay. Putting time in like this only to get on isn't ing worth it.TLDR Rust is fun but nothing you do matters for long you will build something awesome only to be robbed or lose your structure entirely. this game for the forseeable future.

review: Honestly when I first got it I played it to hell and back and had a lot of fun! But it got to a point where I stopped playing because I overplayed (If you don't know what that is it's when you play a game so much to the point where you don't even want to play it anymore). So I stopped playing it for a couple of months until my friend told me to hop on it with him. Holy mother of god they ed this game up. They made the gun mechanics absolute It used to take skill to spray somebody. You used to need a decent understanding of how the guns worked. You used to not be able to spray and pray. Welp that isn't the case nowadays. An experienced player versing a complete nooby to the game has a 50/50 win lose chance. The game used to favor those who actually took the time to learn it without giving the new players so much of a disadvantage to where they wanted to stop playing but that has changed. The devs introduced an update that made it to where you can now build anything on anybodys land. Tool cupboards are placed down to give building privilage saying that anybody within a certain radius isn't allowed to build unless they get privilage. But now for some odd reason the devs made it to where you can build foundations stairs platforms and practically anything you want even when you don't have privilage. This makes it to where if there is a high wall in front of your base it is pretty much worthless since a noob can go get 500 wood come back and build over it. This is probably the worst thing that they could've done to the game. Now it's gotten to the point where you can hop onto a server play for about an hour and have a base and everything built have raidable tools and everything 4 hours later raid a ton of people go to sleep wake up the next day and your base is gone and you have been killed. Now you are back to where you started when you woke up last night. Rinse and repeat every day. So unless you want to stay up 24/7 protecting your base constantly there isnt even a point of coming back to that server the next day since all your hard work is probably gone. Now I know people are going to say "well they just raided your base it's a part of the game" and to that I say yes it is a part of the game but it shouldn't be that easy to do. I have a pretty decent computer. It's a CybertronPC Patriot with 64 gigs of ram an 8 core processor and an Nvidia GeForce GTX 1080 graphics card (I know I have no life xD). But I still have trouble running it at anything above graphic level 3 out of 5 without having it frame studder frame drop or just run like all around. I wouldn't say it's "poorly" optimized but it should be better than it is for as long as the game has been out. So if you are playing on a gaming laptop I would probably pass on getting this game.All around it's become complete I wouldn't recommend this game to anyone at least not in it's current state. So until the devs pull their heads out of their asses and get their together I would hold off on buying this game. Go spend that 20$ on candy at your local gas station because it'll be more rewarding than buying this game.
title: Rust

review: Most people are saying that this game isn't finished yet and that they haven't even scratched the surface of what they want to do but if the game were to release right now it could be considered a finished product. Thats how good the alpha is. Don't think twice you'll love this game the moment you play it but only after putting in the right graphic settings. Its not optimized for machines which is why it runs like crap but the commands to increase FPS make it worthwhile. My computer isn't that great and runs rust at 10/12 FPS but the game feels like it runs at 60 FPS.

review: I have never seen a game look so terrible (graphics wise) and still not be optimised to play on. Don't even think about buying this game if your thinking about running it on a Macbook or graphics hardware that is older then a year. It looks like minecraft but runs worse then crysis maxed out. I have 512mb of graphics 8Gb Ram 2.7GHZ Cpu and I'm getting 1 Frame every 5 seconds...what a joke. Dayz then Warz 7 days to die and now this. I hope you indy companies learn to make a decent game soon because you are loosing the community that made you! I better be able to get my money back from this one.
title: Rust

review: I think Rust is an amazing game. It's my favorite game so far I never had so much fun in my life playing a game. I am playing Rust for a long time now and I will still probably play it for a long time. I remember old Rust days when servers were full and number of total players on Rust was insane high. I was playing with many groups made a lot of friends and laugh a lot. It was really awesome.About the new Rust. I tried it and I can't really say I don't like it. It is really good looking and they are updating it every week so I think the new Rust will be amazing when it will be done but for now I prefer playing legacy Rust. In my opinion PvP is much better in legacy than in the new Rust also most known players that are good stayed on legacy.There is a lot of cheaters in legacy Rust but if you join the right server with active admins you shouldn't have problems with that. So far I didn't see any hackers on the new Rust and it looks really promising. I think that developers decision about not updating legacy Rust anymore is kinda a bad thing since it's really awesome but that's how it is.After all this game is really awesome legacy and new Rust. It is totaly worth to buy this game you won't regret it. So far it is the best game I ever played in my life. I would rate it with 9/10!

review: Went out of my house to hunt and on the way found what seemed like a new player. I pulled out my torch and said " Peace! ". However he told me " i has rock and i can rhape you ". At that moment I started panicking then I told him not to kill me or I wouldn't tell him where all my supplies were hidden. Then he was like "ok show quick or i kill you " . Then he kept spamming me to come while I tried to remember the location of my secondary house so I replied with " OMG I CANT SEE YOU WHERE ARE YOU OMGG! ". Then I told him to follow me. I led him to my wood shelter opened the door and he quickly went inside to see what goodies awaited. Calmly shutting the door behind and letting him scream as he dies a slow death I went back to my mansion to enjoy a few more chicken breasts. 10/10.
title: Rust

review: hmmm Rust where to start such a amazing game after playing 100+ hrs on it it still isnt boring sure it gets repetive but when it starts feeling repetive go to a different game then come back in about 30min and then it shouldnt be as boring but what i find myself doing a lot is starting on a new server every little while when i get bored on one server or get raided or just wanna have fun ). I have had so many good experiences like one time i raided a guy who had 1 wood door and then replaced it with a metal one so he couldnt get out and made him my prisoner and then i said to him "are u hungry and would u like food if so what food do u want" he then replied with "charcoal" for some reason so i gave him his request then he starved to death ( there goes my prisoner/buddy lol. but if u are looking at buying the game dont give up in the first couple of hours because someone killed u. If this happens then just join a less popular server or just keep playing till you get better trust me its not hard to pick up on how to play so i would give this game a 9/10 because this game can go alot further with the realism and i think when its out of alpha it will be amazing and would get a 20/10. Ive been playing rust for about a month or two now and still loving it and still play it every day

review: The first hundred hours of Rust for me was pretty fun. It was a little bit of a learning experience for sure. When I first started I played with the "I'm going to be friendly to everyone" mentality only to find out that it will get you no where. In Rust it's hard to find a good alliance of people unless you bring in your own. There are a good variety of servers to choose from and I personally prefer the vanilla servers.When it comes to combat if you have little to no experience in FPS games on a keyboard and mouse set up you're gonna have a really rough time. When I came into Rust I had roughly 300 hours of keyboard and mouse FPS experience but it all dated back to years ago. Needless to say the first few firefights I lost. However there are items in the game to help with your aim such as a Holographic sight and a laser.In all for being my first "Early Access" game I really enjoyed the first hundred hours of Rust. However with the small amount of updates done to the game in the past few months I grew tired of the "run around harvest scavenge kill" the game had to offer and even more so when you'd put several days if not weeks of work into a server only for it to get wiped. To make matters worse Rust has had a very bad time fighting against people who "hack" or cheat so it's really ruined the experience for a lot of people. Some server admins literally spend a majority of their time teleporting to various people to see if they are hacking just so they can keep their server clear of people who desire to make the game a bad experience. This has also led to another negative aspect the process of banning someone for being too good.I've noticed that a lot of people in Rust hate to admit when they've been outplayed or outgunned. Some of these people who run in large groups will get so upset over a death that they'll claim that the person who just killed them is hacking. Admins sometimes being overwhelmed with "admin duties" will sometimes ban people if a large group of people claim a certain person is hacking. This leads to large groups accusing individuals of "hacking" just so that individual will get banned from the server even if the person wasn't hacking at all.All in all I would rate the game (in it's current state) a 7/10. There is still a lot of work to be done with Rust which will allow for a lot of room for improvement. The issue is how long will it take the developer to get these changes done and pushed out to the public. The major issue with Rust is the large amount of people who cheat. However if you find the right server usually those people don't stick around long.
title: Rust

review: My View of the game when I had 250 hours Rust is a wonderful Game for the Price of 20.00 USD. Things to consider when buying a game like Rust is it is still in the Alpha stages and gets a decent update once every month on the first Thursday of a month and smaller updated every following Thursday until the next month. Rust is very graphically appeasing meaning it is very graphically demanding because a lot of things within the game are not optimized at the given stage. If you are going to buy this game you have to be willing to put time into. Building a tiny base is not going to do as most likely you will get raided and have to restart. Also dont get offended when someone raids you it is part of the game. Killing on Site occurs on most servers and that is just a little taste to the game that should be going beta later 2016.Overall if your considering Rust its an amazing sandbox game that allows you and your friends to live in a ruthless world where your always on the brink of death.The game looks very nice but has some graphical issues.Must play with Friends solo play is not as fun as having guys to have your back.And if any questions on anything just go on Youtube. The game has been out for quite sometime now and there is tutorials for virtually everything.I hope you guys can appreciate this game as much as I do and have a wonderful time playing a brilliantly designed game.My view of the game now that i Have 1400 hours As stated priorly I believe Rust is a great game. I have given the time and devotion needed to truly understand what this game is about and assess the core factors that make Rust Rust. Rust has progresses a lot over the years starting from Legacy which was simplistic and fun to current Rust that just cant seem to get things right in the eyes of the community. New Rust has become over complicated and has seen many major changes throughout its lifetime. Some of these include The Blueprint system Considered to be Rusts High point due to the systems pure RNG basis making everything as equal as possible. But then the community complained and things got changed to the next generation.The Xp system Considered the worst version of rust. Although the XP system was somewhat fun it was very problematic and only rewarding to large groups. It also envolved dubious amounts of grinding and only attempted to please the ever so toxic Rust community but still was not good enough leading into the current and final system.The Component system The component system was Facepunchs way of finding the middle ground between the blueprint system everyone loved and the XP system everyone hated. Upon released everything seemed okay and the system seemed to be working well but what went wrong? The system has a key factor that nobody enjoys and that is the pure fact of grinding to obtain a feasable amount of components to do anything. This one factor has the communities dissaproval and the main reason why people cannot stand the game. I think its okay but could use readjustment. The Game Now It appears as Rust continues to make strides in becoming an ideal survival game it has major setbacks that can not be changed. The game has countless AI bugs that cause repeated heartaches to player and only annoy them taking away from the games over all value. The game also has a community that is very unbearable. In Rust Legacy Rust was still a heavily PVP based survival but it always seemed like people where having fun experiencing the game for what it was and not for what it could become unlike Rust now. In Rust the community is very unforgiving and do nothing but cause arguments start battles and even bully individuals whom are just trying to have a good time. If someone can over look the community then the next thing to look at is the mechanics of the game itself. As Rust has progressed and continues to progress it becomes more and more PVP (player vs player) driven. This I think takes away from the survival aspect of the game. The developers would rather tweak gunplay and add new weapons instead of building off of the games core principles turning rust into a hour consuming Call of Duty rather than a survival based game. Theres no point playing to build if your going to get steam rolled by other players who take advantage of the PVP counterpart incorperated into the game. Rust store description states The only aim in Rust is to survive. To do this you will need to overcome struggles such as hunger thirst and cold. Build a fire. Build a shelter. Kill animals for meat. Protect yourself from other players and kill them for meat. Create alliances with other players and form a town. Whatever it takes to survive.And surviving it has become but is it really what was envisioned for rust when it first came out? or has it become a product of a community that is never satisfied and for that keeps dragging the games quality down.I personally will continue to play Rust because Ive played since the start and will continue untils its finish. as for you that yours decision.

review: Day #116 I was wondering along the forest when I spotted another living person who simingly lived through the radiation. I approached him cautiously with my M4 aimed at his chest... I told him to turn around when he replied that he was friendly... This is the first friendly I have met in my 116 days in this hellish world... Together we have started to put together a makeshift shack to stay alive from the elements while we slowly start to expand our encampment... My buddy takes the night patrols while I sleep... and I take the day patrols while he gets some rest... Day #117 I awoke before the sun had risen over the peak... Me and my partner decided we had to get supplies to stay alive... So we did an unhumanly thing and shot other survivors at their encampments... We took their supplies and food... One was asleep and we decided to put him out of his misery.... Hopefully god forgives us for this hellish sin we have commited...Day #118 I awoke to all of my doors locked and I was unable to escape... I looked out my window which was now barred shut with metal rails... I coud see my partner dead and bloodied in the woods... I had no way out of my base... My only option was to take my own life... My 118th day marks my last in the apocalyptic world...

review: Rust has great potential to be a challenging but fun game. Heavily populated servers can be difficult to get started on but tend to be worth the effort so that you have others to play (team or kill) with after you're up and running. Don't trust anyone tends to be my motto. Naked's that shoot you in the face with a pipe shotgun full kevlar people that snipe your naked body from afar. I tend to only build 1x1's as the servers need to be wiped bi weekly (depending on decay and population). There are currently mutated animals in the place of where zombies use to be. This is only a place holder for the future mobs. Which we don't quite know what direction that will be. The new User Interface is scheduled to be released with the next update as well as the code rewrite. Both should help tremendously not necessarily right away but will be vital in the on going effort. I do however wish that the production team would marry the game's success with man power and effort on their end. I honestly feel like they know they don't have enough people and they don't care. That being said I have 0% knowledge of their inner workings number of employees and etc.Edit 11/25/2016The game has come a long way. The code is no longer split and that's a good thing. I have played an hour or so on the newest code and am enjoying where things are going.

review: Very fun game if you like to collect resources improvise your weapons and fight over an airdrop from a carrier. Has it's moments of glory but waiting 500 seconds to craft stuff can get tedious if you are considering building a big base but it really pays off in the end with the added safety from other players. There's a bunch of high end gear you can get if you are paitent and live long enough to make a base of operations or risk it in the radiated industrial/military buildings where zombies/mutants of different difficulties protect some nice gear and blueprints. 4 hours in (note I played this game before Steam Release) I managed to make a small home with metal doors get food wood and ores. Also got a nice bow with 50 arrows a handcannon (improvised shotgun) and some armor. It's a good mix between Minecraft and DayZ I would say. Resource gathering crafting and eventually building your huge fort to hunting other animals and players and take their food gear and loot up until you have the very best items in the game.It is early access and it's going to screw you over here and there. The map will sometimes reset removing your buildings the game might crash a few times on you but if you can look past that it's a great experience. But if you get bored of games quickly I suggest you wait until it's released to have a more pleasant experience. If you're going into the world of Rust I also recommend checking out some tutorials for it. Diving into the game with no idea what to gather how to craft or even cook food it can get very frustating. Don't be afraid to look up a wiki or have a tutorial on your steam browser as you are playing. Fun times!
title: Rust

review: Legacy is now COMPLETELY locked off from this game. Before you'd have to go through the trouble of switching what build you were on but now they've cut themselves off from their old build entirely. To older players and veterans of this game it's a shame. The newer game is alright for a bit of good fun but in my opinion is over saturated and lacks the simplicity that made legacy such a great competitive experience.It certainly isn't the worst use of 20$ however I do think that it lacks what originally made the game so compelling. Nowadays you're required to play on a group and good luck trying to take over a server that's already being dominated by another group. It just doesn't play out in a way that's fair and competetive to everyone and doesn't cater well to people new to a server. Granted rust never was about hand holding naked noobs however it used to atleast give you a chance to inflict some damage to your enemy. You don't get the same joy you used to from griefing and raiding enemy bases. However it still does get some things right. You're still going to be facing the same people on multiple occasions and you're still going to make enemys and forge alliances. There's a lot of hate and toxicity and it's absolutely wonderful if you're mature enough to handle it.All in all I'd give the new product a 5/10. It has fewer exploits and way less cheaters than Rust Legacy but it's lost most if not all of it's charm. Is it worth a buy? That depends entirely on you and what you're looking for in a video game. If you wanna just run around and play it as a social game you can totally do that. If you want to play fun minigames (which are usually better in games CS GO) you can do that too! If you want to get a group of friends and try to take over a freshly wiped server You can do that.. However don't expect to be able to just hop onto a vanilla server try to succeed and have a good time. I don't like the direction this game is headed so I will NOT reccommend this game. I hope Garry and his team can change my mind one day but I really doubt it.

Rust is good at making you fear other naked caveman that have almost nothing but still more than you. But it's still better with mods though despite being a great infinite source of fun for cheap in its own right.

review: This is the first review I'll have written for a game I've purchased on Steam and most likely the only review I'll ever write for a game I've purchased from Steam. Before purchasing Rust I thought that due to my age (yes I'm aware of my Steam username and my profile picture!) I had outgrown video games. Then came Rust a game that although in its "alpha stage" of development is very playable enjoyable and addictive.Starting Rust you're spawned into the world with nothing but two rudimentary tools a rock and a torch. With the rock you're provided you can farm stone wood and other resources which you can then use to construct buildings and other objects that will aid you in protecting yourself (from the elements and from other players) and/or raiding enemies' bases. That is the basis of Rust farming resources to survive the environment (three biomes forest desert and tundra each with their negatives and positives) as well as for attacking/raiding other players and their bases.Although the emphasis is on resource collection and combat the game is much more nuanced than that especially if you're playing cooperatively/role playing with other players. For example in the first neighborhood I lived in comprised of friendly and cooperative players we moved in next to a player who was antisocial and aggressive. Every time we'd be in the vicinity of his base which was only several yards from our base he would "KOS" (Kill On Sight) us. Upon confronting him about his aggressiveness he countered with "Rust is not a cooperative/role playing game. It's kill or be killed." And you know what? He was right. Everyone plays Rust differently. There's no right or wrong way to play Rust. You'll have fun however you play. Which brings me to only complaint about this game the hackers.Hacking isn't commonplace in Rust (I could be wrong as I only play on official servers) in the sense that the majority of players you encounter will be hacking but given the sheer amount of time you will spend collecting resources building bases and everything else encountering a hacker and losing your prized firearm(s) resource(s) etc. it can be VERY FRUSTRATING dying to them. It's frustrating dying in a fair fight from which I've died MANY TIMES (I liken the number of times you'll playing this game to the number of times you'll die playing Dark Souls!) but you take solace in the fact that you were bested by someone who has out skilled you or maybe has thousands of hours in the game.The small number of hackers aside this game is definitely worth the price whether at full price or discounted. It's also assuring that the developer Facepunch Studios is heavily invested in their game and continuing to update it after all these years. One change that I noticed in a recent update was the sound of a blizzard in the tundra biome it really adds to the immersion of the game! Wonderful. There were several other survival games that I was considering buying but I went with Rust because of Steam reviews and the commitment of Facepunch Studios to their game. I do not regret my purchase.BUY THIS GAME!
title: Rust

review: Giving it a thumbs down since I hadn't reviewed when Legacy was still around. The new version's optimization issues and the requirements of a supercomputer to get any decent framerate and freezing stop basically kill any point of playing at all. I have the "recommended" specs for the game and I'm lucky to get more than 3 frames on any settings other than lowest everything.The concept of building up a base is fun but honestly the fact that half of the time all of your progress just gets reset by some d*ckwad who plays at 3 in the morning when no one's around to defend their bases makes the entire experience sub par at best. You can work hours to build up only to have it taken away 5 minutes after logging off. It's as if a game like Minecraft reset the world every time you closed the program.If you're in it for PvE then forget it. There's hardly any servers for it around and even when you find one "PvE" in this game is "You're lucky to find one non player entity running around for an hour without stopping." The entirety of your experience fighting in this game is going to be likely getting murdered by players better equipped than you a few minutes after you spawn.Game obviously has no single player which even in a game that is supposed to be multiplayer PvP is a huge turn off. Say I don't want to needlessly get murdered by nearly every player I come across? Nope go play a different game. Not to mention the sheer overload of hackers in multiplayer servers lately. You're lucky to be alive for more than an hour on some servers.tl dr Optimization sucks Frame and Freeze issues even on good computers even at low settings PvP is constituted by who's been in server longer and who's willing to stay up until you fall asleep to destroy everything you've worked for PvE pretty much doesn't exist No single player or local server option to avoid random killing and hackers to just play the gameDefinitely not worth the purchase in current state and from the recent updates the developers don't even seem to care anymore. I don't hold any hope for the future of the game and I consider it a toss of 20 dollars.

review: Hi! I'm new and *dead*....Hey guys how do I use this....*dead*Oh! Another starter person! Let us collaborate....*dead*And that's the FUN part of the game. You see Rust is a very brutal first person survival game. It's unforgiving and frankly it's not for people looking for a 'safe' form of entertainment. And that makes crafting your first gun VERY satisfying and landing a killshot with a bow extremely empowering. The problem is the human element. In particular the element of 'humans' (and I use this term loosely) who run servers. I am sure there are some fantastic server admins out there. Sadly the server I was on was not one of them but seems to conform to the norm of what is expected from this game.Upon waking up to a reset world (which happens) I set about spending 5 hours doing my thing. During this time I bumped into a player who was wondering near my home and when I asked him to move along (with a stone hatchet to the face) I was subjected to a vicious string of verbal abuse (not uncommon). Then I was informed that he was the server admin and he was going to find me and delete my house. I found that amusing.A little while later my new admin friend (again loose terminology applied) reset the server without warning because he was no longer the most advanced player on the map. I haven't been back since. The game is not of any value despite thier 'anti cheating' policy hacking and server admin abuse is so rampant that it's almost a game feature. In fact the beginner tutorial should read "You wake up in a open world naked armed only with a rock and surrounded by vastly more powerful cheating buggers."Just don't waste your money on this.

Sure it could use some improvements but those improvements are likely on the roadmap and if they aren't then just contact the devs with your idea. review: If you like the competitions that online multiplayer games can bring this is the game for you. You could always join a server that is dead and never has anyone on it but whats the fun in that? Joining a server with 50 people can be rough though. Loading....you spawn in with only a rock to protect yourself. You don't even have clothes! You see a player with a worn shotgun heading your way. Thinking....gotta hide! You watch him pass you by heading towards a town. He is distracted killing zombies you see him get hit a few times hes pulling out a bandage! Now is your chance! Jump in there and beat him to death with a stone 2 or 3 hits might do it? You killed him sustaining only a petty amount of damage! You did it! Now you have a shotgun with a few shells. Oh you see a backpack on the ground? Whats in it KEVLAR?!? You put it on and feel like a king and just as you walk towards what you intent to be your "epic base". You get shot..........That was fun wasn't it?

review: Okay hear me out. I like this game but there are huge flaws in it that have caused me to no longer play a lot. Rust is overall a great game but has the WORST community I have EVER seen and I also have to comment about the ongoing raiders and overflowing bandits. You can craft items you can build houses and the PvP in there is pretty nice as you can go around with your friends and clash against bandit clans or other groups. Its really sastifying to kill a group of bandits that have been terrorizing the local "naked people".The REAL problem of this game is the community and the house/sleeper system that I personally hate.About thrice I've been accused of being a hacker (In all fair honesty even though I've already confessed this to others I used to hack other games a long time ago but I've cleaned up my act because I just felt really bad for ruining the experiences of other players and it was just tired of coming on top with the use of hacks. Thus I quit hacking within 2 months into it and sucked it up to play legit.) by groups of 2 3 guys I killed legitimately who talk like they're in the thug life and can't spell for I even find myself being banned from high population servers just because one of the bandits I killed happened to be the ADMIN.YES THERE ARE ADMINS LIKE THAT. The worst part of the community can been experienced when you're naked guy in a world of over 100 people. You literally get killed every 10 15 minutes by overly high and mighty griefers who type "LOL NOOB!" and other vulgular things. Its not fun and it is absolutely sad to see such a high potential game plagued by a bunch stupid 10 year old kids with Fully loaded M4s and full Kevlar Armor who think they're the ultimate badass as they gun down unarmed naked fresh spawns.Its so bad I think fresh spawns die more in Rust than in DayZ Standalone.I find it extremely disheartening and disappointing to quit wake up in the morning and see that my guy was killed in his sleep (Disconnecting or exiting the game leaves your person in a "sleep mode" where they are vulernable to other survivors) and my entire house was raided. It really angers me to see my long worked house raided by a bunch of thieves whom I have no way of knowing their usernames.Imagine finishing your dream house get a ton of resources make weapons and get food medkits and stuff. Alright things are looking good so far. Then as you quit Rust about 2 hours later 2 5 guys come raid your house and kill you in your sleep. They take EVERYTHING you have worked hard for and destroy your precious bed so you can't spawn back. Oh they also hatchet'ed your storages and furniture.Back to square one. Have fun repeating this.Its obessive and tedious to constantly go on Rust to check if your house is okay. Trust me you eventually get REALLY attached to your stuff and home in Rust. You can get these feelings of intense paranoia of the safety of your chracter and doubt about your defenses to the point where it just nit picks your mind every 2 minutes. You can't even play another game without thinking about your Rust home and worry about the bastards who can raid your home.Hell I was SO worried one time about bandits raiding my home in a high population server I stayed up until 5 IN THE MORNING to make sure my DEFENSES was good. It might just be me but getting too attached to your home in Rust can really leave you in a mood in real life.While I partially hate how the game works most of it is great. It is fun to gather/craft stuff but just knowing that it could be stolen by 2 5 bandits who can potentially raid your house just makes it almost not worth trying to gather it.Either be on the entire night to look after your house or turn off Rust to leave your house and yourself sitting ducks to bloodthristy thieves. Either way its just really upsetting.In short Great game overall but has horrid community and can be addicting to an unhealthy scale. Because of this I just don't feel comfortable recommending this to anyone. Its still the alpha however so maybe things WILL change. But at the moment its just not really playable due to the griefers and 24/7 raiders.
title: Rust

review: What to say about Rust .... Don't really understand where the Devs are going with this game. They start a new Rust because they werent happy with the direction of the old Rust(Rust Legacy for the purpose of this review/rant). So the new Rust comes along and guess what ... apart from the lack of wolves and bears that drop loot you have pretty much the same old Rust ie Rust legacy. What was the point then i ask ? What was the point behind the "New" Rust and all the changes ? Rust can be fun but also incredibly frustrating. If you don't fancy getting shot stabbed and hacked to bits for your rock then this game is not for you. It gets easier once youre established but its harder than ever to get established with the "New" Rust. Animals being very scarce and when you do get close to one it runs away. Fair enough its supposed to be hard but how the hell are you supposed to make a sleeping bag without cloth ? Ahhhh of course run around killing other players and stealing there stuff. Of course. So we are back to Rust Legacy .... Also don't understand what all the complaints are from the people who like Rust Legacy but dont like the "New" Rust. Its the same game.

review: "I spawned and I got killed by some guy with a rock!!! This game is fucking gay!! 0/10!!!"The preceding sentence is a prime example of the 'reviews' section of this game right now. It's made up of retards who still think the legacy branch is being updated (this game hasn't had updates for months!!) crybabies who got killed in a survival game and can't quit bitching about it and blaming the developers and people complaining about the overrun of "hackers" which are probably legitimate players but managed to kill their victim in one shot from a far with a rifle.Rust legacy branch or current branch (imo legacy is better) is a good game and is definitely worth your money if you know you're not buying pre alpha games and expecting a bug free finished product like most people seem to think in the Steam Community. It's especially fun on legacy when you gather up some friends on a modded server that increases the pace of the game you round up all your resources and you start blasting motherfuckers who come on your turf.If you notice that your game runs like (particularly in the main branch) stop trying to run everything on "fantastic" settings with your shitty HP laptop and switch it down to "fastest" trust me it works.In short Rust is good if you know how to play it and you're fully aware it isn't a finished product. This game is not for the mentally ill or for the common twelve year old.

review: First things first I'm playing on Linux. Any persons interested in playing this one Linux or SteamOS with a future steam machine should run away now. The games concept is great but Facepunch needs to care more about it's users.I say that because almost every time I try to play a new game breaking bug has been introduced. Conveniently the worst bugs appear on Linux too likely due to a complete lack of testing (Garry has even admitted they don't test it on Linux).What has motivated me to write this review is a bug with the Unity engine. It was introduced around the 25th of June and causes keyboard input to allow only one press per key. I think everyone would agree that such a bug makes the game unplayable. Most would also probably say it should be a priority to fix this issue. Sadly Garry's response to such a bug was to say Linux is a second class citizen in his eyes. To add to that a fix for the issue is weeks off because they would rather wait for the Unity devs to solve it.For some perspective the Cities Skylines devs introduced the same bug with their last update a few days ago. They'd simply missed it in their quality assurance. Despite missing it the issue was fixed in a matter of hours after being reported so there's definitely a method to work around it. Yet the Rust devs are opting to render support for a whole operating system of users obsolete.TL DR Run if you use Linux or SteamOS. Facepunch and Garry don't care about you in the slightest.Update Over one year later. Still not recommended. Sure it looks prettier but little has changed. It's like they're stuck in a loop of adding things scraping what they added then re adding it in a different way. Doesn't help that the genre is massively over crowded either.

review: Allow me to tell you a story.......Rust was a game i was really looking foreward too. I'v been following this game since its start way back when i didn't have a gaming pc. After years of waiting i finally got a gaming laptop a few weeks ago. It can run pretty much anything at high or ultra settings. I even checked game debate to see if my rig can run it which it said it could on high settings. I splurged on steam and this was one of my top picks. Now a lot of youtubers and regular gamers have said that this game could run on pretty much any pc high end or low end. GREAT! right? Well see thats the problem It runs like a one legged dog. I mean what the heck!? I understand that it is STILL EARLY ACCESS but Day Z runs WAY better than this. Optimiztion is what they should be working on more than freakin' features in my opinion. Come on man!EDIT 9/30it actually was running on integrated graphics card i found out. fixed it getting decent fps but not like i would with the original rust. If you have a few mates to play with its fun but otherwise prepare to die.
title: Rust

review: **Looking at the steam store page for Rust now July 2018 it's hard to tell if any of my previous criticisms have been addressed or not. Go look an expert's review instead!***EDIT SINCE GAME CAME OUT OF EARLY ACCESS (FEB 10 2018) Looking at the 11th screenshot on Rust's store page should tell you more about this game than anyone can put into words.*(OLD REVIEW)A game that has been in development for two years or more should not be in Alpha still and worst yet at its price for this unpolished rock.My main gripe is that server loading is glitchy as hell on the new system even with low graphics resulting in crashes even though this computer can handle plently of gruntier games.If only people would stop supporting unoptimised infinate alpha/beta games that milk the customer until the game comes into a 'completed' phase where its barely any better than what it was before. I object to this continued treatment Steam wide.EDIT DECEMBER 2017 Still in alpha 2017! Maybe they should think about finishing the game instead of just accepting more purchases. Oh but that'd be out of line given the past four years.

review: Honestly I was really excited to play the game. But my hopes of playing the game was crushed due to the fact that the game keeps crashing everytime I try to start it. During my first session in the game everything was buttery smooth. When I tried to play it again the next day the game wouldn't start. I thought that the problem was caused by my computer but after a few times of re installing the game and fixing the problems with my computer I realized that the problem was actually the game itself. Man what a bust. I hope they fix the crash problems in the future. If they do I might play this game again.

review: So it's a bit addictive but at the same time frustrating. Some players are very heplful but some will take you out at first sight for no reason other than to steal what you have. Sadly that's usually someone with more and better gear than you have. Then you re spawn with a rock torch and two bandages. And nothin' else. You'd best hope you had time to build a shelter and sleeping bag or bed.Super early Alpha but it's pretty fun despite the frustration of kill on sight players. Which always bugs me in a game that's not strictly a PVP first person shooter. I can see great things. As usual if you can get this on sale and like the survival/crafting genre then it's probably worthwhile.

review: Fun game nice to be able to play with a large number of other players. However the contstant wipes of everything is pretty annoying. Most servers wipe (AKA delete everything and start over) every week. There are some that are monthly but that isn't guaranteed when there are forced wipes. I just bought the game and picked a server that was supposed to be good for a month only to find out that tommorow everything gets deleted across all servers in the entire game.So essentially everything you do in the game is completely pointless because in X days everything gets deleted and you have to start over from scratch.Accumulate several hours over the span of a week building up your base and such... then *WIPE* start over. Rinse and repeat. Bah I get enough futility from real life thanks games are supposed to be my escape from that crap.

review: Hey all!LFG Rust A Slightly Modded Server Well what are we? We are a gaming community called Looking For Gamers. We have a discord at http //discord.me and this my friend is our Rust server! We plan on this continuning to be a place where community members can come together to what we do best play. On our Rust server currently we employ the latest version of Oxide with a few plugins Infopanel and ZLevelManager. That's it. The easy mode of most modded servers is set to the wayside in favor of a more vanilla feel but with just a LITTLE magic. So if you are looking for a great stable fun community with active admins come join us! LFG Rust A Slight Modded Server rust.lfgame.rs 28015

review: Please note that this is a review of the Legacy version of Rust. I have framerate issues with the current version so I'm unable to play it. ( You wake up in the middle of a grassy field alone naked with nothing but a rock a couple of bandages and a torch. You get up and take a look around. The animals are just walking around minding their own buisness everything is peaceful. A few minutes later you spot a road and start walking down it. You walk up to an abandoned town and find some pants and a package of anti radiation pills. Then you spot someone else. Someone clothed and has equipment. You walk up to him wondering if he can help you. He then takes his M4 and puts a bullet through your head.You wake up in the middle of a grassy field alone naked with nothing but a rock a couple of bandages and a torch. You now know not to approach anyone for your own safety. Then you kill an animal in order to get raw chicken from an animal that isn't a chicken. Delicious. You make a campfire and a small shack for shelter. Life is beginning to get easier. Then someone approaches your new base kills you and raids it.You wake up in the middle of a grassy field alone naked with nothing but a rock a couple of bandages and a torch.

review: I lived in a shelter behind a very big fortress suddenly I saw someone running to me when I was farming there he said "help! four bandits are after me they are coming!". I myself and ran into my shelter and locked myself inside. The bandits came and said yes we are coming. The lonely guy begged me to open my shelter and let him in I didn't open the door lol he could be one of the bandit in my mind he also begged the bandit no to kill him "Please don't kill me I have nothing". The bandits were looking for the owner of the fortress and blind firing but the lonely guy was just passing by he said that he knew nothing. The bandits then went away and the lonely guy reminded me to be careful about those bandits and he went away too. that's my 1st hour of this game lolthis game has a great concept of survival. you can make your own survival stories find your team build your base raid another team's base and defend your base from raiders or even betray your own team lol.when you pass a street and meet someone saying hi be careful maybe he's not that friendly and shoot you from the back.I love this game and look forward the updates keep the good work devs.

review: It's a early alpha game not much to say. The "What the developer says" section tells nothing about what's going on. Basically in game you have two materials to build stuff with wood and steel that's it. The graphics are very muddy at best with trees clipping to see through things the creation system is unintuitive at best with only basic thing to make even with schematics it seems like I've seen it all. Playing this without a friend is simply dreadful while the community is a little bit better than Infestation's and DayZs you're still killed left and right until you find some real armor or any armor. Guns even things out as people aren't as willing to shoot a armed person after that it's basically a grind for more resources get to base build then stare down the occasional passerby. Overall the game needs a lot of work but as it's P2P at twenty dollars I'm going to judge it as is early access titles shouldn't be happening often unless it's in a open beta stage at best. If you want a minecrafty survival game you found it. Minecraft still has bugs so the jump shouldn't be too hard for people. Later on if they add character customizations and much much more it will improve but right now I say hold your money alocate it to something more polished until a later date.

review: This game is one of the most promising multiplayer games I've ever seen. For starters its content is refreshing and while clearly similar in some aspects to other survival games it still has it's own original feel to it. At the time I'm writing this the game is still in alpha but holy it's incredible. There is no other game that makes my heart race like it does when I'm raiding someone's camp or someone is raiding mine. There is a brilliant balance between the punishment for death and reward for killing. Killing a new player gets you nothing. A rock. Literally a rock. But kill a player that's had some time to craft weapons and gather useful material and you can go from "rocking" trees for wood to having your own fortress defendable with an arsenal of weapons. Of course you don't have to kill anyone. You could work together with friends (which FYI is so much fun I actually bought a freind of mine the game so we could play together) and create some sort of team fortress or two. The game also does a great job of giving you a second chance in case of death so you don't just get frustrated and quit. Once you die if you respawn and return to the place you met your demise and assuming another player didn't kill you and get your stuff you can retrieve your crap and just continue playing where you left off. All in all this game is incredible and based on what I've seen on /r/playrust it looks like there is still a lot more to come. BUY THIS GAME.

review: Game is hmmmmm...let me tell u a little story. Im an old school player here from legacy. Back then it was game...graphics animations even gamplay...pure (but i kinda enjoyed it).Then they decide they'll stop to update old rust and make new one from scratch.Everyone was excited about new Rust so was I. Game finally went in a good direction. I jumped in game now an then to see whats new...game looked gorgeus but sadly really badly optemised (still is unoptimised)...really Rust became a really good game that u would enjoy. Lately game went into deep again. Game is unbalanced (XP system) unoptimised (before month or so i would get 100 an more FPS now barely 50) broken animations (reloading...people would say u need to wait till animation finishes...I wait and there is still no bullets in my gun because of few seconds after real animation ended).And then you have beautiful toxic scumbagy Rust community full of 12 year olds. I mean if ur ok with things i listed up there go for it...ur probably 12 year old buying games with ur moms credit card (jk luv u)...but personaly i wouldn't waste my money onto this game not yet. )Edit last update fixed a optimisation thing a little bit.

review: EVERY server either has hackers or clans of 10 20 people who each dump 18 hours a day into rust and will out grind you every month. I have had countless hours of fun on rust. But if you aren't willing to play the game like it's shift work you won't succeed. I'm tired of lying to myself that rust will ever become anything than the most toxic game I think I have ever played. It is not remotely a survival game anymore. You will spawn into a server with already massively constructed bases with try hards playing tower defense shooting at you for fun. You and your peasant friends will have some fun fighting a bandit or hunting a deer and then everything you have will be destroyed by a clan. And most of the time these guys suck at pvp but when you have a bow going up against 12 of them blowing your base up it is impossible. It has always been that way and will always be that way. And the game will never come out of early access the bears still walk into your house after all of the content they have added. it will slowly die as people stop playing. I wanted the best for this game but being realistic it will never happen.
