review: This game is one of the most brutal PvP games I've ever had the chance to play. I played DayZ when it was starting and growing as an Arma2 mod and that was fine and dandy but this game takes the cake. The crafting system is more of what DayZ needs and with the plentiful expansions that will be coming in future weeks and months this game is shaping up to be the essence of an "MMO" survival game. The server size is just right for the size of the map guns feel rightly powerful for everything you go through to make them (or take them) and building a house in a game has never made me struggle to use supplies sparingly as much as Rust does.The one complaint I have currently is the amount of cheaters present in game but I can honestly say that those that I've had the displeasure of meeting and reporting (along with a gorup of reports from friends) haven't been seen again. Last thing play it with friends. Coax them into playing it with you none of you will regret it so long as you help each other out. The map is nowhere near as absurdly huge or barren as Chernarus in DayZ finding your friends won't be extremely difficult and there is definite strength in numbers. Watching a group of seven people in full armor chasing after you with bows and arrows pistols and rifles is probably a frightening sight as I've never been on the other side of it but it's better to be wielding the guns yeah?Overall great as far as Early Access goes some laggy rubberbanding that should be ironed out in the coming weeks but not a bad investment in the slightest. Looking forward to more house raiding and looting in the future.

review: UPDATE I've played the most recent version of RUST as of 12/6/15. Here's an update of my impressions although I still don't recommend the game.Five of my friends and I logged into RUST this weekend starting on Friday. Since the last time I played we enjoyed some quality updates Better graphics and visuals The procedural maps are looking really good They added a cool sleeping bag mechanic where you can assign a sleeping bag to someone on your friend's list. This made it a lot easier to meet up which was a huge issue with the game. The constant lag seems to be mostly gone which is a HUGE plus because combat has been broken in this game since its inception. Some fun new items and mechanics that just add to the experience Wandering attack helicopters that put everyone on the defenseNow in spite of these improvements and additions the game still have one MAJOR flaw it is barely a game. I can only speak for my experiences but my latest was an exercise in futility. I had a rare weekend of nothing to do. So we took a chance on RUST again to check it out. My friends and I played nearly nonstop Friday and Saturday. We built a modest base reinforced it code locked it and did a decent job of defending it here and there. We didn't do much raiding and didn't even get to the point where we could make AK47s or any of the modern weapons or armor.Then Sunday rolls along. I'm up in the morning mining some rocks turning on the furnaces. There's only about 60 people on the server so the danger of being out was minimal. Then I switch it off so I can go to the grocery store and run some errands. Prior to this we mostly had at least one person online at any point. Within 3 hours of being out and returning we logged on to find that we were all dead and our sleeping bags were destroyed. Everything was gone back to square one. No epic fight. No combat gameplay. No competition. We had been killed by some basement dweller with over 3 700 hours logged in RUST. And that was it. Everyone was super discouraged and tired.The issue with RUST is that it doesn't incentivize competition. Instead it encourages the kind of behavior that is the antithesis of competitive gaming. It would be like Starcraft 2 championship taking place while the opponent was AFK. Sorry but raiding AFKs is not a game. If I'm going to lose my base I'd like to go down swinging not while I'm living my REAL life.To make this review more than just a criticism of the ineptitude of the developers I'll add this suggestion. Provide server hosts a new ruleset option one that provides invunlerability to bases doors and theft when the group or player who owns it is offline. To avoid players from exploiting this ruleset add limit to the invulnerability based on the last sustained login so that players can't build walls around vital resources drop a cupboard and then AFK forever with that account.Maybe there are smarter or more clever ways to handle AFK raiding. I would encourage them to focus on that and provide an option so that some servers could continue allowing the mouth breathers with no lives to dominate people trying to get a foothold and then ones where the adults can play and enjoy the rest of the gameplay.Until then RUST is still an avoid at all costs recommendation from me. That is unless you're unemployed live off government assistance have no real life responsibilites friends or interests...in that case RUST is the perfect game for you. 10/10. Neckbeards for life.OLD REVIEW Even with the improvements that come with the experimental version going live I can't recommend this game. It looks nicer now. They took out the modern weapons and added a procedurally generated map which are nice touches. They also modified and simplified the way building is done and it works well. Basically you can simply upgrade walls using materials you've gathered instead of having to rebuild entire structures with better materials.Unfortunately the one element that has made this game difficult to enjoy from day one is still present lag. Sure your connection to a server might show as 70 85ms but not everyone on the server falls into this latency range. There also seems to be a huge problem with rubberbanding. Considering Rust's mostly melee combat system this just ruins the game. Where a game like Chivarly can execute melee combat in a multiplayer setting Rust fails.Let's walk through a typical mostly unfun few hours of Rust.Imagine yourself putting hours into finding the perfect spot and building a modest base for melting down ore. This of course is after you already died 2 6 times trying to get started. You've upgraded your walls to at least level 5 maybe even level 6 on the interior. You've even crafted a regular Hatchet and Pipe Shotgun. Now you think you're ready to hunt the extremely rare animals seriously there are almost no animal spawns in the new version because they are the only way to get cloth. (Sidenote It's easier to get a pipe shotgun than the amount of cloth you'd need for a bow...) You step outside and start gathering. You're carrying the key that unlocks the door to your base. Suddenly a naked guy carrying a rock sees you and comes right at you. You think "Hey I have a pipe shotgun. I'll let him get real close and then boom." In a game where the hit detection and lag are obvious you might account for the other guy's lag. In Rust? Nope. Before you can react and well before his character model is in striking distance with his rock you've already taken damage and are bleeding out. You try to fire a few rounds of your pipe shotgun but Mr. 3rd World Internet is rubberbanding like crazy and just spamming his left click attack. A few seconds pass and you bleed to death. This guy who has only been playing for a few minutes at most now has everything you dropped and the keys to your place.You think "Hey I'll respawn in my sleeping bag and see what I can do." Unfortunately he finds your place nearby lets himself in with the key he took off you and then kills you with your pipe shotgun.That's it. You have now been set back to square one within less than 1 minute and without much of a fight at all. I'm not hating on this game because the penalties for death are harsh I'm criticizing it because there should be more to the gameplay than simply dying once and losing everything you've done. If I'm going down I want to have fun doing it.Maybe the 2016 version of the Alpha will be better?

review: This game isn't for the faint of heart. You can spend hours grinding a base and make one bad decision and lose all of your work. That being said thats what makes this game so great. You have to really practice and learn rust to really enjoy it. It can be a very taxing game on your time having to stop auto decay on your base or check to make sure you aren't being offline raided. Overall though the adrenaline rush and the feeling of reward that can come from this game is immense. There are drastic ups and drastic downs in the life of a rust player. Trust no one in this game untill you have played with them for a while. Most of the community are toxic trolls but it still can be fun. There seems to be a lot of praise for the devs on this game. I really do think the devs don't deserve it however. They have had a long time with rust and its still in early access. Rust has been out since 2013 as an alpha early access game. They have worked and reworked systems constantly and can not decide what they like. They scrapped the best system they had only to finally bring it back realizing the mistake they made. The game is worth the price tag but the development team has been far from stellar.

review: Rust.Damn frustrating makes you want to smash the hell out of your keyboard. But still is one of the games I'm mostly looking farward to playing more.My first 20 40 hours or so I spend my time running around get killed starting over getting lost gathering stuff get killed starting over getting lost gather stuff get killed building house get killed again starting over over and over. But luckily I never gave up now I gave about 60 hours on record and I know my way around the whole map and fit for fight. I know someone that won't be happy I never gave up when the time's ready I will pay them a little visit. )As long as you don't give up you will learn many important lessons.The hardest part is when you're joining highly populated servers and you're going to start from scratch surrounded by trigger happy gamers with their inventory full of weapons and armor. You can't start up near towns and such and neither live in the land of nowhere. You need to find a good balance between convenience and security and be damn careful.Free tips Get a freakin sleeping bag! Hide it well where no one will look. Don't start around populated areas but still not too far from ressources. Learn the map (www.rustmap.net be aware that the images are a bit outdated) Read up on "decay settings" and how that will affect you (most servers have decay enabled) You want to start by making a well hidden secure building. Remember that when you gather blueprints and use them you don't lose them after dying. Might be an idea running around getting to know the map gathering blueprints. But make a sleeping bag so you always spawn at your SAFE WELL HIDDEN base.You will get killed. You will get lost. You'll lose everything. Again and again. This game is a lot like Groundhog Day actually. It will make you furious and you might want to give up and run into the risk of becoming a mad psychopath. But that's okay. Learn from you mistakes and don't give up. If you manage to get past this learning curve I promise you it'll be very awarding. If you don't invest a lot of time in this game this isn't for you.Considering that the game is in alpha stage it's very playable and enjoyable. You will experience bugs and flaws that hasn't stopped me from having a good time. With time it will only get better and better. And you can also access an experimental BETA where you get some ideas of how the game will look in the future.Now go buy the game run around naked hitting wild pigs with a rock until they turn into chicken filets!

review: Rust is most certainly worth a look. It has elements that remind me a lot of Minecraft but the way the game approaches the survival aspect is rather enjoyable. You can be dropped into a server and play with others without ever realizing there were people on with you (unless you come across them randomly). One of my most exciting moments were after a failed attempt to capture a supply air drop my buddy and I were walking back through a field in the rainy night. The torch I was using to light my way was the only sorce of light to see with. As we discussed some of the stuff we came across on our failed trek suddenly gunshots wizzed over our heads we scatter into the bush and I extingush my light. Haven't played a game in a long while that got me that excited to be playing. Do I recommend this game? I do. It's got it's quirks but you can paint anything and everything you could dream of on signs. I painted a large "goat se" sign on the side of our fort hopefully randoms will come across this beautiful artwork and be awstruck in the wilderness as I was upon seeing it.

review: First off playing this game by yourself is nearly impossible. Buy your friend a copy and play together to really enjoy it!Day one Wake up on a beach. Run inland get by a bear. Die.Day one (2 min later) Wake up on a beach. Run inland found some stones and wood. Built a shack and upgraded it to stone. Built all kinds of stuff. Someone knocked at the door and I stood there for 5 min with my water pipe shotgun pointed at it but nobody came in. Day two Woke up. Someone came in and me last night. I DONT WANT TO TALK ABOUT IT!!!Day two (2 hours later) Built another house way away from others. I figured out I could loot barrels trash airdrops etc. I learned how to make wooden walls! Ended up putting down about 15 high wooden walls. Day three I woke up alive! Walked out my front door only to find my entire house surrounded by bear traps...Rust Single handedly the most fun survival game to play IF you have friends to play with. Without friends you're an easy target. I found that most people are willing to help you out. Larger population servers are meat grinders. I spawned and died so many times because people would wait to get the kills. Since FacePunch is finally nearly done with Alpha I can't wait to see what kind of optomizaitons they're going to do. My PC runs it like its nothing. My Surface Pro3 runs it like it's nothing as well. Great game! ProTip Play with friends to have the best experience. StayAway Don't go into a game thinking you're going to dominate. This game has a way of killing you at the most inopportune times.Rust in one sentence Imagine working REALLY hard all day to get everything you need or want just to go to sleep and wake up and it's all gone.

review: (If you don t want to read all this the bottom line is Rust is one of the best survival games in my option and I recommend buying it if you are interested in a fun survival games solo or with friends.)Do you like to build?Do you like to craft?Do you like to raid other people?If you answered yes to any of these questions than you should buy Rust.Rust is a game where you grind for resources till you have enough stone metal frags sulfur ect to either build up your base and or make a base or start crafting different tools and weapons. You can craft such weapons as a bolt action a semi auto rifle a pipe shotgun and many more. You use these weapons for either self defense or hunting down other players and killing them for their loot on their body. You can also craft different types of armor and cloths. For your base you would want to build a safe and defendable base against raiders. You probably want to make your loot room somewhere safe inside your base and also have a second or higher floor with windows so you can protect your base if any raiders decide to raid you when you are online. You can also raid other players bases using C4 satchel charge rockets and any other creative way to get inside another players base. There are many many elements in Rust and I recommend you explore them all. I give it a 9/10

review: In a few weeks and months this game will be a MUST BUY game. I have only played for about two hours now but I already highly recommend Rust. If you get past the fact that you get killed by mostly everyone that sees you you'll see potention in this game. It wont be another WarZ. The only issues about this game is that stone and animals are never to be seen most of the time and when I see them they're surrounded by zombies. Now this might just be me but when I am not getting ripped apart by zombies or getting shot up by some dude. I always end up starving to death. Another issue I have seen is that the map seems to be a little bit too tiny and I hop the developers work on that. I cannot get into the valley without seeing 4 naked guys and about 6 guys who are all stacked up. This is Alpha of course and I hope they will work on these things. Like before I highly recommend this game. If you enjoyed DayZ or Minecraft this will probably be the best game you have ever played. Just look past the fact that its in Alpha and look in the future to see the potentiol of this game.

review: After having played it for a couple of days i can honestly say that this is one of the greatest games i have ever played. Whether you are playing as a lone wolf a bandit a good "peacekeeper" or as a large team with friends you are able to get extremely emmersed into the game. The combat system is amazing and make tactics and timing an essential to winning a fight. It basically takes a military simulator such as arma and combines it with a survival game such as Minecraft. I am one of the lucky few who can play the game on the max graphical settings and i must say it looks very much like real life. The light refraction and reflection are insanely realistic. The only things in my opinion that could make the game better would be weather rivers and lakes vehicles and more wepons. The rest is amazing.

review: This game... is ridiculous. It appears to be nothing more than a complicated starvation simulator.HOWEVER... it's also incredibly fun and nerve wracking. Finding other players is absolutely terrifying because you never know if they're going to kill you and raid your shelter but at the same time you don't want to log off and have them do it anyway. And if you play with friends? Awesome!My only grip is the fact that right now it really is nothing more than a starvation simulator and you become very hungry very quickly you don't spawn with a full stomach and when you're starting off you will likely die a multitude of times attempting to gather enough supplies and food to survive just one more in game day.Some basic console commands would also be incredibly useful such as "toggle grass" because it would vastly improve graphical performance on low to mid range systems.Also be sure to check your window size and graphic settings in the launch menu as they constantly change to random offsets.

review: At 91 hours I am really enjoying Rust. It could be this way because the server I am playing on has really friendly admins that don't interfere with the players. There are a few facts that must be understood at the moment I am reviewing (may 13th 2015) and should not be reflected on in any future plans or changes due to the development state of Rust This is a multiplayer only game the only thing close to single player is acquiring a server and applying a limit too who may connect. This can be frustrating and glorious at the same time overall it has a many different types of unexplainable in game challenges. I have only played on the vanilla servers so far but modded servers will give you a different game experience from the videos I have seen in the community.There is a "highly specialized" game development cycle. There may be a patch every week up too every month where they may also "wipe" the servers. Usually this does not seem to wipe the blueprints you may have previously found but on the vanilla servers the "world" is wiped. This means simply that your buildings and items you have found will be gone and you must start as a fresh spawn. After the patch has been launched some servers may elect to change their "seed" and create a brand new map. These game cycles create a fold within the community where users can take advantage of the weekly to monthly patch cycles and create events that seem to complement the pains of losing all your digital lootz.There seems to be a high level of investigation and information exposure by all players in the game. All data seems valuable in Rust. This may be just from people learning how to play base locations blueprints or people creating prophetic plans to destroy you and collect all of your items. Many people will enjoy your trust but many may also exploit it. If you can handle getting your dreams crushed then this game is for you. 1 055.8 hrs on record still recommend the game but it is not the same as when anyone started. The dynamics are changing greatly between patches and early access content is getting released and tested really fast.

review: I've spent 200 hours playing Rust at this time and I plan to keep on playing it. Rust is a game like many others where it is better with other people but you don't have to play with people you already know you can find other people and team up with them. The Rust community isn't the best most encounters will come down to 'kill or be killed' and even though this can be quite annoying when trying to start off it's even more comforting when you find someone who chooses not to kill you. I would recommend playing with a friend at first so that you have a better chance of survival in those dreaded encounters!Apart from the kill on sight thing that seems to happen quite frequently this game is really addictive one of the best early access games out there with one of the most reliable dev teams behind it. There are also weekly updates that ensure the game never really gets boring. QuantuumUPDATE 2017 After saying all this I've not spent much time playing the game which is a shame because I really do enjoy the game but I've become bored of the progressional system it feels like it takes too long to make any progress but battlefield servers take away from the core basis of the game if they somehow found a way to find a middle ground between the two then this game would be perfect. If you've just bought the game then you'll probably still have a lot of time having fun. I feel that I probably played too much too soon and I exhausted the game of its enjoyability and in time I'll come back to it. Quantuum
title: Rust

review: As of now the current state of this game is horrendous.*The leveling system is garbage and is obviously there to make you grind even more than you already need to.*Hunger drains way too fast and most foods only fill up around 5% of your food bar.*Animals clip through mountains rocks and other things that make getting food to fill your abyss of a stomach even harder.*The amount of resources you collect and use are rediculous. Why are there stacks of 1 000 and why does making a machete require 100 pieces of metal? Following Minecraft's footsteps and making stacks small and craft requirements reasonable would be a wise decision.*Growing food takes way too long. I end up starving to death waiting for corn to grow.*The game's essentially made for people to greif and loot. When you leave the game your body lays on the floor where you were last at even when you lay down a sleeping bag. My character ended up getting looted inside of my armored house because his foot clipped outside the walls. This is incredibly annoying because my character was at the oposite side of the house from my sleeping bag instead of just being in the bag sleeping. I understand that this is an alpha build at the moment however it seems like these decisions were intentional. It's essentially a kick in the nuts to find out that the 7.1 hours you spent bashing a rock with a rock to get just the basics can be all for nothing because the game doesn't despawn your character when you leave the game.I see potential in this game however the mix of bad decisions bad AI programming and bad balancing make me want to find a way to return the Humble Bundle I spent 5.05$ on.Not anywhere worth 20$ in this state.
title: Rust

review: Where do I even begin. This game is probably the most addicting game that I have ever played. There is so much to do and it is just so fun. The gunfights in this game are so surreal. They draw you in and feel like no other game ever has. You're afraid of losing everything you worked for. Then there is the otherside I hate this game with a flaming passion. It makes you want to eat your mouse and put a hole in your monitor but it always makes you come back for more. I tip my hat to Facepunch for making such a unique game. I absolutely recommend this game if you hate your life and have (or dont want) any kind of social life.

review: I awoke on a white sandy beach. It was calm quiet peaceful. I gazed over the water into the beautiful sunrise when I heard a soft pitter patter. I turned to see the source of the noise. It was a naked black man approaching me with open arms He looked so very kind. I eased forward to greet the naked man. He stopped for a moment seemingly mystified by me. He began to reach for something in his inventory a gift? He smiled then he raised up an AK47 and shot me seven times. I screamed in agony before the naked man began bashing me with a rock.Next I awoke on a white sandy beach. It was calm quiet peaceful. I gazed over the water into the beautiful sunrise before wandering about and stumbling upon a corpse that looked just like me. I took my rock into my hands and smashed the corpse into pieces. I sat on the beach and thought about what I had done. I sat on this white sandy beach. It was calm quiet peaceful. I gazed over the water into the beautiful sunrise while I slowly ate my own battered body.white sandy beach/10 would AK47 again beautiful sunrise to a friend

review: You start off in the woods naked (literally) a gray screen filter fades and you see trees rocks grass all around you. Your objective? Stay alive. This game has a real interesting way of introducing survival aspects with the way it has body affects such as cold and hunger but in a much more dynamic way than other games with this mechanic such as Infestation and DayZ. You need to chop down shoot cook and steal anything that is in your way. You need to find blueprints to make new weapons medkits and structures. Make bases sleeping bags doors to keep the main enemy the player as far away from you as possible. The game really makes you feel like you are alone and no one is there to help you players that find you usually kill you on sight the game really is a kill or be killed situation which is amazing though does not go without it's faults. For an alpha it is great but I do hope they add some type of friend system in the game where it doesn't immediately teleport you to your friends or anything but shows you where they are using some sort of directional arrow. That being said the game being in this state I would give it a 10/10. I hope to see more updates to this game from Garry and his Team.

review: My love for Rust is a bit torn between the potential it holds and the way it's been largely used...While on one end it has given me some of the most thrilling nights some of my first nights on a populated Rust island struggling to finally get a shelter and listening in the rain for the sound of footsteps... some food? an Enemy?! Making my heart beat like crazy....But then some times it's been ruined by a total break in immersion and I think it's largely NOT the game's fault but more a community issue. Servers are dictated by meager rules unless the admin play an active role.tl dr It could be Garry's Mod 2.0 fun but it ends up being CoD linear... Great game but you have to struggle to find a "home".

review: The game itself is pretty great but if you enjoy having fun this game isn't for you. The entire game is about survival of the fittest so going into it you expect to die and get ed over. And that happens a lot. You'll get pretty far into it thinking maybe just this once I can make a respawn point only for someone to one hit you with a bow and you lose two hours of progress and everything you've worked on. It's fun for awhile except you don't ever get past that part. You can't make friends because half the people either don't have mics or don't give a and good luck staying alive for more than three minutes tops. You'll find something then get on. You'll die over and over and the fun parts of the game get quickly drowned out by the constant respawning and lack of any progress at all. Good game player base.

review: I spawn into a desolate land of emptiness. The closest player is over four kilometers away. Die by wolf. Crap. Die by bleeding out. Crap. Create awesome impenetrable fortress and become rampant and take everything and make guns and kill red animals . So much fun. Suddenly I find a person sleeping on the ground. He is only wearing pants. He looks so peaceful as he rests. His body slightly vibrating from server latency his hands tucked underneath his head to mimic a makeshift pillow. As I watch him sleep I begin to contemplate my actions. What should I do? How do i respond to this situation? I remind myself Rust is about survival and only the strong survive. Proceed to fill him full of 556 ammo using my bolt action rifle equipped with a laser sight. He is dead. I feel guilty. I killed an person all that is left is a backpack. He is gone from this world. Never to return. I cry.Oh sweet he had some tuna.

review: a great source of cancerwhere do i begin with this game?looks great sounds great tastes great.but there is something off about it something that holds me from enjoying the game fully..with any game there will always be people who live to play it. people who rarely ever log off so they're miles ahead of you in progression. it is entirely capable for a solo player to survive at least for a little while and climb the progression ladder.it is beyond easy for groups to essentially own servers stomping anyone beneath them who tries to drop their bare cheeks on spawn beach. you are going to have a variably bad time depending on your server choice if you stay solo and don't live on this game.would i say that the game has been scaled back to not cater so much towards clans/groups?maybe a little yes. is the game still catered towards clans/groups? undoubtedly yes."it is more fun with friends!"personally i am not entirely sure if Facepunch will ever manage to move Rust away from groups or if they even care to. probably still give the game a try keep it under 2 hours AND 2 weeks and you can refund it.

review: I would recommend this game to anyone but the puniest of people. I had one experience in this game in which I was stuck in my base by a guy that was enraged not to mention he had a few buddy's. My conclusion was that his life was filled with stress probably overwhelmed. Back to the story. He was out there for a while I grabbed some food and came back after about 10 minutes. Not suprisingly he was still there. So I came up with the brilliant idea that if he could sit outside I could sit inside with a little twist of course. I pulled up an audio clip of noises that came from a base (Footsteps hatches doors and not to mention leaving the furnaces on). I then left for a extended period of time that being 2 or so hours. I came back and a different group was at the door door camping of course. At first I thought the same guys were still out there but I was wrong gladly. The other group wasnt to far off though and not to mention I am a solo and both groups are 3+. I went and got a semi and lured the other group over provoking a giant gun fight. One guy stood from the active door campers and I had no hesitation to clean him up So I did. That was the moment I realised what rust really was and how it works. With the right attitude and mindset anything is possible. From then on I never filled myself with the anger and toxicity of the game and instead enjoyed it for what it it.

review: Перед тем как начать описывать основные характеристики данной игры хочется сразу сказать что она стоит своих денег.1.Производительность.Это главный минус Rust'а. Чтобы играть в него нужен довольно таки сильный компьютер с оперативной памятью ОЗУ не меньше 8гб (это важно). Ну а если ты все таки тот счастливчик у которого откуда не возьмись оказался такой комп то тебе по адресу.Обращение к тем кто "слышал про эту игру и может быть купит" если вам нравится хардкорное выживание с присутствием других игроков то Rust для вас! 2.Минусы.1)Когда я первый раз зашел в Rust я слегка расстроился (. Было такое ..ощущение неудволетворения. Вроде бы дорогая игра а земля не копается и камень не разбивается (. Но поверьте стоит посмотреть пару видео на ютубе в стиле гайдов или же пообщаться с другим игроком в раст с целью обьяснить тебе что да и как и ты поймешь что мысли о том что "зачем я ее купил?! Возврат средств!" Пройдут)Ты поймешь ее главные основные правила и возможности и будешь играть пытаться что то сделать.У тебя конечно могут возникнуть какие то вопросы по самому геймплею (как найти металл высокого качества например но это все поправимо опять же просмотром видеоролика на ютубе или подсказкой профи друга играющего в Rust.2)Производительность.Пожалуй это главный минус раста (. После игры в GTA V на ультрах вам придется принять серьездный нравственный выбор и выставить скорее всего все настройки на минимум. Прям на самый минимум. Это как никак самая требовательная игра за 2к16 год и надеяться на "ульты" думаю не стоит.3.Плюсы.1)Проработка. Разработчики этой игры постарались не только над графикой но и над проработкой геймплея причем неплохо так постарались. Раст очень сильно затягивает когда играешь один не говоря об игре с друзьями.В общем говоря эта игра оправдает ваши ожидания и вы без затруднений сможете согласиться с тем что не зря ее куплили)
title: Rust

review: I built a majestic wooden palace in a secluded dense forest. From time to time a weary traveler would come past and be in awe of this mighty structure that provides shelter from the elements and beasts (people as well I guess). I would welcome them with open arms if they were a naked man with nothing but a rock. It is of course the right thing to do.I assure them the shotgun is for protection not only for me but them as well. I invite them in from the cold with the promise of a warm fire and food in their belly. In a world as brutal as Rust it is rare to meet a kind soul offering shelter and food not many can resist this offer. Once he is inside I lead him through several doors which lead to a sunken pit room with an open ceiling. I then lock the door behind him.It is only then he realises the true nature of the situation as the floor beneath him is full of backpacks and bodies. I throw scraps of chicken to my new captive from the open ceiling above. Another weary traveler walks by I invite him inside for a can of beans. My prisoner screams at the top of his lungs "DON'T TAKE THE BEANS IT'S A LIE!" but it is already too late. He too is trapped. Soon enough they have 3 more friends and I make them fight each other to the death for scraps of food for my amusement. It is prisoner number 7 who changes the game forever. The 4 remaining prisoners combine their limited resources to build a stair case out of the pit. It is then the hunt for the most dangerous game begins. There is no exit all windows are barred. There are no weapons only an 8 story tall maze building and a man wielding a shotgun hunting for you.There were many screams that evening and people passing by quickly fled. By morning only I remained. Preparing a meal for the next person to come to my home.11/10 would hunt man again.
title: Rust

review: I've tried Rust in legacy and now it's new format and I find both have the same fundamental problem. This game rewards stealing and griefing (destroyers) above gathering and building (creators) which inevitably leads to servers dying and there being a ridiculous number of abandoned buildings.Why do I think this is inevitable with this game's model?The only time the destroyers are having fun is by taking advantage of the creators who by necessity have to take more risks in the game (they have to be looking at a rock or tree and making noise while the destroyers just have to run around listening for the sounds of gathering or building). As a map matures the creators stop having any chance at all of advancing far enough to compete with the destroyers as they have already compiled the resources of many other creators and all the supply drops they monopolize.In the end the only people left on the server are the destroyers who now can only fight the other destroyers which is not the easy gains they are accustomed to so they abandon ship and look for a server that wiped recently to restart the process.Until they fix the broken game loop this game will always be a pretty terrible experience for anyone who wants to roleplay and create instead of play deathmatch on a big map.

review: This is what all those minecraft meets fps games are trying to be. You won't want to play this alone but if you get four or five friends in a server and figure out where you want to set up shop things start taking off. Gather loot from trees or kill naked guys farming wood you decide how you want to play the game. Don't trust anyone but at the same time if you have a mic and find the right person to watch your back you can have a real good time with this game. It is one of the best early access games you can buy right now and there is always a new devlog out on Friday. Garry from Gmod is making this so you know he isn't going to just leave it like He wan't people to make mods and game modes for it so even when the game is done and all the final touches are made there is always going to be someone making new guns/craftables to add to their moded server so that the game keeps evolving. $20 well spent I have spent more than that and gotten a ass game. $20 is a safe buy for something that you can pick up and see what is new and going on on a weekly basis.

review: Rust is an extreme time waster in the worst possible way. The "time investment risk" ratio is terrible. You could spend hours on end grinding to create a decent base all for a clan/small team to just destroy it all in minutes when you're offline. This type of play style throws a huge disadvantage in the direction of the casual players. If you want to be good at Rust you need to be prepared to allocate a massive chunk of your time to it.The community is shocking and the lack of a deterrent to kill players results in a "Kill on sight even if your character is naked and has nothing of value" mindset which just ruins the game even more.Imagine writing a 10 page essay. It took you five hours. It was the ultimate grind. Word crashes you lose everything. Rust is this exact scenario in video game format.

review: EDIT UPDATE 3/8/17 WHY MAURINO BERRY SHOULD STILL BE FIRED EDITION.So you see a lot of older users in the community having a grudge against new updates. If you read closely the game dev blog you will see who plagues and ruins this game. Usually whatever has the name Maurino Berry means that your gaming experience will be demoted.The guy literally has the touch of Midas but whatever he touches turns to After ruining the damage rates of lower tier weapons (AKA REDUCING CROSSBOW/SPEAR/BOW DAMAGE) and ruining all the raid system his plague has reached late game Ruining the aiming system with an rng cone and then trying to half fix it with a toddler recoil pattern. Mate I know you suck at your job but in case you want to get an idea You live in U.K. I guess where the facepunch studios are. Try to go to a shooting range or go for vacation to US. Pick up an automatic rifle. Shoot in burst fully auto and single shots. Record results. Try to mimic this into the game. If you are too much of a to do that ask a person that has handled a rifle . PICK UP YOUR PHONE FIND WHERE YOUR CLOSEST MILITARY OFFICE IS AND ASK THEM WHAT YOU WOULD LIKE TO LEARN. THANK THEM. DONE.You are achieving demand destruction in unprecedented scales. LOOK AT THE GAME. SERVERS HAVE A LIFE OF 6 HOURS. WHY?It is the time a person needs to find a radsuit.Go to launch site.camp the ladder.get rifle bodies.Make rifles. Kill people with crossbows. Server dies. Maurino Berry still gets to have a job.Normally the reason you have 5 tiers of durability walls is the stages that the game should be experienced. Caveman (Bow/spear/eoka/rock/bone armor/bone weapons/twig structures).Early civilization (Stone wood tools Crossbow Waterpipe beancan wooden armor wooden structures)At this point if the game was balanced you could enhance this era."mid game" (Revolver semi automatic rifle road sign armor you could put a mortar here or something worse than a rocket launcher stone structures)late game (semi automatic pistol custom smg rocket launcher grenades facemask Iron stuctures iron tools)end game (the meme weapons you have made so far C4 Better rocket launcher scopes everything that a guy with a stone wouldnt know in 6 hours reinforced structure)Now I know this might sound weird to you but people would like to have time intervals that they could compete you know. In order to enjoy the game.So either you'd have to come up with something smart or something linear to allow progression in between those phases in a span of a month. So people who enter the server the first week for example are together with the rest of the server in the caveman age. But the cavemen of the first day have more resources and a bigger base. The resources can be utilized when the second phase kicks in (hint Make the airdrop drop the recipes. When the first team picks the recipes 6 hours later the rest of the people can pick them up). So a PVE event triggers the change in the phase and those that get the first airdrop get to enjoy the current average lifetime of rust servers (6 hours). Make raiding entirely possible in each phase. So twig era can raid twigs mid era can raid stone etc. If they want more defence they have to build bigger. not a 2x1 stone square with an iron door which needs the latest game explosive to be raided. HOW DENSE ARE YOU TO NOT UNDERSTAND THAT 6 HOURS OF SERVER LIFETIME WITH A GAMEPLAY THAT INVOLVES BUILDING a 2x1 STONE CRAP IS WASTING THE POTENTIAL OF GARRY'S IDEA. YOU DONT EVEN HAVE TO MAKE SOMETHING NEW. JUST UTILIZE WHAT YOU HAVE AVAILABLE. YOU HAVE 5 ERAS OF EQUIPMENT AND A BUILDING SYSTEM THAT WORKS. G E T Y O U R S H I T T O G E T H E Rsomewhere around 1/3/164 years in development. Still everyone in this game has no hair. N O HAIR. There are horses you can't ride them.You can figure out how to build an assault rifle from scratch but god forbid you tried to make anything like a catapult of siege equipment. Now grenades do not deal damage to buildings.Anything that was good about this game has been modified/removed/tweaked into forcing you to follow the standard meta which so far leads to the death of servers. (ESPECIALLY ANYTHING DONE UNDER THE NAME OF MAURNO BERRY PLEASE FIRE HIM ALREADY).The first time something slightly interesting popped up was the plantation/crop system. But be sure if users find a way to have fun Mauricio Berry will modify it into a lukewarm boring friendly for 12year olds with 2 hours in game experience.Until he is removed from the development team I firmly believe that this game will devolve to garbage.Do not buy until they remember what they were aiming to develop. A RUTHLESS SURVIVAL GAME NOT MAURINO BERRY FEELINGS ARE SAFE WITH ME SIMULATOR (NO RAID PLS NO FRESHSPAWN KILL PLS NO FUN PLS only farming hugs and homoerotic copulation). There are better games out there go for them.

review: What I love about RUST At the time of writing this review I have 755 hours which I aquired over the span of roughly 4 5 months and let me just say this game is phenominal. Rust is a game that has it all great pvp amazing visuals but what stands out most to me is the freedom that you have. In RUST there are zero rules literally none. Some servers may have group caps and and base building restrictions but everything else is up to the player. You can explore long valleys build bases in tree's and caves kill whoever you want etc etc. The freedom that the game offers you is what keeps me coming back to this game almost every single day. Rust also has amazing pvp. I would say most weapons in the game are optimized enough guns like the LR 300 and the M249 are OP but are extremly challenging to aquire etc. I strongly reccomend this game if you are looking for something to just dump hours in.

review: Overall I find this game to be VERY entertaining. You start with nothing and you just build your way up. There is one HUGE problem that I have with this game. Decaying structures are the most annoying thing ever I can understand having the structures decay after inactivity for like a week and a half but for 2 DAYS?! REALLY?! I don't have that much time to invest in this game while trying to juggle school and work and then somedays I just don't feel like playing the game! We shouldn't be punished for not playing the game as often as possible. I say if you can completely commit yourself to this game and make sure you play it atleast once every two days then get it but if not you are just going to end up being off that your 6 story house and everything in it has decayed. I'm putting recommend but just be wary of the possibilities of losing all of your hard work. If the Devs are looking at these reviews I hope to god that they either do away with decay or make the decay period longer.
title: Rust

review: I understand the game is Alpha/beta whatever but I don't see this game ever being something great. It's a bunch of mediocre games smashed together.Mediocre FPSMediocre survival gameMediocre exploration gameMediocre creative gameI guess the FPS mechanics are alright but the desparity between bow/arrow and M4 are huge. The game is built around griefing other players once you hit a certain point in the game the most efficient way to gather resources is to kill other players and take their stuff or break into other peoples houses and take their things.There isn't anything new about the creative aspect of the game. You smelt stuff you build a wood shack maybe a metal house if you have infinite free time but for the most part you have to build your house in a certain pattern or someone will build a wall around your entrance and block you in.The terrain is boring it looks a lot like Day Z there isn't anything interesting about it there isn't much satisfying about exploring other than finding gear to kill other players with.I'm trying to think of something positive to say about this game but the only positive experience I had with this game was when myself and three friends tracked someone down killed them and took everything they owned. While it was fun for me it wasn't fun for the other player which is pretty much the story of this game. At least they got rid of the zombies just kidding they just reskinned them as bears.

review: Great game in general I really enjoy it and would really recommend buying this game if you havn't already. Rust is definitely at a playable state it is still alpha but i dont see much wrong with it as it is. This game is really good its fun collecting resources and building a giant or small base to live in and be safe in. It's cool how realistic it is hunting animals to collect food cloth animal fat. And funniest of all ( Censor.nudity false ) type that in f1 console and see what it does. Loads of naked men running around wacking trees and rocks. If you really want to succeed in rust and be know as the scary guy on the hill you need to put hours of effort into collecting resources and killing animals and fortifying your base so its hard for people to raid you. Which i like about rust. The day/night time is realistic besides from half an hour day/night. there is a certain time every night when it is pitch black and you cant see a thing. This is where a base comes in handy you just turn your campfire on and cook your meat and it lights up your room. So yeah great game really fun.There are just a few minor issues that slightly annoy me at times. (1) i would be walking along and i suddenly hear WOOF WOOF GRR GRR so i look around for a wolf but there isn't one. Then out of the corner of eye i see a wolf glitched inside a rock his head sticking out of it and his legs poking out of the bottom. This also happens with bears ive seen it a couple of times. Again just a minor issue.(2) Messed up spawns. I would die normaly by natural causes or missing a jump on the rocks. Yeah s**t happens but I spawn in and instantly GRRR GRRR WACK WACK im being attacked by two giant bears and im already on 30 hp. This has happened to me on countless occasions. Again sort of a minor issue but i would definitely like this to be fixed as soon as possible.(3) Ok so i kill a pig and start collecting his resources. WACK (2 cloth) WACK (1 animal fat) WACK (3 raw CHICKEN breast)? hmm hang on a minute didn't i just kill a pig? This happens with all other animals aswell. Not a major issue but its slightly strange. Atleast it gives you food to eat.Ok to conclude my review of Rust (alpha) i'd just like to say that this game is at a very playable state it is very enjoyable and i would strongly recommend buying this game It's definitely worth the money.

review: Rust. This game is a good game that I really enjoyed playing for the little bit of time that I put in. Survival game with lots of different things to craft from Shotguns to AK's to Swords. The biggest turn off for me is the community. The community is very toxic with little to no respect given to new players. For example a new players was asking a pretty legit question but got met with answers to press Alt + F4 and delete "system32" these kinds of childish malicious responses are the kinds of things that make this community toxic. It may seem all haha and funny but this is the kinda thing that speaks volumes about your character. Now players of Rust will disagree with me when I say the community is bad and they will attribute my grief with the constant KoS (Kill on Sight) and the base raids (you have the ability to build up a home/base and put your valuables in which will more than likely get raided) but I dont mind these at all. These are parts of the game. And one shouldnt get upset for things that are almost commonplace in the game. Its like disliking a game that has permadeath and you hate permadeath.... (off topic) but anyway the reason that i cannot recommend this game as the genre its portraying is because although there is some "surviving" aspects the game highly revolves around finding landmarks (Airstrip Radstown Lighthouse Sphere roads) and camp them out to get blueprints ( the only real way to progress in the game ). You cannot get any things of value any other way. TL DR game is fun community is unforgiving. DONT TRUST ANYONE

review: FULL REVIEW EARLY ACCESS Toxic Players. Toxic Game. Good luck trying to play when you get DCed every 10 mins... if you don't get killed during the first 5 min by someone with a gun. Unstable servers. Unstable players. Can't even place a storage box on the ground without a "Error Not Enough Space" message. If you manage to get past the servers problem and acutal build stuff make sure to bring a few friends along. Solo newbies don't last long and even fewer chances of making friends. OFFICAL RELEASE REVIEW NO TEAM MECHANIC I am really surprised they never implemented a team mechanic. This will effect their bottom line for sales in the long run. This is a very fun game... when you are playing as a team with 3+ players. This game NEEDS a team option with no friendly fire. PLAYER COMMUNITY The current player community is 90% toxic. They will pretend to be friends with you only to kill you for fun and take what little you may or not have. There isn't even a whisper or local text mechanic. You can talk on a mic and only those in a reasonable talking distance will hear it but that gives you a tactical disadvantage if are hutning someone. Get a discord. If you are lucky enough start with a new game hope you don't get ganked by players that found out how to cheat or hack themselves an AK. Players that have the upper hand and have been playing for days or even hours longer than you often abuse that advantage and will run around killing noobs near the spawn zones. Or they will troll mid to high level players by raiding their places while they are offline. You can trust no one. You have to constantly watch you back. You will die and start over many many times. You have to hide your stuff more than you think. You have to have a back up plan every time you log on and off.REQUIREMENTS TO PLAY If you dont have a good to great internet connection you will hate this game. If you are not looking around for someone possibly following you ducking behind cover looking for movement in large open areas and generally being cautious and skulk 24/7 you will get followed and killed. If you are lagging even a little bit you are putting yourself at a huge disadvantage. A careless split second will mean losing your stuff on you and starting back at your bag or the beach. Also headphones are recommened if you are not paying attention to nosies around you you will die quick.THE GAME As I mentioned this game is FUN. But it is NOT FUN if you are playing solo. Being a lonewolf doesn't bring perks unless you are on a low pop server and/or start from the begining and constantly work at it. Find someone willing and able to run a private server and if you find the right community boards you will easly find 20 people willing to start a 10 v 10 (or more if you are willing to risk) team death match. Get everyone on sperate sides of the island and start from there. Its not that hard to find players willing to start a good game rather than jumping into a messed up free for all. OVERALL Have a good internet connectionBring your friendsPay attentionEnjoy being a lonewolf and find a way to play the game without losing much of your stuff when you get ganked and be lucky enough to get a edge amog or above the others. Or play with friends or a small community and get the most out of this experience.

review: New review Pros Fun game to play with some friends for a few hours a day. Intense PVP gunfights. Lots of lovely RP opportunities. Radtowns and LOOOOOOT. A couple interesting PVE encounters (Heli &amp Bradley APC) More to come. Great building mechanics easy to learn and use. (probably one of the best in the survival game genre) Although some would disagree the gunplay in this game is pretty decent and easy to pick up. Awesome Developers who update every week with new content to play around with.Cons If you don't have much time on your hands you may have a hard time getting much done in this game without either your base disappearing or it being raided. Playing in a group is advised. Game can be slow at times framerate can be very inconsistent but if you have a high end PC you shouldn't notice much. The community can be VERY toxic. If you are someone who is put off by that then this game is not for you. LOL The game can be hard for new players when you are just starting out. There are a few tips ingame to help you out but for the most part it is very hard starting out for the first time especially if you are solo. Survival aspects in this game are not very "survivaly". There are times where you do feel like you aren't just trying to survive against other people but that is usually very short lived as you can find food and water easily around the map. Conclusion I don't have as much fun in this game as I used to but maybe that's just because I have played it to death and have become quite bored of its repeatitive nature beyond early game. I still recommend it as it is one of my all time favourite games and I still look forward for the future of the game. Epic.6/10 as of now.

review: My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him. "if you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate. you have to stop immediately." Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exacly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me "Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through". I agreed. At 27 i have never touched a cigarette. I must say. I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it because this game gave me cancer anyway.

review: Rust is a promising game with some fatal flaws. While I mostly love the gameplay mechanics and the scope of the world the "fun to suck ratio" is very skewed. Everything in this game is temporary and it can be very frustrating to spend hours building before watching somebody destroy it in seconds. Ultimately you'll spend three or four hours building a relatively safe base before you consider focusing on PVP (you'll need a safe place to keep your loot respawn point and crafting stations). It's around this point that three guys always destroy your base with C4 destroy your spawn point take all your stuff and say mean stuff about your mom. No matter how skilled you are you will not be able to prevent this as your opponents outnumber you and dump ungodly amounts of time into the game grinding for resources and fortifying their bases.The community is overwhelmingly toxic. Expect signs on walls to feature a lot of crudely drawn swastikas and My friend and I have both uninstalled this game multiple times because we actually have jobs and it's just not fun to come home log in and discover that middle schoolers have burnt your fortress to the ground while you were busy being a human being.

review: The developers are constantly adding new mechanics and items to the game. It's not limited to new weapons or skins but vehicles and puzzles and multiple layers to add new gameplay for more enjoyment. With the multitude of servers you can pick your preference of a short term weekly wipe server to a long term two month wipe server. The blueprint system forces you to go out and take a risk with your hard earned items to get more weapons or armor to roam or more resources to fortify your base from raiders. It's a constant rollercoaster of huge wins and devastating losses that will have your heart pumping with adrenaline. Every fight is important and you're constantly on alert. Great game.

review: Should you buy this game?If you are a solo player NOIf you play with your friends YESIn this game there are no benefits of being a solo player just like there are no downsides of being a group player. Therefore teaming with other players is always a priority since it makes the game much easier. On the other hand as a solo player 9/10 times you will be put in an unfair fight against a group of enemies which you WONT win even if you are a god since the numbers are against you. What is the point of playing a game where you can't progress or achieve anything. This is the reason why there are a few solo players (At least in my experience). Even if you succeede and aquire best equipment possible the chances of you winning a 1v3 or 1v4 fight are microscopic. I don't see a reason why you should play this game solo. First 50h this game might look fun but as you keep playing you start to realise how unfair it is and you just get frustrated. This game seems fun but as you play it it doesn't feel that way.I will give you some examples of my own experience to prove my point I went to a server that wiped 2h ago to start a wresh wipe. After 20 min I have gathered enogh resources to buld a 2x2 wood shack. As I was waiting inside my shack for morning to come 2 3 people appear near my shack asking me to bring them 500 low grade fuel or 50 hight quality metal in 1 hour otherwise they will burn my house. Obviously this requirement is impossible so I lost my house and a desire to play this game. If only this situation was a rare thing in this game but it's not.The community in this game is beyond garbage. Clans shooting nakeds at the beach getting killed while trying to be friendly being chased by 2 fully geared people across the entire map 5 secs after spawning naked being insulted in every way possible by other people when they lose the fight and I'm not even going to mention door/roof campers.What does Facepunch do to fix this? Nothing.Each patch this game becomes more and more team based where clans rule everything while solos are stomped into dirt.P.S. review: An open world multiplayer survival game sporting monthly updates that are sure to keep you playing in the next wipe. This game is unique in its wipe mechanic meaning that on the first Thursday of every month when the update hits every server and map are reset completely and players start from ground zero once again. This ensures that everyone has a fighting chance in this game and you won't have to worry about going against players with endgame content while you yourself have but a stone spear while keeping the game feeling fresh.I would highly recommend this fun yet challenging game for anyone looking for an online survival experience!

review: Positive points The Survival Genre at its finestRust is a very immersive experience. You spawn with nothing but a rock and a torch and from then on you need to survive as you can collecting resources building up your base upgrading your tools upgrading your base to keep it safe from raiders fighting wild animals nature itself trading with other players eventually killing them raiding people exploring abandoned buildings etc. Everything in order to survive and set up your life on the game.The graphics are beautiful the sound system is surprisingly good game physics are balanced the maps are gorgeous the monuments buildings caves beaches mountains cities biomes everything meticulously made with plenty of details NPCs' AI are so good that it makes you salty sometimes the game has a lot of weapons resources items puzzles cloths skins and a buch of new features getting in every month. This game is rich of detailes and ways to play it.Always learningThat's my favorite aspect about this game there's always something new to learn on it. I've learned more getting raided ambushed trapped killed cheated than any tutotial could ever teach me. Mistakes make you stronger keep it in mind.Updates and the devs teamRust has monthly updates which makes it always seem like brand new. Some of these updates drastically change the playstyle which is for good most of the times. Anounces of upcoming updates and its contents are always published a month early on rust blog. In other words this game is far from being dead and/or abandoned on the contrary it's never been so alive.Negative points ClansIt's more like a flaw if I can call it so. The game privileges larger groups of players which means duos and small groups with 3 4 players are in a very unfair scenario against larger groups containing +10 people. When the late game comes they're gone raided. Abolutely wiped out of the server. You can always try a diplomatic agreement with these clans to prevent these unpleasant situations offering resources teamworks etc. Another alternative is to hide your base very well making it as hidden as you can. It's totally possible to survive an whole wipe without getting raided by simply choosing the right place to build your base up and avoiding unwanted attention.GrindingThis games requires grinding. A LOT. So if you have time to spend on it that shouldn't be a problem to you. Otherwise you may get stuck in the early game forever. Having a large group of players aside of you makes everything much easier once everyone can focus on a different task doing everything by yourself just to get raided on the very next day is extremely frustraiting.Two phrases which summarize very well what is like to grind in rust "It's never enough" "You will always need more scrap."Toxic BehaviorYou get yourself killed in rust for the most stupidity reason. Sometimes you have just spawned at the beach and get a bullet in your head for absolutely no reason at all. Most of the time people will kill you just for the sake of killing nothing else. There are good people out there tho willing to socialize and be friendly you just need to be luck and find them amonst the murderers and psycopaths.If you're a big fan of the survival genre I strongly recommend you to give Rust a chance. The good aspects certainly prevails the bad ones.

review: In consideration to it's Alpha state it has much potential to achieve and yet a lot to be developed. Entering into the world of Rust might be the most difficult thing you do (results may vary) but once you learn the ropes grow quite a bit of paranoia and perfect your archery things will start to look up!You won't want to set up camp near the radiation towns banditry is ravages this game as a main antagonist to your plans the player can kill any zombie bear or wolf with the right tools but you never know what to expect with bandits bandits lurk around the roads and radiation towns in my experience not ever meeting any in the far reaches of the map.Once you get your base of operations set up you will overcome the petty food problems and focus on more vain grand persuits such as pimping out your house crafting weapons from blueprints you took off a dead zombie and even creating a community of friends for a common survival or going to the darkside of banditry (I swear I will put a bullet in you...) Give it a try!

review: Rust is not for the faint of heart. Or easily offended. Or those who don't care to see semi naked men running about with rocks. What Rust IS is a game that takes survival and resource collecting and player vs player and melds it into an arena enviroment that the hapless player is dropped into to fend for themselves. PvP servers can be ( and usually are) brutal. PvE servers are highly recommended by this author so a new player can try to survive without fear of other players. It should be noted ( at the time of this writing) that Rust is still in development. One would hope some sort of tutorial will be included in the future to help players better understand how the game works. As it is you had best watch videos online to see how the game works and what is expected of you before you start esp if you plan on playing PvP.I do recommend Rust even in its current build. Although buggy at times it (usually) doesnt take away from gameplay. ++Update++ March 11 2016 There is much to say about the state of Dev's minds when tearing down a game and re building seemingly from scratch.. Honestly..I have no Rivscore sorry the state of the game as is is so laggy and full of bugs I will update asap.. stay tuned!

review: Don't buy this game if you value your time and sanity.The game is set up to encourage grinding over everything else. Nominally your goal as a player is to survive. Gathering food water and building supplies so that you can make better structures and weapons so that you can get better supplies etc.The problem is that at any point in this cycle if you die and lose your home base you have to start over from scratch. Also other players can raid your stuff and kill you even when you're not online.Given that success is predicated solely on the amount of materials you can harvest from the environment being successful means dumping huge amounts of time into doing repetitive tasks for marginal gains. And like I said before this can all get stolen from you at any time. All it takes is for some other guy or group of guys who spend more time grinding than you to gather the stuff necessary to demolish your base and steal your stuff most likely while you're offline.In essence your typical Rust session goes in one of the following ways 1. You are killed repeatedly before being able to find any tools or supplies whatsoever. You get insulted by 12 year olds over VOIP for being bad at the game. You quit and feel immense regret for spending your time on this game.2. You manage to gather enough materials to build a small base. This takes about 2 3 hours. You log off. You come back to find that your base was destroyed your materials were stolen and you were killed. You must start from scratch or you most likely quit and feel immense regret for spending your time on this game.3. You build a base only to find out that the server is empty and there's nothing to do. You quit and feel immense regret for spending time on this game.4. You did it. You managed to grind more than anyone else and are now the most powerful person/group in the server. You then realize that there's no reward for doing so and have become the person you despised for so long. You figure that any further "progress" you make is just going to deter people from the server you play on and that your enormous amount of time spent has been for nothing of substance. You quit and feel immense regret for spending your time on this game.By the way the community for the game is incredibly toxic. If you're lucky enough to not be berated with racial slurs every 5 seconds you're going to have to deal with Russian hackers clan s people who shoot you for no reason obnoxious 10 year old kids and pretty much any other stereotypical internet troll you can think of. They are all that is left of the community now.This is on top of the fact that the game is littered with numerous bugs glitches design problems collision issues bad hit detection desync issues poor optimization and all the other fun stuff that comes with the "early access" label.The game has been in development since 2013 and yet the core issues that I have with the game have not changed since launch over 5 years ago. The game is still in alpha. Where did the time go? Where did the money go? It seems to me like they've been doing the bare minimum necessary to prevent people from saying that they've abandoned the project.As a person who has owned the game since its release in 2013 I have personally spent way more time playing Rust than I'd like to admit. Once you fall into it it's addicting. With friends Rust has its moments. But none of what you do in the game ever feels like it's worth the effort. It's probably one of the only games that I have played that consistently makes me feel worse after every time playing it. There's never been an instant where I've left a game of Rust feeling like I had a great time. You're either dejected from your lost time investment or anxious that whatever you've worked on is in jeopardy of being taken from you.I know I've ranted a lot here but this has been a long time coming. I can say that no other game I've played has given me such a negative overall experience. Words alone cannot describe the extent to which I can recommend against this game. Take the money you wanted to spend on this game and put it towards something you can actually enjoy. Buying it will only give Facepunch more of a reason to maintain the farcical status quo they've created over the development of this game.

review: This game is essentially the most challenging PVO (Player Versus Offline) game I have played. I honestly stopped liking this game a while ago but I would definetly give it another try if I have friends who want to play. I recommend this game's mechanics and beauty but not the community and overall experience. I haven't played in the last month but I played this game religiously previously. If you are looking for a game that is raw survival involving food management construction and scavenging then this game is for you. If you want to play with a community then that is a different story.This games is designed to essentially live life as a raider. You start out naked and work your way up to gain the most resources while huge mass of other players are also competing. You start out only with a rock and eventually you will have a gun to defend your stuff. If you do happen to make friends that won't actually steal from you then this game will be consume your time with fun and friendly banter but it can also destroy your faith in humanity as you login to find your property pillaged.As time goes on the game gets slow it's fun for a while but you eventually get tired of having to either own enough stuff to build something solid enough to stop most attacks (concrete for example) or hide. The people who play this game devolve into three types the raiders the desperate survivors and then the players who came with friends who also liked the game but wanted friends to both help and be able to log off without worrying. The raiding players are ones who played long enough or cheated (which happened a long time ago but not recently to me) who hunt new players for sport and steal your stuff just out of entertainment or to cement their power. The desperate are players who spend their time playing to survive and hide until they are powerful enough to be a raider themselves. The friends group are the rarest but the best players to play with as they rotate online and are able to render help to players.What really spoiled the game is the server wiping hacking and community. Unless you play with friends or happen to find some online then be prepared to play the entire time with a hightened heart rate and fits of rage while also being anxious offline wondering if someone has found your base yet. After spending hours uppon hours of playing to become powerful enough to ward off the raiders and other hostiles (zombies) then the worst happens you encounter a hacker. You spent all the time making a machine gun ammo and scavenging materials to be able to play without fear just to have your bullets do nothing and have a teleporting troll blink into your fortress and raid everything. If you finally do wait for the hacker to be kicked or get bored there is the worst thing that happens a server wipe.As it should be expected of early access games server wipes are devestating for players who have sunk more than a couple of hours into a server. You finally find your friend build a base and crafted some decent items only to find that everyone is running around like they have nothing to lose after the admins gift everyone with rocket launchers guns and other weapons only seen after at least a day of mining crafting and scavenging schematics.All in all I would highly recommend this game to someone who wants a SURVIVAL GAME. Suvival does not always mean friends given things and expecting everyone to be reasonable. I would also recommend it to someone who wants a challenge in online multiplaying.

review: After having played this game on fairly populated servers I can say that most people kill you on sight but after a few hours of messing around the game becomes much easier. I have run into plenty of players who have also offered to helo me out with whatever i need. Sure there are huge zerg style clans that can easily ruin your day but what do you expect from a game like Rust? Being a solo player like myself can be especially frustrating at times but with a little bit of brainpower and effort you will soon have yourself set up to defend yourself well enough against attackers. As far as optimization goes there is some work to be done there but I myself have a average rig and on good settings im running at around 50 60 fps wich isn't too bad. Most of the negative reviews I've read just seem like salty kids who got raided one too many times. It would be nice to see some more PVE content but that isnt too much of a downfall for me as I really do enjoy playing but I would also like to see some more variety with regards to clothes and armor as they are quite limited. I am currently playing solo on a vanilla server with a population of around 250 players online at a time it has taken me two days to set up a metal base with huge walls around and I have managed to defend myself against groups of up to 5 people at a time without much hassel. All in all I would reccomend this game as it is loads of fun but if you are a keyboard samurai and dont like having to start fresh a few times before you become comfortable in the game then I suggest you give this a skip and try something like the Sims instead.

review: This game used to be a mess. It's nowhere near perfect however the devs are really working to make this game exactly what we all kind of had in mind for rust. They're listening to the community input much more now than ever and eventually this game is going to be incredible. The only cons to this game would be the server lag and most importantly the hackers. They're the only thing that drives me away from the playing this game as much as I used to. There's nothing worse than buying the game spending hours on end to build up a compound with your friends and then have everything taken away by a script kiddy who bought the game that day to terrorize the server you play on with every intention of ruining people's time until they are banned. If this problem were fixed the game would be my all around favorite game.

review: this game is a SCAM stay away from it. if you want to really off an enemy you can buy this game as a gift for him.they took 8 months to release a new version of the game the new engine is even more broken than it was before. ok the new engine looks beautiful but you want play a game or it should be a screen saver?1 you can't awake your character on official servers 2 animals just enter inside rocks like it doesnt exist 3 melee is broken you can swing your rock to hit an animal and in fact you only hit like 10% of the time even if you're clearly seeing your stone going through the animal it wont take any damage 4 when you try kill a bear using a rock you can actually do it in 2 hits (like pigs or deers). but the most laughable thing is when the bear tries to hit you you take damage before his pawns hit you 5 they added some satellite dishes around the map and they have stairs for you to go up. but your character doesnt go up the stairs you must jump your way up.7 you can take 1000 wood from one single tree8 you need 100 cloth to make a bandage exactly half of what you need to make a sleeping bag or some pants (50 cloth). thats what i call balance!9 you need a super computer to run it smoothly. forget about the minimum and recommended settings my rig is better than recomemended and that doesnt mean i can run it on medium without stuttering or huge drops of fps.the list goes on i got this game broken errors after only 30 minutes so thats enough for me. im just waiting for next excuse by garry. they probably will say they're gonna change the engine again and the game will never be released. Oldest EditAfter 4 months of the release date there are no content added just a bunch of excuses from Garry and his team. Devs should add content test new stuff and that sort of things but facepunch only works to change rock skins new deer skins and some stuff they say they're working but in fact they don't update the game. If you doubt go check playrust the official devs page and check it out for how long they don't add anything to the game it's excuses after excuses and there are no proof that the game still in development. Another alpha early access games have more continous updates than this one.It's sad but I think this game won't change that much until they release the final version which will be basically the same of the early access version.
