review: This is a game you have to spend more than 1 2 hrs per day to actually enjoy it. You will have to spend a couple of hours to get full enjoyment and excitment from the game. Don't complain until you have fully tried giving it a chance.The first 0 200 hrs will probably not be the best you will ever have. In these 200 hrs you are learning from the mistages you will commit."Common" mistakes A wall/doorframe/window will have its softside outwards No TC or failing to feed the upkeep of your base. A window without a door behind it so raiders can access your loot very easily Unlocked code Trusting somebody you don't know you can trust (most Rust players) You are going outside with your door keyAll these are very easily avoided by simply watching a youtube video or some kind of tutorial on how to build a good base for the amount of people you are playing with. For example if you're solo you can find good bases for a solo player same thing if it's for a duo or more. And by watching some "tricks and tips" or some kind of "Rust video for beginners".As i've said before the first 0 200 hrs won't be very good for you. And here are some reasons You will be killed (a lot)Honestly this is the only reason. Getting killed is the main reason as to why you are not progressing or you are progressing very slowly. But after approximately 200 hrs (may be earlier or later depending if you're a fast learner or not) you will understand how the game works and you can counter all the things that can get in your way of surviving the wipe. Such as Stonger base Guns More efficent farming Better blueprints Better movementIn conclusion Don't complain until you have actually tried it. Don't say you have tried it until you have 200+ hrs and play more than 1 hr per day or just a few hrs per week. You have to give rust a real shot.This review is somewhat aimed at "Gamespot"s review giving it a 3/10 because they didnt play it for more than a couple of hrs and therefore didn't enjoy it.

review: 0 / 10 One of the Worst titles iv played in my 20+ years of gaming.I carried on playing and gave it plenty of chances to turn my opinion around.So whats wrong with it?Gameplay 0/10Gameplay was left up to players to decide and ValveAntiCheat (VAC) is behind the games protection....so naturally...EVERYONE is hacking their brains out wallhacks aimhacks no clip flying people EVERYWHERE on most servers what an absolute fiasco. NEVER leave gameplay up to the people because trolls and cheaters will simply come in and wreck your game in an INSTANT they have done here. This is worse than the Crysis 2 multiplayer shutdown disaster. I'd even say the highly populated hacking here is as worse as CS 1.6. ONE in every THREE players is doing something they shouldnt be doing to gain an unfair advantage. Wether its admin commands straigth up hacking or removing all of the grass you should be able to hide in by remaining crouched and still is removed with "grass.on false" in console for EVERYONE to abuse.The cheating going on in rust has caused it's absolute downfall unless the developers A. DUMP VAC for another anticheat that isnt well known for being an absolute joke at catching a cold let alone a cheater.B. Give people an indestructable home or loot or something because nobody can start on a server unless they themselves started it for an unfair advantage or played a tonne with 0 players online. NOBODY CAN START who isnt already pumped up rich by whatever unfair mean they gained their advantage.For anyone who DOES want to play this game there is only one way. An edited paragraph from the main page "The only aim in Rust is to survive. The only aim in Rust is Aimbot.To play Rust you will need to go into the console and type "grass.on false" googlesearch for an aimbot preferably with wallhack and fullbright at night hack and no clip hack and congradulations! You are now the average player. Now go.WHATEVER IT TAKES to survive."Graphics 6/10 Lotta flickery game objects on distance nothing loads until youre near it however that lighting engine is gorgeous the day/night cycle is just beautiful. The graphics are quite promising!Sound 1/10Free SFX you can find by google searching or ripping from other games apart from the Pistol reload which is new and relatively good.They probably wont get rid of VAC or listen to anything this reviewer is blabbering on about so...FOR THE LOVE OF EVERYTHING HOLY AVOID THIS TRAIN WRECK.

review: If your looking to buy this game and you dont know much about it I'd say go for it! It's awesome! But for those of you who have played before or a developer or member of Facepunch (fingers crossed that you guys will read this) I have some 'complaints'.For those of you who dont know Rust legacy is a version of the game which was introduced while the game was being developed and was playable as an alternate version up until recently (as far as I can tell from the forums within the last few months of 2k16). Honestly the current Rust and Rust legacy are two completely different games both haveing their strenghts and weaknesses. While the majority of people play the current version both for its better graphics lack of hackers and the fact that its still being developed there was a strong community who still played the old game. Personally I hadnt played either version of the game in several months but between my three account I probably have close to fifteen hundred hours on the two of them and most of that was on legacy. I came back recently because of rumors of the games death and after discovering they were true Ive been working to find a solution. All I ask is for your guys help and support in getting this game back either as its own title 'legacy' or as an alternate version of the current game. In all honesty we as a community dont care about the lag and the bugs and the hackers that plauged the game and getting it back even without further development on FacePunches part would make us happy. Most of us would even be willing to spend the money to buy it as a seperate title. As far as it not being worth it for the developers to continue it I say dont worry about it. If PacePunch truely got rid of the game becasue they didnt want to host the servers anymore just make it our problem. Have all the servers be client sided. if you cant do that give us the code! I'd be happy to personally develope and host the damn game if it ment people could play it again or give it to the community at large make it a project we could all work on together.Just please consider giving us our game back!
title: Rust

review: This is a story about my first experiance with RUST.I spawned into a world full of massive houses. Assuming they were filled with well armed people I avoided them like the plague. This is how things went until I got beat to death with an axe. Second spawn I decided to build a structure. I found a nice clearing by some radiation and an animal spawn. I had just built a shack when I saw my second person ever. He turned out to be friendly and his name was cass. Me and cass were down on supplies until a kind soul named moldy gave us some weapons and supplies. He was our savior. Another man with a base at a hanger gave us all of his things when he was quiting. He left me with some sound wisdom "Remember this is RUST everyone dies". We took his things and built an actual house. After getting raided a few times moldy called out on the chat that he was looking for some teammates. Feeling obligated to help him me and cass joined up with the "Potato Army". We wandered around helping noobs and killing foes. We were invincible. Until we were killed by a hacker at a friendly rave at the hanger. Moldy and cass quit out and I was left with only one other army member gummy a girl who made cat noises into her mic for the next 7 hours. So I took moldy's stores of weapons and armor and started recruiting members into the reformed Potato Army. At my best we had around 5 15 members gathering wood to build a larger base. the base was almost done while I was negotiating with a man who said he could help us get airdrops. Then a hacker came and killed our entire base. The army was left with only 3 loyal members me gummy and a guy name phoenix. We were selective in who could get in our base and we let the man I was negotiating with in because he said he could also help with the hacker that was killing us. Long story short he killed all of us and raided our base. But he didn't know the password to the door so he was locked in. He stayed there for an hour shouting about how he was a hacker and would ruin the server for us if we ever came back. So after 18 hours straight 2 of my empires had risen and fallen in the same server. Would I recamend this game? Yes. It is buggy laggy and filled with hackers but if you manage to get yourself into a good position nothing can make you feel bad.

review: So much potential but in the current form not really offering much in casual gaming.I've only spent about 15hrs on the game and the learning curve is quick the build up of resources initially is slow and sadly this game doesn't have the right balance yet. It's just too tipped toward the players that can accumulate the resources fastest.The early format though looks interesting and I hope to review this again in a few months.For all the people thinking well this is an Alpha well it is. But once you put a price tag on something you have to be prepared to deliver something that has some enjoyment value and at the moment it's too much of a grind.

review: I wanted to like this game a lot I really did. Like a better survival game than ARK SE. But it's hecking bad.Both the game itself is bad and the community. The community is sexistic racistic and use homophobic slurs. They also LOVE to kill fresh spawns for sport. In this game you don't die straight away when you get gunned down. You go into a "wounded" state where you will lie for 5 minutes before you die. Unless you get help. So these high tier guys guns you down so you can stare at a grey landscape for 5 minutes after you just spent 30 minutes trying to find some food water and clothes. There's no way you can speed up your death or commit suicide. You are forced to wait while the gunners mock you for being new to the game/server.And then you try again...and again...I have about 50 hours in this game but I have practicially only been playing it for 5 10 hours. The remaining have been me trying to find a safe spot to settle find food and get gunned down by high tier guys with AK 47s while I have a rock I can throw once. Once.I really didn't have any funny moments or stories to share which says a bit about the game.

review: Time to write a real full indepth review of my time so far in Rust.I have over 1 110 hours in this game as of writing this.I've played solo duo trio all of the above. One of the hard facts is that with a small group of 3 or less I would recommend playing on low population servers or small community servers otherwise you will get destroyed everyday to being on or ofline raided.But lets start on a wipe day. Typicaly the first thursday of every month unless forced more information can be found about updates or wipe things on http //www.rustafied.com/ . Wipe days are my funnest times for fighting primitive combat(spears/melee/bow/crossbow if you are lucky) fighting for that first few hours trying to get a base down so you can expand is extremely exciting. All the high paced action without the worry of anyone having guns to blow you away with to fast for you to react.Okay so now we are a few days into wipe. You have a base you go to bed and get on in the morning to see you have been ofline raided but they didn't greif you(Not raiders). You fix up the holes they made and start working on repairing and figuring out where you went wrong. You look to youtube and find a better way to go about building. You and your mates collect more for building this new and improved base. You finish and feel so proud about what you have done.Skip to the next day you look into getting guns. You get your radiation suit all ready to go you head out to a monument and manage to get out with an smg body and/or a rilfe body and get your self a pretty gun. You kill a few people but die to the heli because you didn't know what it did. You get your stuff back after finding your body now you seek revenge on the heli. Once again looking up how to take out the heli. You build you and your mates heli towers or heli boxes to fight the heli and finaly take it down getting all sorts of good loot in trade for bullets.01/02/2017 I don't have time to finish this review yet so I will post this now and continue later stay rusty mates.

review: All will decay. Everything will return to the dust from which it came. Entropy is at the heart of Rust. The title of the game suggests as much. Although packaged up as a survival game Rust is a wonderful resource management game. One in which you are constantly gathering resources in an attempt to push back the decay of time while trying to mass enough resources to beat your neighbour on the head.Expect trolls griefing and a bunch of moments of utter dispair as you lose everything you've spent hours collecting/crafting in this semi persistent survival FPS.Highly reccomend playing in a team or at least 2 players. Yes it can be played alone but you will constantly feel like an underdog barely able to keep your house together from larger more aggressive teams.

review: Look at the hours played. Clearly I enjoy this game. And unlike some other members of this incresingly toxic community I'm not going to try and blackmail the devs by changing my review if they do something I don't like. It's a great enthralling engrossing survival game. Your worst enemy is everyone you meet and that goes double on Twitter and Reddit. Build great bases and upgrade them only to be raided and heartbroken by a 30 person clan who doesn't need your stuff but will take it anyway. Collect resources and try not to be headshot by someone sitting on their roof. Write an honest review and watch the downvotes pour in. I absolutely recommend this game. Watch some videos to get you started there's things you need to know. Best most interactive (and patient) dev team I've ever seen even in the face of spittle lipped twelvies screeching poorly spelled hyperbole at all corners. Go buy it now. Scrub.

I quit.I think to have fun in this game you need to be a very active player and probably most importantly you need friends. review: My first review of this game was in 2014. Since then the game has grown even better. The way this game gets it hooks into me is absolutely amazing.If you want a quick picture imagine DayZ. Give it a good engine so the gameplay doesnt feel like a mess. Make the map smaller and different everytime. Add base building and "blueprints"(learning) for a good way to feel progression. And tools to destroy said bases.The game is not perfect but compared to other survival/sandbox games that were released around 2013 this one has shown the most progress and continues to do so.It is not perfect optimization could still be done as FPS varies a bit more than it should and if you play solo duo or trio (1 2 3) the server you play on will die quickly but most of the time the "tense" element remains.

review: So straight up. It is a great game.. It has endless replay value as maps and updates change how you decide to play the game. As a "turtle bot" building a grand base to defend all your hard earned materials. Or maybe as a nomad carrying only what you need while you hunt down people with better gear than you.There are 3 big parts to this game which are Raiding (the action of breaking into another player or groups base taking their stuff) Building (pretty self explanatory you build whatever you like and the terrain allows) and survival (you need to stay warm/cool eat and drink and fend off bears and wolves.)As of the component systems release raiding has become way harder in my opinion. The amount of materials needed to craft the needed timed explosives and/or satchel charges are far greater than the resources needed to build a base safe from said explosives. Weapons are also very limited and the rule of "first raider have the advantage" is much more in effect now. Except for that the combat system is very good with a wide selection of weapons when you finally get them.Building is still a little wonky at times some glitches here and there but overall it is fairly good. You can make pretty intricate designs and use the system to your advantage (double walls where there should just be 1 etc) The constructions some people build still amazes me. And it is easy to understand.Pros Great varietyAmazing graphics if you have the pc to run itConstant updates (small ones every thursday and first thursday of the month a large one)Easy to set up a private serverCons Constant updates... Updates sometimes alter the game to much imho and lately there have been 2.Load times when you enter a server are really high on medium/low tier computers. (read 5 10 minutes)Key aspects of the game are harder now to the point modded servers die out.All in all I think it is a great game and having clocked 2000 hours ingame I would recommend it for anyone that are into multiplayer survival. 8/10

review: One of the better survival games i've played. Combat is fun and balanced I guess. I can't count how many times i've had funny moments on this game either. Game speaks for itself it's player count is high all the time and it recieves updates very often... which makes me come to the bad part of the review.Updates. They've reworked the entire system to how making things and loot things 3 times already since release and all 3 times nobody asked for one. The current one however is the worse out of them all. It's not so much a problem for me anymore but out of all 3 things they tried this one I hate the most. RNG component system to make guns and such ripped straight from 7 Days to Die. There are things in the game that they have chosen to neglect like the animal AI which has been a problem for over a year now to reworking something that was fine to begin with. We went from hitting barrels and looting rad towns to find blueprints for certain items to having a leveling system that unlocks items based on how much work you put in to what we have now.. an RNG looting/crafting system with everything unlocked.Another bad thing about it is it's community. Expect to be offline raided A LOT. 90% of the time you will work for week to make a base only to go to sleep and wake up to find your base destroyed and everything stolen by some no life who grinded the game from wipe day. There is no way to combat this and I doubt they're going to do anything to fix it. Another thing I heard hackers are rampant. Although I rarely come across one it feels as if many people who I fight are hacking. Far as I can tell it's really easy to make scripts to make gunplay extremely easy.My current view on this game is positive. I can overlook the toxicity and the devs almost ruining the game with the component system for the fun moments i've had and the many hours i've played.

It may be hard to find friends in Rust though because of the very toxic community very little you will have the chance of meeting a nice player. review: Much like every other open world sandbox this one is focused survival and building. BUT game mechanics makes it more like first person shooter with crafting options.So I would recommend this game rather to FPS fans than to sandbox/simulation fans.What I like 1. Pleasant real world graphics (not to compare with Minecraft).2. Exploration concept higher ranked items can be crafted after you get a recipe which spawns in radiated cities only non player built territory in the game.3. Building system is hard enough to take considerable amount of time to create safe and convenient place to live.What I don't like 1. Just like many PvP oriented games this one totally lacks any other kind of player interaction except killing encounters. It makes the game boring if you are not playing with your friends.2. Despite seemingly open world on the server I played I found like two day travel territory without any food resources. It seems unrealistic like game mechanics force you to play on the smaller territory and compete for resources with onther players.

review: Honestly I've never played a better game. The scenery is breath taking and vast. I've played this game for thousands of hours and have yet to even think about playing another game. The PvE and PvP are perfectly crafted with the perfect balance. I've personally killed hundreds of bears and haven't gotten tired of it (in the game I don't actually like killing animals in real life. Never have don't plan on it). The PvP is excellent. The fights are intense and very funny with friends at times! I also think that the loading times aren't that long considering what you're getting out this game and a 40$ price? That's great! I've bought this game at least 6 times and keep I'll keep on buying it until I'm bored with it(which I probably never will!). I 100% recommend this game!

review: I can't recommend this game until they allow character customization.Is that petty? Perhaps but let me tell you why it's important to me (and a standard for video games in the current age especially games that are out of Early Access). 1. It limits how much I play the game The game is fun even in its current state. You spend hours and hours of grinding to get the perfect base but at the end of the day what's a base when you can't personally connect to the character living inside? When I create a character I like to imagine where they came from what their stories are to justify how they would look in game. You know what if they add character customization I might actually make the same ugly bastard that I'm playing with now but at least it'd be on my terms and that's what matters.The developers have said that you are brought to the real world the way you are and you didn't get to choose how you look so why should you in Rust? That's a ridiculous statement. You can get surgery to change how you look in real life if you don't like it. Games aren't meant to be like real life there needs to be a point to playing games. So I can't choose how I look in game but I can survive and run away with a bullet in my leg simply by bandaging my arm? Yes that's realism! 2. I would spend more money on the market When buying skins for clothing on the market I like to think of how it would look on my character. Then I realise everything would look like absolute on my character so I don't buy anything. That's bad business.3. Just give us character customization already.Seriously I don't care if you make us pay for it just let us choose already. I wouldn't even care if you had to choose from premade presets. I wouldn't even care if you added it as character lootboxes Pay to get a new randomly generated character. I would lose respect for the developer for the last option but I would be insanely happy nonetheless.Update I can't recommend this game for what the game has become. It's just no longer worth playing.

review: Hm what can I say about rust? I mean sure the game's community is a majority of horribly toxic players who kill new players on sight for no logical reason there is nearly no sense of wildlife in the gane except for the rare deer or bear and that the game is horribly unoptimised but these are just minor set backs right? Ehhh kinda? The game has a $20 price tag which rarely goes down on sale which means its difficult for people to try out this game without paying the extremely high price. Unfortunately this game can be quite tedious and just an openworld PvP FPS most of the time with next to none of the "survival" aspect that Facepunch was going for. The game itself is quite enjoyable with a larger group of friends or even a clan but playing alone is a nearly impossible task as if you are alone and farming resources to upgrade your base and a small group of players ambushed you. Bam everything is lost. Oh and if you try to join a group of players to survive with they'll either kill you or they'll....uhhh no actually they'll just kill you. Luckily this game has got decent players that help new players and aid they're attempt of survival and these players are what give you hope to take down the toxic and fight for the good. Now why am I giving this game a positive review? It's because of how the game has a way to keep bringing you back to make you think 'I want to build a fort and start a clan." Or " I should check back on my base and upgrade it" or just " man I wanna play some Rust ". Sure the game needs many updates and improvements to become a full game sure the players need to stop being so toxic so the game stops having a bad reputation for it's community and sure the price should drop more often for players that don't want to buy a non developed game for $20. These things may happen overtime but at this point I believe that Rust was worth my money and was *mainly* good fun.

review: I brought this game some time in 2016 never got around to playing it. now that i have over 100 hours in a few weeks i am well and truly addicted.It can be annoying when you first spawn and lose your resorces after being killed by some geared guy with an ak 47. Although it can also be very rewarding after a succesfull raid or a clean headshot it is very agrovating when it happens to you. If you are new to the game I strongly recomend playing on a low pop or highly modded server such as a noob freindly or 10/1000 times resorce. This will teach you the basics by doing. Or if you wish to pratice ypur base building skills ther are plenty of creative servers with unlimmited eveything( Just search "creative" in the modded tab). Also there are also servers in which you spawn with all wepons and ammo which is good for learning pvp skills. When i brought the game i just jumped into the first server i could find. This was a offical server which very hard as a noob then i found the bluebery line of servers in the modded tab these are what i play as lot. I tend to play 5x a lot. Overall i think that this is both a fun and rewarding survival pvp game that is well worth its alpha price.

Now don't get me wrong I get that PvP is supposed to be a big part of the game. However nearly every server I tried the spawns are camped for lulz by geared players and all you have is a rock and a torch vs people with guns. review: This game is good don't let reviews from crybabys deter you from it. It was made to be an intense PVP surivial game so complaining about what other players do and other clans do is downright silly. It's meant to be a brutal game and it does just that. If you have a decent rig and a decent GPU the game will run fine with few problems. After putting 700 hours into this game I still find myself playing and enjoying everyday. I lead a clan of 11 members and I can tell you its one of the most fun things I've done on the internet yet. This is a breath of fresh air because far too often there are games getting popular where you get banned for talking and greifing however in rust anything(besides hacking) goes and thats what I love about it. Manchildren/crybabys will hate it actual people who can handle conflict natural born leaders and such will love it.10/10

review: Es ist mal wieder Survival Time. Holz und Steine sind gesammelt die erste rudimentäre Axt und eine Steinspitzhacke sind auch im Inventar. Bogen und Pfeile check. Bauplan craften vier Wände und ein Dach Schlafsack Schmelzofen Werkbank läuft doch prima. Bis auf einmal nachts Schritte zu hören sind. Da ist einer vor unserer Hütte. Klick. Und unsere Tür steht in Flammen. Da will uns doch tatsächlich einer mit dem Flammenwerfer heimsuchen . Jetzt schlau sein und warten. Die Tür ist weg die Flammen auch und schnell rennen wir raus in die Nacht. Geschafft! Sicherheitshalber warten wir noch zehn Minuten bis er auch sicher nicht mehr da ist bevor wir zu unserer Hütte zurückgehen und nachgucken was von unserem Loot noch in den Kisten ist *Schock* Der Kerl hat uns nicht nur alles geklaut was wir haben er hat auch noch eine neue Tür eingesetzt und ein Schloss drangehängt. Das war es mit unserer Base Mit Stock und Stein kommen wir da nicht mehr rein. Jetzt gibt es nur zwei Möglichkeiten Rust deinstallieren oder es so oft neu probieren bis wir selber der Mistkerl sind der anderen die Hütte raidet .https //steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id 1370833249Rust erschien 2013 hier auf Steam und blieb fast fünf Jahre im Early Access bis es im Februar 2018 endlich offiziell released wurde. Ich verrate euch jetzt warum Rust meiner Meinung nach eigentlich ein gutes Spiel ist aber worauf ihr euch da einlasst.GameplayWie schon eingangs beschrieben ist Rust ein klassisches Survival Action Adventure im Stil von DayZ Ark 7 Days to Die und wie sie alle heißen. In der Ego Perspektive steuert ihr euren zunächst nackten Recken durch eine offene Spielwelt sammelt Holz und Steine baut euch eine Basis sammelt Waffen (vom Bogen bis zum Raketenwerfer ist alles dabei) und kämpft PvE und PvP ums Überleben. Und genau im letzten Punkt liegt der Hund begraben.https //steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id 1372199356PvE bedeutet im Prinzip nur dass in der Spielwelt meistens in der Nähe des besten Loots ein paar blau gekleidete Forscher rumlaufen die mit Maschinengewehren auf euch schießen wenn ihr ihnen zu nahe kommt. Die sind aber nach ein paar Spielstunden keine ernstzunehmende Bedrohung mehr für euch. Anders verhält sich das jedoch in Sachen PvP.Ich habe selten so aggressive und unfreundliche (menschliche) Spieler in einem Spiel gesehen wie in Rust. Selbst wenn man nackt ist (also klar erkennbar keinen wertvollen Loot besitzt) wird man grundlos umgeschossen und selbst Anfängerhütten mit Holzwänden werden rücksichtslos geraidet. Jetzt könnte man auf die Idee kommen den Spielern einen Vorwurf zu machen und manchmal mag das bestimmt auch berechtigt sein. Aber genau das ist eben der Sinn dieses Spiels. Es gibt keine erlesenen Basis Bau Rezepte. Es gibt keinen nennenswerten Endgame Content. Der einzige Sinn des Spiels ist das Aufleveln der Werkbank um so zunächst einfache Pistolen über Sturmgewehre bin hin zum Sprengstoff zu erforschen und craften zu können damit man damit dann auf die Jagd nach anderen Spielern und deren Behausungen gehen kann. Die Starken jagen die Schwachen. So funktioniert Rust nun einmal. Und wer meint casual auf einem der Server unterwegs sein zu können und jeden Tag ein Stündchen vor sich hin zu spielen der sei gewarnt. Wer so spielt gehört in Rust definitiv zu den Schwachen.GrafikRust sieht einfach super aus. Die Entwickler von Facepunch Studios zaubern mit der Unity Engine ein inzwischen optisch tadelloses Spiel auf die Bildschirme. Schönere Sonnenauf bzw. untergänge mit ihrem orange bis lilafarbenem Licht habe ich selten gesehen. https //steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id 1371422484Die Optik fordert jedoch auch ihren Tribut. Bei Mittelklasserechnern mit vollen Einstellungen gehen die FPS gerne mal in den Keller. Ich empfehle in diesem Fall das Gras etwas zu reduzieren was zugleich auch der besseren Übersicht im Spiel zugutekommt.UmfangRust bietet euch im Hauptmenü eine Vielzahl von unterschiedlichen Servern auf denen ihr (jedes Mal beginnend bei null) ins Abenteuer starten könnt. Klassischerweise wählt ihr einen offiziellen Server und spielt dort den klassischen Spielmodus also Survival gegen alle auf dem Server befindlichen anderen menschlichen Spieler. Der Servername gibt euch dabei Aufschluss über Land (und somit Sprache) des Servers und über den Spielmodus. Regelmäßig sind auch Zusätze wie beginner friendly oder noob friendly zu finden was zu Beginn vielleicht nicht schlecht ist )Neben den offiziellen Servern gibt es noch Community Server welche von Spielern betrieben werden sowie modded Server auf denen sich eine Vielzahl von anderen Spielmodi und Spielvarianten finden. Wie und wo man da selbst richtig aufgehoben ist muss jeder selber entscheiden. Es gibt die verschiedensten Spielvarianten von Deathmatch (mit sofortigem bewaffneten Respawn) bis hin zu superfreundlichen Servern ohne PvE und PvP wo man einfach nur in Ruhe vor sich hin bauen kann. Rust bietet also zwar durchaus Abwechslung in den Spielmodi der tatsächlich klassische Modus und somit auch die Server die am besten besucht sind sind aber klar die offiziellen mit dem oben beschriebenen Standardmodus von Rust. Cheater Problem?Man kann nicht Rust sagen ohne das gleich jemand bereit steht und etwas zum Thema Cheater berichtet und tatsächlich scheint Rust zu Beginn stark von diesem Problem heimgesucht worden zu sein. Ich hatte jedoch in den nun beinahe 100 Stunden in denen ich Rust gespielt habe nie das Gefühl gerade von einem Hacker getötet worden zu sein. Ich schätze dass die die mich gekillt und geraidet haben einfach nur besser waren als ich )ErrungenschaftenGute Nachrichten für alle Achievement Sammler. Rust beinhaltet 48 Errungenschaften die alle lediglich an das Bestehen des Tutorials geknüpft sind. Man muss keinen Gegner töten und kein Haus raiden aber dennoch ein Weilchen spielen. Diese Errungenschaften sollten für niemanden wirklich eine große Herausforderung darstellen. Da sie sich aber nur auf offiziellen Servern freischalten lassen muss man sich schon zumindest zeitweise für die Achievements den echten Spielern unter den echten harten Spielbedingungen stellen. FazitRust ist grundsätzlich ein gutes Spiel. Es hat ein zielstrebiges Konzept eine sehr schöne Optik eine aktive Community und knallharte Emotionen zu bieten verlangt dafür aber Taktik gewisse Skills an der Waffe und wirklich viel Zeit um die ersten Stunden und Tage eines frischen Servers mitzunehmen wo dort noch keine Spieler mit Raketenwerfer und C4 unterwegs sind (also nur im Urlaub/ in den Ferien spielen ).Wer kein Problem damit hat nach stundenlangem Spielen alles zu verlieren und wieder von vorne anzufangen und auch mit knallharten und erbarmungslosen menschlichen Spielern umgehen kann ohne die Maus an die Wand zu feuern oder in Depressionen zu verfallen der kann in Rust viele unterhaltsame Stunden verbringen. Für Casual Gamer und Pazifisten ist Rust hingegen absolut nichts. Die aktuellen 31 99 Euro hier auf Steam halte ich in Anbetracht des Alters des Spiels für etwas zu teuer. In den häufigen Sales ist Rust aber regelmäßig für unter 20 Euro zu haben. Von mir gibt es eine Kaufempfehlung aber mit ganz klaren Einschränkungen!
title: Rust

review: I would love this game if the community wasnt so toxic in this games whole time on steam the community hasnt gotten any better. The majority of people I see will try to kill me on sight even if is have a rock in my hand and im naked and im not talking about some random person with a spear killing me or something i mean some guys with water pipe shot guns shooting down a naked. Not only that but even if you have a base to run home to they will probably follow mic spam and then spend 10 minutes breaking it down just for fun not loot. This will probably never get better scince there is no penalty to killing people whenever you want and Facepunch cant regulate the community. There are also some other problems i have with the game like finding food early game being way to hard(same with hemp) but those can just be chlked up to "bad luck" i guess. Even the community part may be bad luck but almost all my encounters end with someone dying. I wont recommend this game untill the community grows a second brain cell and stops yelling obscenities at naked people while shooting them down with AKs

review: If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place but if your looking for an outstanding lemon bars recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients 1) 2 cups Flour2) 1/2 cup Sugar3) 1/4 teaspoon Salt4) 2 sticks (1 Cup) Salted Butter Cut Into Small Cubes5) Filling6) 1 1/2 cup Sugar7) 1/4 cup Flour8) 4 whole Large Eggs9) Zest And Juice Of 4 Medium sized Lemons10) Powdered Sugar For SiftingDirections 1. For the crust Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9 by 13 inch pan with butter.2. Stir together the flour sugar and salt. Add the butter to the bowl and use a pastry cutter to cut it all together until the mixture resembles fine crumbs. Press into the prepared pan and bake until golden around the edges about 20 minutes.3. For the filling Stir together the sugar and flour. Crack in the eggs and whisk to combine. Add the lemon zest and juice and mix until combined. Pour over the crust and bake about 20 minutes.4. Allow to cool in the fridge for a minimum of 2 hours then sift powdered sugar over the top before cutting into squares.(Use an 8 x 10 pan if you'd like the layers to be a little thicker.)

review: Writing this review has taken a lot of thought and speculation for what is to come of Rust in the future as it will (hopefully) exit early access and be published as a finished game. My first 300 hours in Rust were amazing. The expanse of the world and its playerbase made me super curious about the game and how I could get better. I literally didnt stop playing. Keep in mind that I played on a single 20 50 player server this entire time that didnt have huge clans. Eventually the excitement dulled out (yu yi). I wasnt playing a game I played it like a chore. Resource gathering 24/7 and taking time out of my day to catch up with the others on the server. Later last month I picked up the game again. To my surprise upon logging in to a 120 player server i found a wasteland of abandoned and raided bases before a montser base. It seems that nowadays in Rust if youre on a more than 100 player server you just play with the intent that you will be found if you are hiding your base away and you will be raided by a monster clan like DMG CML etc. Even hardcore players in small groups dont stand a chance on these servers. It's just a matter of time and surely not a fun one before your bases demise. Rust is now a clan game. Numbers are pretty much all that matter. I still love it.

review: I built a house and went on a journey to find my friends. I then got lost and ventured for about an hour to try to find my house again when i stubled upon a tower that went into the sky. I knocked the door when he answered it... with a rifle. I ran for my life prayed to shrek and finally asked him if i could please just wait in his house until dawn. he agreed and let me in and locked the door. I was in his guest room with my clothes on when he comes back downstairs in all of his naked glory saying " I'm all lubed up." I ran to the corner in fear when he pulled out a shotgun. he had it pointed at me for at least a minute before he spoke another word." Fix my door." he said. So i obeyed. He then proceed to walk closer and commanded me to through all of my weapons on the ground. i refused and jolted for the door which i forgot was locked. I then turned around to see him closer than before. he repeatedly crouched and stood up again ( T Baging me totally Call of Duty style) when he stopped he did not remove the shotgun from my face. I wanted to kill him but i needed to unlock the door somehow. He then enters a code and the door opens. I was finally free... Shrek finally answered my prayers. I ran off and built another house where i still to this day worship shrek... 10/10 get held hostage by a naked with a shotgun.

review: I've played since Legacy and this game has come an increadibly long way ! Over me and my mates account I've played close to 3500 hours. The gameplay is great although often feels choppy even at a high FPS/Good Ping but that is very minor. Updates are rolled out every single week with fixes anti hack updates optimization new items and texture overhauls !!! My biggest problem with this game is the emphasis on clan building a game such as this should be made easier with more people after all thats how all the greatest civilizations lasted..through team work ! But it makes playing on most servers as a solo player almost impossible they need ti implement mechanics to either help solo players or negate the bonus to having a large number of players in a single group ! If you havn't played RUST yet you should take a long look at yourself in the mirror while it's downloading and getting ready to play just expect to find friends fast or get stomped ! (Don't join servers against large clans it ruins the game currently).

review: No servers are wipefree as it's a FORCED wipe every first thursday of a month by the devs. Meaning if you build something pretty and kill all your neighbors don't expect it to last because it won't for more than a month.Having a SSD is pretty much a must as the load time to enter can take 15 20 minutes for someone with a HDD.Servers die fast which sucks. The only servers that stay populated are the very limited "Rustafied" official servers who you most of the time have to wait in a 200 player+ queue to enter which may take several hours unless you have VIP pass (not even exaggerated).Offline raids ruin the fun in the game too as the community seem to enjoy grinding materials for a ton of hours without any action for then to attack an undefended base with yet again no action. Obviously raiding someone while they're not there to defend it is easier for the attackers. However I really don't see the fun in it.

review: Rust originated as an awesome game where you could focus on survival or on attacking other players. The game developers held that against people after forced map wipes so any of your work is done. The game was beautifully designed and lots of fun you had to find blueprints to find new weapons and you could easily work as a team with friends where some can hunt and others build or whatever struck their fancy. The game developers then screwed it all up introducing an XP system that did not work. The system made it that you had to level up and then unlock weapons in a stupid way as you could not easily get all items. and the levels made it you could make metal knives and stuff before a primitive bow and arrow go figure. The Developers then screwed things up all the more by yet another full game wipe and insulting players who game often as well as holding it against them wanting to give XP 'buffs' to people who do not play the game much instead of rewarding those who do play it often. they are wanting to further make it harder to play the game peacefully and want to force players into pvp rather then pve.

review: Described as a "survival simulator " Rust would be more aptly characterized as a "burglary murder grind and grief simulator." If your experiences are anything like mine the same players will attempt to raid your base over and over again fail and while you're away from the game and unable to defend yourself finally succeed kill your player in his/her sleep loot everything and demolish your sleeping bag forcing you to respawn on the other side of an enormous map unable to reach your raided base in a reasonable amount of time. If you make the long journey across the map you'll find that your base has been destroyed or building permissions have been locked by the raider meaning you can't even place a new sleeping bag there let alone repair and use the base again. Therefore you'll abandon that base and either start over elsewhere or move on to a different game.It shouldn't be possible for another player to destroy your spawn point or to hijack your base's building permissions but it is and they do and for that reason Rust is unplayable.

review: I really really want to play and enjoy this game but it simply isn't worth it at this point in time.The recent addition of the XP system took this game from a exciting tense unpredictable survival game with a strong PvP presence to another MMOish predictable unexciting grindfest. Even the no lifers are complaining about the grind to unlock blueprints via levels.Worth noting for those of you with a life ... XP based blueprint unlocks mean most of the advanced(fun) stuff is behind a minimum of 40+ hours of grinding XP/Level is PER SERVER meaning any change of servers to join your friends means completely starting over from scratch Both official and many community servers wipe the map(all bases gathered resources etc) very regularly(1 4 weeks) and also wipe XP/Level on a less regular basis. Do not expect the in game results of ANY time spent in this game to stick around. Once a wipe happens the only thing previous sessions provide you is knowledge in game you're just as scrub as the other nakeds. The developers are still hiding behind the 'Early Access Alpha' tag and will change MAJOR CORE GAME ELEMENTS at whim usually followed by a few weeks of almost un playibility due to repeated wipes from buggy code that has to be fixed and requires character/server data to be wiped to institute the fix.Avoid this game until they decide to 'release' it and remove the Alpha tag. Until they do expect a horrible player experience with tons of bugs and developer induced wipes even the server admins don't want because the code control is awful. Honestly not even sure if the developers themselves know the direction they want the game to go.

review: This game really makes no sense. Why is it crafting if you lose your whole progress to start all over again in endless loop? Community is toxic people will shoot you at sight or group raid your house when you are afk. Later using buggy mechanics to block everything off. You spawn naked surrounded by 4 steel walls. so with that easy move your robbed house is lost. Not to mention exploits that won't be fixed. Especially boosting. Other thing is complete lack of charackter customization. No other survival game is so bad in that manner. In every game I play I spend most of my time on creating character I can enjoy playing with. But not here I just got some black bald dude not only that but also fat. Like literally game tries to make you as ugly as possible. And how devs explain their laziness? By telling us to deal with it and that in real life you also don't know who will you be. It is a lie. My parents knew very well I will not be a black dude and for sure I wouldn't make myself fat. Those are choices this game simply does not offer. Other people aren't lucky aswell from what I have witnessed. Most of players run around as half naked bald women that look like they had some serious chemotherapy. It doesn't take long time to watch survival programs and know who would dominate in numbers. Only other game that broke my immersion so badly was ARK.Building is also out of date compare to more modern games. Building something that isn't made from squares and triangles can prove challenging. Different styles? Not in this game. You have a wall that you can upgrade into a better wall. No diversity in that field. But hey! Does it matter in a survival game?Why would someone want to play this game? Probably only if you like post apocalyptic survivals if you like survival FPS if you like to fight afks if you like to farm dudes with no stuff on them (there is a lot of those) if you prefer to do all of that above but spend as limited amount of time as you can on creativity aspect this game is for you.

review: heey all I played rust for 1600 hours or something. So I decided to write a review. Forgive my grammar because i am not the best in English writing but I want to share my experience with everyone.I loved this game and really straightforward.You spawn in to get your starting items and start to gather and killing.It is nothing more than that. first rust was really simplistic and gave everyone the same fair chance no buy to win scenarios and no extras that give other an advantage on the start. I even believe this game would be played like this even after 10 years from now if I would have stayed like this with just little tweaks to it.After some tweaking some area's got a new finished coat on them and put some scientist in the Military tunnels and on the road. I told my friend and wife in the beginning this would do the game well if they could implement something like that in the game. Maybe a zerg bandit group would be nice also.Also the Outpost came out.I think the outpost would be fairly ok if you could buy like components and armor there. But overall I do not think this would add something to the game then give ppl quick weapons and let ppl hide when chased.Bandit camp.I loved the misty march area it is and I love the scenery around it. Deffo brings a new dimension to the map.Also the gambling area is a really nice setup. But why put a shop there where you can but so many overpowered items.Again a game bust for me.Now Facepunch really did a number on this one.The first negative for me was the Chinook crate. This crate was just to much impact for 1 item. You can get every vital item in the game out of it. so about few hours into the game you can have an AK and Bolt action. One time i started on a Solo server and few hours after the wipe i got the chinook crate with AK and bolt metal face and some other stuff. Looted. For big groups or small zergs this is just to Overpowered and I think this pulls the survival aspect out of the game. Airdrop is far more balanced because half the time you get only simple loot out of it.Then the puzzle switch spots came. I do not really like it myself because it is too vulnerable area now to me. The big group has soo much advantage over that. Also the whole survival game aspect of searching for loot and stuff is just over because all the good loot is now concentrated on one spot in every rad town. Ofc there is some random loot everywhere but you get my point I hope.And then the boat comes. OMG 4 loot crated with the most OP stuff in one spot. I think the scientist on the boat and the boat moving around is very cool. But so much good loot on the boat is just stupid. Probably done because for less no one would go there.From a good survival game this game when to a whole different style. I would call it more and less a hunger game style.The surprising aspect of survival is far gone. The fun of bow fighting for 1 or 2 days is far over. It is rush for the best gun as fast as possible. Ofc you did it in the beginning also but the chance of getting some was not so easy. In the early days I could even trade for armored doors and guns and armor. People searched for day to get an AK. Now no1 has to anymore and if you always struggling to get items then its time to get the other game for real if you can not find 1 gun in 1 day playing then you should go play pokemon.I really hate it that this game is violated so much. why i dont really know but mostly its because all these noobs that can not play a game keep complaining on the forums that they can not get stuff. But does not matter how much they try if they can get it in the beginning they deffo dont get it in the end. Also many game makers overdo themself by adding and adding to a game to keep ppl interested. For me rust just needed some envoirment tweaks ( as bandit and scientist and bug and glisch fix. Also some more anti cheat would be great. Ban those ppl on IP. because many of them just buy a new game. Then ad some new guns now and then and maybe a shop for attatchments. Anyways there are so many things to ad and do without screwing it up so much.Still RUST has its charms and maybe on a modded server you can find the real surviving trill you need.I can not really say that i could not recomment this game because i still enjoy a good old battlefield server to just go and shoot some ppl. Altrue i think that the price asked for rust is to hight. For me then the game is killing itself and wat i see on games that will come in 2019 rust will have to fight for their spot in the top 10 list.thank you for reading and Game on to you all

review: Unfortunately I cannot recommend this game in its current state. Right now unless you have a lot of friends willing to waste time on this game with you its simply not worth it. Solo play is near impossible as you will be hunted down ruthlessly by other players. In its current state RUST is more or less a Troll simulator and not a particularly good one. If your sick and tired of immature gamers and want to avoid games which are based entirely on griefing others DO NOT PURCHASE THIS GAME. Pros 1. Interesting concept. Cons 1. Based entirely of murdering other people. 2. All other elements of 'survival' like hunger thirst etc may as well not exist they do not play a major role in the game other than at the start eating and drinking gets your health up. 3. Worlds can be too small the Devs did this to increase 'Human encounters' but what it really means is the guys with the guns don't have to go far to slaughter everyone else/each other. 4. Unless you start at a Server refresh you are not likely to get far. The world will often become covered in buildings which sort of saps the wilderness feel away from the game but also means there is no free space for others to set up in. Basically you will get molested straight away. 5. Needs more NPCs. 6. Needs more Hostile NPCs. Overall this game has no real aim its pretty generic right now.

review: This is an early access review I'll revise it once the game's released.Post apocalypse survival sandbox done a different way. Rust is a game in which you start out (hilariously I might add) completely nude with just a rock and a torch. The default settings in Rust actually allow you to see the character models' (rather detailed) genitals though I'm not sure why it's optional to block these out. In terms of legality it doesn't help the devs but this is a review. So here it goes.Pros Strong gameplay aspects (crafting is awesome)Great graphicsBeautiful environmentsFun things to do including huntingEasy to set up with friendsVery well set up for an alpha gameCons Awful community super toxic.Can be terribly grindy (but it's a survival game so duh)Some blueprints are impossible to findThis is an early access review I'll revise it once the game's released.Definitely recommend in its current form for an alpha game this is probably the most promising I've ever played.

review: Released 12/11/2013 (and still classified as an alpha release almost 3 years later) but many of the bugs are gone. Animals still move in fixed small circular patterns and often phase through the walls of buildings to kill you in your sleep. With the current version bows and crossbows are severely overpowered compared to firearms but games rarely have a perfect balance when it comes weapons. The build system is well done even if it sometimes seems to take forever just to get a solid base up so you have some protection from the elements deadly animals and looters.The mentality of a large part of the community is on part with the worst behavior depicted in "Lord of the Flies." However that is somewhat expected in this type of game. If that is not something you can tolerate you should probably look for a different game. The bad news? The entire experience is very often completely ruined by people using downloaded skill (yes hacks and lots of them). Aimbot ESP door hacks etc. You can spend 8 hours building a solid base with friends and two cheating thirteen year olds can take it and everything in it from you in 30 seconds or less. Many openly admit to using this or that hack but it is often readily apparent even when they do not admit it (one shot one kill on a moving target on the distant horizon or one player who can mysteriously take on five or more armed and armored opponents repeatedly and never lose).How bad is the hacking problem? I wouldn't spend more than $10 on this game until they get the hacks dialed down considerably.

review: For a game focused on PVP one would have thought the game was more polished.Hit detection is terrible.Jumping is terrible.The community is terrible.For some reason your steam account is bound to one selected skin and you're stuck with that forever.You spend hours farming to get good gear just to get speared in the head because the server didn't detect your shotgun shooting the opposing player in the face and lose your stuff.Doesn't seem like the devs can decide on being immersive or not.You can chop down a tree with a rock but you can't use a fireaxe to break open a wooden door unless you spend 1 hour hitting it.Also there is no "survival aspect" to the game as there is no punishment for dying. Sometimes when my character was hungry I just went and killed myself since that was faster and less costly than getting food.There are better alternatives on this overblown market of "Early access survival games."I'd recommend Don't starve together if you want to PVE.And for PVP I'd recommend.... Wait this genre is bloated and just full of
title: Rust

review: This game is pretty fun and addicting I really wish I could actually play this game but my biggest problem is arguably the community and raiding. This has to be one of the most toxic communities ive ever seen in video games. KOS is common place flaming/trashtalking is everywhere loot despawning door camping for over an hour etc. Its actually worse than gta 5 which is saying something. People become so sweaty and competitive like they think they're in walking dead or something (maybe they do) And with how they've been updating it they're only catering to this kind of playstyle. They added stores to give the game some other kind a player interaction besides cod style shoot on sight but was so half its not even funnyOnline Raiding is probably the funnest and most exciting thing to do but why would you do that when you can just offline raid. Offline raiding is awlays the better option because you have no opposition. I don't know how you can consider that player vs player its player vs static building. And if you're like most people and actually have other stuff to do or am not in a massive clan of people its pretty much inevitable that you're going wake up to a cleaned out base. Of course you can make multiple bases to minimize damage but thats not really a solution and exspensive as now with the new upkeep system. Playing on a pve server is pointless because the devs don't give a about pve. They really only care about making money off of skins at this point thats just early access drift for you.TLDR TOXIC COMMUNITY OFFLINE RAIDING IS BAD

review: TL DR Couldn't get into it got into it with a friend played for almost 20 (edit make that 70) hours straight bought a server. You should probably go buy it.I bought this game a while ago. My first experience was pretty standard. Walk around for 4 hours get the hang of things in the last 10 minutes after 3h50m of walking in circles only to get shot in the face by a naked dude by a shotgun. Then I played with a friend on a PvE server and he had a base setup. He taught me how to use the map how to craft and build etc. We played for 6 hours together just running around hitting the towns for loot to make our base bigger. He logged off so I continued to play. For another 2 hours. At 6 in the morning. Then I bought a server. And played for another 2 hours.I went to sleep woke up a couple hours later and hopped on my server. Then I played for 12 hours straight. I peed maybe 3 times. I blinked for less. Now here I am 8am not wanting to play more for fear of pulling a 48hr er but still wanting to tell someone how hooked I am on this game. I haven't been hooked on a game like this since halo 3 or early minecraft. I can't sleep.God help us all.

review: After I purchased Rust roughly 1.5 years ago it quickly became one of my favorite games ever but at its current state I can't recommend it and am probably going to quit playing soon myself. (AFTER 4850HRS yes you read that right). The devs (HELK) are slowly killing every desire I had to play this game and are turning it into a shell of what it once was and is supposed to be. It started firstly with the twig update which has essentially killed building overall. Then comes the stupid new changes to nodes once again completely uneccessary and pointless. Not to mention the aim mechanic changes. WHY???Every update is now just pointless roleplayer or cosmetic BS nothing towards fixing what is fundamentally broken with this game ans the reason the player base is FLEEING. The devs only seem to focus on what the rust youtubers want (the minority) and not what their actual playerbase wants from the game. Most of the 'rust youtubers' arent even solely playing rust anymore so thats gotta SAY SOMETHING. It's really quite depressing to see what a game I loved so dearly has become.

review: Just Say NoI can not stress enough how horrible this game is compared to other games of it's genre and just in general. This is mostly to do with the how the game is coded and the person who done said coding (and whoever the rest of the team is). There seem to be other influences as well such as umm uhhh hmmmm well if I think of any I will sure let you know so let us get down to it. This game is just no fun. it's full of ugly grass rocks and alot of ugly naked people. If you like games that have a goal then this game is not for you as there is nothing to do. You can argue that you can build awesome bases and raid and just have a good survival experience but this game just does not do it the right way. The multiplayer coding talent does not exist as the servers available are some of the worst gaming experiences I have had. Want to go kill some mobs with the worst animations and AI ever? Maybe this is the game for you then. Want to take 100 spears and break into the strongest base on your server? Too easy why do that when you can just spawn right into someones base because of never ending never fixed glitches? The game has no goal but to ignore it's community. No I have never posted on the FPunch forums or cared too I just did my own research by looking at the forums. The bugs in this game seem never ending due to the way the game is coded. I like to put these types of games in the class of (kindergarten Coders Games) and have a laugh about it but then reality sets in and I get quite down when I realize that people actually spend their hard earned money on games that (in my opinion) are this bad. If you like garbage then go for it. If you like to have fun then why would you play the worst game of it's genre? Years later the game feels like it is still in the same state as the day I bought it

review: I've played this game a bit. It's fun.Seriously tho Rust is the gold standard in survival PVP. Even better there are modded servers and PVE worlds if you like me don't want to just run around murdering defenseless noobs. I've been playing since the earliest days of Early Access and it's only gotten better.The building mechanics are fluid and fun. Gathering is balanced and bears can be deadly when you start out. The graphics are excellent (albeit resource hungry) and the combat is fair. Most people play it for the excitement of violence but there's plenty of game for the rest of us too. (I'd like more PVE elements but obviously the lack of them hasn't stopped me from spending lots of time in the game.) The developers are smart but don't immediately capitulate to the demands of the mob. Highly recommended.

review: Trying to review this game is like trying to explain the intricate details of Area 51. Even if you get inside you won't live long enough to see anything of worth.And that's the problem here. I have spent more than an hour attempting to play this game. However I never was able to get anything more than the rock that you start with. Some of this is due to the game's interface itself. There is no tutorial. No objective. And no way to refer to game controls from within the game to find out what does what. For most single player games this would not be an issue and is sometimes a great strength of "exploration" style games. Much of the fun is finding your way in a barren world learning to survive on your own.However this is NOT a single player game. This is a game world populated by hundreds of young boys whose only apparent goal in life is to slaughter any new player that dared to purchase Rust. You will not survive. The moment you find something interesting to look at or try to craft you will lose it all because some little brat with his junk hanging out has smashed your head in with a rock. You lose everything and must start over.So do I recommend this? No. Not until the developers include a way to at least learn the controls and the crafting systems PRIOR to throwing you to the wolves.

review: Ok I will say this Rust is not an easy game yet it can be easy. I will explain with the following paragraphs that will be split into 2 sections General PvP &amp PvE. General In general this is a great game. Good graphics and great gameplay. Overall a solid 7/10 for me. The next 2 sections will explain my numbers. PvP This section of Rust can be rather difficult. It is not a new player friendly portion of the game. Often times there are jerks on a PvP server that tend to harrass and target new players either to the game or the server. This is a sad part of any MMO but is more previlant here in RUST. This part almost ruined the game for me when I first started. I explect a fair share of bullies in the gaming world but my first server was full of them. my first 6 hours were spent dieing very shortly after I spawned into the world. This would have been due to the players more than the environment. I felt outnumbered and left with little to no way to defend myself. A naked man with a rock and a torch is no match against players with Custom SMG's and with Metal armor on. Seemed like every based I made got raided too. While I know raiding happens but again a bully targeted me and me alone and intentionally raided my based 16 times within the first 5 days of being on that server. Bit much even by my standards. This nearly turned me off RUST completely. In fact I stopped playing RUST for a long period of time. I give PvP a 5/10 cause of all the bullies and hassle you have to deal with in this environment as well as the foul language that is used. PvE This part of RUST is an awesome setup for servers. There are of course bullies anywhere but less so here. The community seems better and friendlier. It is also the section that saved RUST for me. Players against NPC's animals APC's the helicopter patrols and others can be more entertaining then spending hours dieing from players. Yes this seems to be a tamer side but a fun part. Seems to be harder to. Especially when it comes to the servers that have added zombies to the game. Hordes of zombies with only a shotgun and a crossbow seems like it would work but not always when nature decides to try and attack you as well. Overall this style of play is better for those that are starting out or wish for a friendly playthrough. I give this section an 9/10 because of some lag that is caused by PvE mods.

review: Rust is a FPS PVP survival game. If you're familiar to Hurtworld H1Z1 then this will be pretty much similar. At first you will be stranded from at the coast with just a Rock and Torch injured and hungry. You are to find resources around the map and build your way up to making your base. While at the same time cross pathed with some mean players or even the AI helicopters. Getting to kill the helicopter is hard too with this ongoing community of raging wars. The game is built to be PVP in a real harsh world.Rust have generally revolved alot from the beginning stages where players can still pot lucked themselves when hunting out the barrels for blueprints to get some lucky items. However after the developers have changed the gameplay system to an EXP leveling system. Now it's pretty hard for new players whom have joined the game. Especially the game of being the nothing on hand continues to be poor while the fully loaded continues to get richer. With this system in mind it's hard even for players to reach the top level of leveling system. Generally I've seen most of the players get raided at around Level 12 onwards. Where you have gathered your resources to make your Furnace and smelt some Metal Fragments. Ready for some Gunpowder crafting and make guns.For networking most of the official servers are located in the US Australia and Hong Kong. But most of them are stranded with raided houses it's nearly impossible to survive out there where there's already ongoing players whom have build them long ago. While some still continues to play them but have shifted to modded servers instead. It's just basically pointless for players to build all the way up for days and to be destroyed by C4 detonations within seconds. Although modded servers practice a way that they will wipe the servers every monthly or bi weekly basis to get new players to come back and climb the ladder again. It's a vicious cycle.None to say most of the servers are still pretty mean towards players or rather shoot on sight basis. It's hard to get team players if you were to be playing single. So get this game if you're going to play with friends by means they are active in their gameplay too. Since raiding can happen anytime online or offline. You wouldn't want to get back the next day only to see your sleeping body to be emptied out and slaughtered.If you're looking for more friendly survival games out there I suggest you play Unturned Don't Starve Together instead. It's still a survival but in a PVE role yet still able to team together. Moreover the server reset are more frequent there than here. Where you nearly survive less than just a week while the wipe is a month later.It will be good to have the players to choose probably 3 teams on the first day of the wipe. Thereafter players whom just came in later to only have to choose within that 3 teams and play along side with them and unable to swap teams. So at least it's still a PVP with raging war going on meaning three factions team fighting each other and also the neutral party of the AI helicopters. Yet still able to get incoming players to join the team with the growing of faction parties. It's like hiring more players to join and fight for the war. This makes players to have a better objective in game than to think whether should I just roam around killing players and only to hide when the AI helicopters come. Or should the teams form an alliance and gun down the AI helicopters? Now that's another diplomacy system that Rust developers have to think of.

I know I am making this game sound horrible but it is extremely fun if you understand it and/or am good at it in some way whether that is farming for your clan PVP raiding or building. review: I've been playing Rust almost since day one. In recent years I have stuck to Rust Legacy(Which is the older rust.) mainly because regular rust gave my computer issues due to Easy Anti Cheat. My old computer would always get kicked on anygame running it. I have gotten a new computer recently built from the ground up and thankfully it doesn't seem to have any problem with EAC....so I have been spending a lot of time playing the newer one...And I have to say I am loving it!Is it as good as Rust legacy? Not at first but that's mainly because I don't like change...once I slowly adjusted to it though? I would say it's better! Rust Legacy got boring quick because there was nothing new to do...This version? Always being updated and just overall fantastic!I do wish they would texture some of the "Monuments" though.....all solid colors makes them look unusually clean for a wasteland. Inside factories is so white and shiny it puts modern day hospitals to shame...Still an overall excellent game and one I am enjoying very much! It's easily the best EA title I have purchased.
title: Rust

review: Rust to me is the backdrop of Fallout 3/NV and the building mechanics Minecraft that has some of the beautiful elements of Far Cry 3. All great things and what hopefully is the start to an amazing game when it finally sheds it's Alpha build state.I think Rust could be the best MMO I've ever played because I personally don't like any MMO's but something about Rust that works mainly because of it's life like rules and harsh realism. From the moment you wake to the inevitable moment you die (or be killed) you're constantly trying to survive and better your gaming life. Time balance and fun.The sad part is I'm not sure if the game will ever be fixed beyond what it is and improved because it seems already that a lot of work has gone into this 'value' priced game and will take a lot more work to both fix and improve.Technical issues small and brightly coloured text on light backgrounds networking lag on busier servers (yet it says they are at 1% capacity) terrible shadow shimmering/flickering on everything controls are a bit odd (holding down E and also use mouse/trackball to click in another menu is not user friendly) can't scroll with mouse/trackball to select anything can't search for certain server graphical collisions and physics seems too random at times and the moment you 'touch' water (sea/rivers/etc) you instantly drown and die.Though in general the game looks impressive runs without crashing the sound atmosphere is almost perfect (breaking stuff is too loud for yourself to hear though) survival methods feel balanced and the day cycle (sunrise to sunset is truly amazing). Graphically it reminds me of playing GTA IV (2009) 'unmodded' now where it still looks pretty impressive but then it also looks old and in need of graphical TLC ...textures for one!In random order these are the gaming faults of 'Rust' I feel that should change or fixed Weather variations (rain thunder storms snow wind extreme weather moments etc) a lot more wildlife on ground level and skies (harmless and harmful) needs to be added smoke from fires should be seen further way (white and black smoke) advance guns needs to be 'removed' as this breaks it's realism in this type of survival game textures for trees rocks doors etc need much improving (looks to low res/pixelated and old school) you should be able to swim in shallow water and even fish (when the right equipment has been made of course) insects should be randomly around (ground level and flying) plantation should be greatly a part of all this tree fruits (shake tree to gain fruits) the ability to talk to those you are near you 'only' in the game (others too far can't hear you or read your typed messages maybe an indication for those a little to far saying Insert Players Name Said something but was too far to heard or read etc) The Ui should be scalable as it's a little too small to read the Ui should have the ability to be transparent (amount set by user) Inverted Ui colours at night the ability to build and use a compass (can be seen in the Ui maybe) you should be allowed to make your own bare skin character (basic is fine but at least something) the ability to climb trees with a balance gauge so if you mess it up you fall and break something even faster sprint running that only last for brief moments foot prints recently left by others ability to dig (though I'd image this would complicated and change the game too much) ability to throw rocks (you don't need guns in this sort of game it's stupid really) accidentally setting fire to things (but they go out fast otherwise it will be too much of game change) ability to drink and gather water does anyone use the loo in some form on Rust player origin country flags or symbols self created maps (when your able to write on paper or similar with charcoal for example) write on rocks with charcoal or similar (but vanishes or is washed away with rain over time) fighting with others barehanded (no weapons) barehanded fights are balanced by you physical strengths (food consumed exercise fat etc) and lastly ...genders ...I only see men and NO WOMEN ...WtF?!? ...What kind of island is this?!?!?OK that was my random and late review which is months over due but it wasn't something I could just say without truly playing this 'huge' 'expansive' and original MMO type game. If your wondering it's a lot better than Nether and 7 Days to Die but I've yet to try and play DayZ which I believe is very different and not as raw and real as Rust.*2/3* I recommend Rust but sadly feel it's not going to get much better than it is and not include any of what I've said above.Note Rust does not work to well in Stereo 3D (lots shading and lighting issues) and will probably be an issue with VR headset such as Oculus __ ...one day I hope it will though!

review: As of writing this review i've played 450 hours of this game. (thats a lot)This is a survival simulator you start with a rock you end up with a huge castle like base chests full of loot and probably an inventory full of human skulls. Imagine if Skyrim Minecraft and DAYZ collided thats the best way to describe this game.You'll struggle against the elements and wildlife to build a house you'll then spend hours improving that house to protect it from other players (with guns) you'll then go out (with explosives) and raid other peoples houses. Rust is extremely life like you can't take 10 bullets to the chest and live you can starve to death you can freeze to death you can't out run wildlife and you most deffinatly will be murdered if you stumble across a bear in the woods.If you enjoy building and protecting your base or enjoy sniping players from a top a mountain or enjoy hoarding chests full of ammo and guns or taking taking part in full on brutal clan wars this game is for you.Also for anyone concerned about the alpha state this feels like a finished game nothing is broken there is an update about every month.BEWARE This game is hard you will die hundreds of times your base will be raided you will probably google 'how to build a decent base' after a while you will rage quit but most importantly you'll keep coming back because god damn this game is utterly amazing.
