review: Rust teaches you that there are three kinds of people in this world. People who will offer you help and be kind to you and not leave you as a limp lifeless corpse riddled with bullets. People who will in fact leave you as a limb lifeless corpse that is 56% Metal 44% Flesh and 100% Dead. And then there's the oh so magical third one. The kind of person that runs around with nothing but a pumpkin on their heads whilst screaming "Stick it up my butt". I am usually the first kind of person (and sometimes the third) which as you can see makes you the most attractive to teenagers with Tommyguns and mafia fantasies. As you adjust to life after the Third World War (or after an unpopular team wins the super bowl) you will learn that living on your own is meaningless and boring. What fun is it to survive without friends? I eventually moved into a town yes a THRIVING town known simply as "Smoke Town". The server I had chosen was TheRustyChicken (a server I highly recommend). Smoke Town was a thriving place...until the wipe where we proceeded to decimate the town with rocket launchers. THEN WE REBUILT THE TOWN and everything was fine. That is until the mafia obsessed teenagers arrived. They annoyed our town by constantly re spawning stealing what they could and going on Friday the 13th inspired rampages. Life was good in between those though. This game will teach you to be a better person because in reality you don't want someone to break in to your home steal everything from your kitchen and smash you over the head with a rock they found in your garden. Either that or you'll eventually become a self righteous hoarder who says things like "it's survival of the fittest man". You'll then proceed to become a powerhouse until the first people who set up stuff on the server notice you. They will raid you take your stuff and you're back to being a simple naked fellow with a pet rock. Rust is a game that I highly recommend (definitely try to play with friends if you can). Rust is a game that makes you wish the servers time out because if you log on before the people who held a gun to your head do then you can loot their bodies and slay them in your sleep. 8/10.

review: Note its ALPHA version guys 3It's a good game ! Yes it has a lot of bugs some may annoy you more than the other but it's allright. As long as you know everything will be once fixed !. So far 14 dec 2014. Bugs aren't such big of a deal. So enough with the bugs let's get on the real review.You start up with a rock and a torch or with a starter kit on modded servers. You cut trees mine ores and make the best house ever. It's addicting if you are into survival games this is the best one so far i have played. Building houses is not hard at all but gattering resources and NOT getting killed is indeed. Someone can easily sneak behind you and cut you. You die so easily you wont even stand a chance againts a sneak atack. You will always hear footsteps so as long as you don't use music you are safe. You can choose between normal Rust and Rust legacy mode. What is legacy mode you may ask ? Legacy mode is a old version of rust the first one ever made. The 2 modes are like tootaly diffrent games. Nothing same . You can see the devs are working hard on updating the game ASAP to fix the bigger bugs. Smaller ones get their fair spotlight aswell . Overall VERDICT If you are into games like minecraft this is worth a check. And its 10 euros so why not ?7/10 Worth checking outWhen the full version comes I'd say i would give it an 8/10

review: First off I would like to say after watching many people play this game on youtube and having mixed opinions about it I still chose to purchase this game. I have only played a few hours on several diffrent servers and had few interactions with players but some have been as expected (killed on sight and looted for what little I had) but I have also had some positive ones aswell. The game seems to fall to how players interact with eachother this could make people either enjoyor hate this game entirly bassed on these situations. I find the crafting base building and pvp apsects to be entertaining no matter the outcome. Yes i do agree it can be frustrating having progressed so far or finally get a blueprint or item you were working towards or get your base built up just the way you want it to be and get killed but thats just the roll of the dice you take while playing if you cannot stand that I do not think this game is for you. I also think that the progress inprovements that they have made in the updates i have played and also watched on youtube things will never be set in stone or at least in the forseen future. I would recomed this game to anyone who enjoys survival crafting pvp games and is willing to be the most frustrated with a game that they have ever been.

review: As I awoke in a forest I clutched the first thing I could find it was hard and it was round. It was a pet rock quickly I adventured looking for any scrapes of civilization to begin pulling my life together in this hostile world I began to chop a wood pile that had the texture of ceramic fireplace logs. As I smashed my pet rock mindlessly into this pile or ceramic wood a whoosh passes by me I turned to see a bald man in green doctor scrubs holding a bow and arrow aimed right at me As soon as the notion crosses my mind I realize he wants to kill me I damaged his ceramic log god it seemed I ran to my left immediately and then towards him when I got into arm s length my pet rocks face met his face in a violently French kiss of saliva and gore I quickly locate a black bag that it appears he had dropped. There s the scrubs the man was wearing in it and then a shoddy bow and a few arrows and some raw chicken meat. Normally I don t eat meat I find on dead strangers but seeing as I was hungry and there was no KFC in the area I quickly consumed this raw chicken meat. Then as soon as it went down I began to throw up. the sound was of liquid celery on a tile floor a unpleasant sound really as my vomiting stopped I see I m being watched a man in black clothes and a large fire arm brandished at me with malicious intent then I notice the naked man approaching from behind him a documentary about bears flashes into my head its protecting its cub I turn giving the mother distance as the firearm is still aimed at me I hear a crack and a thud next to me the mother is protecting its young as it scavenges the other man who s scrubs I am now wearing I run as far as I can until I hit a road and I follow it so my adventure continues in the hostile land of the angry naked men.

review: Rust has become one of the most iconic games online and its no suprise why with it being an early creator of the mixture of survival base building player interaction and a Development team that truly wants to make a game be the best that it can be. The Good Amazing Development team always looking to make the game better. Gun play is satisfying enough. Community (while not as big as it used to be) is still large enough to alway find a server. Frequent updates. Providing countless hours of entertainment well worth the price of admission. Very easy to run of most pc's and keeps just getting better over time. The Bad While yes this is a survival game after a few days and once you have an okay understanding of the game you really are never in fear of dying from the elements just other players. The ease of weapons kills again any sense of this being a survival game and makes it feel like a shooter with base building and naked people. While there are still communties and servers more than willing to help new players the game overall feels alot more closed off than in previous years and I can see it being hard for a new player to feel welcome if they just jump into whatever server they want. The Conclusion Over the years the player count seems to be less and less with more games coming out that are similar to Rust but I do not believe on the market as of right now there is a game with a Dev Team with this much dedication and interaction and a community that is so creative with how they develop their worlds with in the game. Whether you love survival games or just want to see where it all started this game is well worth whatever price they are asking for at the time.

review: TLDR Not a game for me you might like it i didn't No way to join as a group. If you are playing with friends you need to keep suiciding until you respawn close to them. The process gets annoying and tedious if you want to introduce someone new to the game. No clear objective. You are just... looting to craft better stuff to loot more stuff faster to craft better stuff rinse and repeat add guns in the mix to kill faster/better. All of it to accomplish....nothing. You have to carefully look for servers that recently had a reset. If you join in a let's say week old server then you will have a really hard time as every spot in the island was already taken and everything its filled with automatic guns and sentry turrets and whatnot. Sociopath Simulator 2018 nobody will attempt to communicate with you. The community has an unspoken rule of "Shoot first then check". Not even among the naked guys that just started exists a small hint of cooperation. Even if they are in the same precarious position as you they will try to attack on sight. Elitism The plague that populated Dark Souls. If you know how to play the only helpful advice that you are allowed to give is "Git Gud insert random insult here " The game is in early alpha with poor performance every time some particles appear on screen yet it's littered with microtransactions. The game is a nice concept. However its a concept that can't be good thanks to how Humans work. Anonymity turns us into idiots and this game is the epitome of that.

review: Not recommended. Not anymore... not againI loved the old version which they scrapped. It was complex enough with fun building and raiding required a lot more skill and planing. I have so many fond memmories of the the old version Memmories of growing up from dirt fending off my shack building a tower in a highly contested area and dominating groups on my own. Then having secret dealings at night with a clan of Germans to aquire the elusive C4 blueprint which I needed for my revange plans. That night was unforgettable as I was terriefied of them scamming me as I had quite a lot of items as payment. It was a one on one transaction and when all was said and done the dealer called off the sniper group which was placed just in case I was a scammer. Later on my friendship with that group grew and they let me join their village and keep my autonomy.There were great characters there was soul. Nobody cared about fluff like character looks breast size race or such. There was one simple model for everyone and you had to make a name for yourself as a character that you could role play to your heart's content. It pains me to see where the game has gone and how it just keeps straying from it's origins and just adds on bloat instead of tightning up all the loose nuts and bolts. Waste of potential and a prime example of a project wondering around without purpose due to lack of a goal and constant bombardment of demands by the userbase that does not know better.
title: Rust

review: An up to date review of Rust Are you 1) Unemployed?2) home schooled?3) Have you paid for hacks? (ESP especially)If so then this is the game for you!As a casual player you won't be able to compete with the above 3 categories as most servers when they reset it's during the day. So by the time you get home from work The try hard kids already have everything made and are busy scouring the spawn points looking for new spawned players to kill as no doubt their desire to grief new players comes from some deep psycological issues most likely attributed to being heavily bullied in real life.If you do manage to get a small base built by the time you manage to actually build your first few metal tools you would have found yourself repeatedly door camped for nearly your entire evening (with which is very limited because you actually have a job) as the try hard players have nothing but time of their hands to sit there for hours on end.But don't feel disheartened! You can still at least get to a tier 2 workbench by near the end of the week just before the server resets and it starts all over again...That is the current state of Rust and you can be sure that this will never change.Also if you're not using ESP don't even bother playing. more than half the players on any server you choose are using ESP. The people that use ESP claim they use it to counter the other ESP users. The ESP users are also the very same unemployed try hards...You know how it is Fail at life succeed at video games that reset weekly...

review: Rust is a multiplayer game so there will be other players trying to survive in the same way that you are. Unfortunately for you they can find you kill you and take your stuff. Fortunately for you you can kill them and take their stuff. Or maybe you can make friends and help each other survive. Rust s world is harsh so you might need to make friends to survive.Rust is a multiplayer game receiving updates adding new content to it every friday. These constant updates are very large usually (100+ mgb) and it is not reccomended to buy this game if you do not have much data. Rust also has a terrible anti cheat installed to it. It is called easy anti cheat and you will often have to verify game cache or even reinstall the game to even connect to a server. Now off the internet part onto the community. I can NOT stress enough that if you cannot take the toxicity of this community do not buy this game. From my experiance of this game the community is very toxic towards new players and will KOS (Kill on sight) unless you are on a PVE server. Pros/ConsPros Constant updatesOkay building mechanicsModded serversDedicated serversCommunity serversCons Internet usage warningEACLarge updatesLots of bugsToxic communityOverall6/10 borks.Sources http //rust.wikia.com/wiki/Rust_Wiki

review: I don't care this game is in alpha beta or released this is one of the most fun and despite it being in alpha most polished games I've played in '13. This game hooked me in and kept me hooked in for many weeks and to this day I am still very much addicted to it. Get a group of mates find a server with 10 20 people and enjoy. Whether you want to run around as naked men hitting other players with rocks build a fortress and hunt other people down or make a little cottage and set out on supply runs without disturbing other players this game is one of the best experiences money can buy.Presentation 9.5/10 everything is perfect as far as presentation goes from in game to the server selection menu. Flawless. The only issue I had was last patch changed a few things but they will soon be fixed I am assuming.Graphics 9.5/10 so many moments in this game where I just stopped and looked at my surroundings. I was standing behind a hill while the sun was coming up and I saw a shadow moving in front of me the entire mountain's shadow. I followed it all the way up until it disappeared. The graphcis in this game are just jawdropping. Sound 9/10 There is nothing nicer than making your first gun and firing it for the first time and hearing that gun shot. Zombies make terrifying noises and when you are just chopping wood in a forest and you hear a bear running at you. Some of the best adrenalin you can get from any game.Gameplay 9.5/10 The gunplay in this game is fantastic it accounts for lag so you wont have to lead your shots yet when you shoot a zombie in the head it will instantly drop without any lag whatsoever to avoid for frustrating after death hits from zombies.Lasting Appeal 10/10 I will be playing this until it is full released and beyond.Overall 10/10 If you like Minecraft or DayZ this game is 100% for you. Buy it and help out the developers. If you aren't convinced this game is being developed by Gary of Gary's Mod so you know it's in good hands.

review: Rust has become a toxic wasteland that will cause you to lose all faith in humanity. I began playing in 2015 and the game was great. Over the last few years the Rust community has gone from mature players enjoying the game to 9 14 year old children who run around and kill whatever moves. You will spend an hour naked gathering items for clothing and a base to be killed by a prepubescent child that has by luck of the the draw aquired a revolver from a barrel somewhere. You will respawn naked and again attempt to gather items but will meet the same fate. If you happen to get lucky (skill does not come into play when it's rock vs. AK) and live long enough to gather enough items to build a base or put clothes on your back you will spend literally all of you free time gathering additional items to ensure your base doesn't decay. If you are able to gather the resources to prevent base decay (for the time being) then you are stuck incessently searching for scrap and blueprints so that you can first craft level 1 2 and 3 work benches and a research table so that you can then began researching items that you find (by luck) or researching blueprints that you find (by luck) so that you can actually craft something useful. In the meantime you continue to be murdered by squeaky children for no reason other than your existence. There is no teamwork. There is no community. If you have the misfortune of joining a server later than five minutes after a full map/blueprint wipe you are woefully and hopelessly behind the curve and will find yourself fighting off AK 47 attacks with nothing more than a stone. The concept of this game is phenomenal but the actual gameplay is abysmal unless you're downright lucky. Skill will get you nowhere in Rust and essentially playing the lottery every spawn becomes old very quickly. The game begins to feel more like a full time job than a game. If you do not have several hours per day to devote to gathering resources to prevent base decay gathering blueprints/researching items etc. then you will never actually be able to "play" the game. You will be stuck in a constant state of building and maintaining rather than playing the game itself. This game is essentially a PVP solo deathmatch but you have to devote hours on end to the game (daily) before you can even participate in the match.

review: Rust has progression all right it goes from boring to fun then back to boring. The boring starts when you have no idea what's going on no one wants to help you made the mistake of playing vanilla. So you move to modded you get faster progression and finally craft a gun. You miss every shot because of RNG and die losing all the progress you made. You rage and form a Zerg recruiting members you find on the server things are going good for the next few wipes. Until you trust the wrong person and they inside you stealing all your stuff leaving you with nothing. You leave your Zerg and play solo trusting no one ever again. I've never wasted so much time to learn how bad a game is and how bad the developers of rust really are. I truly believe this games current state is going backwards so fast It's almost as if the devs have given up. Do not buy do not play this game if it's the only game left on steam.Edit Still even with the new update the game is the devs and systems including Anti cheat is a joke. Worse than DayZ. Community is dead and will never see another glory day.

review: I enjoyed the legacy very much but the new version is one of the worst games I have ever played. I have tried playing on a official server. In this game you play as a naked guy with a stick fighting other naked guys. Almost everyone you meet will instantly try to kill you and since the melee combat system is awful you have a really high chance of getting killed. Wood is quite easy to find but finding stone metal and animals is really hard and boring. Animals are the worst thing in this game for me. They are very few hard to find run like they have rockets stuck on them and can instantly climb rocks.Without getting meat cloth and animal fat you can't do almost anything in this game. Even if you manage to build a small wooden house somebody will probably destroy it by the next time you enter the game and steal all your items. Also the basic locks work with keys so if anybody kills you after you leave your house and gets your key can steal pretty much anything you have inside However the building system is awesome. You can create a lot of beautiful buildings. It's one of the best features this game has.I do not recommend this game in the current state because it's simply not enjoyable. It has a huge potential so I recommend waiting until it gets out of alpha stage.

review: I think people who complains about the community are missing the whole point here. Rust is not only about building and surviving bad weathers. The ''toxic'' community as people say is 100% part of the game and I think it is pretty clear. The surviving part is not about hunger the weathers biomes or animals it is all about to survive in this community you have to build to protect yourself from them made a base that will discourage your neightboors to raid you and speak to people arround to see what kind of scum bags they are. Considering this it will probably be the hardest game you will ever play. It is not a game for puppies it is a USA apocalypse simulation my friends in real life people would be total exactly like in the game. You can team up and be head in group or play lonewolf like I do and I do managed to survive an entire wipe being quiet furtive like a ing shadow and of course I made some ennemies I've been raided but I also managed to raid back and took a whole base from a clan of douches all by myself. This game is all about survival like no other games on the market. I give this a 10/10.Little advice for the noob don't go in the overcrowded servers (100+) unless you want a freaking ''hunger game movie'' experience.

review: The game has a very interesting gameplay at its core but the flaws quickly overcome the overall experience. It's kind of Minecraft meets CS GO only to result in a frustrating experience.The good Graphics are amazingLots of stuff to research/discoverHuge maps with points of interestsEvery footsteps you hear will make your heart race.The bad Community is only griefers.It would literally take you ages to search for the interesting items.You start with a rock and a torch everyone will kill you on sight and it takes ages to build something loosely secure.You can't rearrange your house (unless with C4 which can't be easily obtained).I wouldn't recommend this game because of the community at large It's kinda sad to literally spend days building something only to have it take it from you by griefers. Not only they will loot your stuff they will also emprison you in your own home leaving you with the only choice to commit suicide and respawn elsewhere starting from scratch...Makes you really reflect on what kind of sick f**ks are playing this game.You have to then spend countless hours to gather enough resources to get raided again.It's worse on community servers every now and them they will wipe the whole thing including all research that you discovered. Rendering all your days of of farming/building pointless.Unless you like pain and frustration this game is a complete waste of your time there are so much more rewarding games out there.

review: Product received for free. TL DR Great game with many flaws. It's Alpha after all!I received this as a gift from a friend over a year ago now. I never got around to installing it and trying it out sadly but recently I decided to do so at the recommendation of another friend. Luckily it came at a time when my interest in the Survival Sandbox Crafting 'genre' had been piqued. I decided to give RUST a good try after having tried ARK for the first time a few days prior.... I became addicted...123.4 of my 123.5 total hours played have been in the last two weeks alone. I can't get enough of this game and it's quite clear that I have a problem... and my friends have had no aversion to telling me so. &lt RUST is unique to me as it's the first game to truly take my virginity to the genre. Although I had played ARK once before it was for no longer than an hour and it had failed to fully engross me (not bashing it I admit I haven't played it very much at all). As high of praise as it may seem I'm giving RUST there are definitely issues... So enough meandering personal bs let's get into it.The Good Fantastic Graphics for Alpha (Sun shafts water and environments look particularly gorgeous). Great Sound Design. Footfalls wildlife explosions and gunshots all come from the direction of origin and decrease in volume with distance making it easy to orientate yourself and roughly estimate enemy locations. Good Models/Textures. Character models are surprisingly well designed and relatively realistic proportionally. Textures of course vary depending on your settings but for the most part they're on par with even some of the newest games. Procedurally Generated Maps. This is a double edged sword but I'll get into the negatives down below. These are fantastic in theory and make for a unique experience between servers and wipes making it so that no one person can gain a mastery of a certain map which lends itself to an equal playing field... literally... and encourages exploration. Fun and Engrossing Base Building. Nothing is more satisfying than building a good base and RUST's system is rather entertaining and indepth... The problem is grinding for enough resources to build it all. Immersive. I wouldn't have been able to stomach 124 hours if the game wasn't immersive. There's nothing quite like being out in the world with an inventory full of stuff on edge that a player or bear could come by at any second and your up. The adrenaline is real. Weapons/Gear. Weapons are punchy and feedback is solid. Gear is relatively bland at the moment but it serves its purpose. Ingame models look great for an indie title and mechanics are passable. Nothing too special here but nothing bad either. Development Progress. The team has made some amazing strides when it comes to fidelity and gameplay. They've updated graphics character models game models/mechanics and even the game engine such to the extent that Legacy RUST looks like an entirely different game from New RUST. Just go look at some videos you'll see what I mean. Hopefully this is one that will continue through Alpha and into Beta and ultimately release. I feel that many of my grievances below will be addressed in the future. Ingame Progression. The progression is actually quite good and it can be done at your own pace. You're forced to go into Radtowns or Landmark areas (pre built structures. Air Fields Military Bases Power Plants etc...) in order to collect Blueprint Fragments which are used to discover new items to craft. It's an RNG system so good luck... The problem with these areas is that they're usually highly contested and very hostile whether by other players in the area farming Blueprints snipers or radiation. The process is obviously much faster if you team up with friends to share resources and to have someone watch your back in sticky situations.The Bad ING BEARS! Seriously. Bears are way too fast have way too much health and deal way too much damage. The primary cause of death for me has been bears secondary being players tertiary being falls and lastly wolves. Optimization. The game is very poorly optimized and eats up WAY too much RAM. My average is around 6gb on medium settings and tabbing out is basically a no go for me. Load times are excruciating and I've been told it's because of the procedurally generated maps. Why the game can't just cache this information on your HDD? No idea... Alpha is alpha though I guess. CRASHES. To expand on optimization the game is almost unplayable as of the latest patch for me and a lot of other players it seems. Though sadly this isn't anything new as the issues I've been having have been occuring on and off throughout the development cycle. Two weeks ago I was running the game for hours on end without a single problem. Ever since the latest patch however I've been crashing every 15 20 minutes or so which is incredibly discouraging. Animations. Character/NPC animations aren't necessarily all that bad in fact some are good but they definitely seem a bit jenky and/or floaty depending. First person animations are actually quite good save for what looks like some weight painting issues wrists contorting in odd ways and certain mesh vertexes not adapting to the animation rig well. Character Design/Gender Randomization and Lock. The developer's philanthropic view of giving each Steam ID a unique permanent randomized character appearance is quite frankly t as many have aptly pointed out. I'm personally of the belief that this is some copout/consolation. A way to give players variety but also dodge the bullet of implementing a character creator. Give us the ability to create our own characters and stop being an SJWtard. Whether or not this is due to laziness or a lack of skill/ability I can't tell but the fact remains that it's t and you know it Garry! Hire some more devs or get your into gear! ALSO GIVE US HAIRSTYLES FFS! I'm tired of being bald... A.I... A.I. Is literally braindead it's absolutely awful just terrible. Bears Chickens Deer and Wolves (all the wildlife really) often just walk in circles forever. The pathing and waypoints are terrible and the only time they appear to have any brains is if you get close. Predator animals will attack you on sight and prey animals will run from you. Collision/Object Detection. This goes in tandem with the A.I. NPC's literally have no detection of hills rocks cliffs buildings etc. A creature will run straight up a cliffside denying all laws of physics or whatever it encounters. Luckily this is not the case for player structures. You can stand on top of your house and snipe creatures without them being able to reach you. However this is not the case for player structures that do not require placing a foundation wildlife completely ignore those as if they have noclip enabled. Items such as large wood/stone walls barricades traps etc... will be completely ignored by NPC's. They will receive no damage for walking over/near/through these objects it's as if they're not even there. It's clear that these are only intended for enemy players at least for now.Here are just a few things that are not necessarily good or bad but are worth taking into consideration if you're thinking about buying Players can be s. Most will probably kill you on sight if they are in a position to. These are usually very progressed players with full armor guns and a lot of ammo. This is common for the genre so be prepared. The game is tedious. Gathering and farming is real and can be a turn off for many players. You WILL die and you WILL lose many valuables! I can feel your anger... Wipes can make the game feel pointless sometimes as once or twice a month all of your progress will be wiped.

Recommendations as to which effect you should use are given by S.S.A.M. an AI ally but you're free to make your own decisions.

review: 1 000+ hours in Rust. 500 of those where in legacy (the old version). Legacy has a lot of hackers. It's still a lot of fun.Short version It's worth more than $20 easy.Long version The new version of Rust is better than the old version now. There are very few hackers right now in the new version which is such a breath of fresh air for Rust players. The addition of in game voice chat has made the community much more friendly. Don't get me wrong it's still Rust and people are still s. That being said in the new version of Rust you'll see more groups than solo players and those groups have often met while playing Rust. This is a big aspect of the game that legacy didn't really have.Building in Rust is amazing. You start with twigs but upgrade quickly to stone and then armored. You have complete control over your base / buildings. What I mean by this is that you don't just place a house and then place a storage building. You build everything from foundations and walls so it's totally up to your creative freedom. Everything is raidable but some bases take more C4 rockets and pickaxes than others.You will die. A lot. Get used to it and don't get upset. Remember that it's a game. When Rust starts to stress you out take a week or two off. Seriously.I started playing Rust before the new version was even being created. It has been one of the most entertaining game journeys ever because the game is constantly changing.When I started playing the new version there was only 1 gun it had unlimited ammo there was no sound when you shot it you could only build white blocks that didn't really form into anything. Now we've got rockets C4 assault rifles shotguns smgs plenty of tools and armor and clothes.Oh I almost forgot about the part of the new Rust PROCEDURALLY GENERATED MAPS.Yes that's right. Every map in Rust is huge and different. No two maps are the same and this takes the replay value of Rust through the roof. One of the most exciting things is when a map wipes a new map is set and everybody ventures out with nothing but a rock and has no idea of where things are in the world. This is an amazing accomplishment in gaming history and you've got to check it out.Updates come out every Thursday and it is completely obvious that Garry and the rest of the team is dedicated to this game and it will be finished.If you like FPS sandbox building or even just action adventure and strategy games Rust is a must. Seriously. $20 is a damn steal for this game.
title: Rust

review: This game gives me mixed feelings because its fun but only when you're winning. The main goal of this game is to with people. This can be done by destroying their base building a wall around them jokes mic spaming memes outside someones base etc. You can lose everything you've worked for in minutes or working alone take a group of 5 peoples stuff in minutes as well. Obviously there are balance issues though the group of 5 almost always wins because they can gather the resources to make explosives and guns to raid you much faster and you would have to kill 5 of them while they just have to kill you. I have played solo and it's ok and can actually be easier than playing in a group if your group is bad. The balance issue is more apparent when so many people play in clans. The best tips are pick an accessible weapon and get good with it and if you can find a decent player to team up with. Overall the game is ok I wouldn't reccomend it expressly but it is worth a try and I do enjoy playing ir from time to time.IMPORANT hackers are a majior problem in the game and I'm quitting again because of it people will shoot you across a field in the head full auto without missing and snipe you with smgs from the roof of their base (and yes they will do it with mp5.entity) even head on I get killed before I can even see a person as I come around a corner and it's always a little kid who acts like he's tough afterward too. You will see several people get auto banned a week if you play a lot and you know the auto ban isn't catching everyone.

The core game is extremely simple and balanced even in it's alpha form.Yes it's harsh and you will get murdered a few times on most servers. My List of Key things to do to enjoy this game 1. Find the nearest pig and crush its skull with your rock. #1 need is food first off2. Stay off the road. You are asking to be murdered3. Don't go full retard on the first person you encounter. review: Rust has gone through alot of change throughought it's life on steam early access and in it's current state I think rust is the best it has ever been. Legacy rust was really fun then they came out with rust experimental because legacy rust was apparently a jumbled mess of code. The first versions of rust experimental SUCKED REALLY BAD. There were no airdrops for a long time there were no explosives. The building system was BROKEN. You could break into someones stone house with 2 people using pickaxes. Blueprints weren't in the game anymore the GUI was ok. But then it got better. They fixed all those problems the graphics and lighting system is the best it's ever been now. There's tons of explosives and different types of ammo and the building system has been remade quite a bit and I think it's at a really good point now. The only thing I think was a questionable choice to impliment was ladders... I remember when that came out. Boy did it suck. If you want to play a game with intense battles high risk and lots of resource farming Rust is your game. It's in a really good state right now. So buy it if you're up for the challenge.

review: From the a gameplay point of view its all wrong. The balancing will create some very frusterating moments.I think the addition of guns ruins it for everyone expect the people with the guns. Allow me to explain You can be just chopping away at the tree when out of nowhere you will be snipped from a cross the map. There is literally no way you could have seen it comming or at the very least fought back.Personally I think weapons should be kept at a medieval style. With spears bows and even muskets. However full blown Bolt Rifes are a step to far.The reason I think this is simple it gives you a chance to fight or flee. Right now if someone has a gun you can't do etheir. There is no chance of escape and no chance to fight back. However if it was ballanced correctly you should at the very least have a chance to escape and maybe even fight back.Anyway so while the gameplay I feel is very unbalanced how does the rest of the game compare? Tech wise it looks pretty good. The view distance is alright and it gives me a Farcry 3 feel. However it does not run smooth at all. I have a GTX970 and on Medium settings I get 40 FPS. It has a slight stuttering issue aswell.Anyway some people might have a lot of fun with this but unless you are sure you'll have fun I cannot recommend it.

review: Have over a thousand hours spread across accounts. Safe to say this game is addictive fun intense and satisfying all at once.Only pitfall is hackers but thats being fixed now.ABOVE IS MY PREVIOUS REVIEWEdit Im going to have to not recommend this game as of now. The games direction has swayed from the fun arcadey pvp shooter to the clan focused naked killing style of the current. The component system did have its flaws as did the XP system as did the old BP system however all had their own pros. This new BP system essentially promotes clans as whoever can get the drops really gets the first major server changers so essentially whichever group has more numbers wins. This can be said for the other systems as well however the other systems allowed solo's duo's and even trio's to actually experience late game. OLD bp's was similar to now but not as bad as there was no grind for scrap. XP made everyone grind for levels regardless and components allowed people to just farm for gear so everyoneg got a go. Now I might just sound like a salty person who's died to groups or whatever but believe me im not. Ive had my time roaming around when I was at the top of my game dumpstering everyone I saw and rolling around in groups or raiding the little guys I was at that point and at that point the game is ing fun. But thats the issue the people I was killing and the people that we or I was raiding didn't get to enjoy the game like I did because they were always outnumbered or couldn't spend as much time on it as I could or whatever the reason. The reason is simple as to why this game is going the wrong direction for me personally and for alot of other people the game is tailored to groups and the game isn't for casual gamers. That is the reason I cannot reccommend this product if you can look through those pitfalls and go through the steep learning curve the game is for you.
title: Rust

review: So let's get started.Although this game is currently in "Alpha" it is extremely addictive and of course exceptional when it comes to Survival. It meets aspects such as fighting for your life building a home to protect yourself from fellow players or aggressive animals and not only that provides players with a whole new aspect of the word "Survival". Many other survival games have zombie aspects to them but usually you don't need this to meet the genre requirements and the Rust Developers have proven this point worthy.I would like to add that I have spent countless hours running my own server as well as a consitant player within official servers to wide spread my game experience however with the amount of time I have spent it has come at a great cost.For example the games graphics do not meet a standard such as your Call of Duty or your Guild Wars 2 but it meets a standard that I like official in your face and straight to the point. The combat system has its flaws but eventually I see it becoming very modernized and easy to operate. I can say countless bad points but I'm only focusing on one bad point here The Game Developers need to be more active with their player base!We see a lot of updates posts and community updates but personally I would like to see them run the game from a gaming aspect instead of being a typist bunch of developers this would intrigue my interest a lot more as not only are they developers but they endure the same excitement and interest we do in their own game.A part from that this game is 9/10 for Excitement 9/10 for Update features and support 7/10 for Developer involvement.I really do look forward to spending countless more hours in this fantastic world you've created guys!

review: The reviews are not wrong even if it is true that the Devs are destroying the game on purpose or not it's still being destoryed. All the reviews you are seeing from both new players and old ones are accurate. It's the farthest thing from a "Survival genre" game. It's more akin to an "old pvp server" game from 15 years ago when they sort of went like this. Those who were around when it stated who like nothing but to grief hack and kill noobs stayed around and well do just that. The devs being of the same mindset then catered the game to that sole goal. That seems to be what has been done here from all the talk. Many many other descent games for normal players of the survivale genre (Or any other really) that you could find and enjoy. This one is NOT it. Don't waste your time because that is ALL you'll be doing. Trust those whom you read that lost 3 5 7 10 all the ways to 100's of hours rather than lose all that time yourself when you could be playing something else. Farm the cards (if you care about that) and then move on to something actually fun. (you should already know any game in which you can not even choose your own character is gonna be trash..lol) OR you can do like all the reviews you are reading say go see and get griefed get whacked get bored and then do that repeatedly for how ever many hours you wish to just lose out of your life..lol. now think i'll go play Dark Souls 2 SOTFS where dying repeatedly 300 times actually MEANS something ..lmao

review: Definitely balanced for PvP so if you don't like playing with/being murdered over and over by power tripping thirteen year olds you're in for a bad time. A lackluster building system complete with a very very draconian decay system (which means your buildings after x hours without you being around them will begin to take damage which you must use resources to repair). They also removed the zombies which were actually pretty fun and replaced them with like one bear (I've never seen any more than that). They also completely 100% randomized your gender race and physical features which some people think is fine but I personally loathe. It's always a good thing for your players to feel ownership of their characters (especially in a dangerous sandbox like this one) and for them to randomize that aspect after all this time is bizarre and upsetting.In fairness there's nothing vastly or deeply wrong with it (aside from that completely arbitrary character issue that Garry has made very clear he's not budging on) but it's just unsatisfying on almost every level. The guns lack a feeling of heft or value after you bust your to craft or find one. The combat feels like it hinges mainly on MLG bunnyhopping and does not reward the clever player. The building is fun... until your real life takes you away from the game for a few days and you log in to find your walls collapsed and your building looted. Cannot recommend in its current state.7 Days to Die is better.
title: Rust

review: So.I don't like this game.That's the main thing I have to say about it It kinda sucks in a lot of ways.It could definitely be improved there are plenty of things about it that are easy to fix but there are also some that are less so.Now I should also mention that this style of game isn't my favourite by a long shot I've tried a few and I suck at them but hey why not try another it totally wasn't just for achievements plus I've had the game for years. In the end I always died before I could get very far only once getting a shirt only to starve to death a minute later and once getting a full set of clothing and weaponry only because I stole most of it from some poorly hidden crates in the bushes.Now what I really hate about this particular game so much can be summed up by three things The communityLoad times and graphicsCharacter appearance.So. Start with the easy one. The community is toxic as h*ck. perhaps they're okay when you get to know them and I've noticed a few people being nice but for the most part everyone is an to you especially if you're a newbie. Or a 'naked' because apparently the rust elite are so exclusive they use their own lingo. This isn't really something that I expect to change people can suck sometimes and this game is designed in a way that makes that more obvious.As for the graphics and load times well... I have to say the game is darn beautiful at the highest graphics settings. However this is offput by the fact that the load times are unbearable. And by that I mean despite a fairly high end (though perhaps a tad old) pc it took more than a half hour to load into a game and Rust remained on the verge of crashing every time I moved my mouse freezing and then taking a second before I could even see where I was. And let me tell you that is not the way you want to be playing this game. However on lower graphics settings the loading is far more manageable but... well the visuals suck. It's a trade that must be made in all games I suppose but Rust makes it very pronounced. This could probably be improved over time but I doubt it's considered a priority by the devs.Finally we have the characters. This one is very simple. You have absolutely no control over your character in the slightest. You spawn in naked and the game has already decided your skin colour gender and proportions and refuses to let you change them. Now I understand some games like forcing you to look a certain way but that makes sense because you're playing a predetermined character. In Rust you play a nameless silent protagonist and yet still have no control over their appearance. I myself spawned as a woman and while that isn't that bad it's a lot less fun to teabag corpses that way. immersive or enjoyable to be forced into playing a character when there literally is no character to be forced into. I'm not asking for much here just a few tiny options like gender and skin colour in the advanced options or something.On the other hand I'm sure that playing the game further than I bothered with makes it far more enjoyable possibly meeting nicer people and being capable of killing things. And it has definitely improved a lot since I last played it which must have been years ago by this point. I think I actually originally stopped playing because of the old radiation system.So to cap it off I don't recommend this game. I personally disliked it and most people aren't going to be bothered to play it enough to enjoy it. However if you think you might be please go on and read some positive reviewws. Maybe this is your style of game and you'll enjoy the later game aspects that other players talk about.

review: I don't remember why I bought this game.All I know is that I have had so many great experiences with this game. First Week Experience My first week in Rust I meet a guy in a big metal base on the side of a beach.He showed me how to build a small cube base.Some guy camped my base for four hours that night.He killed me then gave me a revolver to defend myself with.About nine hours later someone was pick axing my wall down.The wall went down.I panicked.I shot all over.I killed him.It was the guy who gave me the gun.Friend for life right there.Then I ventured out into the world.Met some group made up of a bunch of Canadians.They welcomed me into their group.(I play with that group to this day.)That guy who showed me how to build a small shack built another base called Fort Wheatley.People running around the server would ask me about Fort Wheatley. I had no idea what they were talking about.Venturing across the waters that separated the mainland from the desert I saw it.A giant base with my name on it.Its like a castle.Walked up to the base.People with guns came out.Asked who I was."I am Wheatley."very loudly."KING WHEATLEY!" they shout.They welcome me in.There is a memorial to me.They give me access to the base blue prints resources and all.Every time I walk by these guys kneel put their heads down and say "Hail King Wheatley."I have no idea what all this "Toxic Community" stuff with the rest of these reviews are. This game is great.

review: Rust. Well. There is alot to say about Rust. 1) The game looks good and is aesthetically pleasing if you have a good PC and can run it on good graphics. It has a nice feeling to it and the ambient environment is awesome!2) The community in Rust is generally a bit ''toxic'' but you can find a friendly chap most of the time who is willing not to blow your head off. To avoid the ''cancerous'' community of rust when you start playing the game i recommend sourcing a friend with a decent amount of hours (200+) to help you get started off and familiar with the game due to many people complaining about getting killed straight off the beaches as a 'naked'. 3) The wide range of servers on Rust is pretty amazing you have the vanilla servers which are great fun if you are playing with a few mates. You have the type of 'minigame' servers that are fun to waste a bit of time on. And the modded servers that are relatively fun if you don't have the time to start of on vanilla. All in all i do recommend this game providing you are prepared to get off a little bit as you get started off due to the skilled player base of many players on many servers in the Rust Community. Hense i ask you to play with a few experienced friends yourself. Hope this helped! Have fun surviving )

review: I purchased Rust way back when it first came out with the intention of playing with some friends. Originally it was a very simple survival game but has since come a long way. While still in Alpha it seems like it could get better. Pros Start off as a Naked guy with a rock and a torch. Gathering materials isn't too daunting and the threat of dying early game is real. While it still needs work there are alot of small things that make the game interesting. ( Cannot drink still water but can drink running water) Building and constructing has few limitations and can be fun. Has a simple and user friendly interface that can be learned in minutesCons Do you like playing with delinquent 12 year olds who constantly cuss and blow up chat.. On EVERY SERVER? Making some progress in the game? Have a nice established base? Naked guy with rock comes and kills you Start all over. Did I mention the community is Pretty much the only main crafting materials in the game are wood rocks and cloth. Until they fix the community problem (good luck).. I honestly don't recommend the game.

review: Product received for free. I wouldn't particularly suggest playing this game if you are short tempered. Right from your first few hours on a server you will get constantly harassed by either naked people with rocks or get shot in the head by a roof camper when you are hitting a barrel. However i must state that the feeling you get when you actually happen to achieve something in the game happen it to be finding 10 bears and get a lot of fat from them or by building the coolest fortress is beyond any feeling you get in any other game i must say.Overall I really love this game and hope more people get to enjoy RUST at full potential. My suggestion for any new player is to find a group of at least 2 people that are more experienced than you and ask questions! Remember that having fun in RUST is not exclusive to only group play but when you get the idea of most things such as gun recoil and game mechanics even a solo player can have fun.Good luck in your adventures reader! D

review: On the surface Rust seems like a very fun game. It seems like the minecraft we always wanted with the gameplay style of Fallout and the crafting and exploration of Minecraft. Unfortunately Rust is not that game. Rust has a learning curve that is so effectively brutal that one must wonder if the developers are sane. If you are not playing with people who somehow are already established in the game the probability you will be killed in the first 10 minutes of playing is likely if not certain. This game deals out death like no other that I have played making Dark Souls look tame by comparison. If you have a dozen friends all on the same server all working together then you will have fun slaughtering everything in sight. If you do not you just wasted your money. There is one thing about this game that strikes me as insane beyond all other parts. The Rust community has a ratio of 1 decent friendly person 100 psychotic sadists who should never have anything more dangerous than a butter knife. These people are as primitive in the mind as the player is when they start out in the game. To the point where these people would be arrested in Europe for hate speech and harrasssment. Maybe the developers will try to tackle this issue. The odds are that they will not. Never have I played a game with such rancid lowly creatures masquerading as human beings. Yes this game is supposed to be brutal these jackals take it to the nth degree in terms of how sadistic they can be. What is even worse is that many of the players are in the 12 13 year old range God only knows what this will do to their minds. At any rate this game should be avoided until the devlopers can fix the learning curve. Otherwise it will continue to be a bloody gory mess.
title: Rust

review: RUST The Game That Escaped Early Access So what are my impressions on Rust after 200 Hours? The community will disagree but I believe 200h is more than enough time to get a feel for Rust. Rust is a survival PVP often compared to ARK or recently Escape From Tarkov but if you've ever played it you will develop a love hate relationship like I have. Not everything is peachy in the beginning not everyone will trust you and you shouldn't trust everyone. The main point of the game is to survive of course. But more so than anything get AKs as fast as you can and kill nake just kidding. Rust puts a spin on wilderness survival by introducing PVP and Minecraft esque elements. Doing anything even with groups of people can be difficult. Be warned this is not Hello Kitty Roller Rescue. This is the Dark Souls of survival games. This is not a pretty game My first time playing Rust was alone. I won't sugar coat my terrible start. I didn't even know how to get stone! (In it's current state as of Feb. 8 2018 I can proudly say there should be no confusion for the literate to learn how to aquire stone now. As should be.) Coming from being a solo I can say it is tough. People will want to take advantage of you they will mercilessly kill you. They will try to ruin your day. But that's a hurtle you need to get over in Rust. The best times in Rust I've had so far are from being naked and going from 0 to hero. Rocks to Guns. The magic in this game comes from the players. The Most Fun I've had in a Survival Game The magic comes from joining a server with nothing to lose and everything to gain. You take out your rock bash fellow naked's heads in for their bow + arrows and begin hunting big game. Or you ask if anyone needs a slave and get sleeping "bagged" into their home. Allies aren't made everyday and you are most likely going to be targeted on approach to fellow Newmans but once it works the magic happens. Before I made any pals on this game I had made basic bases much like dirt houses in Minecraft and I learned the most about Rust from my allies. They taught me how to play better than they could. Soon we had been through entire server wipes together and were a dangerous crew. It feels so good to be one of the most feared or notorious in a server. You don't get that by simply being toxic to your fellow Newman however. You must work for it. A good way to work for it is making shops trap bases defending raids or raiding against geared players and recycling loose items at monuments. A Grind The grinding aspect of this game is something I can get behind. Building 3.0 brought us upkeep which essentially increased the amount of resources you need to thrive. It cut down on Zergs ALOT since they can no longer construct server wide bases without some serious manhours. Trust me it isn't hard to put in time and get alot out. You will LOVE the game when you win and HATE losing. The more work you put in the more comes out. To get to "end game" loot is not easy. If you dont want to put 10 hours or more into a game in one week this isn't for you. Rust is for the dedicated. More so than any other game I know of right now. Usually hours of work can be gone in minutes this is normal. Just know when you're on top you have it all to lose. Can I run it? TIPS AND TRICKS I have 8gb of ram a Ryzen 1600 and GTX 760 and run it fine. To everyone saying they have problems I still can't stress this enough. Look at the minimum specs!!! If you own anything less you won't have the whole experience. It doesn't take a NASA computer to run but anything made in the last 5 years with 5 year old or newer parts should do. SSDs and RAM size helps loading time a SH ton. My old PC with an FX 4100 AMD CPU could barely run this at acceptable frame rates even on low. Maybe a *small* upgrade could be the key. Old i5s run this quite well. Even better than any AMD FX CPU. NEVER DISABLE ASSET WARMUP!!! It makes loading faster but creates stuttering. This is a super CPU intensive game too. I know they're pretty but disabling shadows/shadow effects can help massively no matter what part bottlenecks. And almost all the loading into servers except asset warmup is network intensive. I have under ideal conditions 3 5 minute load times into any given server. Final Verdict I firmly believe anyone can have fun in this game. Fun doesn't always mean success but success is nice. You will love and hate Rust. But for all it's worth if a server doesn't work out for you there's always another one. Rust is a great game. The interactions you have with players make the experience. If that experience is not ideal move away. You will make alot of friends and alot of enemies. Cherrish all of them. Although a bit of salt is optional. Is it for you? Well there's always steam refunds. Also a PSA be n i c e to your fellow Newmans.Thanks for reading.

Unless you band up with other people who just want to kill other players no matter what then this game is for you.It's pure toxicity all around though. 95% of players give no inch and they'll kill you for online 'kicks'. As in steal your base tell you on mic they'll give you your key you bend down to pick it up and their buddy shoots you from the bushes....and they laugh over the mic in some weird sociopathic "heh heh heh" that doesn't even sound normal or healthy. (Creepy true story)I'm thinking this game attracts people who aren't 'well' or have a fantasy of doing things they'd never do IRL. I'm guessing bullied kids in school or alcoholic/drug addict parents. And RUST is their outlet. Oh well better online than from a hotel in Vegas with an actual gun. Way too toxic for my liking. It's fun for about a day then you realize the types of people that actually are IN the game.

review: Click "Join Server". Wait 20 minutes for "Asset Warmup". Crash. Repeat. Collect trading cards.The Crash Notification tells you where to find crash log folders and asks you to send it to the developer. The FAQ on the Rust website also tells you "if you report a crash we will certainly look into it". The key component missing from these is information on how to do this. The developer's email address is however available on their website.EDIT (Feb 2018) I have noticed that the launcher no longer includes an option to use DirectX 9 and that the Minimum System Requirements have been changed to DirectX 11 so it would seem that I will need to purchase new hardware if I want to play this game.

review: Game is fun until you get to end game then nothing is very mysterious anymore and you realize you've done everything and I find I have a lot less motivation to play.The game is about to leave early access and is missing quality of life elements that make the game frustrating i.e No overflow crafting inventory and no sound notifications that you have begun crafting and no sounds indicating crafting is finished. These things may be intentional and that makes it even worse.Base defenses are to strong and the second tier of defenses requires higher tier weapons and explosives to infiltrate which makes it pretty much pointless to raid since you wouldnt get anything worthwhile. This mechanic makes many servers reset the map and character inventory every week to keep things fresh which I think is a bandaid to try and make something broken fun.I've played most of the survival games on and off steam and this is about 3rd on my list many of the survival games are stuck in a constant developement state so deep that quality of life fixes and completion of in game systems never get worked on giving the feel of a half finished game. Rust unfortunately doesn't escape this.If you want to play a survival game where you like to build this isnt for you as bases will be wiped every week. If you like to raid for resources and loot this game isnt for you because you wont get anything that outweighs the investment of cracking into a base. If you like building sandcastles on the beach for six days only to destroy it on the seventh day for no other reason than to build it again in another spot you could have fun with this game.Update I'll admit im a filthy casual when it comes to playing Rust. There are folks with thousands of hours in Rust and love it. Rust is a lifestyle to some and those people are amazing at the game and exhibit a great deal of skill and I respect their ability. But it you aren't one of those players you'll find the game fairly difficult.

review: The community for this game is complete and utter trash. in my entire playing experience the amount of players who aren't tumor cells I can count on one hand. The game itself is fun for about an hour then starts to get repetitious and grindy. This is attributed to not only the very nature of the game (it being a survival game and all) but the fact that there is simply not much to do. You can hunt animals you can get resources you can build a house and the list stops there. The main reason I have so many hours on this game is simply messing around with friends hence if you do not have a party you can play this game with I would struggle to recommend it to you. However if you enjoy survival games that are repetitious in nature you might enjoy it more than I.

review: At first this game is totally frustrating and induces fierce rage. I first spawned outside a hut with nothing but a rock and a flaming torch. No instructions on what to do I selected the rock and began hacking at a tree. As I was chopping away a naked man (with his vulnerables hanging out) clubbed me to death with a rock.Next spawn was a little better I collected loads of wood and then proceeded to waste my time bashing at a cliff face to gather rocks (this doesn't work btw). After a good ten minutes I noticed I was getting hungry so I went to look for animals. I found a wolf. He savaged me and I died losing all my wood in the process.Third spawn was a little better I gathered wood (again) but could not find how to gather metal or stone. So as night drew in I found an empty (doorless) hut where I camped. I could not see so I lit my torch this was purely so I could see but served nicely as a homing beacon for every ing dangerous thing in the area. First I beat away a radioactive bear then I 'just survived' a zombie attack before finally being blown away by the shotgun of another player.Forth spawn I fell of a cliff after getting too close to the edge (fair play).Fifth spawn I wandered into a city and heard a clicking noise. I was complaining over chat about someone being a on the mic but it turns out this is the sound of a radioactive area. I died upstairs as I found a tin of beans!Sixth spawn I went back for the beans but was over powered by a naked man with an axe.Seventh spawn went really well. I collected lots of materials (unhindered) and made me a wooden shelter with a DOOR! Yes! Finally some progress!!! I lit a small fire and it was all feeling worth the pain... until what I thought was a knock at the door turned out to be another naked guy with an axe. He smashed the door in and stole all the stuff I'd taken ages gathering.Eighth spawn I just ran... and eventually starved.Ninth spawn I built three houses in a remote part of the map. All was fine until I got cocky and attacked a bear that fight ended very badly and was over quickly!Tenth and last spawn I found a really helpful guy who showed me how to use blueprints craft more effectively and how to generally survive. He taught me gestures that showed if I was aggressive or friendly to other players. I walked confidently over to a guy we saw and knelt down as sign that I was not going to harm him. He executed me with a rock and took all my stuff.Definitely going back on line tonight 10/10 !!!
title: Rust

It's worth the $20.

review: My 500 hour rust review I purchased this game when it first came to Steam. I played 200 hours on legacy and enjoyed every bit of it. Finally legacy died down and became just another game. Even through hours and hours and hours of amazing times with friends.When new Rust came out it was quite a drastic change. One that certainly had it's ups and downs. There were plenty of issues with it. A lot of people quit the game. A lot of people said it was ruined and ignorantly have still never come back.I can say the following with much confidence This game has become one of the BEST games of all time. I have spent the majority of my time in this game since it's DRASTIC turnaround to greatness. The changes have been great. The improvements have been insane. The game is truly my favorite game right now. And that takes a lot for me to say.To all of the people that have left this game and are maybe thinking of coming back PLEASE do it. The weekly updates to this game are absolutely amazing and you can follow along with Garry Newman and the dev team at http //www.playrust.comPros Best survival game on the market first off. Amazing base building that allows you to create whatever your heart desires. Weekly updates that CONSTANTLY expand the content never allowing you to get bored. Balance constantly changes and always seems to get better. Graphics on max look pretty outstanding for a survival game. Community/modded servers allow for you to find the PERFECT server for you and your friends. Things like faster gathering TP even deathmatch servers etc. Gunplay requires skill and with the mixture of bullet damage that isn't too insanely high as well as medical options as medkits medical syringes bandages barricades to be placed on the spot really allow for the player skill to sustain fights in situations. Raiding is the ultimate game of friends V friends / clan V clan pvp. You won't ever experience anything quite like it. Live map map.playrust.io for any server (I believe any server). To keep track of yourself and friends. Fairly optimized game. Don't know anyone who can't run it. I can go on and on and on....Cons Graphics on low look pretty bad (What game doesn't?) Losing your gear and base constantly CAN potentially be frustrating but restarting is all part of the fun right? The changes are not final and there are some things you might like that MAY be removed at some point The learning curve to be serverwide competitive with other larger clans can be quite large. With building and combat. (This issue isn't an issue for me but maybe for some.) KOS is the only way in Rust. But remember you bought a hardcore PvP survival game. Servers can be laggy and cause desync (Just look for another one.) Really can't think of any other cons right now.Overall this game scores an EASY 10/10 with me. There's no other game just quite like Rust out on the market right now. And games like h1z1 Ark Hurtworld 7dtd etc.. just don't come close to competing with the experiences you get from this game. Thank you Based Garry. Rust is truly amazing.
title: Rust

review: I'm not actually much of a fan. I think this game needs a lot more work put into it. The landscape will randomly flash and it looks like you're falling through the world. It is some what difficult to find resources like piles of wood and boulders for stone. If there would be more camps or storage units for supplies it would make a big difference. For me the $20 they are asking for would be a fair price if the game was done.

review: NEW REVIEW 50/50 not worth buying right now as its quite buggy (no animal sounds so you spontaniously just pop to a dogg with no sounds attacking you from behind) and their is a ton of content missing and broken gameplay...Not sure if the developers care about it..if asked I will go into more detail.Don't pay more than $10 for thisLegacy Sucks...not even worth loading up entire Rust communities died because that game was so broken.NOW the new updated version is interesting no more wood piles resources are easily farmed and found which means its quick and easy for a new player to get started...being raided is still rough but some houses are OP meaning you cannot even chop down someones door now...whats the purpose of a base building game where you can't chop down a wooden door with a axe or kick down a door frame?Larger detail in items better looking world character animations are much better.Is it worth it buying the game now? Yes but only if you have multiple friends playing it...loads of fun except for the developers screwing us now I can't play Rust at LAN parties with friends anymore...I could use Steam Family Sharing and mutliple people could play together but now it just kicks people out...which has ruined my expirence now as we have all moved onto other games because we can't play together on my clans Server.
